title: Jordan's Hussein Plans Trips to Syria and Egypt to Repair Arab Unity
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 4King Hussein of Jordan said today that he was planning to go to Damascus within the next few days, and then to Cairo, in an effort to restore a common Middle East negotiating position between Syria's President, Hafez alAssad, and Egypt's President, Anwar elSadat.

title: Jets Rally and Defeat Saints
description: The Jets, trailing by 1310, rallied for a 1613 victory over the Saints in New Orleans. Details on Page 54.

title: Penthouses Found Fit for a Queen
description: BAYONNE, N.J., Dec. 4The world's largest active passenger ship, the Queen Elizabeth 2, which regularly makes excursion cruises to ports in such places as Britain, Barbados and Bermuda, called at Bayonne so that two readymade, splitlevel penthouses could be hoisted onto her signal deck today.

title: BROTHER BERNARD M. RYAN, TAUGHT AT MANHATTAN
description: Brother Bernard M. Ryan, a professor emeritus of philosophy at Manhattan College and a professional engineer, died Saturday at the Frances Schevier Home and Hospital in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. He was 73 years old.

title: OverCounter Supplementary Listings
description: Week ended Dec. 2, 1977

title: Bridge:
description: At every national championship, there ate a few major national events, which attract all the stars, but there are also secondary events at the same time. These attract large fields of players, some of whom have been eliminated from the topranked contests.

title: Giants Upset Cards, 277; Rams Stun Raiders, Win Division Title
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4Customarily criticized for being dull while being successful, the Los Angeles Rams used a 43yard touchdown pass with 2 minutes 10 seconds to play to beat the Oakland Raiders today, 2014, and clinch their fifth straight title in the National Conference's Western Division.

title: Begin Tells British He Is Opposed To Palestinian State on West Bank
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (AP)Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel told British leaders today that Israel remained opposed to the creation of a separate Palestinian state on the occupied West Bank of the Jordan River, British and Israeli officials reported.

title: Separatism Foes Unite in Quebec
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4The first serious effort to regroup forces opposing separation by Quebec from Canada was completed last night in the city of Quebec with an agreement to form a coordinating committee.

title: FARM COOP'S STRESS IS NEVER ON PROFITS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.Of all the thousands of shareholder meetings held each year, none is as strange or as well attended as the annual gathering just concluded here by Farmland Industries Inc. The meeting was unusual on two counts:

title: PRATTWHITNEY WORKERS WITHDRAW STRIKE THREAT
description: SOUTHINGTON, Conn., Dec. 4 (AP)Union employees of the Pratt and Whitney Aircraft plant here voted overwhelmingly Sunday against carrying out threatened strike at the plant, the town's largest employer.

title: Pacific Games Title Won by Australia
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 4 (UPI) Australia won 17 gold medals to 10 for the runnerup United States in the third Pacific Conference Gmes, which concluded today.

title: Congress Questions Advantage and Cost Of U.S. Consultants
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Department of Agriculture hired the prestigious management consultants, Booz, Allen & Hamilton, to find out how to cut the cost of meat and poultry inspections. It was told, among other things, that the industry could hire more inspectors itself and that the chickens, which pass Federal inspectors at a rate of 25 a minute, could be speeded up.

title: Commodities
description: The prices of bread and other baked goods are about to move up sharply. How sharply depends on the cost of grain, soybeans and sugar in the coming weeks as well as the ongoing increases in labor, fuel and taxes paid by bakers.

title: Misrouted Mice Finally Arrive
description: BAR HARBOR, Me., Dec. 4 (AP)Fortyeight mice, lost for two days on an Atlantic crossing with their food and water supplies running low, have arrived safely at the Jackson Laboratory here. The animals, an unusual collection of genetically different laboratory mice that were shipped last week from Lubeck, West Germany, to the laboratory here, had been misrouted to New York.

title: Coal Industry's Troubles Go Beyond Strike Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Carl E. Bagge, the president of the National Coal Association, complained in a recent speech that coal was getting bad press these days. Just when the apparent national energy agenda was casting coal as the superabundant miracle mineral that would keep Americans from freezing in the dark, he said, some people have come to believe that B.T.U. stands for brutish thermal unit instead of British thermal unit.

title: Soviet Lawyer Arrives in London And Reports Moscow Expelled Her
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (Reuters)A Soviet lawyer arrived in London today and said she had been expelled from the Soviet Union for trying to defend a jailed activist, Anatoly Shcharansky, a member of the Helsinki human rights group.

title: Mrs. Lambert Draws Criticism Over FundRaising Party for Her
description: A month ago, Marie M. Lambert became the first woman elected Surrogate in Manhattan, and three weeks ago she celebrated her 57th birthday. So yesterday, some of her friends gave a $250aperson birthday party to help make a dent in reducing the campaign deficit of nearly $175,000.

title: Dave Anderson
description: EAST RUTHERFOBD, N.J., Dec. 4Most people with a broken jaw wouldn't push into a crowded subway. Some wouldn't even get out of bed. But today Dan Dierdorf played offensive tackle for the St. Louis Cardinals with a broken jaw that was wired shut. His gray plastic facemask had been enlarged and reinforced so that the jolt of contact would absorbed more comfortably. Darth Vader, teammates call him after the grotesque Star Wars character. Not that playing in the National Football League with a broken jaw was unprecedented. Historians recall that George Halas, now 82 years old, once did it for the Chicago Bears in a medieval war. And he survived. So did Dan Dierdorf. No problems, he said after the Giants' 277 upset victory, except for the whiplash effect in my teeth. On any blow to the head, the tremors went down into my teeth. And the tremors occurred often. He blocked and he got caught in pileups and he twice dived to recover a fumble. When the game ended, he walked over to George Martin, the Giants' defensive end whom he had to block.

title: 15Month Snarl Checks Sanitation Law Enforcers
description: In the last 15 months, 133 city sanitation workers have been promoted to higherpaying jobs with authority as special patrolmen to issue summonses for parking, health and sanitary violations. But thanks to a bureaucratic mixup, the little army of inspectors has yet to issue a single summons.

title: Swede Takes Ski Event
description: ORSA, Sweden, Dec. 4 (AP)Sweden's Benny Sodergren, the Olympic 50kilometer bronze medalist last year, defeated three Norwegians today and won the first crosscountry ski test of the season.

title: Books of The Times
description: The dismay that gripped most Americans when Franklin D. Roosevelt died in April 1945, at a climactic stage of World War II, transcended their grief at the loss of a President who had demonstrated his greatness through a dozen years of domestic and global crisis. Fear was widespreadindeed, almost universal  that Harry S. Truman, lifted at this moment of maximum national peril out of the vacuity of the Vice Presidency, was utterly inadequate to his new responsibilities as sole occupant of the most demandine and Powerful office in the world.

title: Rise in Welfare Aid to New York Is Sought by Regional Plan Unit
description: Calling for quicker and greater Federal sharing in welfare costs, the Regional Plan Association said yesterday that President Carter's welfare proposals would leave New York's state and local governments paying $951.6 million to help the poornearly twothirds of their current burden.

title: Egypt Names Experienced Team To PreGeneva Talks in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Dec. 4President Anwar elSadat's call for a meeting in Cairo later this month to clear the way for a new Geneva peace conference has been backed up with the naming of an experienced threemember Egyptian team.

title: Bond Sales Scheduled for the Week
description: In this week's schedule of bond sales, the following issues are expected:

title: Carter Assails Poland  On Divided Families
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)Less than four weeks before visiting Warsaw, President Carter is telling Congress that Poland ranks among the worst in Eastern Europe in helping reunite divided families.

title: Bruins Extend Unbeaten String To 14 Contests
description: BOSTON Dec. 4 (AP)Gilles Gilbert continued his strong goaltending for Boston tonight as the Bruins extended their unbeaten streak to 14 games with a 31 National Hockey League victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Market Place
description: If you expect to sell short and sleep tight, a call option may be a better hedge than a barbiturate.

title: Crewman of Oil Tanker Injured In EngineRoom Fire in Queens
description: A 36yearold marine engineer was severely burned yesterday during a flash fire in the engine room of an oil tanker tied up at a Consolidated Edison Company pier in Astoria, Queens.

title: $1 Million Bet in San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 4It was the first milliondollar betting day in the history of horse racing on the island today, but it also left many of the emotional fans dejected when the favorite, Eureka, a Puerto Rican starter, suffered a torn tendon and finished last in the feature race, the Classico Internacional del Caribe at El Comandante.

title: Excerpts From Text of an Interview With Carter on Foreign and Domestic Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Following are excerpts from the text of an interview with President Carter Thursday by James Reston of The New York Times:

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: Canucks 6, Black Hawks 2
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)Mike Walton and Ron Sedlbauer each scored two goals and Hilliard Graves and Dennis Ververgaert picked up a goal and two assists apiece tonight as the Vancouver Canucks routed the Chicago Black Hawks, 62, and moved into first place in the Smythe Division.

title: Colonel Joe, a Dalmatian, Takes Best at Boardwalk
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., Dec. 4Ch. Green Starr's Colonel Joe, a Dalmatian, defeated 3,340 contenders for the bestinshow prize tonight at the Boardwalk Kennel Club's 11th dog show in the Convention Hall. It was the 3yearold's first top award, and it was a tough final since four of the six dogs were previous bestinshow winners.

title: Administration's Top Tax Expert Suffers a Stroke
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Laurence N. Woodworth, the Treasury's topranking tax expert and a wellknown figure on Capitol Hill, suffered a stroke today and was reported to he in critical condition.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSFrank A., died December 2, 1977 at 93 at Jewish MemorIal Hospital. A veteran of the AEF, his ashes will be burled at Pinelawn National Cemetery.

title: Opera Ebony In Debut Work
description: Opera Ebony, a national organization to create performance opportunities for black opera singers, presented its debut production Saturday night at the Beacon Theater: William Grant Still's Highway 1 U.S.A. This was also the New York premiere of Mr. Still's opera, which had its first performance in Miami in 1963.

title: Broncos Beat Oilers, Gain Playoffs for the First Time
description: In the 18 years that the Denver Broncos have been, playing professional football, the word playoffs has been one that applied only to other, more talented teams in the American Football League: and then the National League. But yesterday the Broncos finally reached their longsought goala spot in the postseasoo competition that could lead to the Super Bowl.

title: Westerners Get a First Look at Team Rodeo
description: DENVER, Dec. 4If team tennis can work, why not team rodeo? The new sport is being born even now.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1977

title: FORREST D. MURDEN JR., 56, AN EXAIDE TO HENRY FORD
description: Forrest D. Murden Jr., an international publicaffairs and management consultant and a former assistant to Henry Ford 2d, died yesterday after surgery in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 56 years old and lived at 2 Sutton Place iin Manhattan.

title: NaderClaybrook Feud Puzzles Consumer Advocates
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Many people in the consumer movement, friends as well as associates of Ralph Nader and Joan Claybrook, were startled and confused last week by Mr. Nader's angry criticism of Miss Claybrook, chief of the Administration's auto safety program.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Bryant's Touchdown on Interception Is GameBreaker
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 4In sickness and in health, and with no regard for the quarterback's poor biorhythm chart, the Giants scored their largest victory in more than four years today by routingyes, routingthe St. Louis Cardinals, 277, before 71,826 somewhat amazed spectators at the Meadowlands.

title: Economic Scene Schedule
description: The Economic Scene by Leoftard Silk does not appear today. Henceforth it will appedr Tuesday and Thursday instead of Monday and Thursday as previously.

title: Instead of Naming the Baby John, Try Katz Meow
description: Have you met Cardinal Sin, the Archbishop of Manila? Or Cigar Stubbs of Florida? What about Dr. Doctor or Groaner Digger, the undertaker; I.C. Shivers, the iceman; Justin Tune, the chorister; Mrs. Screech, the singing teacher; or A. Moron, whose field is education?

title: NEW TABLOID TO PUBLISH TODAY IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (AP)The Philadelphia Journal becomes the city's fourth major newspaper tomorrow with an initial press run of 170,000 to 180,000 copies.

title: Motive Sought in Slaying of Youth
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 4The Nassau County police today continued to canvass an affluent section of North Woodmere, known as Hungry Harbor, in an effort to determine the motive in the stabbing death of 16yearold Richard Lesser, an. honor student at Hewlett High School.

title: HEALTH TEAM HAILED FOR WORK ON DISEASE
description: An editorial in a leading American medical journal lauds a group of Government scientists for brilliant scientific achievement in discovering the cause of legionnaires' disease, the mysterious form of pneumonia that drew world attention in the summer of 1976, when an outbreak in Philadelphia made 182 persons ill and killed 29.

title: Folk Music by Tahuantinsuyo
description: Tahuantinsuyo, a trio of Peruvian, Ecuadorean and Argentine musicians that has built up a loyal following through frequent concerts at the Alternative Center for International Arts on East Fourth Street, moved uptown yesterday. Performing in the auditorium of the Museum of Natural History, it seemed a bit more formal than in the relaxed Alternative Center. But its music carried beautifully.

title: Sadat Says Israel Must Make Concessions for Peace
description: CAIRO, Egypt, Dec. 4 (UPI)President Anwar elSadat said today that Israeli leaders must be willing to make concessions if they want to safeguard the mutual pledge of nonaggression made by Egypt and Israel during his mission to Jerusalem last month.

title: More Boycott Insurance, Not Less
description: The nation's need for an oil reserve to guard against future boycotts is painfully obvious. The Arab boycott in 197374 cost the United States between $10 billion and $20 billion in lost production. It disrupted life in countless ways. Today, with the economy even more dependent on Arab oil, a long boycott could cause severeunemployment and turn automobile driving into a luxury. For some, however, memories of the lines at the gas pump have faded and with them the sense of urgency about the boycott problem. It is hard to believe, but budget officials in the Carter Administration are questioning the need for rapid expansion of emergency oil reserves.

title: Navy Turns Down Bid To Aid Raising of Ship
description: Prospects for raising the partly submerged Alexander Hamilton, the last of the historic Hudson River sidewheel steamboats, appeared to dim considerably yesterday when the United States Navy said it was not in a position to pay for he salvage operation.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Gerard Out On Bail After Indictment
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 5Dr. Mark J. Gerard, the veterinarian accused of switching the race horses Cinzano and Lebon in a betting coup, surrendered to Nassau County authorities this afternoon and pleaded not guilty to a nine  count indictment detailing charges in the case.

title: ISRAEL LIMITS SCOPE OF FIRST CAIRO TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 5The Israeli delegation to the forthcoming Cairo conference to prepare for fullscale Geneva talks will not be empowered to deal with military or security aspects of the differences between the Arabs and the Israelis, according to Foreign Ministry officials.

title: Mushroom Lovers Indulge in A Feast Of Fungi
description: Everyone brought a dish to pass around, but it wasn't just one of those Sunday night suppers. Arline Deitch prepared her cognacrich Cantharellus infundibuliformis dip and Bill Dill shared this year's batch of Clitopilus multiceps post office pickles. For variety, others added pAte de foie de volaille aux chanterelles, morel crepes and the popular Armillaria in soy.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Supreme Court ruled today that a policeman can compel a driver to get out of his car when stopping him for a minor traffic violation.

title: M'DERMOTT'S STOCK RISES BY $6.38 ON UNITED'S MOVE
description: Wall Street professionals, taking J. Ray McDermott & Company at its word, bid up the price of the oil services company stock yesterday by $6.38 a share to $56.50 in heavy trading.

title: Kentucky Beats Indiana Before 23,000 Fans
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 5 (UPI) Jack Givens and Rick Robey combined for 42 points tonight to lead the University of Kentucky to a 7864 victory over Indiana before a crowd of 23,000.

title: Two Choreographers With One Style
description: Though totally unconnected with each other in training or professional experience, Carol Conway and Linda Diamond are both creatively disposed to the smallscale, slightly impersonal dance. Individuals move about in close proximity without making lasting personal contacts, almost like a game in which the pieces remain the same but are constantly reshuffled. Miss Diamond's company was at the Westbeth Theater Center Sunday evening and Miss Conway performed in the afternoon at American Theater Labcratory.

title: U.S. Judge Strikes Down New Federal Ban on Use And Importing of Laetrile
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 5 (AP)A Federal judge has handed down a permanent injunction forbidding the Government to enforce a ban on the use and importation of laetrile.

title: Market Place
description: The Communications Satellite Corporation, in the view of many in Wall Street, offers a good example of how Government regulation can slow the progress of a company of demonstrated technological experience.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ANZERE, Switzerland, Dec. 5 (AP)Irgemar Stenmark of Sweden, the winrer of two World Series events this year, came from behind today and won an International Ski Federation giant s??lom race.

title: Police in Jersey Village Return To Work After 40Hour Sickour
description: RIVERSIDE, N.J., Dec. 5 (UPI)The police in this Burlington County community returned to work yesterday after a 40hour sickout.

title: About New York
description: Absolutely and forevermore, the people in the refrigerator had found the end of animation. Indeed, the bearded man rolled out in cold drawer No. 68 had collapsed into death while he was dancing at a discothque.

title: Gilbert, Former Ranger, To Announce His Plans
description: Rod Gilbert, the former star right wing for the New York Rangers, will announce at a news conference today his decision on whether he will accept an offer of a consulting position with Madison Square. Garden.

title: PRESIDENTIAL GOALS ON JOBS AND BUDGET ARE FOUND TO CLASH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Congressional Budget Office today warned that if President Carter pursues the vigorous economic growth he needs to cut away at unemployment, he must forgo his goal of balancing the budget by the end of his term.

title: Koch Gets Estimate of a Sharp Rise in Budget Gap
description: A revised estimate of New York City's budget gapmore than $100 million higher than Mayor Beanie's forecastwas given to Mayorelect Edward I. Koch yesterday by his fiscal task force.

title: Bravos Hail Magda Olivero
description: Magda Olivero's recital last night in Carnegie Hall was an event for the connoisseur no doubt, but by any standards it was an evening of extraordinary singing. Not everyone responds to her unusual timbre, with its dry, reedy quality, nor to the studied intensity of her interpretations.

title: Sad at at Home: National Hero
description: News Analysis

title: Article 4 -- No Title
U.S. Prisoner Hearings in MexicoCity
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Four United States magistrates opened hearings in Mexico City jails today to approve the repatriation of about 126 Americans serving sentences here, The hearings are expected to be completed by Wednesday, and the first prisoners to return under a recently signed transfer treaty are due to leave on Friday.

title: Jenneke Barton Gives Song Recital
description: While one appreciates the efforts of recitalists in New York to vary their program fare with the unfamiliar, not all unfamiliar music is equally interesting. And when a recitalist puts together a whole program of such quasiexotic, and not much of it reaches out to seize the attention, the experience can be a little boring for the listener.

title: SAUDI ARABIA OIL EXPORTS DECLINE TO 13MONTH LOW
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 5 (UPI)Saudi Arabia's oil exports in October hit their lowest level in over a year, it was reported today, reflecting a stagnant world oil market that will be a major factor in helping to keep prices down for 1978.

title: ARGENTINA BARS AWARD OF 3 ISLANDS TO CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 5Argentina's military Government delivered a formal objection to Chile today over the terms of an international arbitration award that recognized Chilean sovereignty over three disputed islands.

title: The U.N. Today
News Summary
description: International

title: Pentagon Researcher Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (Resters)Dr. Robert Ross Fossum has been named the Pentagon's top researcher as director of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, the Defense Department announced today. Dr. Fossum has been serving as dean of research of the Naval Postgraduate School at Monterey, Calif. He succeeds Dr. George H. Heilmeier, who resigned.

title: Berkeley Backs Rejection Of Cooper Merger Plan
description: Berkeley BioMedical Inc. said its executive committee had voted to recommend to the board of directors rejection of a recent merger proposal from Cooper Laboratories because the proposal was totally inadequate.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Administration Hints It May Help Gas Consumers on Price Petition
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Carter Administration is quietly threatening to intervene on behalf of a petition by a consumer group asking the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to extend natural Ras price controls to the intrastate market

title: Urban Officials Are Uneasy About Carter Aid Plan
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5There appears to be a growing discrepancy between what urban leaders expected of the Carter Administration and what it is prepared to offer in its forthcoming statement of national urban policy.

title: U.N. Shelves a Western Proposal For Human Rights Commissioner
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 5A coalition of Communist and thirdworld countries voted here tonight to kill a Westernsponsored resolution calling on the United NatiOns to appoint a High Commissioner for Human Rights.

title: An Empty Ceremony in South Africa
description: The place where the Tswana sleepthe literal meaning of Bophuthatswana, the second tribal homeland to get independencecalls up visions of a tranquillity for which white South Africa vainly hopes. But the ceremonies establishing it today will not even be greeted with approval by the majority of the Tswana people, much less that of the international community beyond South Africa's borders.

title: Family in a Housing Project Finds It Beats Living in a Tenement
description: We're poor, I know we're poorI guess I'm pretty much used to it now, Ludivina Olevancia said the other day as she sat in the buffpainted living room of her apartment in Vladeck Houses, a lowIncome project on the Lower East Side.

title: Coal Labor Dispute Aided Railroads
description: Steel companies and electric utilities, fearing a long strike by the United Mine Workers of America, have frantically built up inventories of coal at the most feverish pace in decadesand the prime beneficiaries have been the nation's railroads.

title: Partner of Indicted Lawyer Pleads Guilty in BankFraud Case
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5 (AP)A business partner of George Franconero, a lawyer indicted on bank charges, pleaded guilty in Federal District Court in Newark to participating in a conspiracy to misapply $250,000 in funds of ,the State Bank of Chatham.

title: EGYPT CUTS RELATIONS WITH 5 ARAB NATIONS OPPOSED TO PEACE BID
description: CAIRO, Dec 5Egypt today broke off diplomatic relations with five hardline Arab criticsSyria, Iraq, Libya, Algeria and Southern Yemenin prompt retaliation for their efforts at the Tripoli confer: ence to prevent President Anwar elSadat from pursuing negotiations with Israel.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: For South Africans, White and Black, the Talk Is of Stephen Biko
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 5Wherever white South Africans opposed to their Government's racial policies gathered over the weekend, the talk turned to a. young black man whom many had never heard of Until he died in police custody 12 weeks ago, Stephen Biko.

title: Heimann Suspends Trading in Stock Of Lance's Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5In an unusual move, the Comptroller of the Currency today suspended trading in the stock of the National Bank of Georgia, in which Bert Lance, former Budget Director, is a principal shareholder.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: Goals

title: Radio
description: Music

title: The Two Wars in the Middle East
description: Egypt's break of diplomatic relations with Syria, Iraq, Libya, Algeria and Southern Yemen is a tactical response to the charge that President Sadat's formal acceptance of Israel in the Middle East was an act of treason. It is not the end of maneuvers among the Arab nations of the region and Secretary of State Vance is right to see what he can learn on a personal tour next week.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduct 34 min. from Sandy Hook time.

title: Police Department Magazine Struggling to Survive
description: Spring 3100, the New York City Police Department magazine, which took its name from the old telephone number of Police Headquarters, is in danger of a drastic cutback after 47 years unless it can attract more paid subscriptions from civilian police buffs and police officers.

title: Carters to See Nephew's Wedding
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)President and Mrs. Carter will attend the wedding of his nephew, Sydney Scott Stapleton, at Fayetteville, N.C., the White House announced today. The Carters will fly to Fayetteville on Dec. 16 and attend a wedding breakfast and the ceremony the next day. Mr. Stapleton, a medical student, is marrying Caro Lee Gainey. He is the son of the President's evangelist sister, Ruth, and husband, Robert Stepleton.

title: British Hear Begin
description: LONDON, Dec. 5Prime Minister Begin told 200 leaders of Britain's Jewish community here today that Israelis and Egyptians shall talk to each other and we shall find a solution, but he gave no indication what direction his country's negotiations with Egypt would take. Nor was there any hint of what, if any, concessions Israel would make to get a peace settlement.

title: Court Denies Plea To Block Kennecott
description: Trustees for minors owning at least $50,000 of stock in the Kennecott Copper Corporation were refused court relief here yesterday in an effort to block an offer by Kennecott to pay $66 a share or $567 millionfor stock in the Carborundum Company, a big upstate abrasives manufacturer.

title: ACCORD IS REPORTED FOR TAX ON CRUDE OIL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5In private meetings over the weekend among the ranking energy conferees, Senator Russell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, generally agreed to go along. with the Carter Administration's crude oil equalization tax and dropped his insistence on steering some of its proceeds to the oil industry, authoritative sources said today.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
David K. E. Bruce, Diplomat, Dies
description: David K. E. Bruce, one of the nation's most gifted and seasoned diplomats, died early yesterday at Georgetown Medical Center in Washington.

title: Companies Issue Their Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Oct. 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) American Stock Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: MAINE VOTERS REPEAL SCHOOL TAX SYSTEM
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 5By a wide margin in earl3? returns, Maine voters today repealed a bitterly resented school financing system that eliminated reliance on variable local property taxes and substituted a uniform statewide property tax.

title: Housing Discrimination
description: The high court declined to disturb a lower court ruling denying relief to a Toledo builder who had sued city officials to force them to permit construction of lowincome public housing in three suburban neighborhoods to promote integration (Skilken v. Toledo, No. 77443).

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1977

title: Leonard Silk
description: How weak is the dollar? The economic doctors emerge from the sickroom with radically different diagnoses and prescriptions. Rimmer de Vries, international economist of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company and editor of its World Financial MarThe kets, comes out smiling wanly and says, The dollar's weakness has run its Scene course. But Harold van B. Cleveland, international economist of Citibank, emerges with a grave mien and warns, The dollar is still going down.

title: David K. E. Bruce, Diplomat, Dies
description: David K. E. Bruce, one of the nation's most gifted and seasoned diplomats, died early yesterday at Georgetown Medical Center in Washington.

title: Playwright Overhears Lunch Girls
description: NEW HAVENThe scene is a locker roomdrab, dingy and chilly. There is a glazed partition above the metal lockers. Long wooden benches jut toward the audience. David Jenkins's setting appears to be an almost exact copy of his design for David Storey's The Changing Room, which had its American premiere in 1972 at the Long Wharf Theater.

title: Arthur J. Russell Jr., 73, Is Dead; ExPresident of The New Yorker
description: Arthur Joseph Russell Jr., who joined The New Yorker magazine as an advertising salesman in 1929 and retired as its president in 1968, died Sunday in Falmouth Mass.) Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived in Honolulu and Harborside, Me.

title: School Results
New Jersey Briefs
description: A former Republican state chairman, Neilson G. Gross, yesterday moved in Federal District Court in Newark for a dismissal of his conviction on charges of campaignfraud conspiracy, saying that deputy United States marshals dated jurors during his trial.

title: Notes on People
description: Cornelia Wallace won an important court victory yesterday before the trial of her suit for'divorce from Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama. The state Court of Appeals ruled that Judge John W. Davis 3d of Family Court in Montgomery must disqualify himself from hearing Mrs. Wallace's suit and a similar one filed by Mr. Wallace. The court did not say there was evidence that Judge Davis had shown bias or prejudice, but it said he should have excused himself if only to avoid the mere appearance of bias. Mrs. Wallace had contended that because Judge. Davis was appointed to the Family Court by Mr. Wallace, although the judge was later elected to the post on his own, it was incumbent on him to disqualify himself.

title: Price of Ground Coffees Cut by General Foods
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 5, (UPI)The General Foods Corporation, the nation's No. I roaster, today lowered the wholesale price of its ground coffees by 20 cnts a pound in the sixth round of reductions this year.

title: Gas Supplies Are Called Adequate As Utilities Seek New Customers
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5Officials of the state's four gas utilities said today that supplies of natural gas were more than adequate to meet the winter demands of their customers and urged the State Energy Commissioner, Joel R. Jacobson, to accede to their request to expand sales of the fuel.

title: Books of The Times
description: A life of Samuel Johnson? One would think the competition rather stiff for such an undertaking, since, by Walter Jackson Bate's own repeated admission, James Boswell's Life of Johnson remains the single most famous work of biographical art in the whole of literature. But as Dr. Bate, who is now Lowell Professor of the Humanities at Harvard University, also takes pains to point out, Boswell's biography presents a somewhat specialized view of Johnson. The first half of Johnson's life occupies little more than a'tenth of the work. Less than a quarter takes him up to fiftythree, when his life was more than twothirds over; and a full half of the book is devoted to Johnson's last eight years, from sixtyseven to seventyfive.

title: Winter Comes Early to Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 (AP)An unusually heavy latefall storm left Moscow blanketed today with more that. eight inches of snow, double the average snow cover for this time of year, the official press agency Tass reported.

title: Investing in Apartheid
description: Following the death of Steve Biko and the Government's crackdown on the press, condemnation of apartheid in South Africa has become fashionable. Once again, as during the Soweto riots, the South African story is on the front pages and featured in the nightly television news reports.

title: Westchester Saving Expected if County Runs Power Plants
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 5A firm of consulting engineers estimated today that under ideal conditions Westchester County consumers could save as much as 44.8 percent on their electricity bills if the county government took over from Consolidated Edison the supplying of electricity. Under the worst possible conditions, the consultant said, their bills might go up as much as 2.5 percent.

title: Sadat at Home: National Hero
description: CAIRO, Dec. 5  President Anwar elSadat's peace initiatives may have been denounced by other Arab states, but at home they have tapped the reservoir of Egyptian nationalist sentiments that lay for years trapped under the veneer of panArabism imposed on the country by his predecessor, Gamal Abdel Nasser. In the wake of his visit to Israel, Mr. Sadat's popularity exceeds what it was after the 1973 war, when Egyptians found new selfrespect in their military successes.

title: 2 Children Give $25 for Neediest In Memory of Their Older Sister
description: The plight of those in need somehow has a way of touching people of all ages.

title: Ma Bell's Natural Son, Darth Vader
description: Inflation took a turn for the worst the other day when the New York Telephone Company received permission to raise the price it charges for not printing your name in the telephone directory. That the company charges anything at all for not listing a number is an act of astonishing gall; raising the price of not providing this service borders on economic burlesque.

title: Critics of City Computer System Are Criticized by Its Operators
description: The people who operate New York City's Integrated Financial Management System protested yesterday that the Beame administration's transition paper on the sophisticated computer system was unduly critical of it.

title: A Chief Executive for the Police
description: What kind of Police Commissioner does Mayorelect Koch want? He may seek one whose appointment signals militance against corruption of the kind that recently infected the department. In that case, the selection, according to several reports, of John F. Keenan, the special state prosecutor, would make sense. But at this point in the history of both the city and the Police Department, so heavy an emphasis on corruption seems to us misdirected.

title: At Conference on Alternative Energy, Simple Is Essential
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 5Small is beautiful but simple is essential, was the message of alternative energy advocates at a threeday conference here.

title: NEW YORK CITY FACES TOUGH FIGHT FOR AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5New York City faces further belttightening and a tough selling job with Congress to get an extension of the special Federal loan assistance program it says it needs beyond the cutoff date cf June 30, 1978, according to some leaders in Congress and the Carter Administration.

title: HIGH COURT REJECTS HUNTS' LIBYA OIL SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5A Department of Justice proposal that the Federal courts take a closer look at how foreign governments are involving themselves in American business and economic activities was rejected today by the Supreme Court.

title: JOSEPH ASTROVE
description: Joseph Astrove, founder of Tidykins Inc., 112 West 34th Street, manufacturers of infants' and childrens' outerwear and other apparel, died suddenly Nov. 29 in his home, 709 Weaver Street, Larchmont, N. Y. He was 82 years old.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: N.B.A. Worried Over Travel, Officiating
description: Excessive travel and questionable officiating, coupled with teams' inability to win consistently on the road, have become a major concern in the National Basketball Association. Several owners and general managers have begun to work on ways to restore balance.

title: One Dead, 12 Hurt in Wild Ride By Driver on Times Sq. Sidewalk
description: A teenager behind the wheel of a stolen car killed one pedestrian and struck a dozen others last night in a wild, plunging ride along a crowded 42d Street sidewalk that left victims strewn for 500 feet between Eighth and Seventh Avenues off Times Square.

title: European Soccer
description: By Reuters

title: SOPHIA M. DeMUTH
description: AYR, Neb., Dec. 5 (UPI)Sophia M. DeMuth, believed to be the oldest resident of Nebraska, has died at age 111.

title: Release of 2 Women Held in F.A.L.N. Inquiry Urged
description: Lawyers for two jailed former staff members of the Episcopal Church, Maria T. Cueto and Raisa Nemikin, argued yesterday in Federal District Court that the two women have proved, by their ninemonth silence, that they will not testify about Puerto Rican terrorism and should be released.

title: Bel Canto Opera Does Haydn
description: Haydn's operas will probably always remain connoisseur items. They are packed with musical richesalmost too many, in fact, to really come alive on stage. One of them does seem to be catching on with smaller companies, however. L'Infedelt Delusa has been turning up fairly frequently of late, and the Bel Canto Opera produced the work at the Madison Avenue Baptist Church last weekend, apparently the opera's New York premiere.

title: Busch Competition Narrows to 3 Shops
description: AnheuserBusch has narrowed the competition for its $15 million Busch Bavarian beer and Busch Gardens accounts from four ad agencies to three. They are Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, New York; Needham, Harper & Steers, Chicago, and McDonald & Little, Atlanta.

title: Mrs. Guggenheimer Quits Consumer Post
description: After four years as New York City's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs, Elinor C. Guegenheimer has submitted her resignation to Mayor Beame, take effect on Dec. 31, the Mayor's last day in office.

title: Fredman Made Head Of City Water Board
description: Deptor Weyor Stanley M. Friedman yesterday was unanimously elected president of the New York City Board of Water Supply, whose abolition Mayorelect Edward I. Koch has vowed to seek from till. State Legislature.

title: Trial of Berkowitz In Brooklyn Urged By District Attorney
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney, Eugene Gold, urged yesterday that David R. Berkowitz, accused of being the 44caliber killer, be tried in Brooklyn for the murder of Stacy Moskowitz last July 31.

title: Red Smith
description: Jack Price sat in the windowed clocker's stand beside the training track at Dorchester Prep, one of about 150 farms devoted to the care and feeding or race horses dotting the Florida uplands around Ocala. A set of half a dozen horses walked onto the track at the head of the stretch and Price spoke into a microphone.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Around the Nation
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 5 (AP)President Carter's first year in office drew mixed reviews today, from George Meanv, who told the A.F.L.C.I.O. that the Administration's pluses were clouded by high unemployment and continued slack in the economy.

title: Traffic Snarled During Main Repair
description: Traffic was snarled over a wide area of midtown Manhattan yesterday as crews worked in an open trench in the rain to repair a water main that burst Saturday night at 42d Street and Lexington Avenue.

title: TV: Benny Goodman Plays Again
description: The place is the Wolf Trap Farm Park for the Performing Arts. The performer is Benny Goodman with his quintet and his jazz orchestra. The event was recorded last summer, and the In Peformance program, directed by Stan Lathan, can be seen on Channel 13 at 8 this evening.

title: Angels Bonds Is Acquired By White Sox
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 5Professional baseball opened its 76th business convantion today surrounded by palm trees and headaches induced by the recent economic revolt of the players.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: The Black Box Tyranny
description: Beginning this week, cable television subscribers in Columbus, Ohio, will be able to talk back to their television tubes. With the help of a black box named QUBE, which contains a computer connected to the studio, the viewer will be able to tap a button and participate in a quiz show or an auctionand that by no means taps the full potential of the innovation.

title: Rahsaan Roland Kirk, 41, Jazz Wind Instrumentalist
description: Rahsaan Roland Kirk, the wellknown jazz musician who was blind from birth and nearly immobile since he suffered a serious stroke in 1975, died yesterday at Bloomington (Ind.) Hospital shortly after having given a concert. He was 41 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LA MANCHA'S MAN The public is invited to join international scholars and students at a free threeday program of lectures and symposiums on the writings and life of Miguel de Cervantes, starting this morning at Fordham University. The events saluting the Spanish author, considered by many as the father of the modern novel, take place at the school's Rose Hill campus, on East Fordham Road (190th Street), east of Third Avenue.

title: Vance Set to Visit Mideast for 6 Days To Support Sadat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, in a show of support for President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, will make a sixday trip to the Middle East to urge other Arabs to follow Egypt's lead and enter direct negotiations with Israel for an overall peace agreement.

title: Tenacious Mediator in Coal Negotiations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5  It could be said that Wayne Louis Horvitz, the director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service and the man in the middle of the tortuous negotiations for a coal industry contract, was born to be a labor mediator. His fa ther, Aaron Horvitz, was one of the great pioneer labor arbitrators. My father, he says, was the primary influence in my life in more ways than one. Born Oct. 6, 1920, Mr. Horvitz grew up in the New York City area listening to people around the house talking about the labormanagement field all the time. It was a part of my life.

title: Beef Prices Expected to Level Off as More Cattle Go to Fattening Pens
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5After three years of drought, the rains have been falling over Western rangeland this fall and the nation's ranchers have stopped reducing their herds.

title: Stocks Involved in Mergers Rise; Most Others Falter in Tax Selling
description: Stocks of companies involved in corporate takeovers bounded ahead yesterday, but the general stock market lost ground in slower trading. Issues dropping in price outnumbered gainers on the New York Stock Exchange by an 8to5 ratio.

title: Advertising
description: The man who was marketing director of North American Systems when it introduced Mr. Coffee, the coffee maker, is now president of Moulinez Products Inc., the United States marketing subsidiary for the Frenchmade La Machine food processor.

title: ACTING AIDE ON TAX POLICY IS NAMED BY BLUMENTHAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal designated Donald C. Lubick today to serve as acting assistant secretary for tax policy.

title: Men Hold Most Top College Jobs 5 Years After U.S. Order on Bias
description: Five years after the Federal Government decreed that colleges and universities that discriminate against women or minority groups could lose their lucrative Federal contracts, the employment picture at the nation's institutions of higher education remains largely unchanged.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: A controversial new rule adopted by the private sector's authority on accounting procedures could significantly reduce the reported earnings of many independent oil and gas producers. But the rule has aroused so much opposition from the independents, who assert it would impede their access to the capital markets and eventually result in less exploration activity, that the battle is far from over.

title: Safety Unit Would Drop 1,100 Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Labor Departnent today proposed scrapping about 1,100 of what it called nitpicking and picayune job safety regulations that do virtually nothing to protect a worker's health or safety.

title: Knicks' Lineup
description: AT GARDEN 7:30 P.M. TELEVISIONCHANNEL F (CABLE) RADIOWNEW, 7:30 P.M.

title: Drug Tested on Troops in Vietnam Is Found to Cause Cancer in Rats
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)A drug taken daily by tens of thousands of American troops in Vietnam as part of a medical experiment has been found to cause cancer in male rats in tests by the National Cancer Institute.

title: Tennis
description: AT ADELAIDE, AUSTRALIA

title: Denver Post Names Editors
description: DENVER, Dec. 5 (AP)Leonard Larsen; chief of The Denver Post's Washington bureau, has been named an associate editor of the afternoon newspaper. The Post also said yesterday that Tom Gavin had been named an associate editor and as signed to Washington as a national correspondent. The Post also said that Gail Pitts had been named director of the newspaper's business and financial news department.

title: Teachers End Strike in Jersey
description: CHERRY HILL, Dec. 5A 32day strike by 1,200 teachers and service employees in Willingboro ended today when the Board of Education and two unions ratified threeyear contracts. Schools will reopen tomorrow for the district's 12,100 students.

title: MORRELL GOLDBERG, HOSPITAL EXECUTIVE
description: Morrell Goldberg, executive vice president of Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn, died there yesterday after a long illness. He was 67 years old and lived at 55 East Ninth Street, Manhattan.

title: Bottom Line: Women Lead, Few Follow
description: Toni Brown and Terry Garthwaite have had an honorable past as leaders of the old Joy of Cooking, one of the first rock bands to be fronted by women. They have recently reunited for a fine new disk called The Joy, and they appeared Sunday night and last night at the Bottom Line as part of a short promotional tour for the record.

title: On Palestine (1946)
description: On [July 31, 1946] the House of Lords debated the Situation in Palestine and Lord Addison, Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs, reported the British Government's reactions to the recommendations made by The AngloAmerican Commission of Inquiry into the Problems of European Jewry and Palestine.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Mrs. Humphrey in Hospital
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI)Muriel Humphrey, wife of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, has been hospitalized to recover from exhaustion. The Senator's office said Mrs. Humphrey was admitted to the Washington Hospital Center last night and would remain there several days to get a complete rest. She had been helping care for her husband, who is under treatment for inoperable cancer of the pelvis.

title: Money
description: Monday, December 5, 1977

title: Mothers in Hartford Wait In Cold for Clothing Money
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 5 (AP)Thousands of mothers on welfare, several fainting in the pushing crowds, waited for hours in the cold here today to apply for a limited number of $25 emergency clothing checks.

title: MOSCOW IS CAUSTIC TO U.S. ON MIDEAST
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5Soviet political commentary on the Middle East has taken on unsettling antiAmerican tones just as Undtr Secretary of State Philip A. Habib has begun talks with Soviet officials on the area.

title: YOUNG MICHIGAN COUPLE AND A SON SLAIN IN HOME
description: BATTLE CREEK, Mich., Dec. 5 (AP)A week after David Manwarren was quoted as saying that someone was looking for us, he and his wife and a young son were found shot to death in their home, a Christmas tree overturned on the living room floor. His 1yearold son survived unharmed.

title: Sadat Said to Allay Saudis' Fears
description: BAHRAIN, Dec. 5Arab and Western diplomatic and business sources here say that Saudi Arabia's fears over Egypt's peace initiatives with Israel have faded but that Saudi rulers continue to resent not being consulted more by the Cairo Government.

title: HARDLINE ARAB BLOC IS FORMED AT TRIPOLI
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Dec. 5A new Arab front for resistance and confrontation was set up here today by the leaders of Syria, Libya, Algeria, Southern Yemen and the Palestine Liberation Organization to combat what they described as the high treason of Egyptian peace initiatives with Israel.

title: G.O.P. IN ESSEX COUNTY FIGHTS DISTRICT PLAN
description: NEWARK, Dec. 5  Essex County Republicans said today that they would sue to have put aside a plan for dividing the county into districts for the election of freeholders.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
Rites Held for L.I. Youth Slain Near Home
description: NORTH WOODMERE, L.I., Dec. 5The stunned family and friends of Richard Lesser attended funeral services and high school classmates held a brief memorial tribute today for the 16yearold honor student who was stabbed to death Saturday morning on a footpath near his home here.

title: SOCIAL SECURITY BILL FACES MONTH'S DELAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5In a turnabout, Senator Russell B. Long, chairman of a SenateHouse conference on Social Security financing, said today that maybe it would be better to complete action on the bill in January.

title: U.S. Steel Says Industry Needs Price Rise Soon;
description: The steel industry will have to raise its prices in the near future even if imports decline, David M. Roderick, the president of the United StatesSteel Corporation, the nation's largest steel producer, said yesterday.

title: Lawyer Is Linked to I.R.S. Report That Freed Gulf Oil of Tax on Gifts
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 5 (AP)A Pittsburgh lawyer testified today that he wrote nearly all of a threepage Internal Revenue Service report absolving the Gulf Oil Corporation of tax liability for its political slush fund activities.

title: Bermuda Eases Curfew as Calm Continues After Racial Outbursts
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 5The curfew on this racially tense resort island was put back to 9 o'clock tonight as the streets remained quiet for the second day.

title: Albany Senate to Vote on Tax Cuts
description: ALBANY, Dec. 5 (AP)The Senate majority Leader, Warren M. Anderson, displaying the political leverage he hopes to use in running for Governor, today called for a Senate session to pass his version of the tax reductions promised by all the state's major politicians.

title: Bridge:
description: Most experts routinely misplay the following common suit combination:

title: 4.7% DECLINE SHOWN BY NEWAUTO SALES FOR NOVEMBER'S END
description: DETROIT, Dec. 5New car sales slumped 4.7 percent below the yearago level during the final selling period of November, the nation's four major automobile producers reported here today.

title: ACCORD IS REPORTED FOR TAX ON CRUDE OIL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5In private meetings over the weekend among the ranking energy conferees, Senator Russell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, generally agreed to go along with the Carter Administration's crude oil equalization tax and dropped his insistence on steering some, of its proceeds to the oil industry, authoritative sources said today.

title: A Ubiquitous Hand Guides Relations of U.S. and Greece
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5He is a selfstyled journalist who shuns accreditation cards and a selfproclaimed lobbyist who, because he finances this activity himself, has never had to register as such with Congress. A welldressed man with the air of a bon vivant, he neither drinks nor smokes.

description: To the Editor:

description: By The Associated Press

title: Basketball Rankings
description: COACHES POLL

title: PRICES FOR BONDS DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Amid talk of tax cuts and higher interest rates, bond prices dropped sharply yesterday as the gradual decline that began a week ago steepened and picked up speed.

title: Carter Picks Pennsylvania Official As U.S. Commissioner on Aging
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)President Carter announced today that he had recruited 37yearold Robert C. Benedict; Commissioner of Pennsylvania's Office for the Aging, as the successor to Arthur S. Flemming, the 72yearold Commissioner on Aging. Mr. Benedict, of Mechanicsburg, Pa., has held his post since, 1972.

title: You Light Up My Life Puts Glow Into Brooks's Future
description: At the time, it may have seemed like a ridiculous finale: At the end of You Light Up My Life, a lowbudget movie about a young singer, the heroine released her first record and watched it catapult effortlessly up the charts. But Joseph Brookswho wrote, produced and directed the movie, and also wrote its title song is having the last laugh. And perhaps the one after that, too.

title: Coffee Futures Climb 4c Limit; Wheat and Other Grains Decline
description: Coffee futures prices rose the daily limit of 4 cents a pound yesterday on 1 he New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange. The unrestricted December 1977 contract climbed 6 cents a pound to $2.25 a pound, while nearby March rose 4.28 cents to $1.73 a pound.

title: N.F.L. Standings
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Miami 17, Baltimore 6.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: About New York
description: Absolutely and forevermore, the people in the refrigerator had found the end of animation. Indeed, the bearded man rolled out in cold drawer No. 68 had collapsed into death while he was dancing at a discothque.

title: Friedman Made Head Of City Water Board
description: Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman yesterday was unanimously elected president of the New York City Board of Water Supply, whose abolition Mayorelect Edward I. Koch has vowed to seek from the State Legislature.

title: Barzilauskas Is Doubtful For Sunday
description: The status of Carl Barzilauskas, the New York Jets' 6foot6inch, 255pound defensive tackle, remains questionable for Sunday's game against the Buffalo Bills in Shea Stadium.

title: Custom Shirts: Taking the Measure of the Man
description: A South American walked into A. Sulka at 711 Fifth Avenue recently and ordered 292 custommade shirts, 12 in this color, two dozer, in that ... The bill was $10,000.

title: COUNCIL POSTPONES A BILL ON NOMINEES
description: Flexing its legislative muscles to reach for power it contends is inherent in the recently revised New York City Charter, the City Council yesterday began consideration of a bill to require the Mayor to submit for its advice and consent the names of nominees for commissioner.

title: AIR LANDING SYSTEM GIVEN A FLIGHT TEST
description: A flying contest to help settle an acrimonious BritishAmerican struggle over which advanced badweatherlanding system should become the world standard for the next several decades got under way yesterday at Kennedy International Airport.

title: Cost of Consultants Criticized by Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)President Carter told his Cabinet today that too much money was being spent by the Government on consultants, a spokesman said.

title: Trident Missile Tested
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Dec. 5 (UPI). A Trident missile, one of the newest atomic weapons in the Navy's arsenal, rocketed down the Air Force test range today in the ninth successful landbased test of the $21.6 billion program. It flew to an undisclosed target area in the Atlantic.

title: Carter Asserts the Soviet Bloc Violates Helsinki Pact on Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5The Soviet Union and its European allies continue to violate the human rights of their citizens while asserting that they are complying, with provisions of the EastWest agreement signed at Helsinki in 1975, President Carter told Congress.

title: Goldsworthy, Ranger Forward Exiled to Minor League, sent to Indianapolis of W.H.A.
description: The Indianapolis Racers of the World Hockey Association yesterday acquired 33yearold Bill Goldsworthy, a right wing, on loan from the New York Rangers for the three seasons remaining on Goldsworthy's $180,000 annual contract. contract.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5 (AP)Three San Francisco brewing companies filed separate antitrust suits today against Philip Morris Inc. and a subsidiary; the Miller Brewing Company, alleging the latter illegally attempted to monopolize the beer business.

title: People and Business
description: The Maine Central Railroad announced yesterday that its board of directors had elected John F. Gerity president, succeeding E. Spencer Miller, who announced his retirement last Thursday. Mr. Gerity, who is 53 years old and who has been in charge of the accounting and finance departments, will take over his new duties Jan. 1.

title: Federal Waste Tied to Aides Fear of Speaking Out
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI)Corruption and waste continue unchecked behind the doors of many Federal agencies because most Government workers are ?fraid to disclose its existence, Senator Patrick J. Leahy, Democrat of Vermont, charged today.

title: Officer Asks for Abandoned Baby
description: It was to be just a routine police call to pick up a dayold baby girl who had been abandoned in a Ridgewood, Queens, apartment buildingbut for Charles Larkin, one of the police officers who answered the call last Friday, it may have been anything but routine.

title: 180,000 START STRIKE IN THE COALFIELDS AS TALKS BREAK OFF
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Dec. 6The United Mine Workers union went on strike this morning, ordering out at 12:01 A.M. the 130,000 coal miners covered by an expired agreement with the Bituminous Coal Operators Association.

title: Jersey For Expanding Right Turns on Red
description: TRENTON, Dec. 5 (AP)About onethird of 2,170 local bans on right turns at red lights are unnecessary, according to a survey by the State Department of Transportation.

title: Man, 82, Given 1Year Sentence In Wife's Death
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 5Peter Cipolla, 82 years old, was sentenced today to a year in prison for strangling his 76yearold wife, whom he had suspected of infidelity.

title: Capital Appropriations At a Record in Quarter
description: The Conference Board, a business research group, said that capital appropriations by this country's 1,000 largest manufacturers totaled a record of $17.7 billion in the third quarter of this year. The figure surpassed the previous record of $16.4 billion established in the comparable period of 1974.

title: Excerpts From Arab Communique Issued in Libya
description: With a complete sense of panArab responsibility, the conference examined the dimensions of the present stage of the Arab cause in general and the cause of Palestine in particular, and the AmericanZionist designs aimed at imposing surrender settlements upon the Arab nation, and to infringe on the national and firmly established rights of the Palestinian people, the liquidation of national Arab achievements and striking against the movement of Arab liberation as a prelude to subjugate the Arab region and to control its destiny. and to chain it to international imperialism.

title: School Arbitration May Affect Other state Disputes
description: TRENTON, Dec. 5The end of the Willingboro school strike today, with both sides agreeing to arbitration, may be forerunner of how labor disputes involying the 375,000 government employees in New Jersey are to be settled in the future.

title: Islanders' Hot Trio Grande
description: Tinker to Evers to Change. Russell to Cousy to Kensohn. Gifford, Rote and Cenerly. Rosewall, Laver and Newcombe.

title: City Faces Fight On More Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5New York City faces further belttightening and a tough selling job with Congress to get an extension of the special Federal loan assistance program it says it needs beyond the cutoff date of June 30, 1978, according to some leaders in Congress and the Carter Administration.

description: Music

title: 180,000 START STRIKE IN THE COALFIELDS AS TALKS BREAK OFF
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Dec. 6The United Mine Workers union went on strike this morning, ordering out at 12:01 A.M. the 130,000 coal miners covered by an expired agreement with the Bituminous Coal Operators Association.

title: Catholic Relief Services Sends $1.3 Million in Storm Aid to India
description: Bishop Edwin B. Broderick, director of the Catholic Relief Services, has announced that the organization's emergency aid to cyclone and flood victims in India amounted to $1.3 million during a recent 10day period.

title: ScholarAthletes Concerned About Lure of Pros
description: Mark Wichman, a scholarathlete from Bowling Green State University in Ohio whose immediate future includes postgraduate studies, expressed concern yesterday about the overriding attraction professional sports has for

title: Gromyko and China's Envoy Meet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 5 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko met the Chinese Ambassador to Moscow, Wang Yuping, today. The official news agency Tass said the meeting was at Mr. Wang's request and a Chinese Embassy spokesman described it as a normal protocol meeting.

title: Farm Strike Held Certain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (UPI)A farm protest leader said today that a nationwide farmers' strike beginning Dec. 14 against low prices was now a certainty, with at least 40 percent of the nation's growers taking part. George Boucher of Ravenna, Neb., who heads a group called National Farm Strike Inc., told a news conference, The strike on the 14th is a certainty.

title: Concert: Britten Is Remembered
description: Sunday marked the first anniversary of Benjamin Britten's death and a concert in St. Thomas Church commemorated the occasion. Sponsored by the American Friends of the Aldeburgh Festival, which is held each year in Britten's home town on the North Sea coast, it was a moving and enriching evening of musicmaking, producing the special sort of communicative experience that Britten always strived,for in his compositions.

title: Dollar Moves Down In Trading Abroad, Gains Against Yen
description: The dollar slipped against major European currencies in foreign exchange trading yesterday, but gained against the Japanese yen.

title: Lost Flier Lands at Flushing And Finds a Summons Waiting
description: J. Walter Miller, a new pilot from the Boston area, made two mistakes yesterday morning.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Dolphins Defeat Colts For FirstPlace Tie
description: MIAMI, Dec. 5A great run of 77 yards for a fourthquarter touchdown by a rookie running hack, Leroy Harris, was the big play in Miami's 176 victory over Baltimore here tonight in the Orange Bowl. The outcome nut the Dolphins in a tie with the Colts for first place in the Eastein Division of the American Football Conference. Each has a 93 wonlost record.

title: Hope for the Alexander Hamilton Dims as Navy Bars Salvage Aid
description: Prospects for raising the partly submerged Alexander Hamilton, the last of the historic Hudson River sidewheel steamboats, appeared to dim considerably yesterday when the Navy said it was not in a position to pay for the salvage operation.

title: Mother of Woman in Coma Is Questioned
description: The chief of the Homicide Bureau in the Brooklyn District Attorney's office questioned the mother of Rosemarie Maniscalco yesterday in an effort to unravel the events that proceded the collapse of her pregnant daughter, who remained in a deep coma from which physicians say she will never recover.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 6, 1977

title: Wild Drive in Stolen Car Kills 1, Injures 12 on Times Sq. Sidewalk
description: A teenager behind the wheel of a stolen car killed one pedestrian and struck a dozen others last night in a wild, plunging ride along a crowded 42d Street sidewalk that left victims strewn for 500 feet between Eighth and Seventh Avenues off Times Square.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The Financial Accounting Standard's Board has adopted a controversial new rule that could significantly reduce the reported earnings of many independent oil and gas producers. Page 61.

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHORE BHARU, Malaysia, Dec. 5 (AP) Police and Government investigators searched a squaremile area of swamp today for bodies and clues to what happened in the minutes before a hijacked Malaysian jetliner blew up in flight and crashed, killing all 100 aboard. At least one American was identified as apassenger.

title: Opera: AffectingRosenkavalier
description: Der Rosenkavalier is, among many things, a study of love and aging, of the possibility of holding on to youth. In this case, youth is epitomized in the teenage Octavian, and the whole drama of Strauss's opera concerns the Marschallin's growing awareness that she is growing too old to keep him interested much longer. The Metropolitan Opera's performance Monday night, the season's first, brought this out in an affecting way, partly owing to peculiarities of casting.

title: Vance Set to Visit Mideast for 6 Days To Support Sadat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, in a show of support for President Anwar elSadal of Egypt, will make a sixday trip to the Middle East to urge other Arabs to follow Egypt's lead and enter direct negotiations with Israel for an overail peace agreement.

title: White House Aides' Plea for Defense CutsStirs Dispute in Government
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5At a time when the Carter Administration is pressing its allies in Western Europe to increase their defense spending, a sharp debate has broken out within the Government over an attempt by White House budget advisers to cut $3 billion to $5 billion from the Pentagon's proposed budget for 1979.

title: Girl Recites Speech That Sparked Boycott
description: BOYNTON, Okla., Dec. 5, (AP)Sherida Jones recited the I Have A Dream speech of the late Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. today at a school talent program, several weeks after black students walked out to protest high school officials' refusal to let her do so.

title: EARNINGS FOR CARRIER UP 45.5% IN QUARTER
description: The Carrier Corporation, which is acquiring the Inmont Corporation for $244 million in stock, reported yesterday that its earnings for the quarter ended Oct. 31 were up 45.5 percent on a sales gain of 9.3 percent.

title: California Attorney General to Seek the Governorship
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 5Attorney General Evelle J. Younger, the California Attorney General, said today he would announce his candidacy for the Republi can nomination for Governor about Feb. 1 and that he expected to make headway by attacking Democratic Gov . Eunmd G. Brown Jr.'s style of conducting the office.

title: Deaths
description: Aracich, Nicholas

title: South Africa Makes 2d Black Homeland Independent Nation
description: MMABATHO, South Africa, Dec. 5 (Reuters)South Africa, pursuing its apartheid policy, granted independence to the Bophuthatswana black homeland tonight.

title: Inmates Face Disciplinary Action for Revolt Upstate
description: State Corrections Department officials said yesterday that disciplinary action would be taken against the inmates found responsible for Friday's uprising at the State Correctional Facility in Coxsackie, N.Y., and asserted that this position did not conflict with their .pledge that there would be no reprisals against the rebellious inmates.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Atlanta at Seattle.

title: SUFFOLK AND NASSAU PLAN TO COOPERATE
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 5Nassau and Suffolk Counties will begin a joint effort soon to lure business to Long Island, hoping to reverse the view held by many businessmen that the Island is a place of high taxes, poor transportation and a bad business climate.

title: High Court Accepts Case on Rights of Owners of Landmark Property
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether the Penn Central was entitled to compensation for the city's decision to designate Grand Central Terminal as a landmark and bar construction of a multistory office tower on top of it.

title: Nordic Bloc Urges U.N. to Voice. Its Concern. on Rights in Uganda
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 6Five Nordic countries called on the General Assembly today to express concern for the first time over humanrights violations in Uganda.

title: Article 19 -- No Title
description: DO NOT FORGET THE NEEDIEST!

title: Staying Warm (Not Hot) in Winter; Personal Health
description: MAN EVOLVED as a semitropical animal. He is comfortable unclothed in calm, dry air at a temperature of 85 degrees Fahrenheit. His body is better equipped to cope with hot weather than with cold. Therefore, in winter in northern climes, man must take extra precautions to prevent excessive exposure to cold and extra steps to help his body conserve its own heat.

title: Coast Guard Boasts of Its Recruits: They're Able, Seaworthy, Fernale
description: The air over New York Harbor was cold and damp yesterday morning, and the waters were a study in gray. To stand on deck was to allow sea chill through the thickest wrap and to dream of the warm, dry land. It was not a morning to tempt many to sign on for a long voyage.

title: SADAT VOWS TO DEAL WITH ISRAELIS ALONE IF OTHER ARABS BALK
description: CAIRO, Dec. 6President Anwar elSadat said today that he would carry peace negotiations through to the end with Israel alone if other Arab countries involved in the Middle East conflict refused to take part in the later stages envisioned for a conference in Geneva.

title: House Calls for Easing Some Rules for Rural Hospitals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Carter Administration's attempt to control soaring hospital costs took another step backward today when the house passed, 357 to 0, a resolution calling for the exemption of rural hospitals from Federal guidelines that would have drastically altered the services they provide.

title: Article 6  No Title
Mets, Twins Again Discuss Koosman
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 6The New York Mets reopened talks with the Minnesota Twins today in an effort to trade Jerry Koosman, but the trading market at baseball's winter convention was still dominated by the glamorous and highpriced revolt of the free agents.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: DISCOVERIES
description: HERE THEY are againChristmas gift suggestionsand if you're going to go through them, you should know that practicality wasn't the criterion. There's nothing you can't live without, and nothing essential to health and happiness.

title: Letters
description: Your Nov. 26 editorial The Callousness of the Well Fed raises questions that concern all of us involved in the problem of world hunger.

title: Political Fight Erupts Over Fire Ant and Its Antidote
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6The forebears of Solenopsis invicta, like some other American colonists, were stowaways. The best guess is that they hid among nursery plants aboard riverboats out of Paraguay and landed at Mobile, Ala., around 1940. ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? country behind, they flourished in the United States. Today, Solenopsis invicta better known as imported red fire ants infest 190,531,685 aores of pasture, cropland, suburbs, parks and backyards in 10 Southern states.

title: Late Injuries Set Up Raiders' Downfall
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 6Far years the Oakland Raiders had to live with the stigma of winning division championships but not making it to the Super Bowl. Last season they finally capped another firstplace finish with a trip to the Super Bowl and a rousing victory over Minnesota there.

title: Bridge:
description: Beginners learn to throw losers on winners, and when they are experienced, they find there are sometimes advantages to be gained from throwing a loser on a loser. But who ever heard of throwing a winner on a loser?

title: KEY VANCE AIDE SEES GROMYKO ON MIDEAST
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6Philip C. Habib, Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, held a round of talks on the Middle East with Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko this morning before leaving Moscow, a ranking Soviet official reported.

title: Around the Nation
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 6 (UPI)Howard Willard, a smalltime burglar who stumbled on a fortune, was found guilty tonight of murder in the killing of Marjorie Jackson, an heiress and taking $4 million from her home.

title: Shane O'Neill, Playwright's Son, Suicide; Life Was. Dominated by Father's Themes
description: The suicide of Shane O'Neill, whose life in so many ways reflected the problems of despair raised in the plays by his father, Eugene O'Neill, was made known recently.

title: Chess:
description: When Siegbert Tarrasch (18621934), the great German theoretician and systematizer, declaimed, the threat is stronger than the execution, he certainly knew what he was talking about. There's nothing like a good threat to get the opponent to push the panic button.

title: RALPH HIDY, OF HARVARD; BUSINESS HISTORY AUTHOR
description: Ralph W. Hidy, Isador Strauss professor emeritus of the Harvard Graduate School of Business, died yesterday at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston.

title: The U.N. Today
Clothes for Dancersand Others
description: If you didn't know that Rudi Gernreich started his career as a dancer, you might guess it from his attitude toward clothes: He's always favored fabrics like jersey that moved with the body. He objects to anything that restricts. movement In Any way. Recently, he's been designing the costumes for Bella Lewitzky's dance company on the West coast.

title: Coal Dissidents Support Union President Over Strike
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 6Formerly dissident officials of the United Mine Workers union today pledged solidarity with the union president, Arnold R. Miller, as the first day of the nationwide strike by the union kept an estimated 180,000 members away from the mines.

title: For young cooks, blintzes, omelets and a sense of purpose.
description: No one cries over spilled eggs ot flour on the floor, though the students may say ick! to beets and radishes. Stuffed cabbage and blintzes are popular fare, and precocity reigns as tall; turns from chopping celery and carrots to coo au vin and fettucine Alfredo.

title: Dollar Rallies After Early Losses As Germans Call Slide Overdone
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (AP)The dollar lost ground against several major currencies in hectic European trading today, then firmed somewhat in late trading after statements from West German officials to the effect that the slide was being overdone.

title: One Man's Glogg, Another's Eggnog
description: When the nights grow long and the year dwindles to a close, climate and calendar combine to foster festivities that bring together large groups of peoplefamilies and friendsas eager to share the warm spirit of the holidays as they are to share the warm spirits. Christmas and New Year's are the season of eggnog and glogg, of mulled claret and gleaming bowls of punch, of wassails and other potions as filled with tradition as they are with flavor.

title: Letters
description: Not So Ritzy

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: In terms of its contribution to the nation's total energy needs and the amount of investment committed to it, solar energy is still in its infancy. But its development is progressing faster than either Washington or its advocates expected. From technological standpoint, the feasibility of solar energy for heating, cooling and generating electricity has been a reality for some time. Its economic practicability, however, has been another matter.

title: Islanders Down. Stars,. 42.
description: The New York Islanders, going ahead, 32, on Bob Bourne's goal late in the second period, defeated the Minnesota North Stars; 42. Page D18.

Article 18 -- No Title
description: DO NOT FORGET THE NEEDIESTI
