description: CAIRO, Dec. 6President Anwar .elSadat said today that he would carry peace negotiations through to the end with Israel alone if other Arab countries involved in the Middle East conflict refused to take part in the later stages envisioned for a conference in Geneva.

title: Senate Backs Foreign Bribery Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 5 (AP)The Senate approved legislation today imposing $1 million in fines on American corporations that bribe foreign government officials to obtain business overseas.

title: Unions Leaders Face Rebellions In Rank and File
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., Dec. 5Every morning thousands of workers drive to the sandcolored plants of the Lockheed Corporation's missile division here, 40 miles south of San Francisco, where they build Poseidon and Trident missiles and Agena satellites.

title: Dividends
Texas Tech Picks Dockery
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Dec, 6 (AP)An offensive coordinator, Rex Dockery, who is one of Steve Sloan's close friends, was hired tonight as the new head football coach of the Texas Tech Red Raiders. Sloan resigned from the head coachingosition last week to accept a similar job at the University of Mississippi.

title: Strikes and Weather Deject Montrealers
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 6  This is not the season to be jolly in Montreal.

title: Niagara 77, Hofstra 68
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 6 (AP)Niagara rallied from a 12point deficit to defeat Hofstra, 7766, tonight in college basketball.

title: FIRESTONE RAISES QUARTER NET 57.1%
description: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, the nation's secondlargest tire producer after Goodyear reported yesterday a 57.1 percent rise in fourth fiscal quarter earnings and a 14.8 percent gain for the fiscal year ended Oct. 31.

title: Child's World
description: Patricia Wells

title: Food Gifts You Can Make at Home
description: CHRISTMAS came early to my kitchen this year. Weeks ago I asked numerous acquaintances, all of them known as firstrate cooks, to lend me their favorite recipes, those that they would make to give to friends during the Yuletide season. The response was magnanimous. A wealth of recipes came this way ranging from some embarrassingly rich cakes and cookies to curiously appealing, verylowcalorie bottled celery sticks to be served as an appetizer.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: DORIC (Home). Left St. Barthelemy Dec. 3; due 3 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: William S. Gaud Jr. Is Dead at 70; ExChief of Foreign Aid Program
description: Will'am Steen Daud Jr., former chief of the United States foreign aid program and previously a legal assistant to Mayor Morello H. La Guardia of New York, died Monday night of cancer in The Washington Home in Washington. Mr. Gaud, resident of the capital, was 70 years old.

title: Sculptor of Steel Policy
description: WASHINGTONI've got one of the best people in Government working on this problem, said President Carter last month in announcing formation of the interagency task force that has just formulated a plan to help the distressed steel industry. The President was speaking about the head of the task force, a bearded amateur sculptor who also is one of the fast guns among economic trouble shooters in Washington. Anthony Morton Solomon, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, says his twin roles are not incongruous.

title: I.S. Policy Gives New Emphasis To Caribbean, Especially Jamaica
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Carter Administration has shifted the geographical and political thrust of United States policy in the Western Hemisphere by giving new emphasis to the Caribbean region and special attention to Jamaica.

title: Article 16 -- No Title
description: The Knicks defeated the Boston Celtics, 122119, last night at Madison Square Garden in an overtime game they tried several times to lose.

title: New Rosenka valier Infused With Verve
description: DER ROSENKAVALIER is, among many things, a study of love and aging, of the possibility of holding on to youth. In this case, youth is epitomized in the teenage Octavian, and the whole drama of Strauss's opera concerns the Marschallin's growing awareness that she is growing too old to keep him interested much longer. The Metropolitan Opera's performance Monday night, the season's first, brought this out in an affecting way, though it was also disorienting at times, partly owing to peculiarities of casting.

title: REP. GAYDOS OFFERS DATA IN INQUIRY ON NOMINEE
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 6Representative Joseph M. Gaydos, Democrat of Pennsylvania, said today that he had turned over to the Federal authorities financial records describing his past association with the former law firm of Schumacher & White.Mr. Gaydos Is one of six Democratic Representatives from western Pennsylvania who recommended George E. Schumacher as United States Attorney in Pittsburgh. Sources familiar with the investigation have said in recently published accounts that Attorney General Griffin B. Bell and Associate Attorney General Michael J. Egan improperly delayed an investigation into $60,000 in payments made to Mr. Gaydos by Mr. Schumacher's. law firm. Mr. Bell has denied the accusation.

title: Three Lawyers Defy A.C.L.U. to Defend Nazis
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 6 (UPI)Three lawyers for the American Civil Liberties Unicn said tcdhy that they would ignore a local A.C.L.U. board decision and represent the American Nazi Party in a court battle concerning a recorded telephone hate message.

title: Ideas Save Jersey $500,000
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6 (UPI) The state government saved more than $500,000 in the last year by offering employees awards for moneysaving ideas, the Civil Service Department said yesterday. Gov. Byrne cited the Civil Service and Health Departments for outstanding participa. Lion. He said the Health Department achieved the highest savings in fiscal year 1977, more than $170,000. The Civil Service Department had the highest participation on a per capita basis.

title: Rating the Food Processor Cookbooks
description: What was sure to follow the proliferation of food processors on the market is upon usa proliferation of foodprocessor cookbooks. Approximately a dozen are already in bookstores with who knows how many on the way to the printer's.

title: Edward A. O'Neal, ExChairman Of Monsanto Company, Dies at 72
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 6 (AP)Edward A. O'Neal, a former chairman of the board of the Monsanto Company, died in a St. Louis hospital today after a long illness. He was 72 years old.

title: Red Smith
description: Ken Norton, who ought to be heavyweight champion of the world, was in New York yesterday but he left in disgust. Not disgust with New York, disgust with Madridor, rather, with the gurus of the World Boxing Council who met in Madrid last week.

title: The Last 18thCentury American
description: PARIS David Bruce was the last 18thcentury American. Tall, handsome, with distinguished manners and wicleranging interests, he belonged even by appearance to that golden age for. the United States what the fifth cintury B.C. was for Athens.

title: KOCH PLANS TO PRESS FOR SUBWAY CHANGES
description: Subways should be safer and cleaner, trains should be longer and half fare for the elderly should apply 24 hours a day, Mayorelect Edward I. Koch said yesterday, adding that he would press those suggestions with transit officials.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Senator Robert Garcia announced his intention to run for the Democratic nomination for the Bronx Congressional seat that Herman Badillo will vacate when he becomes a Deputy Mayor on Jan. 1. A veteran of 13 years in the Legislature, Mr. Garcia is deputy minority leader of the Senate.

title: Article 12 -- No Title
OLGA PETROVA, ACTRESS AND PLAY WRIGHT, WAS 93
description: Olga Petrova, who wrote The White Peacock and starred in its premiere on Broadway 56 years ago this month, died last Wednesday, in Clearwater, Fla. She was 93 years old.

title: When Sanitarian Is Doing Right He Finds a Lot of Things Wrong
description: Peter Sineno never eats lunch when or at least wherehe works. But then, almost anyone seeing some of the things he sees on the job might not be hungry, for in some places more than. the spoons are greasy.

title: Losing Takes Toll on Loughery
description: It is a twohour drive home from Piscataway, N. J. to Dix Hills, L. I., a long and winding road that leads from Kevin Loughery's place of business to his front door. He makes that drive after every home game the New Jersey Nets play, and most times he makes that drive as the coach of the losing team. The Nets are horror show. They are the worst team in the National Basketball Association. They have won just two or nine home games, just three of 23 over all. It used to be that Loughery could take a loss in stride; he'd file it under F and forget about it. Not any more. This season the losses are breaking over him like ocean waves. He being swamped.

title: Letter: On Rail Passenger Service
description: To the Editor:

title: HOUSE VOTES NOT TO KILL LEFT OVER FUNDS FOR B1
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (UPI)  The House today rejected an attempt to kill $462 million In leftover funds to produce two models of the B1 bomber in a final drive by supporters of the controversial plane to keep the program alive.

title: Yervant Krikorian, 85, Philosophy Teacher
description: Dr. Yervant Hovannes Krikorian, for 40 years professor of philosophy at the City College of New York, the last 14 of them as chairman of the department, died Monday in Sibley Hospital in Washington of Parkinson's Disease. Fre was 85 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Village Orchestra Impressive
description: CARNEGIE RECITAL HALL, normally the site of solo recitals or intimate chamber music, played host Monday evening to. an honesttogod orchestra. Now, the Greenwich House Orchestra, based in Greenwich Village, may not be a bigtime professional ensemble in terms of either size or sumptuousness. But sometimes the right circumstances and an extra degree of enthusiasm can compensate very nicely. Michael Bartos, the conductor, had clearly rehearsed his charges exhaustively, and the result in the grandest piece assayed, Beethoven's Symphony No. 1, was undeniably impressive. Mr. Bartos had crisp, straightforward ideas about the music, and his musicians executed them with energy and precision.

title: PAYOFF ALLEGATIONS ON SCHOOLS STUDIED
description: Federal authorities are investigating allegations that a Californiabased educationalservices company paid off officials of a Bronx community school district to obtain school business.

title: WEST GERMANS FACE GROWING STUDENT IRE
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 6When Helmut Kohl, the West German opposition leader, came to speak at the Technical University here last week, he found a jeering crowd of militant students who had occupied the auditorium and refused to budge. The Christian Democratic leader withdrew and gave his lecture at another building half a mile away.

title: Carey Names Dyson to a 2d Post, As Urban Development Chairman
description: ALBANY, D ec. 6In a move designed to use the powers of the Urban Development Corporation to help revitalize economic development, Governor Carey announced today that John S. Dyson, the outspoken State Commerce Commissioner, would take on the added job of chairman of the U.D.C.

title: Japanese Adopt a Major Portion Of Trade Liberalization Package
description: TOKYO, Dec. 6Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda and his economic cabinet ministers today adopted a major portion of a package of proposed tradeliberalization measures that an envoy will carry to Washington soon In an effort to ease the mounting trade tensions between the two allies.

title: Quake in Soviet Central Asia
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6 (AP)An earthquake measuring 7 points on the 12-point Soviet scale struck the area of Tashkent in Soviet Central Asia today, the Soviet press agency, Miss, reported.

title: Market Place
description: Investors thinking of mutual fund shares as stocking stuffers this Christmas may be interested in knowing which have the best overall records in recent years.

title: Freed Black Farmers Tilled Manhattan's Soil in the 1600's
description: Before it was Chatham Square, before it was Astor Place, before it was Greenwich Village and before it was Herald Square, the crowded Manhattan land now designated by those names was farmland, and in the 1640's, while it was controlled by the. Dutch, much of it came into the hands of freed black slaves. Blacks caught up in the surging interest in genealogy aroused by the book and television film Roots, may find their American ancestry goes back much further than they thought if they check the minutes of the Dutch Rurgemeesters and Schepensthe New Amsterdam Town Councilor other yellowing documents in the city's new Department of Archives, libraries and historical societies.

title: LEONID VAGIN
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6 (Reuters)Leonid Vagin, a deputy director of the Soviet Scientific Academy's Institute on the U.S.A. and Canada, has died at the age of 57, according to an obituary published today in a Moscow newspaper. Canadian affairs for the Kremlin. Mr. The institute assesses American and Vagin joined the institute five years ago as a financial administrator, an institute spokesman said.

title: Upstate Communities Dig Out of Snowstorm
description: Following a twoday storm that brought as much as 14 inches of snow to certain parts of New York State, residents dug themselves out yesterday and prepared for more.

title: RUDOLF KUSTERMEIR, 84, GERMAN FRIEND OF ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 5Rudolf Kustermeir, a German victim of Nazi persecution who after World War If inspired a movement of German atonement for antiJewish brutalities, died here Sunday at the age of 84.

title: News Summary
description: President Sadat of Egypt said that if other Arab countries refused to take part in later stages envisaged for a conference in Geneva he would carry peace negotiations through to the end with Israel alone. He accused the Soviet Union of using the Palestinians and Syrians as agents against a settlement and said he had a surprise in store to teach the Soviets a lesson but that it would not be the severing of relations. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: Article 8 -- No Title
Washington Post Trades TV Stations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Washington Post Company announced today that it had agreed to exchange its television outlet, WTOP, for WWJTV, Detroit, which is owned by The Evening News Association.

title: An Insurance Broker Convicted in Suffolk Of Taking Premiums
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Dec. 6George P. Tobler, who until last year was the broker for most of Suffolk County's official insurance, was convicted in State Supreme Court here yesterday of the theft of more than $13,000 in insurance premiums.

title: Haitian Refugees Freedom Delayed for Lack of Quarters
description: MIAMI, Dec. 6When they were told the news, the men slumped into smoldering anger and said in the French patois of their homeland that they would not return to jail. They would rather be deported to Haiti, they said in frustration, than return to an American jail.

title: U.S. and Soviet Meet in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6Negotiators of the United. States and the Soviet Union met for three hours today in the Soviet Embassy in Bern, the Swiss capital, to open a third round of talks on eventual demilitarization of the Indian Ocean. The talks were inaugurated in Moscow in June and the second round was held in Washington in September.

title: Family Tradition Is Major Factor For Many Who Give to Neediest
description: Family traditions have long been an important factor .for those who give to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Thursday, December 6, 1977

title: SCHOOL GUARD SEIZED IN SUBWAY CAR RAPE
description: A public school security guard was charged with rape yesterday after he was seized by a Transit Authority police man while allegedly assaulting a 28yearold social worker in a subway train in Brooklyn.

title: Carter Plan to Aid Steel Includes Loan Guarantees and Tax Breaks
description: The longawaited steel package, two months in preparation by an interagency task force headed by Anthony M. Solomon, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, will raise import prices and will almost certainly lead to higher prices for domestically produced steel, and thus eventually to higher costs to consumers. The plan is intended to raise the steel industry's earnings by $900 million a year.

title: Great Swamp DeerHun StartsWith Protest
description: BASKING RIDGE, Dec. 6At 7 o'clock this morning, 145 hunters moved off into the mist covering the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge. When they began returning a few hours later to check in the deer they had shot, they did so under the angry glances of members of the Humane Society, including Jeanette Williams, wife of United States Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr.

title: Unions LeadersFace RebellionsIn Rank and File
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., Dec. 5Every morning thousands of workers drive to the sandcolored plants of the Lockheed Corporation's missile division here, 40 miles south of San Francisco, where they build Poseidon and Trident missiles and Agena satellites.

title: 3 U.S. Marshals Put on Suspension In Gross Jury Case
description: TRENTON, Dec. 6Three assistant United States marshals have been placed on administrative leave while allegations that they romanced female jurors during the 1974 trial of Nelson G. Gross, the former New Jersey Republican chairman, are investigated by Federal officials.

title: Civiletti Named Bell's Top Assistant
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)President Carter will nominate Assistant Attorney General Benjamin R. Civiletti to succeed Peter F. Flaherty as the Deputy Attorney General, the second highest position in the Justice Department, it was announced today.

title: Books:
description: DAVID DUBINSKY arrived in this country on New Year's Day in 1911, a PolishJewish immigrant of considerable ambition and talents and completely obscure prospects, like a lot of immigrants. But he was also imbued with the socialistslabor tradition and had acquired a prison record in Poland for his union activitiesjust the kind of radical foreigner the nativists were warning us about.

title: A Life of Solitary Unconfinement
description: WHOSE mommy is you? My interrogator was a 5yearold boy who lived next door to me last summer. I resented his question as much as I deplored his syntax and told the pipsqueak to beat it. I had taken a oneroom cottage in Menemsha, a fishing village on Martha's Vineyard. There, the fact that I was a single woman in the middle of a family compound was continually being brought to my attention. I had only to glance out my window at my neighbors clothesline; festooned with briefs and bras and B.V.D.'s, it seemed to be flaunting the very under pinnines of family life.

title: Dow Off by 14.12 to 806.91
description: The Dow Jones industrial average plummeted 14.12 points yesterday amid investor concern over the slumping dollar in foreignexchange markets and warnings that domestic banks face a possible liquidity squeeze. Trading volume rose substantially.

title: People and Business; Alton W. Whitehouse Is Elected Chairman of Standard Oil (Ohio)
description: Alton W. Whitehouse has been elected chairman and chief executive officer of the Standard Oil Company (Ohio), effective Jan. 1, it was announced yesterday. He will succeed Charles E. Spahr, who is retiring. Mr. Whitehouse has been serving as vice chairman since January of this year in a temporary post, created to effect a smooth transition of Mr. Spahr's responsibilities to Mr. Whitehouse. Before becoming vice chairman, Mr. Whitehouse served as the corporation's president and chief operating officer since 1970.

title: OwensIllinois Sets Layoffs at TV Division
description: OwensIllinois Inc.. announced would lay off about onethird of its approximately 1,550 employees in its television productions division in the next six months.

title: Elderly Advised to Keep Heat Up to 65 Degrees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP)With winter approaching, the National Insti. tute on Aging advised elderly persons today to keep their homes heated at 65 degrees or higher to avoid a potentially fatal drop in body temperature.

title: 2 Arrested for Barring Inspectors From Vessel
description: JUNEAU. Alaska, Dec. 6 (AP)The master and mate of a Chevron USA tanker have been arrested for refusing to allow state pollution inspectors to board the vessel at the Port of Valdez, officials said today.

title: Monte Carlo Goes Americain
description: MONTE CARLO

title: Castro Says Cuba's Role in Angola Is Not Negotiable
description: HAVANA, Dec. 6President Fidel Castro said last night that the presence of Cuban troops in Angola had nothing to do with relations between the United States and Cuba and was not a negotiable issue.

title: Oranges With the Sweetness of Magnolia
description: Add oranges to Louisiana's lengthy list of delicious delights. Also tangerines, lemons and grapefruit.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Carter Administration today announced its plan to protect the depressed steel industry against import competition and to help provide the financing, through loan guarantees, tax breaks and other aid, that the industry needs to modernize its plants.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 7, 1977

title: SENIORITY IS UPHELD ON MATERNITY LEAVE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that an employer cannot deprive a female employee of accumulated seniority because she takes an uncompensated leave of absence to give birth to a child.

title: European NATO Nations Indicate They May Ask for Neutron Bomb
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 6Defense ministers of Atlantic alliance countries opened a twoday meeting here today amid indications that the European allies were moving toward a decision to ask the United States to manufacture and deploy the controversial neutron bomb in their area.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Cheeks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fond and sent to PA. Box. 5194 Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these arondes:

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: The Jaipur Ball Could Happen Only in N.Y

title: Article 13 -- No Title
Wine Talk
description: WHEN it comes to wine books, less very definitely can be more. Take this year for example. Gone are the banal coffee table volumes, long on art work and short on substance. Gone; for the time being anyway, are the howto books that dell you, over and over again, to drink white, wine with the fish.

title: CARTER FUNDRAISER BACKS 2 JET FIGHTERS

The conservative Prime Minister's appeal, and those of his fellow candidates, were pitched at the pocketbooks of Australians more than at their hearts or minds.

title: Notes on People
description: THE La Scala Opera in Milan, Italy, begins its yearlong 200th anniversary celebration tonight with a production of Verdi's Don Carlos, but the festivities are being sullied by a dispute involving the refusal of Herbert von Karajan, the conductor, to allow a worldwide telecast of the performance.. Many of the La Scala stars are under personal contract to the Austrian conductor to make a film version of Don Carlos, and he contends that world film and television rights to his project would be prejudiced by a worldwide broadcast tonight, Mr. von Karajan fought bitterly with Paolo Grassi, president of the Italian television network, and finally agreed that tonight's performance may be televised in Italy only. This led to Mr. Grassi's tart comment: How nice that von Karajan has at least authorized the transmission in Italy of an Italian opera from an Italian theater.

title: Justices, 90, Block A Loss of Seniority In Maternity Leave
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that an. employer cannot deprive a female employee of accumulated seniority because she takes an uncompensated leave of absence to give birth to a child.

title: Freed Black Farmers Tilled Manhattan's Soil in the 1600's
description: Before it was Chatham Square, before it was Astor Place, before it was Greenwich Village and before it was Herald Square, the crowded Manhattan land now designated by those names was farmland, and in the 1640's, while it was controlled by the Dutch, much of it came into the hands of freed black slaves. Blacks caught up in the surging interest in genealogy aroused by the book and television film Roots, may find their American ancestry goes back much further than they thought if they check the minutes of the Dutch Rurgemeesters and Schepensthe New Amsterdam Town Councilor other yellowing documents in the city's new Department of Archives, libraries and historical societies.

Its tenants included professional firms that represented Cunard's interests. The imposing Great Hall on the groundfloor, one of the city's most notable interior spaces, was the ticketsales office for steamship passengers.

title: Hicks & Grreist Gets Own a Phone Drive
description: Some people in the electronics field are saying that the telephone could be the hot. Appliance of the near future. The telephone they're talking about is the one you buy in a retail outlet not rent from the telephone company. international Telephone and Telegraph, after American Telephone and Telegraph's, Western Electric, the world's second largest. phone manufacturer, is getting ready for what some industry sources say will be a $400. million .retail market in three years. It has assigned its personal, communications unit to Hicks & Greist for advertising.

title: Brazil Symphony In New York Debut
description: THE SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA of Brazil made its New York debut at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night with four pieces, two by Brazilians and two by Russians. Half of that program made sense on the face of it; the other half took bit of understanding. The homegrown works were the Preldio from the Bachianas Brasileiras of VillaLobos, the father figure of the country's composing tradition, and In Memoriam, a 1976 score by Marins Nobre, a member of the academic avantgarde, South American division.

title: David Bruce, American and European
description: David Kirkpatrick Este Bruce was proof that American foreign policy could be bipartisan and that the amateurselected for ability, not campaign contributionscould equal the professional in diplomacy. A lifelong Democrat, he served as ambassador for six Presidents, three of them Republicans. President Eisenhower appointed him Ambassador to Bonn despite his campaign contribution and muchsought advice in 1956 to the Democratic Party. His political affiliation was never concealed; his Republican appointments, which he did not seek, were resigned before Presidential campaigns. But in international affairs, he saw only a continuum of national interest in the American search for a peaceful world.

Try fancy tickling with imaginative Christns stockings, made of various combinations, of lace, velvet satin and silk The stockings are shaped like toe shoes, platform shoes, Mary Jane's, cowboy boots, pumps, etc. They are $14 at Henri Bendel, main floor, and if you want something special, phone the designer, Michele Reisch, 6913764. Division of the American Conference. title: Praise The Pudding
description: By far the most popular ending to the Christmas meal here is Christmas pudding, which resembles fruitcake both in some common ingredients and in the need to be made ahead of time, to allow flavors to blend and mellow. Margaret Aird, whose recipe below is a conglomerate of several family heirlooms, says it is still not too late to make puddings for this holiday. And they keep for at least a year and only get better, said Lady Aird.

But the Government of President Hafez alAssad is still willing to cooperate with the United States, the Soviet Union and the United Nations in a search for a negotiated solution.

One of the most interesting aspects of veal is the remarkable manner in which it Complemented by other foods and flavors. Almost any sweet herb spice goes agreeably well with veal whether it be a sweetly perfumed herb like: basil or tarragon or something as pungent and assertive as curry powder.

description: THE MEANING of the story is in learning how to read it, says a writer who is being interviewed in one of William S. Wilson's stories. I taught myself to write, he adds, in order to find the boundaries of my beliefto learn how to read existence.

title: Managing a Raise for City Managers
description: In the opinion of almost all who have studied the matter, the 2,000 managers of New York City's 186,000 employees need a raise. Although managers comprise the eleven highest grades of the New York City civil service, some at the lower end earn less than their unionized subordinates. That is because managers have had raises of only 14 to 20 percent since 1971, while the workers whose pay is set by collective bargaining have received raises of 35 percent, in spite of the 1975 wage freeze. Managerswhose skills are described by such titles as budget examiner, park manager, housing rehabilitationspecialistare public servants whose value is so great that they are easily lost to other employers. Appropriate raises for them would cost about $5 million a yearbut would save money by saving leadership.

title: SOVIET ARMY LEADER, VASILEVSKY, IS DEAD
description: Marshall Aleksandr M. Vasilevsky, the chief of staff of the Russian Army during World War II and later the Soviet defense minister under Stalin, died Monday in Moscow, according to Tass, the Soviet news agency. He is credited with major role in the planning for the battle of Stalingrad in 1942 and 1943, which military historians regard as one of the turning points in World War II.the general staff. Of the 34 months he held that post, General Vasilevsky spent 22 in the field at various fronts.

title: Eased Marijuana Curb Vetoed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP)Mayor Walter E. Washington yesterday vetoed a bill that would have lowered penalties for posession of less than an ounce of marijuana in the District of Columbia to the same as a traffic offense.

title: Malcolm X's Slayer Calls Two Innocent Though Convicted
description: A man who confessed to killing Malcolm X in 1965 but said that his codefendants were innocent, is again trying to exonerate the two others. All three were convicted of murdering the black nationalist leader at a Harlem rally.

title: 78 Seen Good to Poor At U.S. Savings Banks
description: The year 1978 for savings banks will be somewhere between middling good and middling poor, Gorge Hanc, senior vice president and chief economist of the National Association of Mutual Savings Banks, said yesterday at the group's annual meeting in New York.

title: G.A.O. REPORT FINDS GAINS IN DEPOSIT ON CONTAINERS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6The General Accounting Office, in a report to Congress issued today, found that legislation imposing a mandatory national deposit on beer and soft drink containers would substantially reduce litter and solid waste while lowering industry packaging costs.

description: In a 3to1 decision, the United States International Trade Commission ruled yesterday that imports of industrial fasteners are harming domestic producers.

The prospect of undiluted Midler always seemed to make network executives a touch nervous, although one of her stage productions was presented uncensoredand very successfullylast year on paid television's Home Box Office.

title: Music:

The American Composers Orchestra, which made its debut with one concert last spring, has mustered enough financial support to give three this season. It played the first of them in Alice Tully Hall on Monday night.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (Reuters)Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the United States was continuing to pursue a British-American plan for majority rule in Rhodesia.

description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6The Federa grand jury called to investigate allega tions that the South Korean Governmen bribed American Congressmen to gair their support expired yesterday after turning over a sealed document to Judgc William B. Bryant of Federal Distric Court.

description: What is the proper balance between research and teaching in a large university?

title: Why Sadat Is Not Enough
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6President Sadat of Egypt is now the most visible and dramatic personality in world politics. Having startled the diplomats and politicians with his sudden mission to Jerusalem, he is now on TV almost as much as Walter Cronkite, but the feelpig here is that he is now in danger of overplaying his hand.

title: The Coal Strikers Burden
description: Once the United Mine Workers of America and its autocratic president John L. Lewis could tie.the nation in a knot with the mere threat of a strike. This week Arnold Miller, the union's current president, called a strike, but the nation is not particularly worriedindeed, it is hardly even concerned. For Mr. Miller heads an unruly union, full of independentminded Vietnam veterans who pay littleheed to national leadership of any sort. Moreover, Mr. Miller's union of 180,000 controls only half the nation's coal production; its proportion declined dramatically in recent years because of the rise of nonunionized coal production in the West. What's more, the nation expected the strike, and companies have built up three and fourmonth coal stockpiles.

title: Close Call for Tanner
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 6 (AP)Roscoe Tanner barely escaped an upset as he edged a fellow American, Brian Teacher, 62, 67, 75, in the opening round of the $100,000 South Australian tennis tournament today. Tanner poured across 19 aces.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ART ALL OVER What is reportedly the largest group of contemporary Aubusson tapestries ever shown in New York has just gone on view in the mezzanine of One World Trade Center (North Tower). Alexander Calder, Jean Arp and Chaim Gross are among the 42 artists represented by 49 tapestries. The tapestries will be displayed daily from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. through Jan. 2.

title: Villanova 61, Rutgers 54
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 6 (AP)Keith Herron scored six of his 25 points in the final minutes and led Villanova to a 6154 victory over Rutgers. The Wildcats, 40, held off a Scarlet Knight rally and handed Rutgers its first loss against one victory this season.

title: Article 14 -- No Title
Simon & Garfunkel:
description: AFTER an elaborate rehearsal of Paul Simon's first special for television, the director decides to have a hearttoheart talk with the star. Mr. Simon has just run through a version of Old Friends with his former partner, Art Garfunkel, and the duet has prompted the director to observe, obtusely but very sympathetically, that the sound of you and Artie singing together is so much better than the sound of either one of you singing alone that whatever petty differences you might have had in the past I strongly urge that you take a long, hard look at them.

title: High Court Voids New York Aid to Parochial Schools

title: House Liberals Join Conservatives In Rejecting a New Abortion Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6Liberals and conservatives united in the House of Representatives today to defeat a proposed compromise on the abortion issue that was considered too permissive by those opposing abortion and too stringent by those who support freer access to abortions.

title: Coast Guard Boasts of Its Recruits: They're Able, Seaworthy, Fern ale
description: The air over New York Harbor was cold and damp yesterday morning, and the waters were a study in gray. To stand on deck was to allow sea chill through the thickest wrap and to dream of the warm, dry land. It was not a morning to tempt many to sign on for a long voyage.

title: Comatose Woman and Fetus Die; Prosecutor Questions 4 Persons
description: Rosemarie Maniscalco, the 27yearold pregnant Brooklyn woman who had been comatose since she suffered brain damage two weeks ago, died yesterday in Victory Memorial Hospital. A team of physicians tried vainly to save her or her 20week old fetus.

title: Technology
description: A scientist who was among the California group that won the race to be first to induce bacteria to make a human hormone says he is optimistic that the same trick will work with insulin. The trick appears to have opened the door for commercial exploitation of genesplicing techniques to make human substances considered important for medical uses. Page D3.

title: Gilbert Retires And Takes Job With Garden
description: Seated at a table covered by a red checkered cloth in the back room of Il Vagabondo, an East Side restaurant where he had shared many postgame beers with his New York Ranger teammates, 36yearold Rod Gilbert announced yesterday the end of his 16year playing career. He said he would accept a longterm public relations job with Madison Square Garden.

title: Castro Says Cuba's Role in Angola Is Not Negotiable
description: HAVANA, Dec., 6President Fidel Castro said last night that the presence of Cuban troops in Angola had nothing to do with relations between the United States and Cuba and was not a negotiao!e issue.

title: EUROPEAN LEADERS AGREE TO BACK LOAN IN COMMON MARKET
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 6West European heads of government agreed in principle today to raise a huge new loan on the international capital marketpossibly $1 billionto help lift sagging industrial investment in their depressed economies.

title: Teddi King Memorial Sunday
description: A memorial service for Teddi King, the singer, will be held Sunday at 7:30 P.M. at St. Peter's Lutheran Church, 54th Street and Lexington Avenue.

title: Article 7 -- No Title
Outgoing
description: SAILING TODAY

title: They Stuck Their Necks Out When They Adopted 2 Giraffes
description: When Jock and Betty LeslieMelville sit down for a meal in their home on the outskirts of Nairobi, it is not at all unusual for Daisy Rothschild to stick her big neck through the window to see what's on the table.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A suit by stockholders seeking to block the $567 million purchase of the Carborundum Company by the Kennecott Copper Corporation has produced a showing of support from other shareholders owning nearly one million shares of Kennecott, court papers disclosed yesterday.

title: Islanders Smith Shuts Out Hawks
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7The Islanders and the Chicago Black Hawks did not play to a tie tonight. That was the first surprise. The Islanders leagueleading line saw their goalscoring streak end at 19 games. That was the second surDrise.

title: Malaysian Pilots Threaten Strike
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Dec. 7 (AP)The Malaysian Airline Pilots Association says its members will strike for 24 hours beginning at 6 A.M. next Tuesday unless the Government takes immediate security measures to prevent hijackings. The action Is planned in response to the crash Sunday night of a hijacked Malaysian airliner in which all 100 persons aboard were killed.

title: Marijuana Valued at $15 Million Seized on Venezuela Fishing Boat
description: Marijuana Valued at $15 Million Seized on Venezuela Fishing Boat

title: Rangers, Flyers in 33 Tie
description: Dave Maloney called it a barnburner. Said Pat Hickey, It was good hockey, good fun. Coach JeanGuy Talbot said simply, Whew!

title: Laurence Woodworth Dies at 59; Administration Tax Policy Expert
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Laurence N. Woodworth, the Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for Tax Policy and chief draftsman of the tax proposals that President Carter plans to send to Congress next month, died today in Riverside Hospital, Newport News, Va. He was 59 years old.

title: Havana Has SprucedUp Look but Buses Don't Run on Time
description: HAVANA, Dec. 6After years of neglect Havana seems to be getting a face lift, restoring the faded beauty of one of Latin America's loveliest cities.

title: Metals Futures Continue to Rise; Coffee, Wheat, Soybeans Also Up
description: Metals futures rose again yesterday, continuing an advance that began last week.

title: Snowfall Puts Colorado Ahead of 76
description: KEYSTONE, Colo., Dec. 7The Indian dances staged at nearby Vail early last season in a vain effort to produce snow probably will not be needed this winter. Last Sunday, just before many of the Northeast ski areas were being buried by a snowstorm that in some instances lasted 30 hours, most of Colorado was plastered by a near blizzard. That whiteflaked windfall puts ski conditions in these parts back to normal for this time of year.

title: U.S. ENERGY ENVOY CALLS U.S.S.R. DATA ESSENTIAL
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7 (UPI)The Carter. Administration's energy envoy to the Soviet Union said today that it was absolutely essential that the world's two biggest producers and consumers shared their estimates of where they will stand in 10 years.

title: Mortgage Loan Rates Are Steady
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI)Interest rates op conventional mortgage loans in November were unchanged at 9.07 percent for new homes and 9.08 percent for older homes, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today. The average price of a new home gained $1,900 to $55,900, while the average price of a previously occupied home climbed $2,800 to $49,4000.

title: Poor in Caracas Live in Barracks Waiting for Apartment Homes
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 6  For three years Evaristo Vsquez and his family of eight have lived in Governmentbuilt plasterboard barracks in a Caracas area of dirt roads and gullies piled high with garbage.

title: Letters
description: Hysterical Nuclear Scenarios

title: Giants Playing Down HicksGregory Brawl
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 7If appearances are not deceiving, Jack Gregory, 255 pounds, defeated John Hicks, 258, in a tworound barroom fight Sunday night that had the Giants laughing today about going 15 rounds instead of four quarters.

title: Design Notebook
description: THE ENIPIRE STATE Building's classic profile has been inspiring a lot of close looks lately and that is because it doesn't look quite the way it used to. Since midautumn, the tower's top 30 floors have been bathed at night by colored floodlights, and the change has been dramatic enough to make the building ah altogether different presence on the city's night time skyline.

title: Nobel Winners: A Dream of Peace
description: BETTY WILLIAMS was practically spitting fire. The Irish housewife who, with Mairead Corrigan, will accept the belated 1976 Nobel Peace Prize in Olso this Saturday, had just been told what Bernadette Devlin McAlisky had said about Mrs. Williams's Peace People movement. Calling it dangerous and saying it cannot bring peace, Mrs. McAlisky had told a New York Times correspondent in Belfast: They are being used and they will be discarded as I was. The British will use them for information, the opportunistic politicians for personal glory.

title: Chrysler Offers Small Cars With Front-Wheel Drive
description: Chrysler Offers Small Cars

title: Ehrlichman to Be Paroled in April After 11/2Year Term
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)John D. Ehrlichman learned today that his imprisonment will end after one and a half years, the third longest stretch for anyone caught up In the Watergate scandal that ended Richard M. Nixon's Presidency.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Balloting Set to Begin Next Week On Contract With Greyhound Bus
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 7 (AP)Some 14,000 bus drivers and terminal workers of the Greyhound Bus Lines will be mailed ballots beginning Sunday on a new contract agreement, officials of the Amalgamated Transit Union said today.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: RapeCase Suspect Consents to Tests On Hair and Blood
description: HACKENENSACK, N.J., Dec. 7The defense counsel for Bruce A. Ader, the bulldozer operator charged with raping baby sitter and robbing two homes in Bergen County, consented today to prosecution request that Mr. Ader submit to tests on his hair, blood and saliva.

title: 76 Workers in Toy Plant Upstate Felled as Toxic Fumes Fill Building
description: AMSTERDAM, N.Y., Dec. 7 (AP)  Seventysix workers at a toy manufacturing plant here were taken to hospitals in the area today and 1,400 others were removed when toxic fumes spread through the plant. Officials said it was the second such incident in the same building of the Coleco Industries plant in three days.

title: News Summary
description: Retaliating against foreign critics of its peace initiatives, Egypt closed down the cultural centers and some consulates of the Soviet Union, East Germany, Hungary and Czechoslovakia. The announcement in Parliament by Prime Minister Mamdouh Salem drew prolonged applause. The move appeared to decrease prospects for Moscow's cooperation in the confusing new peace process. [Page A1, Column 1.]

title: U.S.  Tries to Assure NATO on Arms
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7Defense Secretary Harold Brown sought with limited success today to reassure America's European allies that the Carter Administration would not sacrifice their interests in its negotiations with the Soviet Union on a new strategicarms treaty.

title: Haig Says New Soviet Hovercraft and Tank Raise Risk of Nuclear War
description: Development by the Soviet Union of a hovercraft for amphibious operations and a new tank has led Gen. Alexander M. Haig to warn that an imbalance be tween the West and the Soviet bloc in conventional weapons inevitably increased the prospect of an earlier employment of nuclear weapons to halt any Soviet attack.

title: Capital Outlays Up 4.6%, But Slackening Is Expected
description: For the Carter Administration, which is counting on business spending to keep the economic recovery going and to reduce the unemployment rate of about 7 percent, the business expectations might be considered disappointing.

title: STROKE LED TO DEATH OF MRS. MANISCALCO
description: An autopsy showed yesterday that Rosemarie Maniscalco, the 27yearold Brooklyn woman who was 21 weeks pregnant, had died of a massive brain hemorrhage caused by a natural event.

title: Article 6 -- No Title
CARTER SAYS HOUSE VOTE ON B1 WILL WASTE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)  The House decision yesterday to continue funds for two B1 bombers amounts to pouring half a billion dollars down a rat hole, the White House said today.

title: Dr. Proxmire's Bitter Pill Is No Cure
description: That quiet knock on the city's door the other day was not the caterer bearing cold meats for the inauguration ball. It was Senator William Proxmire, bringing cold comfort for the winter that stretches long and dark before the next Mayor. At the end of it must come an extension of the law which authorizes seasonal Treasury loans, and which expires in June.

title: The West in Hock
description: On an average working day, the oil exporting nations earn about $150 million more than they spend abroad. Most of those millions are accumulated by Saudi Arabia, which deposits them in major European and American banks. The banks, in turn, lend the money to governments and corporations in oil importing nations so that they can Day tomorrow's fuel bills.

title: Trees and Wreaths Will Cost You More
description: REAL OR artificial? No matter what kind of a tree you choose for Christmas, you'll pay more than you did last year.

title: New Short Form for Taxes to Be Even Shorter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Taxpayers filing income tax returns next year on the 1040A short form will need to fill in only 15 lines as against 25 lines this year. The Internal Revenue Service estimates this will save almost 70 million hours in paperwork, which would be a reduction of 10 percent.

title: Crash Kills Dr. Peter Goldmark, Scientist Who Invented LP Disk
description: Dr. Peter Carl Goldmark, whose invention of the longplaying phonograph record for CBS revolutionized the recoraedmusic industry, was killed yesterday in an automobile accident on the Hutchinson River Parkway in Westchester. County. He was 71 years old.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Tuesday's Fights

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Natural Gas Company will receive a $3.3 million rate increase, the Board of Public Utility Commissioners announced yesterday. A spokesman said in Newark that the commissioners would formally approve the increase today.

title: Navy Recruiting Is Hampered by Illiteracy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Navy is running into serious problems of illiteracy among potential recruits. In Detroit, for example, nine out of 10 youths seeking to enter the Navy are rejected, largely because of an inability to read.

title: Justices Relax Rule on Phones In Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Supreme Court concluded today, 5 to 4, that Federal district courts have the authority to order a telephone company to install surveillance equipment as part of a criminal investigation on the basis of evidence no stronger than that needed for a search warrant.

title: ATLANTIC CITY WEIGHS PLAN BY OIL INDUSTRY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 7This resort area is trying to decide whether to limit its expected economic resurgence to gambling casinorelated business or to embrace industry and jobs related to offshore drilling for oil and gas as well.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
Aspirin Said to Aid Males in Surgery
description: BOSTON, Dec. 7 (AP)Aspirin can protect male, but not female, hipsurgery patients from forming blood clots in their veins, a common and sometimes fatal complication of hospital care, according to a new study.

title: Charlie Swift, 43, Announcer For Eagles, Commits Suicide
description: MEDIA, Pa., Dec. 7 (AP)Charlie Swift, the playbyplay announcer for the Philadelphia Eagles football team, took his own life today with a bullet shot to the head, an autopsy report said.

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart that appeared in The Times on Nov. 29 incorrectly presented the participation rate and percentage of women in the labor force. The data were for the entire labor force, full time and part time, not fullcime workers only, as the chart stated.

title: New York City Air Cleaner but Still Not Clean Enough
description: New York City's air is significantly cleaner than it was a decade ago, but it is still dangerous to health. The problem is the continuing pollution caused by cars.

title: Dow Edges Up 0.52 to 807.43, But Stocks Show Modest Decline
description: The Dow Jones industrial average stabilized yesterday after its 14point decline on Tuesdaythe biggest drop since Julybut stock prices generally showed a modest decline.

title: BEGIN SEES A CHANCE FOR PACT WITH EGYPT
description: LONDON, Dec. 7  Prime Minister Menahem Begin indicated here today that Israel was ready to sign a separate peace treaty with Egypt if Egypt wished, but he added that any separate treaty should be considered only the first part of comprehensive Middle East settlement.

title: U.S. and Japan: Basic Conflict
description: TOKYO, Dec. 7Economic bureaucrats and politiians are staying at their cluttered desks well after normal quitting time here these chilly days, struggling with the mounting trade controversy that has seriously strained relations be

title: Disks: Mode Is German
description: FRENCH MUSIC is supposed to be light, clear and direct, or, so the Teutonophobic Francophiles of this century insist. But, in fact, French music of the late 19th century went through a decidedly dark and heavy phase. This was no doubt in part a reflection of Wagner's cultural hegemony at that time, and a national'response to defeat by the Germans in 1870. But the reformist efforts in French musical life in the 1870's led not only to some Germanic music, brut also to the establishment of a musical culture that flowered ultimately in the great French music of the late 100 and early 20th centurieswhich music, ironically, defined itself in part in opposition to Germans.

title: Brazil to Curb Shrimp Fishing
description: BRASILIA, Dec. 7 (AP)Beginning. on J an.1, shrimp fishing off northern Brazil wil lbe limited to Brazilian boats or foreig nobats operating in association with Brazilians. A 1975 accord allowing ships from oaher countries, including the United States, to fish in Brazilian waters expires at the end of the year.

title: Three's a Company: Women Partners In Casual Furniture
description: We needed to manufacture something we understood we don't know about electronic plated widgets. We kept calling whatever it was going to be the better mousetrap, and it stuck, said Cathy O'Neill.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: 3 Appliance Chains Charged With Price Deception
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7The state charged today that three New Jersey homeappliance chains and a retail store had used fraudulent and deceptive advertising involving false saleprice reductions and bait and switch tactics.

title: Meeting With King Khalid.
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 7A Saudi radio broadcast announced today that President Assad would arrive in Riyadh, the royal capital, tomorrow to meet with King Khalid.

title: Backgammon:
description: The first annual Bill Eisenberg Cup was held last weekend at the Cavendish West Club in Los Angeles. Bill Eisenberg, a top West Coast player, was 1975 world champion of backgammon. Nevertheless, he is probably better known for skill in another game, bridge; four times he has been a member of a world championship team.

title: Congress Eases Law on Medical Student Transfers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Congress passed today and sent to the White House a bill that all but rescinds a law that required American medical schools to admit and give advanced standing to a small number of students who spent their first two years in foreign medical schools.

title: Few Show Up to Read Files on the Assassination
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Bob Katz was a 16yearold high school student sitting in an algebra class in Chicago when he heard over a public address system that President Kennedy had been assassinated.

title: Union Head Says Byrne Reneges On Vow Not to Cut College Staffs
description: MONTCLAIR, Dec. 7A union leader accused Governor Byrne today of reneging on a campaign promise that there would be no faculty reductions at the eight state colleges, and said a job action Was being considered to protest against the dismissal of what he said was about hilt the teachers who were up for tenure or reappointment.

title: Article 1  No Title
A Paralyzed Denver Man Files Federal Suit in Swine Flu Case
description: DENVER, Dec. 7 (AP) A man confined to a wheelchair and barely able to speak has filed a $2 million negligene'e suit against the Federal Government, contending that he suffered permanent brain damage after receiving a swine flu vaccination last year.

title: Books of The Times
description: IS IT POSSIBLE that one of these years most children's illustrated books won't be about bears, frogs, pigs, rabbits and monsters? Probably not, although you can tell from the number of retold traditional tales that appeared this year that some writers and illustrators are feeling the strain of inventing something new. They've even reillustrated parts of Alice and The Wind in the Willows, whichI'm sorryoffends my sense of the order of the universe. Anyway, among 400 or 500 of this year's illustrated books that I browsed through recently, the following, in no special order, caught my eye most insistently

title: Collingswood Officer Is Cleared In a Fatal Shooting on Route 130
description: CAMDEN, N.J., Dec. 7 (UPI)A Camden County grand jury has cleared a Collingswood policeman accused of fatally shooting a man he stopped for questioning last month.

description: AT DETROIT

title: A Jewish Meeting Applauds Unusual GuestCairo Envoy
description: Ashraf A. Ghorbal, the Egyptian Ambassador to the United States, was given a rousing welcome in New York last night by one of the nation's leading Jewish organizations. It was described as the first time an Arab ambassador had addressed such a group.

title: Swiss Leaders Named in Quick Vote
description: GENEVA, Dec. 7Switzerland chose two new Cabinet ministers and a President for 1978 today in an uncontested election that again demonstrated the smoothness with which the Swiss political system fills the nation's highest political offices.

title: Leonard Silk
description: With 1977 drawing to a close, businessmen are once again anxiously listening to what economists have to say about the year to come. Yet when businessmen are not beseeching economists to forecast, they are deriding

description: CAIRO, Dec. 7Egypt moved today to broaden its counteroffensive against foreign critics of President Anwar elSadat's peace initiatives by closing cultural centers and some consulates of the Soviet Union and four other East European Communist countries.

title: World News Briefs
description: SALISBURY,Rhodesia, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Two Rhodesian black nationalist organizations welcomed today the statement by President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia yesterday that he would no longer participate in the BritishAmerican initiative for a Rhodesian settlement.

title: Firemen Catch Suspect in SlowSpeed Chase
description: With its siren screaming and engine starining to push it to its full 35mileanhour top speed, a 40foot Fire Department aerial ladder truck lumbered through 12 blocks of Bronx traffic yesterday afternoon in successful pursuit of a tow truck that had allegedly sped off after striking a 13yearold boy.

description: The rising array of Government regulations for land developers, home builders, financial institutions and all others involved in the housing industry is a major factor in the sharp increases in newhome prices, according to Murray L. Weidenbaum, director of the center for the Study of American Business at Washington University, St. Louis.

title: Approval of Rehabilitation Projects For a Disputed Developer Criticized
description: A New York State Assemblyman criticized the Beame administration and the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development yesterday for permitting a controversial developer to take on two planned housing rehabilitation projects in the Bronx.

title: Youth iWth Gun Robs Passengers on Subway
description: A teenager armed with a gun, stormed several cars of a southbound IND express train last night and terrorized passengers as he forced them to turn over their wallets, the Transit Authority police reported.

title: A Crop of Gifts For Garden Buffs
description: IF THERE are gardeners on your gift list, relax. They are easy to please if the gift will grow, make a plant look better as it grows or add to the gardener's knowledge of growing.

title: PRICES FOR BONDS CONTINUE TO DROP
description: The credit market's sharp postThanksgiving drop continued without letup yesterday, fueled partly by the failure of new issues to attract investors and partly by news that consumer borrowng had increased sharply in October.

description: The Rev. Edmund P. Joyce, vice president of the University of Notre Dame, said: It is important to remember that college football was not a Madison Avenue creation. It was not designed as a vehicle for selling soap or beer.

description: NOW'S THE time to make mice and bugs uncomfortableor at least convince them that there are better places to take shelter and dine than among your fruit trees and decorative bushes.

title: Shipbuilding Orders in Britain Up
description: LONDON, Dec. 7 (UPI)Britain's nswly nationalized shipbuilding yards will get orders for merchant ships totaling well over half-a-million metric tons, or $810 million, this year, Michael Casey, head of British Shipbuilders said today, Orders are all well up on the 405,000 gross tons of 1976, and value has shown an even more marked increase, Mr. Casey said.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: RIGHT CHRISTMAS What better way to enter into the holiday spirit, asks the venerable church of St. Lukeinthefields, than to join a caroling stroll across Greenwich Village, indirectly linked to A Visit from St. Nicholas"? The beloved Yuletide poem is, of course, more widely known for its first line, 'Twas the night before Christmas ...

title: Personal Beauty
description: WHAT' the gift just about everyone likes, but considers an extravagance to buy for themselves? Soap, beautiful soap. Not the everyday, supermarket soaps, but marvelous big fat cakes that are a joy to handle and smell like a dream.

title: OPEC COMPETITION WITH WEST MOUNTS
description: VIENNA, Dec. 7The oil exporting countries are tending increasingly to use their surplus cash for direct investments in developing nations in competition with American banks, according to a high Arab official here.

title: F.B.I. Captures Prisoner In Florida Who Escaped Manhattan U.S. Jail in 75
description: Patrick James Huston, who has been on the Federal Bureau of Investigation's 10mostwanted list since he escaped more than two years ago from Federal detention headquarters in New York, was seized yesterday as he rode a bicycle on a street in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
Miss Nadig Wins Downhill Race
description: VAL D'ISERE, France. Dec. 7 (AP)Switzerland's former Olympic star, Marie Therese Nadig, ended a twoyear eclipse of her career today by winning the season's first World Cup downhill ski race.

The announcement in Parliament by Prime Minister Mamdouh Salem drew prolonged applause. The move appeared to decrease prospects for Moscow's cooperation in the confusing new peace process. title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: Excerpts From Memo by Hoover
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)Following are excerpts from a Dec. 12, 1963 memorandum from J. Edgar Hoover, Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, to his aides describing a telephone conversation that Mr. Hoover had had with J. Lee Rankin, the counsel for the Warren Commission: I said I personally believe Oswald was the assassin; that the second aspect as to whether he was the only man gives me great concern; that we have several letters, not in the report because were not able to prove it, written to him from Cuba referring to the job he was going to do, his good marksmanship, and stating when it was all over he would be brought back to Cuba and be presented to the chief; but we do not know if the chief was Castro and cannot make an investigation because we have no intelligence operation in Cuba; that I did not put this in the report because we did not have proof of it and didn't want to put speculation in the report; that this was the reason I urged strongly that we not reach conclusion Oswald was the only man.

title: Where to Capture A Holiday Unicorn
description: We think unicorns are very magical, said Marty Proctor, whose shop, Unicorn City. keeps a veritable stable of those mythological creatures. And this is a great time to have magic in the house.
