description: Using a rocket type of drill to blast through 1,380 feet of ice, engineers have penetrated into a lost world extension of the Pacific Ocean beneath the ice of Antarctica.

title: People in Sports...
description: I'll probably retire, but I always leave 10 percent open. So said Gordie Howe, the 49yearold grand old man of hockey, on Wednesday night as he contemplated plans for after the season. He had just scored the 1,000th goal of his career in a 63 victory by his New England Whalers over the Birmingham Bulls. I'll be a grandfather soon, he said, and not many grandfathers play hockey. Maybe so, but Howe, who is in his 31st year as a professional hockey player, has changed his mind about retiring several times before, most notably when his two sons Mark and Marty. both also with the Whalers, turned pro.... Kevin Stacom, a guard cut by the Boston Celtics on Nov. 9 in order for the team to get to the 11player limit, has been signed again by the Celtics, and Steve Kuberski, a forward, has been placed on waivers Louie Nelson, a guard who played briefly with San Antonio last year and for seven games with Kansas City this season, has been signed by the struggling New Jersey Nets. The Nets placed Mark Crow, rookie forward used sparingly, on waivers....Lenny Randle, the New York Met infielder, has agreed to lead blind children in a songfest at a holiday party of the Associated Blind on Dec. 17.... Willie Mays, now doing public relations work for the Mets, donned a red hat and a white beard yesterday to play Santa Claus for some girls preparing for the fourth annual Colgate Women's Games, starting Jan. 7.

title: Mime: Portraits of Women
description: WOMEN, despite being half the human race, make up the great unexamined subject in mime theater. The dolllike ingnue is seen often enough, and the withered crone, but by and large, female characters are absent from mime programs. Happily, Rebecca devoted at least half her evening at the Open Eye to the subject on Wednesday. Unhappily, she didn't go deeply enough into it.

title: VANCE ASKS BACKING IN NATO ON ARMS TALK
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 8Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, seeking allied support for Washington's projected strategicarms limitations accord with Moscow, told the North Atlantic Treaty Organization today that the arms talks were at the heart of SovietAmerican relations and that stability would not be possible without such an agreement.

title: About Real Estate
description: The huge crane that has reposed idly so long on the roof of the incomplete Parc Vendome addition on West 57th Street is going back into action. It will start by lifting formwork for a pool, probably on Monday. The threeyear construction hiatus has ended. construction hiatus has ended.

title: Data in Union Insurance Inquiry Are Sent to Justice Department
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)Evidence gathered in a 16month Congressional inquiry into abuses of millions of dollars in labor union insurance policies was turned over to the Justice Department today for possible prosecution.

title: RIGHTS GROUP TELLS  OF VIOLATED PLEDGES
description: LONDON, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Twothirds of the member states of the United Nations violate the human rights they have vowed to uphold, and governmentsanctioned torture is widespread, according to Amnesty International.

title: Pakistani Girl, l0, Undergoes 3Hour OpenHeart Surgery
description: BROWNS MILLS, Dec. 8An emaciated Pakistani girl, flown to the United States last month in her family's last hopes to correct her severely damaged heart valve, underwent successful open heart surgery here today.

title: Publishing: Ideas And Hannah Arendt
description: HANNAH ARENDT, the political scientist and professor, was working on a philosophical trilogy at her death in 1975. Although she left only notes for the third part of The Life of the Mind. the first two completed books will be published separately, as well as in a boxed set, March 22 by Harcourt Brace Jovanovich.

title: Opponents on Abortion Issue Gear for a New Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Supporters and opponents of the use of Medicaid funds for abortions geared up today for renewed combat in the aftermath of a HouseSenate compromise on the issue.,

title: Esmark Earnings Fell By 18.9% it 4th Quarter; Drop in Profits at 23.8%
description: Esmark Inc., the diversified industrial company, which includes Swift & Company, the world's largest meat packers, yesterday reported a 23.8 percent drop in profits for the final quarter on a sales gain of 3.8 percent, sand an 18.9 percent; decline in earnings for the fiscal year ended Oct. 29.

title: Mother Has G.I.'s Kidnapped Son
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Dec. (AP)The police said today that the kidnapped 3yearold son of Sgt. Richard A. Neumann of the United States Army was with the child's mother in Britain. The police said the child had been born out of wedlock and a West German court had given the father custody. On Monday, according to the police, a masked Englishspeaking couple took the boy from the home of Sergeant Neumann's parents, where the child was living.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: Lady Zia Wernher, 85, Daughter Of Grand Duke Michael of Russia

title: People and Business
description: James J. O'Connor, 40 years old, formerly executive vice president, has been elected president of the Commonwealth Edison Company of Chicago. He succeeds Thomas G. Ayers, 62, who has been both president and chairman of the utility since 1975. The latter will continue as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: ALFRED IACUZZI
description: Alfred Iacuzzi, chairman of the Romance languages department at the Baruch School of City College for two decades until his retirement in 1967, died Tuesday at his home after a long illness. He was 81 years old and lived at 747 Argyle Road, Brooklyn.

title: South Koreans Say Deal Is Near for Park to Testify in U.S. Next Year
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 3The United States and South Korea will sign an agreement early next week under which Tongsun Park, the Korean businessman, will go to Washington next year and testify in criminal proceedings, South Korean Foreign Ministry officials said today.

title: Books: Demythologizing The Animal Kingdom
description: THE CULT OP THE WILD. By Boyce Reneberger. 279 pages. Anchor. $7.95.

title: INFLATION ABATED TEMPORARILY
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 8The Government resorted today a lessthanexpected 0.7 percent increase in the Wholesale Price Index last month, suggesting a furtherat least temporaryabatement of inflation.

title: Dollar Mixed Abroad
description: LONDON. Dec.8 (AP)The dollar had mixed fortunes in thin trading on European foreign exchanges today but dealers said the underlying trend was to weakness.

title: Art: Noise in the Attic
description: AS gallery habitus know, the Institute of Art and financed Urban Resources is an organizations financed by state and Federal funds, which puts on exhibitions and performances, usually of an avantgarde nature. It is situated at, the top of the Clocktower at 108 Leonard Street in SoHo, which is an environmental statement on its own. A large, seedy, cityowned building, it has the ambience of an Estern European ministry as seen by Alfred Hitchcock in his prime.

title: Kalule Wins Decision
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 8 (AP)A Ugandan light middleweight Ayub Kalule, outpointed Ralph Palladin of Washington in a 10round bout tonight to move a step closer to a crack at the world title. The 23yearold Kalule, who has made Denmark his base for his boxing career, was in control throughout.

title: Moynihan Warns Apparel Industry On Labor Reform
description: Speaking as a friend, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan warned the apperel industry yesterday against unthinking resistance to labor law reforma measure that has been approved by the House of Representatives and is scheduled for

title: McDonnell Develops A Flying Fire Engine
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 8 (UPI)The McDonnell Douglas Corporation said today that it was developing a flying fire engine and rescue vehicle to carry firefighters to highrise buildings.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a transmission error, an article in The Times yesterday about a student arrested for stealing cars statedincorrectly that public transportation was available between Shirley, L.I. and Suffolk Community College in Seldcn. There is none.

title: The Pop Life
description: PEOPLE who don't like disco often dismiss it as hopelessly constricting. That thudding beat and those everrecurrent stylistic signatures bludgeon away any individual expression, they argue. It's mmaiess entertainment tor moving bodies and little more.

title: Weekend TV: Whales, Angels and Lifers
description: TO begin, tomorrow night at on NBC, there is the humpback whale, in its own way as inter esting as any other star floating around the television screen this weekend. Narrated by Richard widmark, Gentle Giants of the Pacific spends most of its hour in the clear blue waters off Hawaii, where a large group of the 40foot leviathans gather each year.

title: 17 Oil Workers Die As Copter Hits Rig And Falls Into Sea
description: LAFAYETTE, La., Dec. 8 (AP)A helicopter crowded with oil workers crashed into the offshore rig on which it was trying to land in high winds today and dropped 130 feet to rough seas below. Seventeen men died; two lived.

title: JUDGE BLOCKS PLAN TO LIMIT FARM ACRES
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8A Federal district judge issued an order yesterday temporarily blocking the lnterior Department' plan to enforce a 75yearold land law a plan that has threatened to break up thousands of large farms in 17 Western states.

title: Miners in West Virginia Predict a Long Strike but Feel That Somehow They Can Cope
description: DANVILLE, W. Va., Dec. 7Many miners here in the heart of the Appalachian soft coal region believe that the nationwide mine strike will last at least until February.

title: Burlington to Construct and Expand 4 Plants in the Republic of Ireland
description: Burlington Industries announced today It would build two new manufacturing plants and expand two existing plants in the Republic of Ireland with construction to begin on all the projects this month.

title: Worthless Watchdogs
description: To the Editor:

title: Ousted Head of Bonwit Files Claim
description: John Schumacher, who was summarily dismissed on Oct. 28 as chairman and chief executive officer of the Bonwit Teller chain, has struck back against Bonwit's parent company, Genesco Inc.

title: Council Unit Rejects Rill on Confirmation Of Commissioners
description: The Charter and Governmental Operations Committee of the New York City Council yesterday rejected a bill that sought to give advice and consent powers to the Council over mayoral appointments of commissioners. With six votes needed, the tally was 5 to 0; there were four abstentions.

title: Meany Asks More Protectionism To Stop Loss of Jobs to Imports
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8Job losses to imports must he stopped with more protectionismclosed door for closed doorGeorge Meany said today.

title: Flyers 6 Goals in 3d Crush Rangers, 7 to 4
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8  Having waited until the final period to unleash their forechecking attack, the Philadelphia Flyers then cracked open the New York Rangers with six goals for a 7.4 victory tonight.

title: Price News Buoys Stocks Early But Close Is Mixed, With Dow Off
description: Stock prices rose slightly yesterday morning in response to a smallerthanexpected increase in November wholesale prices but ended the day on a mixed note.

title: Bridge:
description: Even world champions are not automatons: They cannot think at the speed of a computer. So whether your opponents are internationally famous stars or average players, it is worth looking for plays that will test their reactions.

title: Britain Says It Plans to Reduce Size of Its Army Force in Ulster
description: LONDON, Dec., 8 (Reuters)Britain is planning to reduce its army forces in Northern Ireland next year because of improvements in the security situation there, Defense Secretary Roy Mason told Parliament today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: REMEMBER THE NEEDIEST!
Knicks and Nets Appear Close To a Settlement
description: A settlement concerning $7.2 million owed the New York Knicks by the New Jersey Nets appears to be in the offine.

title: Despite Defeat, Soares May Head New Lisbon Cabinet
description: LISBON. Dec. 8  President Antonio Ramalho Eanes began consultations with political leaders today over the formation of a new government following the parliamentary defeat, in a dramatic predawn vote, of the minority SocinEst Government of Prime Minister Mario Soares.

title: Cairo's Persuasive and Patient Negotiator
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 8Egypt's chief delegate to the United Nations, who will soon be facing the Israelis across a conference table in Cairo, is a career diplomat trained to listen patiently, negotiate persuasively and act decisively, never to show temperament and at all times to remain outwardly composed.

title: Music: St. Peter's Pipe Organ
description: AMONG the many sources of delight in the spectacular new Citicorp Center on Lexington Avenue between 53d and 54th Streets is the new German pipe organ installed in the equally new St. Peter's Church, which is on the same 54th Street corner as the original church but is now tucked cozily under the soaring skyscraper

title: Around the Nation
description: Farmers Head to Rallies To Protest Farm Prices

title: On a Night for Artists, Glitter Bows to Talent
description: Alice Neel said she was 77 years old, and it probably wasn't too soon for her to have an absolutely fabulous time.

title: KISSINGER TRANSCRIPT RULED U.S. PROPERTY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A Federal district judge ruled today that 33,000 trapscript pages of Henry A. Kissinger's telephone calls were public property, not private possessions of the former Secretary of State.

title: Campbell Is Winner Of Heisman
description: Earl Campbell, the senior running back for the University of Texas's undefeated and untied football team, was named last night as winner of the 43d Reisman Trophy, college football's most coveted award. This award goes annually to the outstanding college football player in the United States.

title: S.E.C. Proposes Rules Covering Company Buying Own Stock
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed rules today covering corporate purchases of their own stock.

title: Auto Output Off From 76 Week Level
description: DETROIT, Dec. 8 (AP)United States auto makers will build fewer cars this week than in the yearearlier level, marking the first time that has happened since the beginning of the 1978model year, Ward's Automotive Reports and Automotive News said today. The 202,335 cars expected to be produced this week is up from the 201,283 last week, hut down from 207,133 in the corresponding week last year. For the year to date, domestic car makers will have assembled 8.9 million, compared with 8.1 million in the period of last year.

title: Commodity Spot Price Index Up 2.5 To 211.6 From 209.1 Last Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and Industrial materials rose to 211.6 from 209.1 last week.

title: Concert: Drucker shines
description: Add John Corigliano to the list of composers in full retreat from the overintellectualized school of composers. Mr. Corigiano, son of the late, longtime concertmaster of the New York Philharmonic, is quoted as saying: It has bean fashionable, of late, for the artist to be misunderstood. J wish to be understood. It is the job of the composer to reach out to his audiences with every means at his disposal ... Communication should be a primary goal.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Dec. 8 (AP) Gov. Carlos Romero Barcelo of Puerto Rico says his Government has prepared a plan to keep the Commonwealth Oil Refining Company operating. He made the statement last night after Ashland Oil Inc., of Ashland, Ky., announced earlier in the day it was no longer interested in acquiring controlling interest of Corco.

title: CHIEF JUSTICE BLOCKS USE OF DOCUMENTS FROM RAID
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 8 (AP)Warren E. Burger. Chief Justice of the United States, ordered the Federal Bureau of Investigation today to refrain for now from offering as evidence to a grand jury any portion of some 7.000 documents seized from Church of Scientology offices here in a raid last July.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Two Salesmen Tell of Taking Part In Surgery, in One Case on Skull
description: Two medicalequipment salesmen told a New York State legislative panel yesterday that on rare occasions they helped in operations in New York hospitals at the request of surgeons who were using the equipment for the first time.

title: Manhattanville Chorus to Sing Christmas Music
description: The Manhattanville College Chorus will offer selections from Bach's Christmas Oratorio as well as traditional carols as part of its annual Music for Christmas program, Sunday at 4 P.M. in the college chapel on the campus in Purchase, N. Y.

title: Shots Fired at a Mine in Ohio
description: Shots rang out yesterday at a mine in Ohio, but nobody was hurt and calm prevailed at most other mines across the country. The shoting took place at a mine near Pomeroy, Ohio, but a special investigator said that he did not know whether the shots had come from pickets outside the mine or from nonunion foremen working inside.

title: Music: Homage to Pierrot
description: THE BRANCH of music that has come to be known as modern, orf contemporary, has been dated, with good logic, from the composition of Pierrot Lunaire by Schoenberg, in 1912. So the New Music Consort, a young group of specialists in residence at York College of the City University of New York, was within its proper domain when it included the 65yearold wrok on its program Wednesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. The sonority of Pierrot, with its chambersized ensemble, its spiky lines and its glinting textures, still influence much modern music after more than half a century of compositional fads and fashions.

title: The Lollipopping of the West
description: LONDONIn The Second Coming, Yeats asked: And what rough beast, its hour come round at last,/Slouches towards Bethlehem to be born? What he had in mind, prophetically, was world war, the apocalyptic turn in the great wheel of history, the blooddimmed tide of revolutionary despair and social misery breaking across the seeming stability of the industrial West. But even Yeats, with his weakness for ectoplasm, tablerapping and theosophy, could not have anticipated the menagerie that has come slouching and mincing out of 20thcentury unreason.

title: KEEP 77 INCOME TAX, JERSEY PANEL URGES
description: TRENTON Dec. 8A study commission recommended today that the 2 to 2.5 percent state tax on gross income remain unchanged at least until 1979 and said the tax could finance the property taxrelief program indefinitely without any in crease in the tax rate.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Dr. Burton Gottfried, a Long Island dentist. will put away his drills and take out his meerschaums today for his stint at the. Long Island Antique Show and Sale at the Nassau Coliseum. Dr. Gottfried a widely known pipe collector, will display nialy of his valuable possessions and talk about his favorite subject. On the sales floor, about 150 dealers from 10 states will offer art glass, lamps paintings, silver, rare books, jewelry, Edison phonographs and more. The Long Island Depression Glass Society will also be there with a wide assortment of 1920's and 30's glassware. And there will be three appraisers who will pass judgment on old items from home for $1.50 each piece. Hours: 1 to 10 P.M. today; 1 to 11 P.M. tomorrow; 1 to 7 P.M.. Sunday. The 52.50 admission fee (75 cents for those under 12) includes free reentry privileges throughout the show. From Ncw York City, take the Meodowbrook Parkway to exit M4 and follow the signs. Information: (516) OV 11118.

title: Management
description: William Chatlos, an investorrelations expert, recently pondering why many companies misunderstand stockholder needs, wrote down questions and some answers, where possible, as he flew back to New York headquar

title: Harris of L. I. City High Five Is Finally the Star of Stars
description: With four new starters, Long Island City High School has a new look on the basketball court. But the one returning starter gives the Stars a solid link to their successful past.

title: Advertising
description: Louis and Carole Rogers, husband and wife, are both in the world of publishing but in very different worlds. Quite literally God and mammon.

title: AUSTRALIA   CAMPAIGN GIVEN LIVELY FINISH
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 8For the final rally of his arduous election campaign, Gough Whitlam, the Labor Party leader who is hoping recapture the prime ministership he lost two years ago, chose a Greek neighborhood in this city, which has a Greek population of 110.000. He and his speech were greeted with a roaring enthusiasm that has been conspicuously absent at his and his opponent's rallies.

title: COAL TALKS RESUME Bill QUICKLY RECESS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Negotiations to end the coal miners strike resumed this afternoon but were quickly recessed until 2 P.M. tomorrow.

title: OldFashioned Christmas on S.I. Tomorrow
description: There will be an oldfashioned Staten Island Christmas tomorrow from noon to 4 P.M. on the grounds of the Conference House, a 17thcentury waterfront estate. Visitors will find strolling carolers, openhearth fires and a revival of the old custom of bringing in the yule log.

title: Kuhn Loeb Chairman in New Post
description: Ian MacGregor, chairman of Kuhn Loeb Lehman Brothers International, has been elected president of the International Chamber of Commerce, it was announced at the organization's 131st session in Paris.

title: Ottawa Cabinet Calls on Montreal
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 8In one of its rare appearances outside Ottawa, the Canadian Cabinet under Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau listened to 19 groups discourse on local economic and social problems, held its regular weekly session and then fanned out all over Montreal and its suburbs for meetings, speeches and ceremonies.

title: At the Movies
description: IM ADOLF ZITZ, declared the pudgy, moonfaced Dom De Luise with manic glee. I'm head of Rainbow Studios and my main problem is that Paramount has Rudolph Valentino. So I run a World's Greatest Lover contest and the winner gets to star in a movie as my Rudolph Valentino.

title: Japanese Sell at Below Cost In Bid to Avoid Bankruptcy
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8While Japan's foreignexchange holdings continue to snowball as a result of its successful export drive, the earnings of its exportoriented industries are rapidly failing due to the sharp appreciation of the yen.

title: Democratic Leader Denies White House Forced Him to Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  Cheerfully conceding that the chairmanship of the Democratic National Committee under a Democratic President was inherently a lousy job, Kenneth M. Curtis insisted) today that he had not been hounded, out of office by a critical White House staff.

title: New York Visitors Unit Takes Canceled Hassan Stop in Stride
description: York is a global city.

title: Improvising Handel on Harpsichord
description: Rummaging around in Junk shops has been a hobby of mine for a long time, said Kenneth Cooper the other day, recalling how he happened to acquire the music with which he will begin his Tully Hall harpsichord recital at 3 o'clock tomorrow afternoon.

title: ACCORD IS REPORTED ON SOCIAL SECURITY WITH TAXRISE DELAY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Demoeratio Congressional leaders and the. White House today reported provisional agreement on a Social Security financing, bill that would require no increases in payroll taxes next year above those already mandated by law.

title: Horsemen Stage Meadowlands Protest
description: A temporary boycott by horsemen at the Meadowlands caused a drastic delay at the New Jersey track yesterday in the taking of entries for tomorrow night's races.

title: Panel to Study Definite Sentences
description: Governor Carey named District Attorrey Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan vesterday v to head a committee of 15 lceiislators, lawyers and professors of law who will examine New York State's criminalsentencing structure as well as aarole and probation procedures.

title: Oil Spill Mars San Francisco Bay
description: RICHMOND, Calif., Dec. 8 (UPI)An equipment failure caused about 1,500 gallons of oil to spill into San Francisco Bay in the loading of a Chevron tanker yesterday.

title: Yesteryear Museum in Morris County Becoming Relic
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 8'We have to closeit is impossible to go on

title: SeatBelt Use Found Highest: InForeign Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Volvo drivels are nearly three times as likely to fasten their seat belts as Cadillac drivers. Women buckle up more often than men, young people more frequently than older people and Westerners more commonly lean easterners.

title: Veterans Reassured on Drug Tests
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (Reuters)The Army today advised Vietnam veterans who were given the antimalaria drug dapsone not to he concerned by test reports that showed it might cause cancer in male rats. It said the dosage given to rats in the testa, results of which were announced recently by the National Cancer Institute, was almost 320 times as great as that received daily by soldiers in Vietnam who were given the drug from 1966 to 1973.

title: BOND PRICES STEADY; MONEY SUPPLY IS UP
description: Increasing about as much as expected, the nation's basic money supplyknown as M1rose $1.8 billion in the week ended Nov. 30, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday. The broader money supply known as M2 climbed $2 billion.

title: 2 Killed, 3 Injured in Jersey ChemicalPlant Blast
description: BRIDGEPORT, N.J., Dec. 8An explosion and fire ripped through a chemical treatment plant here today, killing two construction workers and injuring 1 at least three others.

title: Ballet: Message From South Africa
description: WHEN ALVIN AILEY presented the premiere of Masekele Langage In 1969, It was very obviously the choreographer's most political statement.

title: On Secretary Andrus's Agrarian Reform
description: To the Editor:

title: TeenAgers Accused of Killing Two
description: Two Bronx teenagers have been arrested and charged with killing two men Eind seriously wounding a 15yearold boy in three separate knife attacks that according to detectives, took place within a block of one another in a twohour period last week.

title: 1,000 Attend Rally At Yale in Support Of Employee Strike
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. SAs more than 1,000 students and members of unions and community groups held a rally this afternoon to support striking bluecollar workers a; Yele University, both sides in the dispute worked on a elan that might result in strikers returning to work next Monday under their old contract.

title: DR. PAUL C. PAYNE, 87; RELIGIOUS EDUCATOR
description: The Rev. Dr. Paul Calvin Payne, general secretary of the United Presbyterian Board of Christian Education from 1939 to 1957 and a pioneer in religious education, died Dec. 2 at Taylor Hospital near his home in Swarthmore, Pa. He was 87 years old and had suffered a heart ailment for several years.

title: New Bid by Lawyer for Berkowitz
description: A lawyer for David R. Berkowitz. sus pected of being the .49caliber killer. asserted yesterday that the constitutional and statutory rights of his client would be violated if he was tried anywhere in New York State.

title: $360 REFERENCE PRICE FOR IMPORTED STEEL lS URGED BY R0DERICK
description: David M. Roderick, president of the United States Steel Corporation, said yesterday that a reference price averaging about $360 a ton on. imported steelabout $50 more than Japanese producers have been chargingwould be fair and enable the domestic industry to compete with foreign producers.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asburv Park and Belmar, deduct 34 mln. from Sandy Hook time.

title: Egyptians Rally in Support of Sadat as He Calls His HardLino' Arab Critics Dwarfs
description: CAIRO, Dec. 8Suzan Attef, a 15year old schoolgirl, stood in the warm sunlight of Cairo's Abdine Square today with tears welling in her eyes. Her father died fighting in the war against Israel in October 1973.

title: PANEL VOTES TO CONVERT FOOD STAMPS INTO CASH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A special House subcommittee on welfare voted today to convert the food stamp program into extra cash benefits for the needy.

title: Moscow's Predilection
description: Your reports on the hostile Soviet reaction to the SadatBegin dialogue underscore once again the problem of Moscow's role in world affairs.

title: Syrian President Flies to Riyadh To Seek Saudis Aid Against Sadat
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 8Syria's President, Hafez aIAssad, arrived here today to try to enlist Saudi aid in opposing Egyptian peace overtures to Israel.

title: Environmental Deadlock Over Sohio Plan Is Easing
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Dec. 8A long deadlock over the controversial plan of the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) for terminal here to handle Alaskan crude oil may be nearing an end, according to government and industry sources.

title: WESTCHESTER TOWN LOSES ZONING CASE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 8A. justice in State Supreme Court here today struck down the Town of New Castle's prohibitions against multifamily housing as unconstitutional and exclusionary and ordered the town to give him within six montns a plan to allow the construction of 3,500 multiunit dwellings in the next 10 years.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 3 Children Die in Fire In Bronx Apartment

title: KOCH IS STILL TRYING TO FILL MAJOR JOBS
description: With barely three weeks until he takes office as Mayor of New York Edward I. Koch is still trying o fill toplevel jobs in his administration, with his latest rejection coming from Eugene Keilin, who has declined to become Deputy Mayor for Finance.

title: The F.B.I. Mess
description: IN THE NATION

title: New York Says We're Sorry To Robbed Honeymoon Couple
description: Mayor Beanie made New York City's love affair with Darlene and Jerry Jenkins official yesterday with a City Hall ceremony honoring the Vermont couple whose honeymoon almost turned into a nightmare.

title: Republicans in Albany Senate Get a Tax Cut Passed
description: ALBANY, Dec, 8In a hurried oneday session, the Republicancontrolled State Senate approved today a S482 million tax cut for next year that the Democrats charged was a blatant ploy to further the gubernatorial ambitions of the Senate's majority leader, Warren M. Anderson.

title: Her Poem Was Banned Near Boston
description: Jody Caravaglit is more interested in credit lines than bylines now, more involved in photography than poetry, more woman than girl, more private than public person. But in an odd case of arrested development, she has become a cause clbre today in a town where she has never lived, for something she did years ago, dabbling in a craft she no longer pursues. She is only 22 years old and her photographs have not yet made her a big name In the big city, but in Chelsea, Mass., any household knows her words: Jody Caravagliashe wrote the poem.

title: Israelis Deny Secret Negotiations With Egyptians Are Taking Place
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 8  Israel flatly denied today reports that ranking Israeli and Egyptian officials had been holding secret talks somewhere in the Middle East on substantive issues that were expected to come up at next week's Cairo conference.

title: Deaths
description: DLERNancy (nee Lamb) Beloved wife of Josef Dear sister of Margaret Lamb. Services private.

title: Zaire Cabinet Quits to Make Way For Mobutu's Program of Reform
description: INSHASA, Zaire, Dec. 8 (UPI)The Government has resigned to make way for a new cabinet in the framework of reforms pledged by President Mobutu Sese Seko five months ago, it was announced today.

title: Conferees on Gas Take a Step Ahead
description: Washington. Dec.8  Senate energy conferees, whose 9.to.9 deadlock over natural gas deregulation has stymied even the appearance of action since the issue came up, took one small step toward compromise today.

title: Driver of Year: It Was a Long Road for Yarborough
description: Cale Yarborough, a 5-foot-7-inch former running back who gave up a football scholarship to drive race cars on South Carolina dirt tracks for $80 a week, if he was lucky, touched down his twinengine Aztec airplane in New York yesterday to accept the 1977 Olsonite driver-of-the-year award.

title: JERSEY PLANT IS TOO TO AID LEAD CLEANUP
description: An automobilebattery reprocessing plant has been ordered to put up $150; 000 so Elizabeth, N.J., can clean lead dust from homes, pave over contaminated soil and provide medical care to residents living near the plant.

title: JAPANESE INDICATE THEY CANNOT MEET U.S. TRADE DEMANDS
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8Japan has no Intention of making a public pledge to turn its massive trade surplus into a deficit, Nobuhiko Ushiba, Japan's new Minister for External Economic Affairs, declared in an interview here.

title: GIFTS WORTH $500,000 TO PASSMAN REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Tongsun Park, the Seoul businessman who has figured prominently in the investigation into charges of South Korean influence buying, contends that he gave about $500,000 its cash and other things of value to former Representative Otto E. Passman, according to sources familiar with the investigation.

title: Albany Sees a 12Month Increase In Costs of Welfare and Medicaid
description: Statewide welfare and Medicaid spending in New York State is officially forecast to show a rise over a 12-month periodcompletely counter to the pattern in a report by the Assembly Speaker, Stanley Steingut, last week that had heralded the first decline in spending in 20 years. Mr. Steingut's report was based on the first six months of 1977.

title: Princeton Routs Fordham, Rutgers Beats Columbia
description: The losing teams at Madison Square Garden's second college basketball doubleheader of the season last night had different reasons for their exceptionally low point totals.

title: Bill Crofut Tunes His Banjo to Music of Poetry
description: The concert that Bill Crofut will give tomorrow night at 8 in Town Hallhis first in New Yorkwill be the end product of an unusual assortment of influences. They include Pete Seeger, the folk singer: Tony Scott, the jazz clarinetist; Robert Penn Wirren, the poet and novelist; Peter Prescott, the book reviewer; an afternoon of Mozart sonatas in Salzburg; a couple of years in Japan and India where Mr. Crofut studied the sitar, and performances with the harpsichordist Kenneth Cooper and the opera singer Benjamin Luxon.

title: Bermuda: Tenacious Island Pondering a Fragile Future
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 8As the sun went down over the picturesque, pastel buildings of Hamilton harbor, the men in the Royal Bermuda Yacht Club bar, dressed in blazers, club ties and, appropriately enough, Bermuda shorts, shook their heads in glum agreement and snorted over a story in an American newspaper saying their Government had overreacted to racial disturbances over the last weekend.

title: WESTCHESTER TOWN LOSES ZONING CASE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 8A justice in State Supreme Court here today struck down the Town of New Castle's prohibitions against multifamily housing as anconstitutional and exclusionary and ordered the town to give him within six months a plan to allow the construction of 3,500 multiunit dwellings in the next 10 years.

title: Grand Jury Charges Doctor Gave Wife Fatal Drug Dose in Hospital
description: A Filipino doctor who works for Har!ern Hospital was indicted yesterday on ; a charge of administering a fatal dose of a drug to his wife while she was a patient at the hospital last February.

title: The Rescue Plan for Steel: Cureor New Problems?
description: The Economic Scene

title: Iraq Says That Kurds Living Abroad Must Return in 2 Months for Amnesty
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Dec. 8 (Reuters)Iraq has given Kurdish rebels living abroad two months in which to retum home if they wish to benefit from a political amnesty.

title: Kummerfeld to Head Fiscal Panel After Carey Raises Salary $10,000
description: First Deputy Mayor Donald D. Kummerfeld, who turned clown a chance to join the incoming New York City administration, confirmed a longheld rumor yesterday and announced that he had agreed to become executive director of the State Emergency Financial Control Board, where he will oversee that new administration.

title: Roosevelt
description: RESULTS

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: Money
description: Friday, December 9, 1977

title: Dayan Tells Israelis That U.S. Retains Mideast Role
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 9In preparation for the arrival in Israel tomorrow of Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, Foreign Min'ster Moshe Dayan has been stressing the importance of the role of the United States at the impending Cairo conference, in which Israel and Egypt will be negotiating together directly.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9 (AP)The Zenith Radio Corporation will cease all operations at its plants in Sioux City, Iowa, and Watsontown, Pa., as part of its previously announced plan to lay off 5,600 United States workers. In September, the company announced it planned to halt all United States production of its stereo products and within a year to cut back by onequarter its United States work force.

title: Alexandre Minor, at 83
description: Dr. Alexandre Minor, a retired phiEgtcian, died Thursday night of a heart attack at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 247 East 87th Street.

title: Fiuit packing operations in Arad. Rumania receives citrus fruit from Israel and exports it to other countries.
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Dec. 9Israel and Rumania haye agreed to a major expansion in trade and economic cooperation, the first substantive benefit Rumania has realized from its role as an intermediary in the latest round of Middle Eastern diplomacy.

title: BOLIVIA SAYS IT PUT DOWN MILITARYCIVILIAN PLOT
description: LA PAZ. Bolivia. Dec. 9 (AP)Bolivia's military Government announced today that it had put down a plot by unidentified civilians and military officers to overthrow the sixyear regime of Gen. Hugo Banzer Suarez.

title: Fabian Bachrach Kenneth Holland
description: Kenneth Holland, a leader of international cultural and education exchanges and president from 1950 to 1973 of the Institute of International Education, died yesterday while being taken to a hospital after having suffered a heart attack at his home in Bronxville, N.Y. He was 70 years old.

title: Waterfront Agency Making Check For Payoffs to Carriers or Officials
description: Officials of the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor said yesterday that they were scrutinizing more closely than in past years the applications from more than 100 stevedoring companies that handle cargo on New York and New Jersey piers to determine whether illegal payments had been made to shipping companies or officials in the United States or foreign countries.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Lee Fuhrman
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 9 (AP)Lee Fuhrman, a city editor of The Atlanta Constitution who retired from the newspaper in 1968, died yesterday of cancer. He was 74 years old.

title: British Team Takes ProAm Tournament
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 9Soutn Herts Golf Club of London, England, carded a 12underpar 59 today at the Port Royal Golf Course to win the 25th annual Bermuda Goodwill golf tournament with a 72hole low net total of 239 strokes, two below North Palm Beach (Fla.) Country Club.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: OSAKA, JaoanYang Hong Su, South Korea, outooinied Jiro Takada, Japan, 12; Yang wins Orient flyweight title.

title: Trailways Ends Its Rent Strike At Port Authority Bus Terminal
description: Trailways Inc., the nation's secondlargest intercity bus company, has ended its rent strike against the Port Authorits of New York and New Jersey, and the agency withdrew yesterday an eviction notice that would have ordered Trailways out of the midtown bus terminal by Jan. 8.

title: Czechs Down Racers
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 9(UPI)Pavel Richter scored three goals tonight to lead Czeohoslovakia's national hockey team to a 53 victory over the Indianapolis Racers of the World Hockey Association. It was the opener of the Czechs ninegame series against W.H.A. teams during the next two weeks and the loss counted in the league standing.

title: JEROME E. MALINO, AT 83; LAWYER AT GILBERT FIRM
description: Jerome E. Malino, a partner in the law firm of Gilbert & Gilbert, died Wednesday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 875 Fifth Avenue.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan enjoined the American Broadcasting Companies and ABC Sports yesterday from broadcasting six 197778 season foreign ski events in the United States.

title: 6 New York Examiners Oversee StateChartered Banks in Britain
description: LONDON, Dec. 9New York State's only employees overseasthe six Banking Department examiners posted in Londonmay unwittingly be demonstrating a new law of bureaucracy to stand beside those of C. Northcote Parkinson: Bureaucracy can block bureaucracy, as well as beget it.

title: Tax Rules Eased On School Costs
description: Taxpayers who have left their jobs to pursue education that will aid them in their current lines of work but have hesitated to claim tax deductions for their school expenses can take some comfort in two littlenoticed Tax Court decisions.

title: Waller Tribute By a Sextet Has Wit and Fervor
description: The Tribute to Fats Waller that Gil Wiest has devised for his Michael's Pub, 211 East 55th Street, to be there through the end of the month, isno mere compilation of songs and tunes associated with the late and very much lamented Harmful Little Armful.

title: The New York Times/Craig R. Whitney
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8Abe Stolar was a young idealist when he left his native Chicago 46 years ago to help build Communism in the Soviet Union. Today he lives at the edges of Soviet life, in an empty apartment he and his family gave up along with Soviet citizenship two years ago to emigrate to Israel.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE Third Division

title: Knicks Conquer Hawks
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 9  Willis Reed called it a great victory for his New York Knicks. Almost any coach in the stational Basketball Association feels that way about winning on the road.

title: Nets Given Extension
description: The Nets' request for a twoweek extension in their dispute with the Knicks was granted yesterday by Judge Robert L. Carter in Federal District Court. The Knicks did not oppose the Nets move to delay the start of arguments concerning indemnification payments of $7.2 million plus interest owed to the Knicks.

title: IDoctor Denies Guilt in Wife's Death
description: Arsenio Favor, a 29yearold doctor accused of murdering his wife, who was also a doctor, again protested that he was not guilty when he was arraigned yesterday before Justice Harold J. Rothwax in State Supreme Court in Manhattan on a murder indictment.

title: Many Styles of Living Are Suffering as West German Officials Wage War on Urban Terrorists
description: COLOGNE, West GermanyThe recent wiLve of terrorism and the measures to fight it have changed the manner of living of many West Germansnot just top politicians, financiers and industrialists, who seem especially vulnerable to ideologically inspired violence.

title: U.S.S.R. Launches Manned Spacecraft In Docking Attempt
description: MOSCOW. Saturday, Dec. 10Two Soviet cosmonauts were launched into space this morning aboard a Soyuz 26 spacecraft in another apparent attempt to rendezvous with an orbiting research station.

title: Treasury Asks TaxDeposit Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)  The Treasury Department proposed regulations today to end the decadesold practice whereby banks had free use of as much as $240 billion a year in Federal tax deposits.

title: Floridian Wins P.G.A. Event
description: BOYNTON BEACH, Fla., Dec. 9 (AP) Roland Stafford of Bradenton, Fla., shot his second consecutive underpar round today to win a Professional Golfers Association club tournament and $3,500. Stafford had rounds of 71 69 for a total 140, four under par, and edged Kelly Childs of Birmingham, Ala., by one stroke.

title: A Victim New York Took to Heart Is Now Held for Police in Vermont
description: Jerry Jenkins, the outoftown newlywed to whom New York City opened its heart after his car had been stolenand driven on a fatal rampageon his first night here last Monday, was arrested yesterday by New York City detectives on a charge of cashing more than $2,500 in bad checks in Vermont stores.

title: Associated Press
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 9Welcomed by banners, balloons and cheers, 61 Americans who had been in prison in Mexico and the 18monthold child of one of them arrived here tonight in the first phase of a prisoner exchange between the United States and Mexico.

title: Allies Look for Breakthrough on Pact With East to Cut Troop Levels
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9The United States and its Western allies feel a breakthrough may finally be at hand in their longstalled Vienna talks with the Soviet Union and other Warsaw Pact countries on reducing the military forces of both sides in Europe.

title: Publicly Traded Funds
description: Unaudited net asset values of publicly traded Investment shares, formerly listed as Closed End Funds, as of Friday. Also shown Is the closing listed market price of each fund's shares, with the vercentage differences between the net asset value and the stock price.

title: Around the Nation
description: Tractor caravans, with President Carter's sister participating in one of them, moved slowly along the nation's highways yesterday, The Associated Press reported, as farmers headed for rallies in state capitals to dramatize their asesrtion that they are not being paid enough for their crops. The protest is sponsored by a group called American Agriculture. The farmers, who say they are losing money, have threatened a nationwide strike next Wednesday, meaning they will not plant crops if the authorities do not act to guarantee them higher prices.

title: Mother of 3 Who Died in Fire in Bronx Is Arrested
description: The 28yearold mother of three children who burned to death while they and their two brothers were alone in a Bronx apartment Thursday night, was arrested and charged with seconddegree manslaughter yesterday.

title: About New york
description: Andrei D. Sakharov, the outspoken Nobel laureate, remained something of an exile in his own Soviet homeland on the other side of the world, but his two publishers, free within the afternoon limits of the VanWyck Expressway traffic flow, were never far in their conversation from the cause of Mr. Sakharov and the other Soviet dissidents.

title: Yanks Sign Eastwick to 5Year Pact
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 9More tremors cut across the baseball world today when the New York Yankees signed Rawly Eastwick in yet another milliondollar plunge into the auction market. And, in a trade by another powerhouse team, the Cincinnati Reds acquired Vida Blue from the Oakland A'sonly to be told that the commissioner of baseball saw substantial questions that could block the deal.

title: Spanish Journalist Is Stabbed By Rightist Youths, Wife Reports
description: MADRID, Dec. 9 (Reuters)Rightist youths shouting We are the guerrillas of Christ the King stabbed and beat up Jose Antonio Novais, one of Spain's best. known journalists, here last night, his wife said today.

title: The Ambassador At Large
description: PARISOnly two officers in American history have been granted the military rank of General of the Armies. Technically, the first to be so honored was John J. Pershing, as of Sept. 4, 1919, although the U.S. World War commander never wore more than four stars.

title: TUITION ISSUE BLOCKS SOCIAL SECURITY BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A HouseSenate conference reached agreement today on a multibilliondollar increase in Social Security payroll taxes but was prevented from reporting a bill by an impasse over a college tuition tax credit opposed by the Carter Administration.

description: CAIRO, Dec. 9Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance arrived.tonight at the start of a sixday mission to the Middle East and said the United States wanted to do everything it could to maintain the diplomatic motion begun by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt.

title: Dance Company From Spain Pleases Carnegie Hall Crowd
description: A Spanish dance company without the emotional quality of duende is a Spanish dance company without soul. It can, however, he Spanish dance company made up of technicians that keeps an audience more or less happy, which is what the Ballet Nacional Festivales de Espafia accomplished with no effort Thursday night at Carnegie Hall.

title: Soviet Purchasing More U. S. Grains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)The Soviet Union has bought an additional 851,600 metric tons of United States grain for delivery the coming year, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Moscow Gives West Brief Portrait Of First Lady of the Soviet Union
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9 (AP)The Soviet Union offered Westerners a rare glimpse of its first lady today, Viktoriya P. Brezhnev, who will celebrate her 70th birthday Sunday.

title: Rep.Wolff Victim of Burglars A gain on L. I.
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 9 The office here of Representative Lester L. Wolff was broken into during the night along with other offices in a twostory building at 156 Main Street, according to the authorities. The Congressman said it was the third such incident affecting him in the last year.

title: Personal Investing
description: Wall Street's inspired marketing men keep turning out new investment vehicles at almost the same rate that Detroit stamps out new model automobilesor maybe faster.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONA research biochemist at the University of California in Berkeley has invented an apparatus that has proved useful in court cases involving paternity as well as in medical diagnosis. It has also attracted the attention of Federal agencies interested in the identification of persons by their

description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 9Welcomed by banners, balloons and cheers, 61 Americans who had been in prison in Mexico and the 18monthold child of one of them arrived here tonight in the first phase of a prisoner exchange between the United States and Mexico.

description: The General Motors Corporation was ordered yesterday to pay $200 each to more than 12,000 New York State purchasers of some 1977model cars and to give them full threeyear warranties. The autos involved are Cadillacs, Buicks, Oldsmobiles and Pontiacs in which engines were switched.

description: BURLINGTON, N.J., Dec. 9Histon. enthusiasts of this 300yearold city of 12,000 People on the Delaware T:iver will gather tomorrow in the Guild House of the 1703 St. Mary's LIpiscopal Church to commemorate the 200th anniversary of New Jersey's first regularly published newspaper, The NewJersey Gazette.

title: Adoption Lawyer, Facing Charges, Is Cleared for StateRun Program
description: TRENTON Dec. 9An attorney who is under indictment on charges of conspiring with attorneys from out of state to violate New Jersey's adoption laws has been cleared to render legal services for the state's.subsidized adoption program.

title: Elizabeth Shriver, J. D. Blake, Lawyers, Wed
description: Elizabeth Lawson Shriver, a lawyer with the Public Broadcasting Service in Washington, was married there yesterday to Jonathan Dewey Blake, a partner in the Washington law finn of Covington & Burling.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Friday Dec. 9, 1977

title: Psychiatric Examination Sought For a Defendant in Bolles Case
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 9 (AP)A motion seeking a psychiatric examination for Max Dunlap. one of two men convicted of the carbomb death of Don Bolles, an Arizona reporter, has been requested by defense attorneys.

title: Associated Press
description: LUNCHEON IN CASINO: Conventioneers got a preview of how casino will look in renovated Resorts International Hotel, formerly Haddon Hail, when management set up buffet there. Construction may be completed this month.

description: The General Motors Corporation was ordered yesterday to pay $200 each to more than 12,000 New York State purchasers of some 1977model cars and to give them full threeyear warranties. The autos involved are Cadillacs, Buicks, Oldsmobiles and Pontiacs in which engines were switched.

title: Kummerfeld to Head Control Board After a Pay Rise
description: First Deputy Mayor Donald D. Kummerfeld, who turned down a chance to join the incoming New York City administration, confirmed a longheld rumor yesterday and announced that he had agreed to become executive director of the State Emergency Financial Control Board, where he will oversee that new administration.

title: Saturdays On Planet Libido
description: Far away on the gray planet Uxor the Emperor Zung, with evil incarnate written all over his goatee, is confronting the luscious Velma Suttee, U.S. spacetraveling sex object. Yes, pace fans, it is 1937 and we are watching a Saturday afternoon movie serial, and we know what is about to happen now, do we not?

title: Article 2 -- No Title
description: PATERSON BLOCK DESTROYED BY FIRE: Firemen completing cleanup after general alarmfire early yesterday destroyed four multifamily homes and left one man critically injured. The blaze started at 285 Governor Street and took 50 firemen two hours to bring under control. Donald Tourse, 66, was taken to Barnett Hospital.

title: A Sad Compromise on Abortion
description: The abortion legislation finally passed by a weary Congress last week has been hailed by some as a compromise. Senator Javits went further, saluting the measure as a victory for humanity and enlightenment  major victory for women's rights. But the sad reality is that after five months of bitter debate, Congress has endorsed an abortion law that is a defeat.

title: Gamble Rogers, Singer and Monologist, at Ballroom
description: The Ballroom, which usually draws its entertainment from Broadway and its relatively sophisticated fringes, is shifting this week and next to a folkoriented setting. The change is being made by Gamble Rogers, a singer, guitarist and monologist. making his first New York appearance, although he has been performing for the last decade.

title: German Pilots Reject Guards
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Dce. 9 (Reuters)West German pilots rejected a proposal today that armed antihijacking guards should travel on passenger airplanes. A spokesman for the pilot's association, Cockpit, said: We do not want shooting aboard, and in any case a Would not achieve anything.

title: TV Rings Out a Carter Show
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9If the White House had had its way, Americans celebrating the new year would have seen and heard the President wishing them well by television at 12:01 A.M., New York time, from Teheran, where Mr. Carter will be the guest of the Shah of Iran.

title: Satra Wins TheaterTV Rights To Summer Olympics From NBC
description: Satra Corporation has won United States theatertelevision and videocassette rights to the 1980 Summer Olympic Games in Moscow as part of a negotiated settlement of Satra's two suits seeking $275 million each against the National Broadcasting Company and the International Olympic Committee.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Convention Leaders Unhappy ()tier. Carter's Absence
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9A largely unspoken but significant issue at the biennial convention of the A.F.L.C.I.O. here is the absence of an invited guest, the President of the United States.

Associated Press Hanna Holborn Gray
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9The board of trustees of the University of Chicago is expected to appoint Hanna Holborn Gray as the university's 10th president tomorrow.

title: RECREATION BACKERS GAIN ON LIBERTY PARK
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 9Citizen and recreational groups won major concessions today in the writing of a final report, to be submitted to Governor Byrne, by a special study commission for the development and administration of Liberty State Park here.

title: Goldin Says City Loses Millions By Not Enforcing Parking Laws
description: New York City's enforcement of parking regulations was labeled a failure yesterday by the City Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, who charged that the Traffic Department was not speeding the flow of cars, was not helping business or the shopping public and was losing S41 million in revenue that should be collected from illegal parkers.

title: National Starch Board Will Weigh a Bid by Unilever
description: The National Starch and Chemical Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had called a special board meeting tomorrow to consider a takeover offer from the huge BritishDutch Unilever food, soap and chemical group.

title: Jaworski Protests U.S. Plan on Korean's Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Leon Jaworski, spceial couwel to the House ethics committee, today objected to an impending agrcement between the Carter Administration and the South Korean Government that would preclude ??limony before Crngress onal investigating committees by Tongsun Park. the fugitive witness in the Korean investigations.

title: The quaint gas lamps that light Congress Place, below, and many other Victorian streets in Cape May will disappear forever next June 30 unless city officials can convince New Jersey's public utilities board to exempt town from ban.
description: CAPE MAY, N.J.The soft light of 139 gas lamps cast a multimilliondollar glow over the streets of this seashore resort at the southern tip of New Jersey because of the tourists they help attract, according to city officials.

title: Assad Ends Riyadh Talks
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 9President Hafez alAssad of Syria today corn pleted the talks he began here yesterday with what Arab officials described as the aim of winning Saudi underestanding for his opposition to Egyptian peace initiatives with Israel.

title: Albany Puts a Freeze on New State Hiring
description: In an effort to amass additional funds for a tax reduction next year, Governor Carey's administration has ordered an immediate freeze on the hiring of new state employees, except to fill critical vacancies.

title: First Snow
description: Snow belongs to the open country. It has no reason for being, in the city, where it becomes a slushy nuisance with little beauty, once it has fallen. A snowfall itself, the shifting curtain of flakes di if ting down, has its brief loveliness even in the city's cpnyons; but once on the streets it is just so much cold, vet inconvenience.

title: Harvard Sets Back City College
description: Bob Hooft scored 4 points to break the last tie of the game and help Harvard take a 9281 victory over City College in a basketball game last night at Holman Gym. It was the first victory of the season for the Crimson after three defeats.

title: U.S. SAID TO DECLINE TO STEP IN FURTHER IN SUPPORT OF DOLLAR
description: WASFIINGTON, Dec. 9The Secretary of the Treasury, W. Michael Blumenthal, and the Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, Arthur F. Burns, have declined, in the face of growing pressure from European finance ministers, to commit the United States to a more active intervention policy to support the dollar's rate, American officials reported today.

title: Lowell's SaccoVanzetti Papers Are Opened After 50 Years
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 9The parcel measured 12 inches on each side. It was wrapped in brown paper and secured with twine and red sealing wax. On the outside was a note saying that these were the SaccoVanzetti papers of A. Lawrence Lowell, former president of Harvard.

title: 3 CONVICTED OF FRAUD ON SUMMER LUNCHES
description: Three officials of an affiliate of B'nai Torah, a controversial operator of poverty programs, were convicted yesterday of defrauding the Governmentby submitting hills for food that was not served to needy children in a summer lunch program in New York City.

title: China Debates Restoring Presidency, Vacant for Decade
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 9After a decade without a president, China is apparently debating whether to restore the office and who should get the post.

title: Priest's Shelter Tries to Salvage Times Sq. Youths
description: The upper windows of Under 21, shelter for runaway and troubled youths on Eighth Avenue in Manhattan, were softened yesterday by delicate venetian blinds that filtered a view of the Cameo Theater. Promising a triple hill of Big Rape, Heat Wave and Sweet Red Lips.

title: Banker Sees No Need for Props
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (AP)A.W. Clausen, president and chief executive officer of Bank of America, the largest bank in the United States, said today he saw no need for United States authorities to take special measures to prop up the sagging dollar.

title: Houston Natural Gas Earnings Up 14% in Quarter and 12.1% for Year
description: The Houston Natural Gas Corporation, the intrastate pipeline operator, which derives about half its income from oil and gas, coal mining and marine transportation, realized a 14 percent increase in earnings for the quarter ended Oct. 31. The company's report yesterday put earnings for the 12 months period at 12.1 percent gain.

title: Cutbacks by C.I.A.'s New Director Creating Turmoil Within Agency
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 9  The Central Intelligence Agency, which is just beginning to recover from the trauma of having some of its more provocative covert actions disclosed, is now troubled internally over the decision of its new head, Admiral Stanfield Turner, to dismiss most of the top officers in the branch that carried out covert operations.
