title: Dave Anderson
description: Back when Weeb Ewbank was coaching the New York Jets, a TV network displayed a primetime salute to college football featuring that season's outstanding players. I've got to watch that, Weeb Ewbank said a few hours before the show. I'll get to see some of the kids we're hoping draft. But the next day Weeb Ewbank grunted, Cheerleaders and bands, that's all it was. The same grunt can be applied now to the Heisman Trophy awards special, whin appeared Thursday night as a tribute more to two postgraduate cheerleaders, Connie Stevens and Leslie Uggams, than to Earl Campbell, the University of Texas running back. In previous years, the Heisman Trophy projected an aura of tradition, even if the aura was somewhat stuffy. The winner had invariably been the most publicized college football player in the nation, if not the most outstanding. But the Heisman Trophy dinner always had a certain dignity that could not be bought. Until now. Earl Campbell did not win the 43d Heisman Trophy, he won the first Schlockman Trophy.

title: Carter Policy on Aid to Poor: Praise, Doubt From Experts
description: As the struggle to capture President Carter's mind and heart to achieve solutions to America's urban problems approaches a critical phase, urban affairs experts who have followed the evolution of the Administration's policy await the

title: Gary Player Cards 68 but Canada Leads
description: MANILA, Dec. 9 (AP)Gary Player of South Africa shot a fourunderpar 68 today to take the individual lead in the 25th World Cup golf championship.

title: ASSAD URGES KUWAIT TO JOIN HARDLINERS
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 9 (AP)President Hafez alAssad of Syria flew here today and sought to convince Kuwait's ruler, Sheik Sabah alSalem alSabah, to join in opposing the peace initiatives toward Israel by Egypt.

title: In Memoriam
description: AUERBACHJoseph and Ida. Dartings, we were blessed to have you as Parents. Rest peacefully. Your Three Graces

title: Officer Fined in Assault, but Jail Term Is Suspended
description: HACKENSACK, Dec.9 The only policeman convicted after five officers were charged with assault in the beating of two civilian guests after a police fundraising dinner in Allendale in February 1976 was fined $1,000 today, given a oneyear suspended jail sentence and placed on probation for two years.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: AT LONG LAST What, besides success do Rodeo, Giselle, Don Giovanni. On the Town, West Side Story, Camelot, The Sound of Music, Carousel. Kismet, Hello. Dolly! My Fair Lady and The Royal Family have in common? The answer is Oliver Smith, whose set designs for ballet, opera and theater mark a 35year career that began with his work for the Ballet Russe de Monte Clarlo

title: Violet Smith Rides No. 500
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Dec. 9 (AP) Violet Smith became only the second woman jockey to ride 500 winners as she guided Candy Top to victory today in a weathershortened card at Finger Lakes. Patty Barton is the only other woman rider to reach 500 victories in thoroughbred racing.

title: M. T. McGifford Returns to City In Tenor Recital
description: Michael Tarawhiti McGifford, a New Zealand tenor of partial Niaori extraction, gave his latest. New York recital in Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night. As in his previous appearances. it was his sincerity and directness of expression as an artist and his sweetness as a personality that made his performances engaging. At the same time there was no denying that his vocal limitations and a bland approach to curious program kept the evening as a whole from being a worthwhile exprience.

title: The Rev. Roy D. Petipren, 84, Missionary in Korea 47 Years
description: The Rev. Roy D. Petipren, a missionary in Korea for 47 years, died there on Tuesday of a heart attack. He was 84 years old.

title: Nissan Motor to Increase Price On Its Vehicles Sold in the U.S.
description: TOKYO, Dec. 9 (AP)The Nissan Motor Company said today the retail prices on its motor vehicles sold in the United States would be raised an average of 3.6 percent over shipments in December.

title: Leasing City Hospitals
description: Most city and state officials now acknowledge that eliminating excess hospital beds is a top priority in reducing hospital costs. Leasing several of the remaining municipal hospitals to qualified community corporations, to voluntary hospitals, labor unions and local medical schools, and contracting with hospitalmanagement companies for the operation of others is another step which would contribute to the prudent use of municipal resources devoted to hospital care. It would also be a step toward eliminating the city's present twoclass system of hospital care.

title: ENERGY CONFEREES WEIGH COMPROMISE ON GAS PRICE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Energy coaferees are seriously discussing a compromise on natural gas pricing that sould give them the best or political words, the chance to claim that they voted Jot deregulation or to claim that they voted against it.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed In order of oust positions Letter designates O'f B listing FIRST$8,500, cl., 3YO, 6f. Pratt.

title: Cauthen Rides Three Winners, Nears Plateau
description: Question: Why would a jockey whose mounts had already earned more than $5 million in 1977 want to ride in all nine races on a wet and dreary December day at Aaueduct? and took aim on the goal he now appears ready to reach.

title: Sittler's Late Goal Wins for Leafs. 32
description: DENVER, Dec. 9 (UPI)Darryl Sittler scored with just over two minutes to play tonight, giving the Toronto Maple Leafs a 32 National Hockey League victory over the Colorado Rockies.

title: Civil Rights Coalition Challenges U.S. Antibusing Law
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A coalition of civil rights groups charged today in a suit filed in Federal District Court here. that legislation designed to prevent busing as an instrument of desegregation of schools was unconstitutional.

title: Soares, Victim Of Polarization
description: LISBON, Dec. 9The fall yesterday of minority Socialist Government of Prime Minister Mdrio Soares reflects a deepseated crisis that stems from the rigidity and personal animosities pervading Portugal's political parties.

title: Books of The Times
description: To the architectural historian, the placement of buildings, their relationships, style, use and ornamentation are a language communicating something about the people who live and make a living in them. Carole Rifkind, who is on the faculty at the Columbia Graduate School of Architecture and Planning, has read the language of the main streets of American towns and cities, from the early days to the present. Like stoptime photography, her book intends to show us the changes over time in this generic American urban street and what these changes have meant in the urban history of this country.

title: People and Business
description: The president of the American Petroleum institute, Frank N. Ikard, says United States oil companies could face nationalization unless the industry changes the present climate of hostility and conflict with the Federal Government.

title: And Some of Them Even Give the Dates
description: If all you're looking for in a calendar is the basicsthe date of the day after tomorrow or Shrove Tuesday or a place to note the school reuniontoday's calendars may strike you as just too much. But they do display the publishers genius for appealing to almost any special interest. Here are some of the more outstanding offerings.

title: College Results
description: MEN'S BASKETBALL

title: WATERFRONT AGENCY CHECKING ON PAYOFF
description: Officials of the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor said yesterday they were scrutinizing more closely than in past years the applications from more than 100 stevedoring companies that handle cargo on New York and New Jersey piers, to determine whether illegal payments had been made to shipping companies or officials in the United States or foreign countries.

title: Latest Bids Fail to Save British Art
description: LONDON, Dec. 9The final funds necessary, to keep a pair of bucolic 18thcentury paintings in Britain failed to materialize last night, to the dismay of British artlovers, who live in a state of constant anxiety about the.national heritage.

title: Dollar Ends Mixed In Trading Abroad; Gold Shows Decline
description: The dollar posted a mixed performance in foreign exchange trading yesterday, gaining against most major currencies in trading abroad but slipping against most in New York trading.

title: Suspect in 71 Slaying Convicted
description: MEDIA, Pa., Dec. 9 (UPI)  Robert Nauss, a former Warlock motorcycle gang member, was convicted today of hanging a young Philadelphia woman, whose body has never been found. A Delawafe County Court jury deliberated about four hours over two days before finding Mr. Nauss, who is 25 years old, guilty of first degree murder in the 1971 slaying of Elizabeth Ann Land, 21. The conviction carries an automatic life sentence.

title: Answers to Weekly Quiz
description: Questions on Page 15.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Death row has been cleared of its last inmates in New York State because of recent court rulings, corrections officials announced.

title: African U.N. Group Agrees to an Inquiry On Rights in U ganda
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9The 49nation African group at the United Nations agreed tonight to join the five Nordic countries in formally asking the United Nations Human Rights Commission to investigate rights violations in 1Uganda.

title: Notes on People
description: An appeals court at Versailles, n sr Paris, has found Charles Aznavour guilty of tax fraud and ordered him to pay more than $2 million in back taxes and penalties. Yesterday's verdict against the singer and composer reversed the finding of a lower court in June that Mr. Aznavour had a valid argument when he said that he owed no taxes in France from 1972 to 1974 because he had established a legal residence in Switzerland. The ruling yesterday, which cannot be appealed, stated that the singer took up foreign residence with the Fole purpose of getting out from under French tax law.

title: Bowling
description: AT ALLEN PARK, MICH. $100,000 GRAND PRIX Mens Division lurk Roth, Staten island, 7,437 (six rounds); 2, Pete Couture, Windsor Locks, Conn., 7,243; 3, lay Robinson, Van Nuys, Calif., 7,734; 4, Marshall Holman, Medford, Ore., 7,140; 5, Tommy Hudson, Akron, Ohlo, 7,128; 6, Carmen Salvino, Chicano, 7,013; 7, Bill Spinner, Hamden, Conn., 6,969; 8, Dennis Lane, Kingsport, Tenn., 6,924; 9, Steve Westboro, Collage Grove, Ore., 6,843; 10, Dick Weber, St. Louis, 6,742.

title: NEW CASTLE IS UPSET BY RULING ON HOUSING
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y., Dec. 9Residents of the Town of New Castle today expressed anger and confusion at yesterday's Sate Supreme Court ruling overturning the town's ban on multifamily housing as unconstitutional and exclusio'nary. Those who seemed most threatened were recent arrivals, who came here to escape the problems they associated with multifamily housing.

title: Joanne Witty Is Wed to Eugene Keilin
description: The marriage of Joanne W itty, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Witty of Roslyn, L.I., to Eugene Keilin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Keilin of Houston, took place yesterday afternoon.

title: Personal Investing
description: An unusual form of openend mutual fund has been offered by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith. It is a 75 percent to 25 percent portfolio blend of discount bonds and equities. Page 33.

title: The New York Times
description: The stock market, buoyed by signs of a stabilizing dollar in foreignexchange markets, advanced broadly yesterday in slower trading.

title: The New York Times/Carlo R. Whitney
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8Abe Stolar was a  young idealist when he left his native Chicago 46 years ago to help build Communism in the Soviet Union. Today ho the edges of Soviet life, in an empty apartment he and his family gave up along with Soviet citizenship two years ago to emigrate to Israel.

title: Satra Wins TheaterTV Rights To Summer OlympicsFromNBC
description: Satra Corporation has won United States theatertelevision and videocassette rights to the 19S0 Summer Olympic Games in Moscow as part of a nep,Wiated settlement of Satra's two suits seeking $275 million each against. the National Broadcasting Company and the International Olympic Committee.

title: Radio
description: 6 A.M., WNYCAM. Missa MIMi. Ocheghem; SeculavMusic of the Renaissance. Weinhoppel.

title: 2 Dancers Go From Z to A On Ailey Bill
description: Sara Yarborough and Donna Wood are doomed to finish last in any alphabetical cast listings, but on stage they easily occupy the top line. Both dancers gave impressive backtoback performances Thursday evening at City Center's 55th Street Theater as Alvin Ailey's American Dance Theater presented Portrait of Billie and Cry.

title: The New York Times
description: BURLINGTON, Dec. 9History enthusiasts of this 300yearold city of 12,000 people on the Delaware River will gather tomorrow in the Guild House of the 1703 St. Mary's Episcopal Church to commemorate the 200th anniversary of New Jersey's first regularly published newspaper, The NewJersey Gazette.

title: Mets Trade Leaves Others Wondering
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 9The baseball trading market hurtled toward its deadline after a chaotic week here, but reverberations were still being felt from the blockbuster last night that involved 11 players, four teams and two leaeues.

title: Bridge
description: Most of the clubs in New York City and Long Island have staged grand national team championship preliminaries during the last 10 days.

title: Old College Try Puts Spirit in Harness Race
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Dec. 9The cheerleaders were almost trampled tonight as Nassau Community College held special harness race to revive school spirit.

title: An Italian National Accused in Deposit Of Stolen Checks
description: A 43yearold Italian national who describes himself as a tourist, but who owns a tailor shop in Brooklyn. has been arraigned on charges of depositing nearly $350,000 worth of stolen government checks into six bank accounts over the last 18 months.

title: SMITH MEETS 3 LEADERS OF LOCAL RHODESIA BLACKS
description: SALISBURY. Rhodesia. Dec. 9 (AP)Rhodesia's white minority Government and locally based black nationalist leaders agreed today that their negotiators should move as swiftly as possible toward a peaceful solution for the country's future.

title: Cutbacks by C.I.A.'s New Director Creating Turmoil Within Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Central Intelligence Agency, which is just beginning to recover from the trauma of having some of its more provocative covert actions disclosed, is now troubled internally over the decision of its new head, Admiral Stansfield Turner, to dismiss most of the top officers in the branch that carried out covert operations.

title: Horowitz Jubilee Concert
description: Tickets are no longer available for the Vladimir Horowitz Golden Jubilee Concert with the New Yark Philharmonic in Carnegie Hall on Jan. 8. The orchestra's subscribers and donors, as is traditional were given priority in orderine tickets.

title: CAREY STARTS FIXING HIS POLITICAL FENCES
description: Governor Carey used a Democratic state committee meeting yesterday to smooth ruffled feathers among his fellow Democrats and to try to unify the party behind his allbutannounced candidacy for reelection.

title: AvantGarde Designs For Men
description: At Bloomingdale's, the curtain is going up on the Off Off Broadway of men's clothinz.

title: Brown Reduces His Defense Staff,  But Many Get Jobs in New Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 9Defense Secretary Harold Brown, who promised to cut about onequarter of his staff members in an economy measure, has found employment for many of them. Mr. Brown has set up a new agency within the Pentagon.

title: SENATEHOUSE MEETING ON SOCIAL SECURITY: Senators Russell B. Long of Louisiana, left, and Daniel Patrick Moynihan of New York during SenateHouse
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A HouseSenate conference reached agreement today on a multibilliondollar increase in Social Security payroll taxes but was prevented from reporting a bill by an impasse over a college tuition tax credit opposed by the Carter Administration.

title: A Victim New York Took to Heart Is Now Held for Police in Vermont
description: Jerry Jenkins, the outoftown newlywed to whom New York City opened its heart after his car had been stolenand driven on a fatal rampageon his first night here last Monday, was arrested yesterday by New York City detectives on a charge of cashing more than $2,500 in had checks in Vermont stores.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Analyses of state budget expenditures for the past six months show that the Carey administration has been playing a game of political oneupmanship that is affecting the state's economy and the lives of thousands of the state's unemployed.

title: Associated Press
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9The board of trustees of the University of Chicago is expected to appoint Hanna Holborn Gray as the university's 10th president tomorrow.

title: Trudeau to Meet Provincial Leaders
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 9Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has called a meeting of the provincial premiers in Ottawa, tentatively set for Feb. 1315, to formulate a joint program with the federal Government to bolster the badly sagging Canadian economy.

title: News Summary
description: A meeting in Cairo will be held today between PresidentAnwar elSadat and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, who arrived there yesterday to prepare for the EgyptianIsraeli peace conference that starts Wednesday. Mr. Vance said that the United States wanted to do Oerything it could to support the peace overtures made by President Sbdat. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Judge May Defer Rebates for Tenants in New York
description: Landlords of 30,000 rentcontrolled apartments in New York City would not be required to give the tenants cityauthorized rent rebates on Jan. 1 under an order expected to he issued next week by a Supreme Court justice.

title: This Weekend, a Tibetan Bazaar
description: It Is not likely that the small number of Tibetan refugees who live in New York City will ever again see their country, known as The Land of Snows. But they hold on as best they can to the history and arts of Tibet through the Tibet Center at 114 East 28th Street, an organization founded a year ago by a former Buddhist monk and scholar, Khyongla Rato.

title: Up, Out of the Valley of the Shadow of Death
description: BOSTONWhen my father died many years ago I was in my mid20's and recovered rapidly from grief, even though I had strong affection for him. It has interested me to note that the four children of my oldest sister, who died of a rampant cancer recently, have shown a similar capacity to take death in stride.

title: Coal Operators Head, Once Mine Union Official
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 When 7or seph Patrick Brennan, the son and grandson of Irish coal miners and union men up in the anthracite, as northeastern Pennsylvania's depressed hard coal region is called in the United Mine Workers cf America, Man left the union and took job with the mine operain the tors in 1973, he says his News agerl mother warned him Saints preserve us, son, next you'll be leaving the church.

title: Among the Bureaucrats
description: As a lifelong New Yorker, I was easily taken prisoner by the Washington stereotypes. I found them eminently believable, especially those involving the legendary Federal Bureaucrat. With no trouble at all, envisioned legions of slothful bureaucrats bestirring themselves only to waste my hardearned money or, on infrequent and unavoidable occasions, to frustrate the public will.

title: Judge Drops Count Against Joan Little, Based on the Arrest
description: A Brooklyn Criminal Court judge yesterday dismissed charges of criminal mischief against Joan Little and her companion, George McRae, as well as a charge of assault against Mr. McRae after hearing the testimony of two police officers.

title: Stunning Lion Theater Builds on Kafka
description: On the deserted and unlikely premises of the former West Side Airlines Terminal, the Lion Theater Company has mounted an original and totally stunning set of theatrical variations upon Franz Kafka's The Trial.

title: World News Briefs
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, Dec. 9 (Reuters) The Government of Bermuda lifted the curfew today that it imposed on the island at the height of racial troubles here Friday. But it left in effect a state of emergency that allows the police to arrest people and search homes without warrants.

title: Mr. Koch Views the Arts
description: In a position paper and recent interview on the arts, Mayorelect Koch has shown that his heart Is in the right cultural place while his mind has acquired only limited grasp of the subject. His proposals range from the harmlessdisplay more art in public placesto the redundantcreate a New York City Council on the Arts. It would be a great mistake to set any of this in motion without a good deal more solid study.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 10yearold Pakistani girl with a damaged heart, who originally was denied a visa to enter the United States for surgery, was recovering normally from a threehour operation here in Bowns Mills. her doctor said.

title: GOLD FUTURES SLIDE AS DEMAND SLACKENS
description: Prices of preciousmetals futures continued to decline yesterday in the face of slackening demand.

title: 13 Added for Shrine Game
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 9 (UPI)The West Squad's roster for the EastWest Shrine football game was completed today with the addition of 13 players. The game is scheduled for Dec. 31 at Stanford Stadium.

title: Ellen Goldman, a palmist, tells the champion's fortune
description: A bell clanged. Here he is, ladies and gentlemen, The Greatest! said a ring announcer in a tuxedo, and, not surprisingly, Muhammad Ali climbed over the ropes.

title: Manila Court Backs Referendum
description: MANILA, Dec. (Reuters)The Supreme Court today rejected petitions seeking to prevent a Dec. 17 referendum in which President Ferdinand E. Marcos is seeking reendorsement of his presidency after five years of martial law,

title: EauityTheater Crucible Focuses On Failing Sense of Community
description: The salient feature of the new production of Arthur Miller's The Crucible, at the Equity Library Theater through Dec. 18, is that the play is not being done as an editorial for the morning paper or as a gloss on history. David William Kitchen, the director, has treated it as a stage vehicle, and although the play has a point of view, it does not overwhelm the audience with it. The Crucible in his hands does not become a parable for our times.

title: DEMOCRATS TO MEET IN REMPHIS IN 1978
description: WASHINGTON, Dec.9Lured by the promise of $150,000 in cash and services, the debtridden Democratic Party chose Memphis today as the site for its 1978 midterm miniconvention.

title: Leahy Urges Traders To Aid in Futures Law
description: Conceding that Congressmen generally knew little about commodity futures trading, Senator Patrick J. Leahy yesterday urged those in the business to aid in rewriting legislation covering the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, the Government's watchdog agency. We need your input, he said at a luncheon of the Futures Industry Association.

title: Gerulaitis Turns Back McEnroe at Forum, 7-6, 6-4
description: Vitas Gerulaitis had to struggle two hours before turning back 18yearold John McEnroe, 76, 64, in a benefit challenge tennis match for the Community Action for Legal Services last night in the Felt Forum.

title: News Summary
description: A meeting in Cairo will be held today between President Anwar elSadat and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, who arrived there yesterday to prepare for the EgyptianIsraeli peace conference that starts Wednesday. Mr. Vance said that the United States wanted to do everything it could to support the peace overtures made by President Sadat. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Donald Webster, Figure In Case Against Mandell, Kills Himself, Police Say
description: OCEAN CITY, Md., Dec. 10 (AP)Donald E. Webster, an accountant for the Pallottine Fathers and a key prosecution witness in the political corruption trial of former Gov. Marvin Mandel of Mary. land, committed suicide at his condominium. the oolice said today.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: THE subject this week is murder, and our featured literary perpetrator is P.D. James, whose latest mystery, Death of an Expert Witness, has been published by Scribner's. P.D. James. we can reveal, is the pseudonym of Phyllis Dorothy White, an Englishwoman. A recent meeting with Mrs. White produced the following portrait parle: Subject is in her late 50's, a grandmother of four (and one on the way), with coalblack hair and a manner that can range from maternally solicitous (when asking her interviewer about a recent cold) to earnestly intelligent (when talking of the craft of writing mysteries).

title: L.P.G.A. and P.G.A. Agree They Disagree
description: The Professional Golfer's Association voted last week to allow women into its apprentice program, a move that was reported to be in response to a request from the Ladies Professional Golf Association that the two grouns deveiop a closer working relationship. The action by the P.G.A. executive committee, said Donald E. Padgett, president of the P.G.A.. was a signifirant and progressive move that will benefit our association, the Ladies Professional Gold Association and the entire spectrum of golf.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor: I was astonished to read, in a favorable review (Nov. 6) by Gwen Davis of my book, Marlene: The Life of Marlene Dietrich, a statement by Marlene's daughter Maria Riva that my acquaintance with Miss Dietrich was largely restricted to some conversations at the Beverly Wilshire Hotel which concluded when I announced I would write a biography of her.

title: Manhattan Tops Columbia In Overtime as Grant Stars
description: Manhattan tallied 11 points in the first 2 minutes 57 seconds of the overtime period and defeated Columbia, 91SO. at the Lions Levien Gym last night Alton Byrd led a 146 Columbia burst at the end of regulation time that tied the contest at 7373, but the Jaspers Steve Grant scored 7 points in the overtime to clinch the game for Manhattan.

title: The Government Moves to Help Steel, But Prices Will Rise
description: The full weight of the Federal Government came down in support of a major American industry last week as the longawaited plan to protect the depressed steel industry was announced in Washington. The package is expected to raise the industry's earnings by $900 million a year, but there will almost certainly be higher prices for domestically produced steel and thus higher costs for consumers.

title: Topics
description: We have never seen an unidentified flying object and never hope to see one. That does not mean, however, we scoff at the growing number of Americans who inundate Government offices with reports of their sightings. We do not write of such experiences as optical illusions, perhaps inspired by blockbuster movies like Star Wars and Close Encounters of the Third Kind. And far be it from us to mock the United Nations for spending time on the subject at the insistence of Grenada, whose prime minister is U.F.O. buff of many years standing, or flying. Nor do we suggest that when the White House science adviser asks the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to investigate such phenomena, it is a case of passing the buck, or nonbuck. We certainly do not hold it against President Carter that, on a slow day as Governor of Georgia, he is supposed to have spotted a U.F.O. with his own eyes.

title: Closing of Maternity Wards Urged For 9 Hospitals in New York State
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 10Two major healthneed studies of a sevencounty region that includes Westchester County have recommended the closing of maternity wards at nine hospitals, a oneyear moratorium on hospital construction and other changes in health care.

title: Births
description: John E. and Gladys Miranda are happy to announce the birth of their first child, John Stefan, on Dec. 7, 1977.

title: Obituary 3 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Officials Minimize the Impact of a Strike by Farmers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10If the nationwide demonstrations culminating in strike by some farmers next Wednesday have any effect at all, Washington officials believe, it will be more political than economic.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THE tour buses do not, I believe, make the rounds of Kings Point, that northern tip of the Great Neck peninsula. That's too bad, because Kings Point is a most striking neighborhood for a visit. Like so many Long Island communities, it lies well off the main travel routes and is even a suburb of Great Neck. And presumably that's the way the residents like it; if they wanted to be in the eye of the world, they would have moved closer to the traffic.

title: William Hoyt Masters French Horn With Poise
description: Given the notorious intractability of the French horn, the main point to be made about William Hoyt's New York debut recital Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall is not that there were flubs and spluttersthere always arebut that he proved himself the master of his instrument rather than the other way around. One could listen comfortably to the music without worrying about the next wrong note.

title: Cleaver's Trial Set for Feb. 24
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 10 (UPI)The trial of Eldridge Cleaver, the former Black Panther, on charges of attempted murder and assault with a deadly weapon will start in Alameda County Superior Court Feb. 24. He appeared yesterday before Judge Alan A. Lindsey, who set the trial date: The charges stem from a 1968 gun battle with the Oakland police, in which Bobby Hutton, a Panther, was killed and ??? police officers wounded.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
description: THIS nation has gone through a number of cycles in its lovehate relationship with legal gambling. Periods of indulgence have been followed by almost total prohibition. We are in the middle of a prolific upswing following a period of relative quiescence. This recent period of repose makes it easy to overlook the prominent part that legalized gambling has played in the history of this nation.

title: Berger v. Brown et al.
description: A PRIME task of scholarship, Raoul Berger asserts, is to heighten public awareness that the Court is overleaping its bounds. With this mission, Mr. Berger has written a massive polemic against the Supreme Court's interpretation the 14th Amendment to the Constitution, condemning virtually every important decision since the Amendment was adorned shortly after the Civil War.

title: DESPAIRING YOUTHS TO GET HARLEM AID
description: Harlem Interfaith Counseling Services plans to turn nine landmark buildings in Harlem into a livein facility for troubled teenagers who cannot or do not wish to live at home with their families.

title: People Who Have Changed a Few Consumption Habits Are Living Longer
description: We seem to have turned the corner in the epidemic of heart disease, Dr. Robert I. Levy, director of the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute, said at the American Heart Association meeting two weeks ago. He cited some impressive statistics

title: POLITICS
description: WILLIAM F. HYLAND never wears out a welcome. The state's Attorney General announced that he will step down next month, when Governor Byrne begins his second term, a career decision typical of the man who has been balancing public and private roles for most of his 54 years.

title: 1 Robert Wallen Fiance Of Annamaria Yordan
description: Annamaria Yordan, who teaches Spanish and mathematics at the Loyola School, and Robert C. Wallen, who is in his first year at the Medical School of the Universided Autonoma de Guadelajara in Mexico, plan to be married.

title: Susan Halper Fiancee of Ethan LevinEpstein
description: Susan Clay Halper, a psychiatric social worker, and Ethan Adam LevinEpstein, an assistant United States attorney in the Eastern District of New York. elan to be married next spring.

title: A Design For Orderly Living
description: In 1967, when the Hampton~ landscape was mostly the province of shingled cottages. a 29year old architect named Charles Gwathmey completed residence for his parents in Amiga Amagansetl that was a composition of cubes and cylinders. with sharply slanted roofs and vertical wood siding. The light, geometric object was striking 10 years ago when there was nothing else like it and it cemains visually powerful today, when the beachfront dunes are overrun with its progeny.

title: Officials Snarled
description: HARTFORD THE suggestion in a study for the state's Commission on Special Revenue that organized criminal elements cannot be kept out of legalized gambling in Connecticut has drawn some understanding nods from commissioners, even from some of them who do not agree. I've often felt the same way, said Walter P. Stecko, one of the nine members of the Gaming Commission, as it is known. He retired in May 1976 as deputy commander of the state police, after having served 29 years on the force, and recalls the frustration, after long investigations, of having to settle for the arrests of runners, minor bookmakers and other minor criminals.

title: A Barn Where Art Grows
description: GREENWICH THERE are sparks in the basement, fluff in the loft and sand and mud down the hallway. Where you would least expect to find it, along the winding roads of the lush back country of Greenwich, is the area's distinctive nonprofit arts workshop and crafts centerthe Greenwich Art Barn.

title: Tree Farms Offer a Yuletide Harvest
description: Unless otherwise specified, all farms are now open seven days a week during daylight hours. Call ahead for directions, weather conditions and any lastminute alterations in hours or availability of trees. In addition to these major farms numerous smaller growers are scattered throughout the state. Some farms have an advance reservation (reserve and tag) service.

title: Giving Help To the Gifted
description: TWICE a week, Amy Decker leaves her fifthgrade class in ShorehamWading River elementary school a few mintues early to go to the district's high school, where, she says, I learn things and thenput them into the computer to see if I'm right.

title: THEATER
description: STAMFORD YOU may not associate Helen Keller with the Christmas season, but then again you may not associate love with Christmas. If you do, you owe it to yourself to get to Stamford and to the Hartman Theater Company's production of The Miracle Worker by William Gibson.

title: Part of Suit Over Power Lines From Canada Rejected
description: ALBANY, Dec. 10A State Supreme Court justice has dismissed part of a lawsuit brought by 45 upstate landowners to stop a $226 million ultrahigh voltage power lire under construction by the State Power Authority that will bring Canadian power into New York State.

title: Arson Suspected in Fiat Fire
description: TURIN, Italy, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Afire caused more than $2.3 million in damage at a Fiat car company warehouse here early today, and fire officials said it was almost certainly arson. It was the fifth case of suspected arson at Fiat this year. No one was injured.

title: VANCE GETS PLEDGE FROM SADAT TO BAR A SEPARATE PEACE
description: CAIRO, Dec. 10Secretary or state Cyrus R. Vance obtained President Anwar elSadat's pledge today that the Cairo conference opening next Wednesday to prepare a Middle East peace conference would be openended and would serve as a stepping stone toward an overall ArabIsraeli peace accord, not as a forum for achieving a separate EgyptianIsraeli agreement.

title: WOMEN IN SUPPORT UNITS BACKED AS ASSET TO ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)A yearlong study indicates that the Army can more than triple the number of women who support combat units and not lose its effectiveness, military sources said today.

title: Quality Handcrafts
description: BEDFORD HILLS IF the hurlyburly of holiday shopping is getting you down, it may be wise to take it easy by visiting Craftsmen Unlimited. Stepping into the cheerful yellow and white frame house with its rooms full of bright ornaments, wreaths, Christmas stockings, tabletop trees and frosted gingerbread houses would warm the heart of the mostardent Scrooge.

title: Author's Query
description: For A biography of Stonewall Jackson, I am interested in locating any personal letters, particularly relating to the Junkin family who I believe are somewhere in Pennsylvania.

title: In Summary Those Friendly Feds May Not Be Much Longer; Who Shall Run The Schools? Nonaggression Treaty on L.I. Keeping Apart Church, State Zone Defense In the Suburbs Is Breached Time to Pay Up For Polluting The Honeymoon Is Over Turning On Power Law
description: It has not been the best of times for those laboring on the Sisyphean task of keeping New York from the brink. Early last month Moody's Investor Service gave its lowest possible rating to $450 million worth of shortterm municipal notes, forcing the city to cancel the sale.

title: Christmas Wonderland, 1977
description: THE little boy tilts his head back so far that it is parallel to the floor. He makes this great effort to take in the very top of the great tree. A waiffaced, goldenrobed angel revolves at the pinnacle, while the electric candle she holds flickers Spasmodically.

title: Dong Suk Kang, Violinist, Stands Out for Elegance
description: Elegance was the hallmark of the'recital by Dong Suk Kang, a 23yearold South Korean violinist who made his New York debut in Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night. A student at the JuilHard School of Ivan ilaamian anu Sally Thomas, he has already won prizes in major international contests and made tours of Europe and the United States.

title: Flora And Fauna
description: A deprived urban child, I read whatever I could find about dogs, birds, beasts and the lilies of the field as if they were tales of evolutionary brilliance brought back from distant planets for me to admire but never to see. For the past few weeks I have been surrounded by hundreds of dollars worth of books displaying, in time for Christmas, all the wonders of nature. They range from marvelous to mediocre, and offer my subjective impressions here not as an amateur naturalist, but as one perennially addicted to the category.

title: MARKETS
description: The Dow Jones industrial average spent part of last week veering downward toward the 800 level that marked its lowest close of 1977 before rallying smartly on Friday. The final session produced a gain of points, the best advance in four weeks.

title: Turkish Leftists Escape Jail
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Nine leftwing activists escaped from jail today in a breakout involving gun battles inside and outside the prison walls, the police reported. Three security men were wounded, two in a gun battle with the escaping prisoners Inside the walls and one outside with accomplices, according to the police.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: DETROITA. Alfred Taubman is a sleekly dressed, barrelchested real estate, wheelerdealer who operates from a small office in Southfield, Mich. His work place is filled with modern artdrawings, prints, small sculptures. But the most impressive object or all is a facsimile check for $337 million on the Wells Fargo Bank. For Mr. Taubman, a 53yearold shopping center developer, was the victor in the notorious battle for Irvine Ranch in Orange County, California, the most foughtover piece of Western real estate since the Little. Big Horn and one of the richest pieces of underdeveloped landscape in the nation. The loser: Mobil Oil.

title: The Other Solzhenitsyn
description: IT is now 10 years since the Soviet Writers Union condemned Aleksandr SolzhenItsyn's monumental novel, Cancer Ward, for its gloomy and pathological naturalism in portraying one of the greatest causes of depression in our time. Although Cancer Ward is about policy and politics in the Stalinist era, it is primarily about cancer, not symbols. It is about archipelagoes that metastasize close to home and about the various attempts we make navigate. No one following the controversy over Laetrile should fail to read this book.

title: Births.
description: Fred and Shelly Lucky (nee Brodsky) with much pride and icy are thrilled to welcome to the world their son, David Adam, born 7 lbs. 9 ozs., on Dec. 6, 1977 at the Mt. Sinai Hospital in Los Angeles.

title: RESEARCH FINDS GAP IN BLACKS TRAINING
description: Efforts to Alleviate U.S. Shortage of Black Doctors Should Begin in 10th Grade, Report Says.

title: INTERVIEW
description: I'M born under the sign of Leo, Madeleine Mono said, and that explains everything. Leo people, the petite Englishborn former actress explained, are noted for being generous, extremely ambitious, at times domineering, gracious peoplepeople that set trends that other people follow.

title: In Defense of Trenton State Prison
description: WITH the recent announcement of the Department of Corrections construction plans, the fate of Trenton State Prison has once again become the subject of controversy.

title: Women in Prison Find an Escape
description: BEDFORD HILLS A LL RIGHT, I need three volunteers. Good. Now, Alice and Shirley, you each pick a topic to talk about. Jean, you have to listen to both and respond to what they're saying. You know, eye contact, body language, everything you normally do in a conversation except both of them are going to be talking at once. Ready? Someone give them a count.

title: Hearing Set for Nazi Leader
description: ST. LOUIC Dec.9 (UPI)Frank Collin, national director of the American Nazi Party, has been ordered to appear for a preliminary hearing Jan. 26 on a charge of assaulting the police chief of suburban FlnriAsant. Mr. Collin, 32 years old, was not dressed in a Nazi uniform in his brief appearance yesterday in the courtroom of a St. Louis County Magistrate, H. Lloyd Kelley. He is accused of striking Police Chief Robert Truetken in a brawl between Nazi and antiNazi demonstrators Oct. Siin Florissant.

title: A Favorable Situation For a Queen Sacrifice
description: The most difficult part of making a positional queen sacrifice lies in foretelling how much activity the opponent's queen will develop.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: R OSSI TERHelen Kaufman. Born in Allegheny, Pa.11385, died in Palo Alto, Calif. November 29th. She is survived by a son, Jonathan, 2111 Edgewood Road, Redwood City, Calif. and 4 grandchildren, Christopher, David, Joan and Amy. No service or flowers please, Contributions to the charity or service of your choice.

title: In Meyersville, an Indoor Tennis Layout
description: MEYERSVILLE IN recent years, winter tennis centers, which in many cases offer far more than indoor tennis, have sprung up all over New Jersey. The trend has been toward building the body beautiful, beckoning those with time and money with a wide variety of luxurious health and beauty treatments.

title: Homes for Retarded Get a New Approach
description: SCARSDALE S CARSDALEis the testing ground for a littleknown, but significant, shift in New York State's approach to finding sites for group homes for the mentally retarded, a move prompted by a Federal court order a year and a half ago to remove the retarded from large institutions and place them in small, communitybased residences.

title: BigMoney Basketball: Something Must Give
description: ARTHUR M. WIRTZ, director, Chicago BullsI would say only four clubs in the National Basketball Association are showing any profit. The salaries for the players are more than the gate receipts. Club salaries run somewhere around $2 million plus another $2 million for travel expenses, office staff and other things.

title: ExPrisoners From Mexico Say They Are Nixon Victims
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec, 10Americans who had been imprisoned in Mexico and who return.ed to the United States yesterday portrayed themselves today as victims of a drug crackdown by an overzealous Nixon Administration that they said deprived them of basic human rights while they were used as statistics to increase the budget of the Drug Enforcement Administration.

title: It's Carter Folk vs. Regular Democrats
description: WASHINGTONBarely three hours after the White House unexpectedly announced last week that Kenneth M. Curtis would step down soon as Democratic national chairman, the former Governor Maine arrived at an office in Washington for a scheduled meeting on party business. The door was locked, and a handwritten sign read: The meeting with Governor Curtis has been canceled and will not be rescheduled.

title: OUTLOOK IS GLOOMY ON WELFARE CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Key members of Congress and Administration strategists now believe that there is almost no chance of reaching President Carter's goal of enacting a comprehensive bill to overhaul the welfare system next year.

title: Russians Confine 20 on Rights Day
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10The Soviet Union, on United Nations Human Rights Day, placed more than 20 dissidents under house arrest today, cutting off some of their telephones and officially threatening to have drunken hooligans break up a silent demonstration in Pushkin Square.

title: The State's Official Crystal Ball
description: SHORTLY before the Connecticut General Assembly adjourns in June, it will receive a manu script prepared by more than 100 scientists and engineers indicating the paths they think the state should follow in nine critical areas.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARECIBO (PRMMI). Son Juan Dec. 15; soils from, Pt. Elizabeth, New Jersey.

title: Watch the Linebackers In GiantEagle Battle
description: If it were not that two of the best middle linebackers In pro football were playing, today's GiantEagle game in Phildelphia might be as thrilling as Sunday in Philade.Inhia.

title: West Germany Has an Answer For Idle Youths
description: ESSEN, West GermanyHorst Schroer dropped out of school at age 15 after finishing only the eighth grade. In most West European countries he would no doubt have joined the lengthening rolls of unemployed youthone of the continent's most pressing economic and political problems. But Horst. now 17. is haltway through an apprenticesnip program at the giant Krupp concern here that will virtually guarantee him a job as a skilled lathe operator.

title: Mary Jane Reagan Pride Of William James Garvey
description: St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Garden City, L. I., was the setting at noon yesterday for the marriage of Mary Jane Beagan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter J. Beagan or claraen City, to William James Garvey, son of Mr. and Mrs. William J. Garvey of Clarks Green, Pa. The bridegroom's uncle, the Rev. Thomas McCann, performed the ceremony.

title: A.F.LC.I.0. UNVEILS ITS TRADE PROPOSALS
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 10The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organization proposed today a broad program to protect the jobs of American workers from what it termed unfair competition from foreign imports.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: THE way Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein tells it, the Administration's current method of planning urban and regional policy is like getting ready for a shot to the moon without any aerospace engineers.

title: A Printing Executive, 73, Criticizes New York's Tax Regulations
description: A 73yearold printing executive who began his New York business career as an errand boy sent out invitations to witness the unfolding of a horror story at his taxappeal hearing held recently before the State Tax Anneals Bureau.

title: Letters
description: Harold Schmeck, in his Nov. 30 news article on pain relief for dying patients, emphasizes the growing belief that even addictive drugs are appropriate for relieving pain in the terminally ill.

title: Japan's Trade Policy Is SelfProtective
description: TOKYORichard Cooper, the United States Undersecretary of State for Economic Affairs, came to Japan to try to convince Japanese leaders to open their country more to foreign traders,,.At Cooper news conference on the two nations', growing trade troubles, a reporter expounded on one Japanese position, and then asked critically what the United States was doing to match that particular effort.

title: F.D.A. Proposes Warning Posters At Stores Selling Saccharin Items
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UN)Under a proposed Food and Drug Administration rule, grocery stores selling products containing saccharin would have to post warning signs near their entrances and at each aisle where foods containing the artificial sweetener are sold.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Charles Dickens's Christmas Carol with Bob Cratchit, Tiny Tim and Old Scrooge (in his skinflint and enlightened phases) is always in evidence at this time of year. Dickens wrote the Carol in 1893 and henceforth one of the things to which people looked forward at Yuletide was the publication of a new Dickens Christmas story. He also enjoyed amateur theatricals and each year he would take part in Christmas plays with his children and their friends.

title: Beverly Magill Is Married
description: Beverly Williamson Magill, widow of Winfield Arthur Magill. was married yesterday to William Lloyd Musser, in St. Philip's Chapel in Solebury, Pa., by the Rev. Charles Hanna, a Presbyterian minister. The bride is a daughter of Mrs. Wilbur Studley Forrest of New Hope, Pa., and the late Frederick Beasley Williamson Jr., who was president of Goodall Rubber Company in Trenton. Mr. Musser, a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. I. V. Musser of Mifflinburg, Pa., is retired vice president of McCurry, Dingwall Associates Inc. in New York. His first wife died.

title: Adolph Rupp, Basketball Coach Who Won 879 Games, Is Dead at
description: Adolph Frederick Rupp, the most successful coach in the history of college basketball during 42 years at the University of Kentucky, died last night in the University Medical Center at Lexington. He was 76 years old.

title: Germany as Locomotive
description: FRANKFURT  By any measure, West Germany is the powerhouse of Europe, the locomotive that by dint of economic might pulls its neighboring Common Market countries along in its train. But today those neighbors are deep in an economic slump, in company with most of the industrial nations of the world.

title: The Puritans: Teachers for Today
description: STUDENTS today are especially interested in the meaning of American history and literature for their own lives. Our national and international situationsthe shortage of natural resourses, unemployment, combined with the consumer mentality that has become a part of the American lifesuggests a bleakness to some. It is pondered, even among scholars, whether the story of a people in a land of plenty may, in fact, be a dangerous burdenan irrelevance.

title: GARDENING
description: THE Christmas cactus is a popular seasonal plant found each year in seemingly greater.numbers and variety in florist shops and garden centers. No matter what the size of the plants, it seems they are always covered with buds or flowers. Yet, once they are in the home, it is almost a prestigious achievement to have the same plants flower consistently year after year. Even dedicated houseplant growers ask, Where did I go wrong? The culprit is central heating and the uniformly warm temperatures maintained both day and night in most homes. In its native habitat in Brazil, the Christmas cactus grows at an altitude of 2,000 to 9,000 feet where the night temperatures drop into the 50's in the fall. It is in response to this temperature drop that flower buds are formed.

title: A People's Experience
description: THE choice of rhetoric is a central problem for the historian of slavery in America. In what tone, with what, language, should he depict the South's peculiar institution? If he portrays life under slavery as an unending sequence of horrors and brutalities, his tone becomes so shrill that he loses credibility. If he gives too much emphasis to the sunshine amidst the shadows, he sounds like a proslavery aooloRist.

title: U.S. Is Getting Billions in Loans InterestFree on Withheld Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)Taxpayers are lending the Government billions of dollars without interest because more money is being withheld from their paychecks than they will owe in income taxes at the end of the year, the General Accountine Office says.

title: Cindy Caley Plans May Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Wallace B. Caley of Wilmington, Del.. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Cindy Lynn Caley, to R. Michael Everett, son of Wendy Hackett Everett of Provincetown, Mass., and Richard W. Everett of New York. Mr. Everett and his fiance plan to be married next May.

title: Susan B. Schiffer Is Married
description: Susan Berwind Schiffer, director of communications for the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission, was married last evening to Aubrey Theodore Stautberg Jr., who is with Butcher & Singer, an investment banking concern in Philadelphia.

title: Talk With Selma Fraiberg
description: SELMA FRAIBERG is a 59yearold child psychoanalyst who is a professor of child psychoanalysis in the department of psychiatry of the University of Michigan Medical School. She's grayhaired, of medium height, a rather lively, energetic person. She speaks softly, but confidentlyand with no trace or psycniatric jargon. Her one child, a daughter, is now in college. Her husband teaches American literature at the University of Toledo. Mrs. Fraiberg is still active as a clinician. She is also the director of a Child Development Project aimed at working with young children of Washtenaw County, Mich. who have run into emotional problems for one reason or another. She is best known for her book The Magic Years, published in 1959, when she lived in New Orleans and taught at Tulane Medical School. It is a book still very much of use to countless parents and students who want to understand the early years of childhooda time when little boys or girls are ever willing to merge fantasy with fact, ever inclined to animistic interpretations of natural phenomena.

title: Wine
description: quent ly outside the lint ish proscription. It became sown, thing of a patriotic duty to drink madeira in Me colonies in the years leading tip to the Revolution.

title: Long Beach, L.I., Makes Pitch for Casino Gambling Before State Senate Committee
description: LONG BEACH, L.I.With the conclusion of the fifth, and possibly last, public hearing by a State Senate Committee here, this South Shore waterfront city's campaign to turn itself into the mecca of East Coast casino gambling has entered c. new phase.

title: Nancy Maretz Sets Wedding to Student
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Fred R. Maretz of New Haven of the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Esther Maretz, to Robert Jules Schwarzberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bolek Schwarzberg of Fresh Meadows, Queens. The wedding . planned for June.

title: Government Wins By Large Margin In AustralianVote
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Sunday, Dec. 11 Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser and his Liberal Party won a surprisingly largescale victory in yesterday's Australian election. Incomplete returns this morning gave the Liberals, actually a conservative party, the likelihood of maintaining a better than twothirds majority in the 124member House of Representatives.

title: Private Hospitals Say That City Snatches Away Their Patients
description: Officials of private voluntary hospitals in New York City have accused the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation of subverting its program to unify ambulance services in an effort to snatch patients away from them and use them to fill empty municipal hospital beds.

title: SCHOOL CHANCELLOR OUTLINES PROBLEMS
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker has told Mayorelect Edward I. Koch that the New York City public school system faces series of critical issues in the next four years, including an increase in racial imbalance that may defy correction, a decline in student enrollment and student performance, and continued violence and vandalism in school buildings.

title: The Arab Body Politic
description: This Is a unique moment In the history of the conflict, a historical moment. So I am not going to lose It. And It need be, I be going [alone] to Geneva with the Israelis. We shall discuss a comprehensive settlement. And then I shall call an Arab mit to submit this comprehensive settlement [to] them to decide upon it. And everyone will decide for himself. (President Anwar elSadat, quoted in Newsweek.)

title: DINING OUT
description: IT is easy to understand the magnetism of Millie's Place in Great Neck. Millie's is a new place and visually one of the most beautiful restaurants on the Island. Small, dark wooden tables are set against one long wall of rosy brick, hung with interesting kilims and wood carvings. Opposite, more tables are placed along a divider surmounted by a handsome, polished brass rail. A sweep of warm, satiny wood defines the bar.

title: MAILBAG
description: To the Editor: It is sad that a fine play by one of today's best playwrights was damned with faint praise by the press and consequently had to close down after a few performances. Arnold Wesker's bold concept of The Merchant was a thoughtprovoking attempt to expand on Shakespeare's most controversial comedy. Are we, then, except for the usual diet of musicals, to subsist almost exclusively on plays by contemporary writers whose only virtue is a keen ear for colloquial speech, but whose twodimensional effusions show nary a trace of poetry or vision?

title: AN SST LANDS AT KENNEDY WITH AN ENGINE SHUTDOWN
description: An Air France supersonic Concorde was forced to land on a priority basis at Kennedy Airport yesterday after mechanical problems resulted in a shutdown of one of its four engines.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: It wasn't big newt The Park Service police in Washington halted a car gain; at an unreasonable speed with its lights off at 2 A.M. on Oct. 7, 1974. Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Dentcrat tf Arkansas, was identified as one of the five occupants. A woman, identified as Annabelle Battistella, ran from the car and jumped into the Tidal Basin.

title: Braila
description: LAMKAYWilliam, beloved husband e the late Nettye, devoted father of Allan, dear brother of Pauline, cherished grandfather. Services Tuesday, December 13, 12:15 PM, The Riverside, 76 St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: A Yuletide Project For the Retarded
description: WEST LONG BRANCH IN keeping with the true spirit of the holiday season, two organizations for the mentally impaired and a department store chain are working to bring smiling paper angels into many New Jersey homes.

title: Califano Assails G.O.P. Senator on Tax Credit Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Joseph A. Califano Jr., strongly denounced Republican Senator today for refusing to withdraw an amendment to a bill raising Social Security taxes that would give $250 income tax credit to the parent of a college student.

title: Author's Query
description: I am writing a biography of my colleague and friend, the late Leopold Stokowski, for Hawthorn Books. I would be deeply grateful to all those who have letters, docuMents, any and all memorabilia which they would allow me to use and would be pleased to see included in this book. I would also welcome typewritten accounts of personal events of special interest.

title: ARKANSAS TOWN GETS HEALTH CARE PROJECT
description: PARIS, Ark., Dec. 10The 3,700 residents of this rural western Arkansas community may soon enjoy highquality hospital care that is among the most costefficient in the nation.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Whatever else fashion photography may be, it is entertaining. And entertaining is one word to describe the 150 photographs in the exhibition The History of Fashion Photography, on view at the Brooklyn Museum, Eastern Parkway, through Jan. 8, 1978. All those crazy ladies in crazy clothes, preening at poolsides, cavorting with elephants, or swanning around on the wilder shores of love, make up a very special kind of dream world that was (we all know) originally devised to sell clothes, but continues to charm and delight long after the clothes it sold have gone to the thrift shop.

title: THOUSANDS OF REGULATORS FOR SCUBAS ARE RECALLED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Consumer Product Safety Commission announced yesterday the recall of tens of thousands of scuba regulators sold around the country because they might fail and cut off air to divers.

title: Durham Deplores Flight of a Black Family After Harassment
description: DURHAM, N. C., Dec. 10State officials and community leaders are voicing dismay and disappointment over the decision of a black couple, harassed by night riders in the predominantly white neighborhood into which they had moved, to leave North Carolina.

title: What About the Water? Homebuyers Should Ask
description: Where there's a well, there's usuallythough not alwaysa way of getting water into your home if you are building in an area without municipal services.

title: Bear Mountain Fete Will Begin Friday
description: THE eighth annual Bear Mountain Christmas Festival at the Bear Mountain Inn, with winter scenes of confectionary delights and yards of holiday cookies, seems guaranteed to assure visions of sugarplums from this Friday through New Year's Day.

title: Man Convicted in Marijuana Case
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 10 (AP)A Michigan man charged in connection with the biggest marijuana seizure in Maine histcry was found guilty yesterday of possessing and importing 3.000 pounds of the contraband from Colombia. Judge Edward T. Gignoux of Federal District Court postponed sentencing of Jackie D. Milirr. 25 years old. The marijuana had been seized last May at Mr. Miller's renuu cottage at Mill Isle in Arrowsic.

title: Islanders Inflict 74 Setback on Red. Wings
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Dec. 10The last time the Islanders played the Detroit Red Wings, the Islanders won, 41, in a fierce, tightchecking contest. Tonight the same teams met. Add three goals to each club's total, change.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The New Jersey Nets have 8:05 home games in Rutgers gym Piscataway Wednesday night against the Golden State Warriors and Friday night against Walt Frazier and the Cleveland Cavaliers. The only Knicks home game will be Saturday night against the Chicago Bulls at 8 o'clock in Madison Square Garden.

title: Realty News
description: The Nestle Company, a chocolate and coffee concern, has leased more than 82,000 square feet of office space in Westchester One, the 865,000 square foot building on North Broadway in White Plains N.Y.

title: Knox, Sbarra Sparkle In L.I. AllStar Contest
description: BETHPAGE, LI., Dec. 10A team of senior allstars from Nassau County school football conferences 2, 3 and 5 defeated a team from conferences 1,4 and 6 156, today at Bethpage High School. The winning squad was called the Blue team and the losers were the Gold.

title: Letters: Will Tax Changes Raise Hotel Rates?
description: To the Editor: John Brannon Albright tells what really is going on when he reports the hotel industry's contention that pleasure travelers would pay higher hotel and restaurant charges under President Carter's proposal for reducing expenseaccount deductions (Travel Notes, Nov. 20). The public ultimately pays all expense accounts, advertising and milliondollar contracts for entertainers and athletes, which is all considered in the cost of doing business.

title: Notes: Williamsburg, In a Pinch, Seeks Aid
description: As the wreaths, garlands and candles are placed in position in readiness for the Christmas season at Colonial Williamsburg in Virginia, its officials are pointing out that the historic complex gives away more gifts than it receives. They say that the 80acre town of restored homes, exhibition buildings, stores and gardens is in strong need of some yearround charity from Americans to make it financially sound. The reason: income from the more than million visitors a year falls far short of operating expenses. Last year's operating deficit rose above $4 million.

title: Christmas Liquor to Move
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10 (UPI)Seven hundred thousand cartons of liquor and wine in a State Liquor Control Board warehouse were assured of Christmas delivery after employees who handle the merchandise had ratified a new contract today. Teamsters Local 158, representing 100 employees, approved a new threeyear contract with the Holt Hauling and Warehouse Company by a vote of 50 to 14.

title: Saudi Arabia's King Issues Plea For Arab States to Close Ranks
description: RIYADH, Saudi. Arabia, Dec. 10King Khalid of Saudi Arabia, concerned that a rift among the Arabs was getting out of control, issued a strong plea for unity after talks yesterday between Saudi leaders and President Hafez alAssad of Syria.

title: LETTER FROM STONY BROOK
description: IN an office where the bookshelves house volumes of intimidating complexity, where the blackboard is covered with diagrams and scientific formulas of almost indecipherable meaning, and where even the decorative art is geometric, precise and highly structured, Max Dresden, physics professor, sits facing a watercolor painting given to him by graduate studentby far the mostcolorful and least scientific item in his office. But then, it is a portrait of Albert Einstein.

title: GARDENING
description: MANY kinds of ceropegias (seroPEEJeuh) grow wild in tropical and South Africa, India and the Catr y Islands. Available species are curiciti; succulents that make interesting altcteasytocarefoihouse plants.

title: Celebrating the Holidays Close to Home
description: LAST January's tarnished tinsel, broken toys and unwanted neckties, the last departing relative and the bills stacked inches high are a dim blur as children of all ages brighten in anticipation of another Christmas season.

title: Private Interest and Public Rights
description: THE passage in 1975 of Connecticut's Freedom of Information Act was hailed as a major step forward in the struggle to insure good government. The conventional wisdom held that the more open all government activities were to public scrutiny the less opportunity for backroom dealings and therefore the greater the advantage to the average citizen and the public interest.

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER
description: SHRUB OAK THIS is about speculation, the polite, Saturdaymorningovercoffee kind of speculation about adjustments, about lost opportunities and old decisions, and about career that might have been.

title: Inquiry Continuing Into 2 Campaigns Involving DelBello
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 10Federal authorities continued this week to seek financial records on file for the two election campaigns of Westchester's County Executive, Alfred B. DelBello, amid a continuing mystery about the investigation.

title: ART VIEW
description: There is an unmistakable aura of romance attached to the idea of creative collaboration in the arts, especially when artists are induced to leave their studios to work in the theater. There is a heightened air of expectation in the very notion of painter or sculptor we particularly admire designing the production of a ballet, an opera or a play. The reasons for this special feeling are not mysterious, I think. For eyes regularly nourished on the finest achievements in modern art, the common run of stage design tends to be a bore where it is not simply an affront. We automatically discount it as creative factor in much of what we go to see. In this realm we are usually grateful for small mercies, having learned through long experience to tolerate on stage a vocabulary moribund pictorial conventions and dismal visual clichs we would not stand for,and, in truth, would not very often asked to stand forin a museum or gallery. The promise something better, perhaps even something wonderful, something that can actually be admired and exulted in rather than forgiven and forgotten, is inevitably a cause of excitement.

title: Photographs: A Retrospective
description: PRINCETON PRINCETON UNIVERSITY'S Art Museum is the Showcase for the first major retrospective of the works of Francis 13ruguiere, and it is a display that anyone interested in photography cannot afford to Miss.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Shopping Mall Becomes Shelter
description: PANAMA CITY, Fla., Dec. 9 (UPI)A shopping mall was turned into an emergency shelter today for residents of 2,000 homes left without heat when a work crew accidentally shut off the city's natural gas supply. The National Weather Service forecast temperatures to plunge into the low 20's during the night.

title: Carter Signs Proclamation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)President Carter has signed an annual proclamation designating Bill of Rights Day, Human Rights Day and Human Rights Week. Today was proclaimed Human Rights Day and will mark the beginning of Human Rights Week. Bill of Rights Day will be observed next Thursday.

title: Capital Spending Looks Unpromising
description: Business spending for plant and equipment both this year and over the next six months will apparently be lower than the Administration had hoped, according to figures issued by the Commerce Department last week.

title: Garden
description: If a live evergreen will be trimmed for the indoor Christmas tree this year, select the planting site now, prepare the hole, cover it with boards and put a tarp over the mound of excavated soil to prevent freezing.

title: STAMPS
description: The same year, 1840, that Edward Stanley Gibbons was born, Sir Rowland Hill succeeded in his campaign to reform the British postal system, and the world's first adhesive postage stamp, the Penny Black, was issued by Great Britain. The two events are intertwined, for Stanley Gibbons has played a giant role in the philatelic world that the Penny Black revolutionized.

title: JeanMarie Hutcheon Wed To Capt. James A. Daleo
description: JeanMarie Hutcheon and Capt. James Anthony Daleo of the Army Medical Corps were married yesterday in St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Harrington Park, N. J., by the Rev. Paul C. Deckenbach.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: The losing battle with regard to flood control in Northern New Jersey dates back to 1870, when the State Legislature first admitted there was a flood problem in the Passaic River Basin. Since that time, many studies have been undertaken that superficially recommend solutions to flood control.

title: CRIME
description: The clergy as detectives. We have had priestinvestigators ever since G.K. Chesterton's Father Brown, who was the progenitor and by far the best of the species. Chesterton was interested in ideas, and used Father Brown as his instrument to incorporate issues that far transcended the mere detective story. tits successors tor me most part have not done nearly so well. They tend to get bogged down in doctrine; they have no real ideas for the most part; nor does their writing have the gleam of Chesterton's prose.

title: BUDGET GROUP WARNS OF DEEPENING CRISIS FACING NEW YORK CITY
description: The Citizens Budget Commission, which warned of New York City's fiscal crisis years before it occurred, predicted yesterday that the worst was yet to come on the road back to solvency and that in no case could the city avoid bankruptcy without substantial Federal help.

title: Mindy Shangold Fiancee Of Richard Craig Gordon
description: The engagement of Mindy Joy Shangold to Richard Craig Gordon has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. David Feld of East Meadow, L.I., the prospective bride's stepfather and mother. Miss Shangold also is a daughter of the late Alvin H. Shangold, a civil engineer, who was with the E. Lionel Pavlo Engineering Company of New York.

title: Miss McPhee Is Betrothed To John Taft
description: The engagement of Martha Ann McPhee to John Godfrey Taft has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. William Robert McPhee of Kansas City, Mo., parents or tne ruture brule. Her Hance is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Horace Dwight Taft of New Haven, a grandson of the late Senator Robert A. Taft of Ohio and a greatgrandson of President Wiliam Howard Taft.

title: City's Crisis Makes Road Even Rougher
description: The scorching summer months arrive. A young mother, recently widowed, must find work to support her family. The summer offers her the chance to look for a job while her chilren enjoy the relief of fresh air and fun at camp.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on conference report for legal services corporation amendments of 1977, passed, 236 to 110, Dec. 7.

title: Paul, in 2 Hats, Emerges as Symbol of Baseball's Hectic Hour
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 10  Baseball's traveling circus headed back to the mainland today, leaving all kinds of strange footprints on the sands of Waikiki Beach after a week of chaotic trades and high, hard finance.

title: Economics vs. the Environment
description: Nobody can keep paying taxes like that forever,WHEN the phones start to ring at the State Department of Environmental Conservation headquarters in Albany some Friday afternoon, people there know that there is probably trouble somewhere, and if it's trouble it's probably on Lone Island.

title: Millville'Holly Capital of East
description: MILLVILLE T HE Christmas carol admonition to deck the halls with boughs of holly may prove to be easier sung than done this Yuletide season.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Der. 10 (AP)Model trains, still popular Christmas toys, are also going to school to help teach reading, writing, arithmetic, geography,: city planning and science.

title: Susan T. Hill, James E. Cole Are Engaged
description: The engagement of Susan Tomilson Hill to James E. Cole, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur R. Cole of Clovis, N.M., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. James T. Hill Jr. of New York and Cotuit, Mass.

title: Crafts for the Season
description: NEW HAVEN ONE effect of steadily increasing prices has been the conversion of indifferent shoppers into serious ones. The available selection of attractive merchandise at a price one can easily afford seems to have dwindled.

title: Patricia Green Betrothed
description: The engagement of Patricia Ellen Green to Stephen W. Dunn has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Milton Green of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and Palm Beach, Fla., parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Dunn of Lexington, Mass.

title: Archivists Add Africa Branch
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Dec. 10 (Agence FrancePresse)A West African regional branch of the International Council of Archives has been set up here, with Senegal's director of national archives as its chairman. It is the council's seventh branch.

title: Author's Query
description: For a book of letters of Don Marquis (18781937), I would be grateful to hear from anyone with knowledge of the location of such letters

title: News Summary
description: Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, who arrived in Israel after meeting in Cairo with President Anwar elSadat to prepare for the conference with Israel there this week, said there was a lot of work to be done before going on to what he called the ultimate meeting in Geneva. He said that it was agreed in Cairo that when the conference starts Wednesday it would have a flexible agenda, no fixed timetable and that the seats for the Arab leaders who are boycotting the conference would remain open if they wished to reconsider. It was also agreed that the talks could be raised to the level of foreign ministers. [Page 1, Column 6.]
