title: 1710 Victory Gives Cincinnati Edge for Playoffs
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 10The Cincinnati Bengals added to the complexities of the National Football League's postseason playoff prospects today by upsetting the Pittsburgh Steelers, 1710, on a cold, cold afternoon that saw the Steelers lose four fumbles, including two by Franco Harris on the Bengal 28and 18yard lines.

title: FILM VIEW
description: Of all the national film movements that.have surfaced in Europe since the end of World War II, none has exhibited the consistent ferocity.of the halfdozen young German directors whose work now more or less definesfor us on this side the Atlanticthe longawaited renaissance the German film, It's a very different kind of renaissance from any others we've seen In movies. For one thing, none of the young Germans has made much of a dent at theater box offices at home or abroad. It's not simply that they don't feed on popular support; they seem to go out of their way to spurn it, as if such success would be a sign of artistic failure or moral weakness. Though these directorsRainer Werner Fassbinder, Werner Herzog, Willi Wanders, Volker Schlondorff, among othershave as their only easily defined common denominator the humanist's outrage with the qua! Ity of life in West Germany today, their revolutionary zeal tends to make their work elitist, either incomprehensible mass movie audiences or too harsh and rigorous for people who 31.111 consider films as a means of escape. Perhaps in other country today is there such a gulf between the artist and his public.

title: Pictures at an Exhibit
description: Look at that one, said a woman whose evening gown amused itself by sweeping cigarette butts along the floor. Isn't he divine? What sport does he play?

title: Christian Teal Impresses In Violin Recital
description: Sometimes a grand technique isn't necessary for an enjoyable an intelligent performanceparticularly if the artist and the concert setting don't arouse grandiose expectations. Last Sunday evening at Carnegie Recital Hall, Christian Teal, a faculty member of the Blair School of Music in Nashville and first violinist of its resident Blair Quartet, made his New York debut, accompanied most persuasively by another Blair faculty member, Enid Katahn.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: Howard Fast is dealing in dynasties these days. First, there's The Iminigrants, which he estimates is his 56th book. It describes the rise and fall of Daniel Layette, a visionary Italian fishermantycoon with a promising set of offspring, and, sure enough, there's more to come. The promise will soon be fulfilled in The Second Generation, a sequel to The Immigrants, which in turn will spawn an as yet untitled third volume that brings the Layette family from the turn of the century up to the present.

title: DINING OUT
description: TUCKED away in a corner of Cliftonspecifically, just off Main Avenue where that thoroughfare is cut through by Route 46is the tiny Bel'Vedere restaurant. It has occupied little shingled house there for just over a year, or ever since Anthony Grande decided that he would rather cook on land than in the galleys of the Home Lines cruise ships. And we must count ourselves fortunate that he decided to become a landlubber.

title: Out of the House And Into the Kitchen
description: WESTPORT MALVINA KINARD believes women should work. She didn't always feel that way. In fact, it wasn't until she was divorced at age 59, after having been a housewife all her life, that she took stock of her situation and thought about a job.

title: Rcisernary P. Suozzi To Be Wed in May
description: Rosemary Patricia Suozzi, who graduatel last Wednesday from the Georgetown University School of Nursing, and Dr. Joseph C. Mancini, a Washington physician, plan to be married in Mayin Glen Cove. L. I.

title: Susan Carvajal Nelson, Teacher, Bride Of Frederick Nagle, Investment Officer
description: Susan Carvajal Nelson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Nelson of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday in New York to Frederick Floyd Nagle, son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Floyd Nagle of Greenwich, Conn. The ceremony was performed in St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Vincent O'Connor and the Rev. Richard Russell, Catholic chaplain of Yale University.

title: Hammond's Agenda Beset By Problems
description: PURCHASE MICHAEL HAMMOND, the president since last May of the State University College of New York at Purchase, can be regarded, perhaps, as a parent with a fastgrowing child on his hands, a gifted child, a complicated one, a demanding child who keeps storming into his office insisting that there must be more allowance, more clothes, a private studio, money for books, paints and brushes.

title: Cauthen Reaches $6 Million Mark
description: As the track announcer put it yesterday at Aqueduct near the finish of the sixth race, That's Steve Cauthen going for six million dollars.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: BLDWIN PLACEMan of La Mancha. Today only at 2 P.M. Godspell. Wednesday to Saturday 8 P.M., next Sunday 2 P.M. {through December). $5.50, except Saturday $6.50. Special rates available for groups, students under 18 and the elderly on Wednesday, Thursday and Sunday. Mahopac Farm Playhouse, Rte. 6.6281169.

title: Fancy New Tropical Rhododendrons Are Ideal To Grow in Cool Rooms
description: Anew race of tropical rhododendrons offers rich floral dividends for energysaving greenhouse gardeners who keep the temperatures cool. A minimum night temperature of 45 degrees is not out of line for these splendid plants. The vivid flowered shrubs from the IndoPacific add bold bursts of late fall and winter color with bonuses of bloom in other seasons, too.

title: Questions/Answers
description: Aphids are a nuisance on my pots of parsley. Is there a way to get rid of them without using chemical sprays? M.B., Katonah, N.Y.

title: New Yorkers Start Bundling Up As a National Cold Snap Arrives
description: Plunging temperatures, exacerbated by gusty winds, sent New Yorkers rummaging through trunks and closets for gloves, scarves and earmuffs as the vanguard of a national deep freeze moved into town yesterday.

title: Begin's Message to the U.J.A. Tells of a Real Peacemaking Process
description: Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel, in his first message to the American Jewish community since last month's visit to Israel by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, declared last night that we have embarked upon a real peacemaking process.

title: SPEARING PERSONALLY
description: IARRIVE four minutes late for the interview with my old friend, Mandel Perodin, but it doesn't matter. He has made each one of them productive by studying for the graduate philosophy course he's taking.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. The Jew as a Traveler.

title: A Queen Is Paying A Call in Bayonne
description: BAYONNE AT the moment last weekend that the world's largest active passenger ship, the Queen Elizabeth 2, slid gently into a big drydock at the Military Ocean Terminal here, one of the crewmen leaned over the railing on, the signal deck, tossed his cap into the air and shrieked with joy.

title: Abigail, a Boston Terrier, Tops Philadelphia Show
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 10  There were 3,384 dogs from across the United States competing for the top award at the Philadelphia Kennel Club's S3d show tonight in the Frederick Center Exhibition Hall, but a 121/,pound Boston terrier, bred and owned by a New Yorker. captured it in style.

title: Seven Receive Rockefeller Public Service Awards
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 10Seven persons who have made important contributions toward solving critical social problems were given the Rockefeller Public Service Awards this week.

title: Joanne Taylor Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Warren W. Taylor of Pleasantville, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joanne Taylor, to R. Steven McCarthy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. McCarthy of Middletown, Conn. Miss Taylor is a senior at Columbia University, her fiance is an alumnus of the Columbia School of Engineering.

title: Judith C. Dudyak Is Affianced to Robert Thomas
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Dudyak of Spring Valley, N. Y., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Judith Carol Dudyak, to Robert Chanler Bryant Thomas, son of the Rev. and Mrs. William R. F. Thomas of Tomkins Cove, N. Y.

title: Jazz: Fine Duet
description: Don Cherry and Ed Blackwell, who played together in Ornette Coleman's quartet during the 1960's, recorded two volumes of duets for Byg, a French label. in 1969. The albums, Mu partsone and two, are long since out of print, but they have become soughtafter collector's items, and in their modest way they were of real importance. They announced a new, worldembracing esthetic for jazz, for while they included improvising in a Colemaninspired vein, they also reached out to include rhythm patterns, scales and instruments from Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Pacific.

title: Woman, 75, Running Center for Elderly
description: Essie Davis believes that if you see a problem, you should do something about it. In practicing that belief, the 75yearold Miss Davis, whose right leg was amputated when she was 16, is up by 6 o'clock every morning, preparing 31 breakfasts in her Harlem apartment for elderly people confined to their homes. She and teenage volunteers then walk through the neighborhood delivering them.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: ACTOR'S CAFETHEATER, Franklin and Fremont Streets, BloomfieldMacbeth. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. (through December). 32.9044.90; students and the elderly, $1.9043.90. (201) 4297662. Bloomfield College (Westminster Theater).

title: Cutoffs on Medicaid Prompt Shift inThinking on Abortion
description: The almost total cutoff of Medicaid funds for abortions in New Jersey and Connesut last summer has brought substantial changes in the ways indigent women deal w'th their pregnancies.

title: some U. S. Plane Hijackers Want to Return From Cuba
description: Several of the 80 or so hijackers of American planes who live in Cuba are eager to return to the United States and face the charges against them. Though the penalty for air piracy is 20 years to death, two hijackers who were interviewed in Havana last weekend said, We want to come home and take the rap, Neither the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the Federal Aviation Administration nor the State Department, which has primary responsibility for such cases, has taken steps to apply for extradition.

title: Party Leader Named in Cracow
description: WARSAW, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Agriculture Minister Kazimierz Barcikowski of Poland today was appointed party chief in the southern city of Cracow in a move apparently intended to strengthen party control there. The announcement by the Polish press agency did not say if Mr. Barcikowski, 50 years old, would give up the agricultural portfolio he has held since 1974.

title: Marcos Grant Is Protested at Tufts
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Dec. 8The acceptance by the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy of a $1.5 million grant from the family of Ferdinand E. Marcos has raised a storm of protest here in recent weeks, with students and faculty members charging that the endowmentpoor school has sold its reputation to the authoritarian President of the Philippines for the proverbial mess of pottage.

title: Amy Carter Revises Vision of Chain Saws
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)Amy Carter has received her Christmas chain saw, and that, according to White House spokesman, is probably more than she wanted.

title: Economic Indicators
description: Statistics for commercial agricultural loans, carloadings, steel, oil, electric power and business failures are for the preceding week and latest available

title: TV VIEW
description: For a brief time this evening, the raw underbelly of society can be glimpsed in a program stuffed with coarse street language and blunt imagery. This slice of television verite is being offered not on public television, which has long been expanding the medium's permissibility borders, but on a local in dependent station, WPIXTV, which rarely ventures outside the limits of a typically conservative and safe schedule constructed on the moneymaking bedrock of old TV reruns and even older movies.

title: Jewish School on L.I. Teaches Students About Their Real Cultural Heritage So It Can Be Passed

Peretz Jewish School in East Meadow, waiting for the start of the first class of the new Mittleshul High School sponsored by the Workmen's Circle of New York, a fraternal Jewish organization.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)The acting head of the negotiating team for the United Mine Workers stalked out of today's bargaining session, accusing coal industry officials of stalling efforts to end a fivedayold nationwide miners strike.

description: PURCHAS WHEN you think of recycling do you still imagine a troop of Boy Scouts loading piles of old newspapers on the back of a borrowed truck on a Saturday afternoon?

title: Phone Numbers Sea. Up For Help for Disabled
description: Four tollfree telephone numbers In New York State to serve callers seeking information and help for the disabled were announced yesterday by Governor Carey.

title: TUE LITERARY VIEW
description: ARE the literary critics of Americaand perhaps even a few of its wellknown novelists toocurrently suffering from a seizure something called liberal guilt, a disabling affliction that leads to absurd and dangerous consequences? Do they secretly, or perhaps not so secretly, envy writers in other countries who have suffered throueh the agony of slavelabor camps, police torture chambers and other forms of political terror? When critics lavish a kind of praise on Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn's The Gulag Archipelago and Nadezhda Mandelstam's Hope Against Hope that they tend to withhold from some of the betterknown products of the American literary marketplace, are they really attempting to tell us, without openly admitting to the belief, that life under the tyrannies, for literary purposes at least, and very likely for moral purposes as well, is actually superior to life in freedom? short, if we express our admiration for the heroic Russian writers of the 1970's, do we not stand condemned as apologists for the very terror these writers have so magnificently described and defied?

title: Judi Schwebel Sets Wedding to Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Tack P. Schwebel of New Rochelle, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Judith Schwebel, to Andrew Lerman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Lerman of Woodmere, L.I.

title: Kilmer and Moseley Lead Washington to Key Triumph
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 10The opportunistic Washington Redskins took advantage of almost every opportunity the St. Louis Cardinals gave them today and pulled out a 2620 victory that kept alive their chances for the National Football Conference wildcard playoff spot.

title: Charlotte Speedway. Plans Busy May
description: In motor sports, the month of May traditionally belongs to the Indianapolis 500. The opening of the track for practice, the two weekends of qualifying and the race itself dominate coverage of motor sports on the national level.

title: Caryl Goldberger Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard Goldberger of Scotch Plains, N.J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Caryl Goldberger, to Lewis Levine, son of Mr: and Mrs. Aaron Levine of Rockville Centre, L. I. The couple, graduates of Syracuse University, will be married next May.

It's my mother. She's turned Into a lock.

title: Martha Weaver Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. J. Ritner Weaver of Orange, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Martha Melinda Weaver, to Gordon W. Dowds, son of Judge Notman R. Dowds of the Los Angeles Superior Court and Mrs. Dowds of San Marion, Calif. Miss Weaver is an admissions counselor at the University of Bridgeport. Mr. Dowds expects to graduate in June from New York Medical College. They plan to be married June 10

title: THE BETE NOIRE OF FRANCE'S LEFT
description: JeanFrancois Revel is the latest in the famous and honorable line of 1renchmen who say things their onnpatriots would prefer not In hear. Albert Camus did so after the last world war and Andre (ode before it. Zola at the time of the DT vous trial and Vollain earlier still. All were all;itio,(1 the Establishment of their day, Someanos by critics or opponents who ought to have known better, and were generally admired in the end as upholders of truth and justice. Revel is a publicist and pamphleteer as fine as any of them.

title: Dealing the Cards of Cairo
description: Secretary of State Vance is touring the Middle East this weekend to learn how he can deal with the deck that Anwar elSadat has so energetically reshuffled. The radical turn of events in the region seems finally to have been factored into American diplomacy. The question now is whether Syria, Jordan and, above all, Saudi Arabia are still playing.

title: An Artist Celebrates the Pioneer Spirit
description: WARREN HOW is being alive today different from the experience of the early Americans? Eric Sloane, painter and author, looked at the windblown rain falling outside the barn studio at his home in Warren and spanned the history of the country with his thoughts.

title: Literature As Insult
description: WIN deepisolation experiments, writes Robert M. Adams, a man with nothing to see, hear, or feelin the closest approximation of zero sensationcalls on his own voice to bear him company. But the deepisolation experiment of modern life, or the more extreme forms of modern literature, man's voice offers only cold comfort, because in both areas he has begun to bad mouth himself to a degree unprecedented in his history. Increasingly, he uses language not to soothe, solace, satisfy, divert or inform himself, but in such a way as to violate, hinder, hurt, baffle and exasperate his feelings and expectations.

title: A Service Station Battles to Survive
description: ??? A SMALL businessman and a giant corporation are locked in a battle that could have repercussions far beyond the borders of this small borough in Bergen County.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONWhen Administrations change, according to the conventional wisdom, the top officials who have been running multibilliondollar Federal programs are quickly snapped up to become highranking officials of private corporations.

title: Long Beach Woos Panel on Casinos
description: WITH the conclusion of the fifth, and possibly last, public hearing by a State Senate Committee here, this South Shore waterfront city's campaign to turn itself into the mecca of East Coast casino gambling has entered a new phase.

title: Philanthropists and Beneficiaries Discuss Use of $32 Billion Gifts
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 10Nearly 400 philanthropists and representatives of the organizations they support have met in New Orleans to discuss the $32 billion that Americans will give away this year and how to collect and spend it more creatively.

title: Girls and Horses
description: One of the earliest religious disappointments in a young girl's life devolves upon her unanswered prayer for a horse. Somewhere around the age of 10, I, too, fervently asked God to send one, even though we lived in a flat and the landlady wouldn't permit a radio on the window sill, let alone a horse in the yard. The horse never materialized, and my attitude toward them in general took a downward slide. Horses are for shy people, slow readers, for children whose parents give them birthday parties at the St. Regis. They are also for putting me right off their backs or sitting down. There are reasons for my defensive attitude, but like every other little girl I began life praying for a horse; unfortunately, I can't recapture the feeling behind the wish.

title: Andrea J. Katz Is Fiancee Of Todd Richard Stimmel
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Katz of White Plains of the engagement of their daughter. Andrea Jane Katz, to Todd Richard Stimmel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Stimmel of New York.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: Little wonder the stock market has been b.ounding up and down like a yo:yo lately:There are so many anomalies in the economic picture these days and so much uncertainty over what lies aheadfor domestic business. inflation. Government polices energy and taxation as well as over the whole international plcturethat no one seems to have much reliande on any forecasts, whatever they predict.

title: Rutgers Defeats St. John's As Bailey Sparkles, 7261
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 10Jim Bailey was so good in leading Rutgers University to a 7261 victory over St. John's tonight that Lou Carnesecca, the losers coach, said: I think Bailey is just tremendous. I try to think back when last I saw a center like that. He's excellent.

title: Candace Dunlop, David Henritze Jr. Plan June Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Dunlop of Stamford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Candace Marie Dunlop, to David Durham Henritze Jr., son of Mrs. Derek Peters and Mr. Henritze, both of Atlanta.

title: A Stitch in Time
description: Our postpermanentpress era of readymade clothes and domestic goods marks the first time in history that young girls both rich and poor could grow up without learning how to sew or to do any of the needle arts or crafts. This despite the early 70's recession which, combined with an appreciation of 60's hippie domesticity and festive handwork, produced a flood of instructional craft books, especially on needlework and quilting. The flow of derivative and repetitious books on decorative doityourselfing is finally abating. At the same time, a small number of remarkably fine books have appeared on aspects of textile arts in social context. The best of this year's books are elegantly produced, and their knowledgeable texts draw from anthropology and history as well as from textile scholarship. Unintentionally perhaps, they inspire a quiet feminist pride in traditional women's work, in the beautiful decorations that have universally adorned home and hearth.

title: Cities to Explore Revitalization Law
description: WHITE PLAINS IF New York City officials have witnessed the departure of business with increasing dismay in recent decades, so have the leaders of Mount Vernon, New Rochelle, Yonkers and Peekskill.

title: Parents Suit Alleges School Malpractice
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP FOR more than two years, David Spiro was driven by one of his parents from their home in Dover to a private school in Convent Station, where, as a youngster with a learning disability, he was enrolled for the special attention and education available at the Early Childhood Learning Center. That was between 1973 and 1975.

title: The Duryea Camp Exults
description: ON election night last month. Edward Ecker, the East Hampton Republican leader, celebrated a G.O.P. sweep of the town elections by handing out 150 Duryea for Governor bumper strips. He had done the same thing a year ago when the Assembly minority leader, Perry B. Duryea Jr. of Montauk, was reelected to the Assembly.

title: The Youthful Zest Of Adult Hockey
description: HE calls his adult hockey team the overthehill gang, but to Michael Harris, a 37yearold commercial photographer, the Tuesday night Great Neck team is the highlight of his week.

title: Where to Cut Your Own Christmas Tree See Page 4
description: LEGEND has it that the snowcovered beauty of an evergreen forest inspired Martin Luther to decorate the first Christmas tree. Today, many Westchester residents are seeking to rediscover that wonder as they head north to chop down their own evergreens. The majority travel to nearby Christmastree farms, which are now spreading rapidly in the southern part of the state.

title: C. ERNEST NAUEN
description: C. Ernest Nauen, vice president for corporate relations of the National Distillers and Chemical Corporation, died Friday evening of a heart attack after playing squash at the Fifth Avenue Racquet Club, 1at 37th Street. He was 45 years old and lived at 14 Tory Hole Road Darien, Conn.

title: A Town in Hiding In South Carolina
description: You know you're entering the South Carolina Low Country when the traffic dwindles along U.S. 17 and the gaudy amusement parks of Myrtle Beach are an hour behind you. Billboards thin out, live oaks and palmettos abound, marshes extend to the horizon. Twentytwo miles south of the Georgetown International Paper Company and just beyond the Francis Marion National Forest you notice a small sign reading, McClellanvilleSeafood Capital. If you miss the sign, look for Boots Texaco Station. Turn left off U.S. 17, go about mile and you've arrived in McClellanville, the village nobody knows.

title: How Interesting to Know Mr.Lear
description: IT is astonishing how few remarkable poems have been written in English for children. A reading The Oxford Book of Children's Verse, for example, reveals hundreds of poems from medieval fairly recent times that exhort and admonish young listeners to keep a civil tongue, bow their knees, be meek and mild, and generally pretend that swaddling bands are still straneline their limbs.

title: Computer Is a Useful Tool for Firemen in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 7 When Kansas City firemen go out on a call, they're likely to know a lot more about what they may find there than firefighters in most other cities.

title: MAN ALLOWS FRIEND TO COMMIT SUICIDE
description: Morgan Sibbert, a retired engine told the 10th annual Euthanasia EAucational Council conference in Manhattan yesterday that he had let a 75yearold physician friend who was suffering fron Parkinson's disease come Into his hone and end his life.

title: ANTIQUES
description: Toys of tinmalleable, brittle, featherlight and ever so commonhave enchanted children of all ages for more than a century. And as the Yuletide approaches. the fanciful and fragile tin toys that teased the minds of the very young and won their hearts, too, are the subject of two events: an exhibition of early designs, and an auction of more recent ones.

title: Painting. in its profusion of.
TeenAge Maturity
description: NOT every impresario can pronounce himself happy at the prospect of a $3,000 deficit from his annual fundraising event, but Michael Pollon isn't your average impresario. He's the executive director of the Westchester Conservatory of Music, and in view of the extraordinary example of community spirit on display last weekend during the performance of Mozart's The Magic Flute, he had every reason to be proud.

title: Life by E1 Full of Sound and Worry
description: When Henry Drillings stands on the balcony of his 16thfloor Coney Island apartment, he can look out at freighters plying the dark blue waters of the Atlantic and the stately steel frame of the oncefamed parachute jump. He can watch the quiet undulations as sea breezes move through the trees. He can sometimes hear the birds chirping below.

title: CAREY STUMPS STATE IN PREELECTION PUSH
description: ALBANY. Dec. 10  A somewhat unusual threepiece banda trio of elderly men playing an accordion, a saxophone and a banjoperformed a version of Happy Days Are Here Again, and Governor Carey was buoyant.

title: But Winpisinger's Machinists Have Familiar Union Woes
description: LOS ANGELESBurly, tough William W. Winpisinger, the president of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, looks and sounds like a casting director's idea of a typical labor boss. He is anything but.

title: BROWN IS CONFIDENT ON REELECTION BID
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10Three years after a narrow victory put him in the Governor's office and 18 months after he gave Jimmy Carter a brief fright on the way to the White House, Edmund G. Brown Jr. approaches a reelection campaign full of confidence.

title: Myra Fisher Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Fisher of White Plains have announced the engagement of their daughter, Myra Susan Fisher, to Dr. David Haskell Saturen, son of Dr. and Mrs. Bernard Baer Saturen of Philadelphia. Miss Fisher is a social worker at Bellevue Hospital in New York. Her fiance is a professor of music at Fairleigh Dickinson University. The marriage is planned for Jan. 8 in Philadelphia.

title: SHOP TALK
description: A SPOONFUL of sugar makes the medicine go down. It can also sweeten one's outlook, buoy the bridge or canasta group and alleviate the agony of tobacco withdrawal. And a storehouse of candy is surely the stuff that dreams are made of.

title: Allen James Morton Jr. Fiance of Patsy Jennings
description: Mrs. Thomas Scott Jennings of Jersey City has announced the engagement of her daughter, Patsy Ann Jennings, to Allen James Morton Jr., son of Mrs. Morton of Oberlin, Ohio, and the late Mr. Morton. The wedding will take place in May.

title: A Buddy System Aids the Chinese
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 10The Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Company used to have a good thing going with its neighborhood food store in the western suburbs of Peking.

title: How Should Public TV Handle the Inflammatory?
description: If you tune in to Channel 13 at 10 P.M. on Wednesday, you can watch an American Nazi expound on the inherent inferiority of blacks and a Ku Klux Kianner expound on the invidious influence of Jews. The comments are likely to prove offensive to many, but the show, The Extremists: American Nazis and the K.K.K., is in fact Channel 13's way of avoiding running a different public television show that would have been even more offensive. Does the Channel 13 substitute represent flight from controversy or conscientious programming? What are the obligations of a public television station in dealing with such inflammatory matters?

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Whoever thought the day would come when NBC and CBS would fight a ratings war with cornpeting specials of The Nutcracker? And did anyone expect that even Public Television would air a different dance program per week for two straight months, beginning with a new look at the ballets of George Balanchine?

title: Welissa Gloyd Wed To Gordon Wilcox
description: Melissa Mayer Gloyd and Gordon Wilson Wilcox, both of Seattle, were married yesterday in Easton, Conn. The Rev. Dr. William Sloane Coffin Jr., Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert B. Wilcox Jr., parents of the bridegroom.

title: Geoffrey Hornbeck To Wed Ann Oliver
description: Mr. and Mrs. aran M. Oliver of Bethlehem, Pa., and Boynton Beach, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Elizabeth Oliver, to Geoffrey Hayes Hornbeck, son of Mrs. James S. Hornbeck of Darien, Conn., and the late Mr. Hornbeck.

title: Urban Garden Effort to Expand
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)The Agriculture Department has announced a $3 million program to help thousands of poor families grow their own vegetables.

title: Pension Revisions
description: TRENTON FOR the last few years, the amount of money deposited by the state and local governments into pension funds to pay for the retirement of their employees has been increasing annually by $30 million to $35 million. In 1976, these deposits totaled more than $272 million.

title: Black, Indian or None of the Above?
description: How can those of us who insisted for years that employers had no business inquiring into the race, sex ethnicity of job applicants now tolerate and even welcome a resumption of that inquiry? We can and we do, and we think the Carter Administration is handling the matter with intelligence and sensitivity. The Civil Service

title: Balancing the Books Is a Continuing, Costly Effort
description: Two years ago New York State declared that a financial emergency existed in Yonkers. Like New York City, Yonkers was unable to obtain funds from private investors for essential services and seemed about to default on outstanding obligations. Albany came to the rescue with loans and advances in aid, and established an Emergency Financial Control Board to make sure the money was managed properly.

title: Connecticut /This Week
description: AVONAnnual Artists Demonstrations and Open House, today, Saturday and next Sunday, Farmington Valley Arts Center, Avon Park North, noon to 5 P.M. Painting, woodblock printing, silk screening, pottery, batik, leather, jewelry, glass, crochet, etching. 6781867.

title: Krivine and Ivaldi: An Extraordinary Duo
description: One of the most satisfying violin and piano concerts this listener has heard in a long time was played by the Duo Emmanuel Rrivine and Christian Iva at Carnegie Recital Hall on Thursday night. The nair of French musicians appeared in the Carnegie HallJeunesses Musicales series.

title: In Summary
description: After almost two months of talking, the members of the House and Senate conference committee on energy may finally be close to agreement, but true to the spirit of the protracted negotiations a complete package probably will not pass this year. The best hope is for the conference to finish before Christmas and for Congress to return after New Year's for final action. Given the importance of the legislation, and the conflicting interests, floor fights in both houses are likely.

title: TERRORISM IMPEDING BASQUES AUTONOMY
description: MADRID, Dec. 5Sporadic terrorism and tension in the province of Navarre are complicating the progress of the northern Basque provinces toward provisional autonomy on the same footing as Catalonia.

title: 3 Women Killed in Brooklyn Fires
description: Three women died and the husband and two children of one of the women were injured in three fires in Brooklyn late Friday night and early yesterday morning as firefighting efforts were hampered by high winds and temperatures in the low 20's.

title: Serious Fall Off Horse Fails to Deter Youngster
description: Last March 26 dawned bright on St. James, L. I., and Harry deLeyer looked forward eagerly to his instructional chores.

title: Yanks Look Better to Messersmith This Time Around
description: Gone, Andy Messersmith says, AND forgotten.

title: Ocean Vessels Racing Ice in St. Lawrence Seaway
description: SAULT STE. MARIE, Mich., Dec. 10More than 100 ocean vessels are fighting heavy winds, snow and thickening ice in a race to get out of the Great Lakes by Thursday, the official closing date of the St. Lawrence Seaway.

title: Westchesterites Offer Latin Tenor in Pagliacc?
description: Last Sunday night's performance of Pagliacci at the Hunter College Auditorium featured two notable New York debutsof the Performing Arts Society of Westchester, which has been staging operas since 1974, and of Jesus.

title: Ethel Ziselman Is Betrothed to Dr. Leslie Jay Green
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ban Ziselman of Lido Beach, L. I., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Ethel Marsha Ziselman, to Dr. Leslie Jay Green, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Green of Jamaica Estates, Queens, and Poughquag, N. Y. A June wedding is nlanned.

title: 40Horse Hitch Sold At Auction in Iowa
description: ZEARING, Iowa, Dec. 10 (UPI)Dick Sparrow's famed 40horse hitch has been auctioned off.

title: GOING HOME
description: know falls, the first flurries of a new season in a house we only recently moved into. I look out the hack window and watch it building thick and wet on the branches of fir trees. Behind me, in the living room, wonderful fire crackles in our new stove from Belgium, with the glass door you can see the flames through.

title: Around the Nation
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 10Kaneaster Hodges Jr., a smalltown lawyer from Newport who is practically unknown in Arkansas politics, was appointed today to serve the last 13 months of the term of the late United States Senator John L. McClellan.

title: CUOMO TOP CANDIDATE IN DEBT FOR CAMPAIGN
description: Mario M. Cuomo not only lost the New York City mayoral election, he lost more than any of the candidates, according to final financial reports.

title: CHRISTIANS AND JEWS SEEK NEW DIALOGUE
description: DALLASBlinking tears away. the Rev. Jimmy Allen spoke to an audience of Baptists and Jews about a Jewish friend who was taken to a Nazi concentration camp.

title: FORD PREDICTS DOWNTURN IN AUTO SALES FOR 1978
description: DETROIT, Dec. 10 (UPI)Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, predicted today a downturn in 1978 car sales, which he attributed to an economy oeset by uncertainty.

title: Harlem Volunteers Are Trained To Detect High Blood Pressure
description: Twentyone volunteers reported at the Harlem Service Center of the American Red Cross last week for training in detecting high blood pressure, a silent killer that has a disproportionate share of its victims in the black community.

title: Behind the Familiar Donizetti, Puccini and Verdi
description: One would think that the musical world had discovered, or rediscovered, just about all there is to know about the operas of Donl zeta, Verdi and Puccini, cthree of the most popular composers in the standard repertory. To Judge from three recent record releases, one would be wrong. Even an oftrecorded work like Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor has been dusted off and put through the cleansing processes of modern musicology to reveal unexpected facets in a new recording (Philips 8703 080). A fresh version of Verdi's Simon Boccanegra (Deutsche Grammophon 2709 071) throws clear light on this darkly colored, still too neglected score, while the final opera of Puccini to receive phonographic attention, Edgar (Columbia M234584), fills the last major gap in our knowledge of this important figure.

title: INTERVIEW
description: HACK ENSACK PAROMINENTLY displayed on the desk of Leon J. Sokol is pen in a holder that is embedded in a base containing the Seal of NeW Jersey. It was one of the pens Used.to sign the incometax bill, Mr. Sokol said the other day. I'm very proud of that.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10 A.M. (Channel 4) Here and Now: Governor Carey.

title: 2 Soviet Astronauts Head for a Link:Up With Space Station
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10Two Soviet astronauts today headed toward a linkup with an orbiting space station after an early morning blastoff from the Baikonur knace center in Soviet Central Asia.

title: Great Adventure Park Plans to Expand
description: JACKSON TOWNSHIP THE Great Adventure Amusement Park has a new owner and there are plans to expand everything for the 1978 season except the admission price.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Deer Season
description: BLOSSBURG, Pa.Dawn was cold and gray. A light snow sifted through the bare, black branches of hardwoods, or clung to feathery hemlocks.

title: Widow in Bergen Fills Husband's Role
description: HACKENSACK WHEN the Bergen County Philharmonic Orchestra approached the late Herman Schulman a few years ago to make him its man of the year, Mr. Schulman, who had never been known as a patron of the arts, said: Aw, cut the baloney. If you want to use my name, use my name. It's fine with me.

title: Deaths
description: STERNEllen, beloved wife of PM, devoted mother Of Roy, Frank anal Betty, adored grandmother Of Petri. cia, Lisa and Andrew. Graveside services Mt. Hope Cemetery, Westchester, Sunday, Dec 11 at 1:45 PM. In lieu of flowers, kindly contribUta to the Neurology Service Fund, Me; mortal Hospital, 1275 York Ave; N.Y.C.

title: Prime Minister Called Ineffective on Government Reform, Party Unity and Economic Issues
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda, who entered office almost a year ego on a pledge to reform the government, unite his party and forge new economic progress, now finds himself in trouble on all three fronts.

title: CARTER POPULARITY FALLS TO 56% IN NEW GALLUP POLL
description: President Carter's popularity, which has steadily declined since last March, stands now at 56 percent, according to the latest Gallup Poll, with 29 percent disapproving of how he is handling the Presidency and 15 percent undecided.

title: Spain Leads by 3 As Ballesteros Stars
description: MANILA, Dec. 10 (AP)Severiano Ballesteros of Spain shot a threeunderpar 69 today and led his team to threestroke edge over Canada after 54 holes of the 25th World Cup golf chamnionshi D.

title: as Planners Try to End Such Blight
description: Elevated structures in densely populated areas have few friends among planners. Whether they are used for subways, railroads or automobiles, they have for years been considered blights that lower property values, divide neighborhoods, disrupt local traffic patterns, destroy vistas, cast palls of darkness and generate intolerable noise.

title: Tongsun Park Deal Meets New Snag
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia, the Senate majority leader, said today that he would not accept a deal for obtaining Tongsun Park's testimony in the Korean influencebuying scandal if it foreclosed Mr. Park's cooperation with Congressional investigators.

title: Barbara Hopfe Plans Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles T. Hopfe of Massapequa Park, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Barbara Ann Hopfe. to Jonathan Brundage Sayward, son of Mr. a..id Mrs. Elliot Myers Sawyard of Levittown, L. I., and Becket, Mass.

title: Vermont Man Still City Guest, With Changed Status
description: A Vermont man who, with his wife, had been wined, dined and made an official guest of New York City after the armed theft of his car last !Monday night was arraigned in Criminal Court yesterday and held in $1,000 bond for a hearing on extradition to Vermont on charges of cashing fraudulent checks.

title: Ethiopian Runner Triumphs
description: LONDON, Dec. 10 (AP)  Eshetu Tura of Ethiopia sprinted past Britain's David Black over the last 200 meters today and won the International Athletes Club crosscountry race at London's Crystal Palace. Tura covered the muddy 8,580 meters in 26 minutes 42 seconds. He finished 40 meters ahead of Black.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: MANY people have beautiful old picture frames stowed in their basement or attic, or on the top shelf of closet, that would be perfectly fine except that the corner joints have begun to work loose and mounting a picture safely thus heromes impractical.

title: The Life and Times Of Shaw's 'St. Joan'
description: This makes for the kind of soaring theater that has caught the imaginations of audiences ever since there was a stage to champion ideals on, to wave a banner on, to see a battle on and watch a hero lose on. Heroes, after all, do have to lose. The theatricality lies in the loss she compromises herself by recanting her beliefs. She denies her visions to avoid execution, only to find the alternajive life imprisonment. It is a fate worse than death, and she rejects it heroically.

title: Canadian Wins Tenpin Final
description: LONDON, Dec. 10 (Reuters)Rea Rennox of Canada defeated the United tSates champion, Lauren Lacost, in the final round of the Tenpin Bowling World Cup today, 570542.

title: Turning The Nutcracker Into a TV Spectacular
description: Im shooting from the best seatno, seatsin the house, said Tony Charmoli, director of the television production of Mikhail Baryshnikov's version ()fiche 85yearold ballet classic, The Nut cracker. As for Mr. Baryshnikov, who had staged this Nutcracker for the American Ballet Theater nearly a year ago, he said of the TV production of his first venture into choreography, I am pleased. Now Nutcracker can be seen in little cities, too. On Dec. 16, at 8 P.M., CBSTV will indeed carry this ballet to little cities and to millions of viewers who could not otherwise see the world's most popular Christmas ballet.

description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 10 (AP)Brad Shearer, a defensive tackle for the University of Texas, was named the recipient today of the Outland award as the outstanding interior lineman in college football.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayLong Island Sports Car Association 100mile T.S.D. rally; start at Howard Johnson's Route 112 off Exit 64 of L.I. Expressway, Medford, L.I. Registration: 9 A.M.; first car off 10:01.

title: Finally, An Abortion Law
description: Worn by a fivemonth war of nerves, the House and Senate last week compromised on Medicaidfinanced abortions but it seemed to satisfy no one except, perhaps, the Federal employees whose preChristmas pay checks had been jeopardized by the dispute. senator Edward M. Brooke of,Massachusetts, who had vigorously opposed the stringent ban sought by the House, said that the agreement liberalized abortions for poor women. But by Mr. Brooke's own reckoning, the compromise would have allowed only about a third of the 260,000 Medicaid abortions performed in the year before legislative restrictions took effect last June.

title: Welfare Crackdown Adds to State Aid
description: WHITE PLAIN TAXPAYERS who hate to see others getting public money to which the recipients are not entitledprying neighbors, disaffected husbands and wives and hardworking wageearners with small incomeshave helped Westchester get a rebate from the state of $1,710,977 of the county's welfare expenditures this year.

title: It's All For a Good Cause
description: HARTFORD THERE has been a breakthrough of sorts for men at the Commission on Special Revenue. While the commission was tied down last month with such weighty questions as how to deal with compulsive gamblers and how to keep the underworld out of the various statelicensed gaming activities, a sofa and two chairs were removed from the ladies' room in the commission's headquarters in Wethersfield in the frazzled cause of sexual equality. Gloria Morris, one of the nine commissioners and a bit of a militant on the subject, was furious.

title: Rieker Helps Lehigh Take Football Title
description: WICHITA FALLS, Tex., Dec. 10 (AP) Rieker plunged for one touchdown and threw for two more scores and an opportunistic Lehigh defense, led by Greg Clark, recovered four Jacksonville State fumbles today to give the Engineers a 330 victory in the Pioneer Bowl and the N.C.A.A. Division II national title.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: THE ACTS OF JUNG ARTHUR AND HIS NOBLE KNIGHTS, by John Steinbeck. (Ballantine/Del Rey; $4.95.) This is the realization of an ambition John Steinbeck (190268) pursued over many yearsto retell Malory's 15thcentury tales of Camelot so they'd appeal to presentday youth. Our reviewer, John Gardner, observed that the tale begins cautiously, then takes on a richness of detail that transforms the vision but makes it no one's but Steinbeck's. An appendix offers fascinating letters the author wrote about his work in progress. This first paperback edition is embellished with attractive decorations.

title: Pamela E. Ray, E. F. Vaughan, Lawyer, Wed
description: Pamela Eldridge Ray, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Henry Ray 3d of Oyster Bay, L.I., and Sanibel Island, Fla., was married at noon yesterday in Oyster Bay to Edward Foley Vaughan, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. James N. Vaughan of New York. The Rev. Robert T. Hollett, assisted by the Rev. Damian Halligan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: LAST winter I was one of Westchester's night owls. Night owls are tennis fanatics who play from 11 P.M. to midnight. Their counterparts, early birds, are on the courts before the rooster crows.

title: Ashford and Simpson: Bright Song
description: Nickolas Ashford and Valerie Simpson, who were at Avery Fisher Hall Friday night for two shows, write and sing songs about heterosexual monogamy. That may not seem unusual but in this heyday of the who'scheatingonwho song and the wheredidourlovegowrong song, it is. The musical style in which Mr. Ashford and Miss Simpson couch their message is Harlem gospelbright, upbeat, flamboyant and strongvoiced. The message is secular, but compared to the sort of thing so many soul artists are singing to gospelderived music these days it comes off sounding innocently starryeyed.

title: S. Robert Morse, 85, Vice President Of Ohrbach's Who Retired in 1957
description: S. Robert Morse, a retired vice president of Ohrbach's, died yesterday in Los Angeles New Hospital. He was 85 years old. Mr. Morse had lived in Los Angeles since his retirement in 1957.

title: TV's Teen Idol Comes Down With Adult Movie Fever
description: LOS ANGELES if I don't want to be considered a teen idol the rest of my life, then it's my responsibility to give the serious film audience a product that's quality, explained John Travolta, his diamondblue eyes riveting his dinner guest at Hollywood's stylish Imperial Gardens. Noticeably absent that night was his boyish beatific grin, a trademark of this actor who is better known as the endearing, dimwitted Vinnie Barbarino on ABC television's Welcome Back, Kotter.

title: Palestinian Rivalries Complicate the Answer
description: BEIRUT, LebanonNow we're all rejectionists, thanks to Sadat, a Palestinian militant gloated in Tripoli, Libya a week ago after the public reconciliation between the leadership of the Palestine Liberation Organization and the more radical Rejection Front.

title: Morocco From a Fresh Viewpoint
description: I awake as we sweep in over the African coast at dawn. Far below, breakers are four ranks deep, one behind the other, rolling up a long sandy shore. My camera takes too long to reach. By the time am fully conscious and ready to shoot, we are circling Casablanca, a city of low white buildings. Very modern looking (perhaps I am prejudging because I have read that most of it dates from the last 30 years, all since Bogart and Bergman.)

title: Betsy Thomas Betrothed to Edward Mair
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stiles Thomas of Allendale, N. J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Betsy Thomas, to Edward MacDonald Mair, son of Dr. and Mrs. George Mair of Northampton, Mass. The wedding is planned for June.

title: MAVERICKS FINDING NEW POLITICAL PATHS
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 10 (AP)Kandra Hahn is an unlikely political maverick.

description: He calls his adult hockey team the overthehill gang, but to Michael Harris, a 37-earold commercial photographer, the Tuesday night Great Neck team is the highlight of his week.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Carl Fader of Woodmere, N.Y. are happy to announce the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Ilene, to Mr. Michael Jeffrey Rehns, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max Rehns of Kew Garden Hills, N.Y. A Swine wedding is planned.

title: Carter Says He Expects Israel to Show Courage in Response to Sadat
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10  President Carter says he expects Israel to respond to Egypt's Middle East peace initiatives with the same great courage that President Anwar elSadat showed in making them.

title: Catch22 For The Ten
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Dec. 9Amnesty International, which is receiving the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo this week, has just published its annual report charging that more than twothirds of the nations of the world, including the usual villainsthe U.S.S.R., Chile, Iran, Uganda, South Africawere guilty of violations of human rights.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Ibsen's Love's Comedy was his only comedy, written in 1863 in rhymed couplets and last produced in New York at the Hudson Theater in 1908. It has rarely been done since, the last recorded production having been at the Pasadena Playhouse in 1935. The play's hero, an idealistic and hotheaded poet who competes against a staid businessman for the love of a certain Svanhild, is considered a prototype of Ibsen's Peer Gynt and Svanhild the first of the playwright's strongminded heroines. Now, Love's Comedy is to be staged by the Jean Cocteau Repertory. Furthermore, the director is none other than Martin L.H. Reymert, Ibsen's grandnephew, who had read his greatuncle's complete works by age 12. Though Mr. Reymert has served as actor and designer for the company since its inception, this is his first and most fitting directorial assignment. Explaining the prolonged absence of Love's Comedy from the stage, he stated, It does not fit into our contemporary mold of Ibsen. We do not think of Ibsen as writing in a witty, delightful and charming manner. Theater)

title: Argentine CourtMartial Sentences Eight Relatives And Employees of Banker
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 10Eight rela. fives and former employes of David Graiver, an Argentine banker accused of having invested money abroad for guerrilla organizations, have been sentenced to up to 15 years in jall by a courtmartial.

title: PLAN TO REPORT DRINKERS OPPOSED BY COAST BARS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 10)UPIRussel Fitzpatrick, spokesman for 350 taverns and bottle shops, says the California Highway Patrol's Let's get the drunk off the road campaign is a bad idea.

title: 5 MILLION ALIENS EXPECTED TO REGISTER NEXT MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (UPI)Immigration officials say that they expect to hear from at least five million aliens next month under the annual address report requirement of the Immigration and Nationality Act.
