description: As a cherry picker raised Senator Jacob K. Javits and Rabbi Shmuel M. Butman 30 feet in the air to light the candles of the world's largest Hanukkah menorah, thousands of people, mostly bearded Hasidim in long, black coats, sang and danced Boras on the cold cobble stones.

title: Jews in Cuba, Once Prosperous, See Community Shrink to 1,500
description: I was the king of maternity wear here, the rotund, 70yearold Isidoro Stettner said in Havana. I was girdles, all kinds of dresses, $70, even $100 evening dresses. I represented Lee Beachwear in Latin America. I remember New YorkToots Shor, the St. Moritzthat was the best breakfast in town. I used to fly into Idlewild and go straight there. Maybe if we have relations again I'll get my old job back.

title: DENVER PROJECT TO AID DELINQUENTS IS HAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI)A cornmunitywide experiment in Denver involving intensive educational help has been 89 percent successful in turning hardcore juvenile delinquents away from crime, a Government report said today.

title: Dog Saves His Paralyzed Owner
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., Dec. 11 (UPI) A German shepherd named Rojo saved his paralyzed owner's life in a fire early today, when he dragged the man out of bed and into another room, the authorities said. George Laline, 75 years old, told the police that he had knocked a lathy over as he was lying in bed. He said he picked the lamp Up and went to sleep. A short while later, he said; he awoke to find his bed hot and his room full of smoke. The dog dragged M. Laline out of the bedroom and into the kitchen just as a police officer, Jeffrey Persche. kicked in the rear door of the apartment.

description: JACKSON, Miss., Dec. 11Benjamin Hooks, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, has given black Mississippians assurances of support from his organization in a campaign to help Southern blacks retain their land.

title: Deft Cabaret Doubly Choice
description: Largely because the bright and airy twolevel livingroom set designed by John Shaffner for the Production Company's presentation of Nol Coward's Fallen Angels stands unused at the shank of the evening after the performances at the company's theater, 249 West 18th Street, the company is using it as both the setting and the inspiration for a cabaret called Disgustingly Rich.

title: Tribute for Rupp Tonight
description: A tribute is scheduled tonight at the Rupp Arena on the campus of the University of Kentucky in Lexington for Adolph F. Rupp. The Wildcat coach, whose college basketball teams won 879 games, died Saturday night at the age of 76. Details on page 38.

title: Emanuel Ax's Style Is Growing
description: Emanuel Ax devoted his Alice Tully Hall recital yesterday afternoon to Chopin and Ravel, and although there were some grand and finger twisting momentsthe Ballade in F minor (Op. 52), Scarbo from Gaspard de la Nuit or the Scherzo in B flat minor (Op. 31)the prevailing impression was gentler. defined by such music as the Chopin Polonaise in F minor (Op. 71, No. 3), his Three Etudes (Op. Post.) and his Three Mazurkas (Op. 59), and the Ravel Valses nobles et sentimentales.

title: Klammer Wins Downhill Despite His Early Error
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 11 (AP)The current world and Olympic champion, Franz Klammer of Austria, overtook the world's fastest skiers today and won the season's first World Cup downhill race for men.

title: The U.N. Today
Western Oil and Gas Hunt Recalls Days of Gold Rush
description: SALT LAKE CITYThese are the echoes of the Old West: Boom town. Cattlemen fighting the railroad over land. Men roaming the western slope of the Continental Divide seeking a fortune hidden in the earth.

title: Egyptian Jews in Brooklyn Are Finding Hope in Sadat Peace Initiative
description: When Israeli negotiators land in Egypt next Wednesday to talk peace, another wave of excitement, hope, and nostalgia will sweep through a small group of people in the United States who have a stake on both sides of the disputeEgyptian Jews.

title: Flight Recorder Found in Ruins Of Hijacked Malaysian Jetliner
description: JOHORE BHARU, Malaysia, Dec. 11 (AP)  Searchers have recovered the flight recorder of the hijacked Malaysian Airlines System jetliner that crashed near here, killing all 100 people aboard, the police said today.

title: Four Ways of Warming Up to Winter's Weather
description: Last weekend, the temperature reached 20 degrees and the chill factor was 9 degrees below zero  an early reminder of the prediction that this winter will be harsh, much like last year's.

title: Western Wind Expert Vocal Unit
description: A perennial problem with Christmas concerts is that, given the lightweight musical fare, the performers often seem to have more fun than the passive patrons. Saturday night's Alice Tully Hall Christmas concert by the Western Wind, an eightyearold vocal sextet, managed to spread good cheer more evenhandedly than mostthe last item on the program was A Medieval Mead Party in the Lobby.

title: Five Are Drowned in Athens As Heavy Rains Cause Flooding
description: ATHENS, Dec. 11 (Reuters)At least five persons were drowned in the northern part of the city today as flooding followed heavy rains that fell on Greece for the second straight month.

title: Scoring and Statistics of Games in the N.F.L. Yesterday
description: AT KANSAS CITY, MO.

title: The Doctors Are Few and the Medicine Is Scarce for Indochina's Refugees
description: Dominica Garcia woke up early one recent morning and decided to do little work in her New York hotel room. I typed this, she said after some coaxing, reaching across a desk at the office of the International Rescue Committee. It's an appeal  I guess it's a little emotional.

title: Egyptian Official Visits Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. II (Reuters) Vice President Husni Mubarak of Egypt arrived today on an official visit during which he will brief President Valery Giscard d'Estaing on the latest Middle East peace moves.

title: Eagles Prevail, 1714, on Jaworski Run
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 11Ron Jaworski scored on a 1yard bootleg run with 20 seconds remaining to play and gave the Philadelphia Eagles a 1714 ic.tnry over the Giants today.

title: Susan Kottler Is Married To Stephen Shestakofsky
description: Susan Kottler of Arlington, mass., psychiatric social worker in Boston, was married at home yesterday afternoon to Stephen Shestakofsky, a New York lawyer. Rabbi Benjamin Rudavan, 11Pformed the ceremony.

title: Saudis Lend Brazil $55 Million
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Dec. 11 (AP)Saudi Arabia will end Brazil $55 million to help finance a hydroelectric power project on the Sao Francisco River in northeastern Brazil, it was announced by the Brazilian Embassy today.

title: Grim Life of Newsboys in the 1800's Depicted in Trade Center Show
description: One is holding his stack of newspapers jauntily. His hat is pulled down rakishly. There is a toughguy look on his face and a cigarette dangles from his lips..

title: Sports Today
description: Davidson at Rutgers, 8 P.M.; Kings Point at Army, 8 P.M.; Lafayette at Wagner,. 8 P.M.

title: Screen: Puzzling Heart of Glass
description: Heart of Glass, which was shown at the New York Film Festival, was reviewed on Oct. 1 by Janet Maslin. Following are excerpts from the review. The picture opened yesterday at Cinema Studio. 1966 Broadway, at 66th Street.

title: New York City Is Turning Down 48% of New Welfare Applicants
description: Nearly half of all new welfare applicants in New York City are being turned down48 percent since July 1, compared with 25 to 35 percent before new, tighter controls in mid1976and complaints of harassment and delays are being raised by client representatives.

title: OpiateLike Substance in Gland Shows Promise as Pain Reliever
description: A chemical found in the pituitary gland has been synthesized and used with promising results in treating severe pain and the symptoms of narcotic withdrawal in a small number of patients, according to scientists who are doing research with recently discovered, natural opiatelike substances.

title: Scintillating Cooper Harpsichord
description: Kenneth Coopet generally manages to pull a few surprises at his harpsichord recitals. On Saturday afternoon in Alice Tully Hall he uncovered what might just be the tip of an icebergfive pieces by Handel adapted from his operas and oratorios, excerpted from a longforgotten collection of 65 arrangements, all published in the composer's lifetime between 1726 and 1758.

title: Constance Meadnis Saintonge, 72; Taught Writing at Mount Holyoke
description: Constance Meadnis Saintonge, whb taught English literature, composition and creative writing at Mount Holyoke College from 1928 until her retirement in 1970, died Friday at her home in South Hadley, Mass. She was 72 years old.

title: RADIO PROFITS SOAR FOR INDUSTRY IN 76
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (AP)The commercial radio broadcasting industry enjoyed a 96.9 percent increase in pretax profits last year despite continuing losses by the radio networks, the Federal Corn, munications Commission reported today.

title: Temperaments Exceed Four at Philharmonia
description: Lukas Foss's Meet the Moderns series with the Brooklyn Philharmonia at the Brooklyn Academy of Music doesn't exactly offer only the froth on the cresting wave of the avantgarde. The program Saturday night began with piece that is 76 years old, and included two works by worthy interwar German composers. There was also one work from 1971 and one that had literally lust been finished.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JACQUES BE NIMBLEJacques D'Amboise, leading male dancer of the New York City Ballet, will give a talk and demonstration tonight based on his career, which also includes choreography and teaching. The informal event, at 6 o'clock, will have the audience participate in questions and answers. It will be in the main rehearsal hall of the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center. Admission is $10 and the event is sponsored by the Walden School. For more information, call 8777621 or 2.

title: TRADE UNIONS LOSING GRIP ON CONSTRUCTION
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11The building trades unions, long the strongest segment of organized labor, are losing their control of the construction industry.

title: Welfare Reform: So Much Talk, So Little Action
description: The leisurely process by which an overhaul of the nation's welfare system is to be brought to fruition appears to have become even more leisurely. The New York Times reported yesterday that the Carter Administration's proposal, which is slated to gointo effect in October 1980, is beUrban lieved by key members of Affairs Congress and the Administration to have no chance of being enacted in this Congress. Some Congressional observers are more pessimistic and believe that the plan is already dead.

title: White Rhodesians Way of Life And Political Views Show Strain
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 6  The ads appear every few hours on television and every day in the newspapers. They show fashionably dressed, smiling people enjoying poolside barbecues, playing golf and tennis, dancing at nightclubs. The images change but the people are always white, never black. The tag line is always the same: Once you're a Rhodesian, no other land will do.

title: ANTIOBSCENITY DRIVE DISPUTED IN ATLANTA
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 11 What may be the most intensive and controversial antiobscenity drive in the country is now under way in Atlanta and surrounding Fulton County.

title: 2Term Choice Of Australians
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 11John Malcolm Fraser spent 10 years on the back benches of Australia's House of Representatives and has said that if the light of recognition had not fallen on him in 1966, when he received.

title: Jersey, After 100 Years, to Protect Big Supply of Pine Barrens Water
description: TRENTON, Dec. 11  After 100 years of talking about it, the state is about to begin enforcing rules to. protect 17.7 trillion gallons of mostly pure water underlying the semiwilderness called the New Jersey Pine Barrens.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: FIRST511,000, mdns., 3Y0 and up, ltiem. Prob.

title: Messiah Blends Two Styles
description: Handel's Messiah used to be viewed as a monstrously ceremonial work enhanced by huge performing forces and ponderous tempos. More recently, scholars have encouraged quicker, more intimate readings. David Randolph, who has been conducting New York Messiahs for two decades, hac never been an eitheror man, and his performance of the great oratorio Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Hall was, as usual, a mixture of both approaches.

title: Need for Expanding Rights of Prisoners Pressed by A.O.L.U.
description: A warning that prisoners rights should be expanded by legal means or other lesspeaceful attempts at securing rights will surely follow is set forth in a new American Civil Liberties Union handbook.

title: 3 Killed in Helicopter Crash
description: MARSHALL, Ark., Dec. 11 (AP)All three persons aboard a National Guard helicopter were killed today when it crashed about six miles north of here in a hilly area of Searcy County. The names of the victims were not released.

title: Beirut Fears an IsraelEgypt Pact That Omits Issue of Palestinians
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 11Lebanese leaders fear that President Anwar elSadat's peace initiatives will lead to a separate treaty between Egypt and Israel, leaving Lebanon with the Palestinian problem unresolved.

title: Saturday's College Results
description: HOCKEY

title: $1.5 Million in Medicaid Is Found Misspent by New York Agencies
description: More than $1.5 million in Medicaid assistance that had been allocated to provide housekeeping services for New York City's disabled and elderly was instead spent by private agencies on such items as Christmas parties, car rentals, parking fines, entertainment, outoftown trips by employees, loans and management fees to parent organizations, realestate purchases and gifts to civilrights campaigns.

title: News Summary
description: The United States will doall it can to mend the split among the Arab nations over Egypt's peace overtures to Israel, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said at a joint news conference in Jerusalem with Prime Minister Menahem Begin. Mr. Vance's trip to the Middle East was made to obtain pledges from both Israel and Egypt that they would not seek a separate peace at next week's conference in Cairo and to persuade other Arab nations to attend the meeting. Mr. Begin said, as President Anwar elSadat said Saturday in Cairo, that he would not seek a separate treaty. Later, Mr. Vance said that the United States expected King Hussein of Jordan to join the conference. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Study Finds Cincinnati Police Test In Decentralization Has Failed
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 11 (UPI) A threeyear Cincinnati experiment in neighborhood team policing, endorsed by Presidential commission, failed because drifted back into customary police routine, according to an Urban League evaluation report released today.

title: Patriots Beat Dolphins, 1410, But Are Nearly Out of Playoffs
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 11The New England Patriots played so well today in defeating the Miami Dolphins, 1410, they deserve a better fate than what the National Football League's comp!ex playoff qualification system is about to give them. An hour after this game ended several of the players were still in their locker room when the bad news came from Baltimore.

title: Paris Lives It Up on the Subway
description: PARIS, Dec. 11  Parisians by the hundreds of thousands jammed the city's express subway trains this weekend, trying out new lines and visiting a huge new main station at Les Hanes in the center of town.

title: Japanese Minister in U.S. for Trade Talks
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. II (AP)Nobuhiko Ushiba, Japan's Minister of External Economic Affairs, arrived here today to present to the Carter Administration his Government's proposals for reducing Japan's massive international trade surplus.

title: The Holiday Brings a Fondness for Old Favorites
description: It is as inevitable as an occasional piece of burnt toast or a halfpuffed souff16 that all recipies emanating from that nearby stove and from this typewriterhuman factors being what they areare not of uniform inspiration. Nor could they be received with equal enthusiasm by whatever readers may rhanrp iinnn this column.

title: The New Yolk Times/Robert Walker
description: GLEN COVE, LA., Dec. 11The five judges waited patiently as the bailiff brought the defendant into the woodpaneled. i.orrn that had a handlettered sign saving Peer Court.

title: Executive Changes At Levine, Huntley
description: At an intimate breakfast in the Park Lane Hotel Friday, Harold Levine of Levine, Huntley, Schmidt, Plapler & Beaver, president and chief executive, announced that he was stepping up to chairman, and that Robert Schmidt, 40 years old, was moving in as president. Allan Beaver, 39, and Larry Plapler, 42, have been named executive vice presidents, and Patrick Hillman, Arnold Berger and John Russo have moved to the vice president level.

title: Soviet General Is Killed
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 11 (Reuters)A highranking Soviet air defense officer, Maj. Gen. Vladislav Kadyshev, has been killed while carrying out his duties, the armed forces daily, Red Star, reported today. The 49yearold air force officer was described as chief navigator of air defenses. No further details were given of his job or how he died.

title: Users of English Try to Introduce Washington to It
description: WASHINGTON  It may be like commanding the ocean waves to stand still but a small determined band of wordsmiths has infiltrated Washington in a valiant effort to restore the English language as a tool of government.

title: Buccaneers Triumph for First Time
description: A 26game treadmill of defeat finally ended yesterday for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in New Orleans. The Bucs, who had lost every game they played since joining the National Football League last year, used three touchdowns on pass interceptions to defeat the Saints, 3314, and set off a jubilant victory celebration, their first.

title: BERGLAND BARS NEW STEPS TO EASE FARMER PROTEST
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11 (UPI) Agri culture Secretary Bob Bergland said today that he was uncertain about the effects of this week's threatened farm strike, but the Administration would not give in to farmers demands for guaranteed nrofits.

title: TRADE UNIONS LOSING GRIP ON CONSTRUCTION
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11  The building trades unions, long the strongest segment of organized labor, are losing their control of the construction industry.

title: Carter Aide Ending Panama Visit
description: PANAMA CITY, Dec. 11 (AP)Hamilton Jordan, a key aide to President Carter, said today the Administration would make Senate ratification of the Panama Canal treaties its top priority after Congress completes work on energy legislation. Jordan made the statement to reporters here before ending a tjareday visit to Panama.

title: Nat'1 Hockey League
description: Boston 8, Ranged2. Atlanta 5, Pittsburgh 1. PhiladelPhia 11, Cleveland 1. Cnicago 8, Minnesota 3. Washington 2, St. Louis 1. Buffalo 3, Vancouver 0.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SANTA CLARA (Prudential). Cristobal Dec. 16, Buenaventura 18 and Guayaquil 20; sails from 39th St., Brooklyn.

title: Christmas List
description: WASHINGTONFor Christmas 1977, here are the presents I intend to give:

title: The New York Times/Dec 12, 1977
description: A picture of moderate economic growth for the industrial world in 1978 has been painted by a blueribbon panel of American economists and analysts assembled by the Conference Board.

title: The $2,000 Necktie
description: An advertisement the other day described a necktie, made of cut velvet and studded with diamonds, for that man in a million, only $2,000. The initial temptation was to exclaim Obscene! but that, we soon realized, would be as irreievant as mothers urging children to finish their liver because people not as fortunate are starving in Calcutta.

title: FEDERAL EMPLOYEES GET AID FOR ABORTION
description: Congress has legislated restrictions on abortions for the poor at a time when the Federal Government is paying for abortions for Government employees and their dependents. Among the officials who are eligible for this benefit are the members of Congress.

title: Pakistan Acts in Emigration Fraud
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Dec. 11 (AP) The police arrested three men today on suspicion of having arranged. illegal entry to West Germany for 123 Pakistanis. The Pakistanis, who were reported to have paid at least $1,200 for the trip to West Germany, believing that they would he given work, were deported last week.

title: In Aemoriam
description: MARKSAlbert E. Our dearest Dad and Grandpa. Although we miss you more each day, the love that you left us gives us strength and comfort, we love you.

title: TEACHERS SALARIES IN STATE RANK HIGH
description: The salaries of teachers in New Jersey rank in the top 20 percent of teachers salaries nationwide, according to an annual survey just released by the New Jersey Education Association, which represents the teachers in contract negotiations.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post posit.ons

title: Limit on Journalists At Cairo Talks Lifted
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 11 (Reuters)Israeli journalists will now be permitted to visit Egypt in unlimited numbers, the Interior Ministry announced tonight.

title: Brightening of a Child's Holiday Is Wish of Neediest Cases Donor
description: The 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, now entering its second week, runs through February, but many who contribute think of the fund many times during the year.

title: Syrian Rules Out Talks With Israel In Cairo or Geneva
description: ABU DHABI, Dec. II (AP)Syria will stay out of ArabIsraeli negotiations in Cairo even if they produce progress, and will boycott any subsequent Geneva peace talks, Foreign Minister Abdel HaInn Khaddam of Syria said today.

title: 9 Bombs Explode in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Seven small incendiary bombs went off in a department store here today but were quickly extinguished by British soldiers, staff and the sprinkler system. Two others exploded today in a Chinese restaurant in Londonderry but caused no damage.

title: Miss de los Angeles Gives Superb Recital
description: At any time there are no more than a handful of artists who understand what a song recital should be and are able to convey that understanding to an audience. One of those rare ones for many years has been Victoria de los Angeles, and her appearance yesterday at Avery Fisher Hall found her still in possession of both the understanding and the ability. Sne also is still in possession of an audience: the hall was sold out and the overflow filled the stage seats.

title: Denver's Team Is High, and the Fans Are Even Higher
description: DENVER, Dec. 11There's nothing unusual about football mania at this time of yearTexans and their Longhorns, Nebraskans and their Big Red and diehard Giants rooters are all famous cases, and then there are the Minnesota Vikings fans.'But Denver's Broncomania is something else again.

title: FishStore Owner Slain
description: The owner of the Ocean Fish Market, at 2655 Eighth Avenue at 142d Street, was found shot to death on Saturday night at the rear of the store. The owner, apparently a robbery victim, was identified as 43yearold Mariano Cracolici of Northvale, N. J.

title: Bill Crofut Delightful Folk Singer
description: Superficially, Bill Crofut, who gave his first New York concert at Town Hall on Saturday evening, resembles the folk singers of the 50's who followed in the wake and inspiration of Woody Guthrie, Pete Seeger and the Weavers. Tall and rangy, with his shirtsleeves rolled up, plunking vigorously on a longnecked banjo and urging audience participation, Mr. Crofut often sounds strikingly like Mr. Seeger, who got him involved in folk music more than 20 years ago.

title: Reporter's Murder Near Cairo Airport Puzzles the Police
description: CAIRO, Dec. 11 (returns)The Egyptian police questioned airport taxi drivers today in an effort to piece together the final hours of david Holden, the British journalist who was killed last week by a bullet in the back. The police believe the motive may have been other than robbery.

title: Three Boys Rescued From Icy Pond
description: As the thermometer hovered near 20 degrees, Fabian, William and Lucas Ruiz, ages 12, 10 and 9, were playing on icecovered pond in a North Bergen, N.J., park. Suddenly the ice gave way, throwing the boys into the water. Lucas, right, the last to be rescued, had. to be given mouthtomouth resuscitation on the scene. The three brothers were all taken to North Hudson Hospital for treatment.

title: Bridge:
description: Half a century ago, the American Auction Bridge League, for men only, was founded in Chicago. It was a consideraole surprise to most of the founders that within a few years the word auction was dropped, and so, incidentally, was the sex restriction.

title: Stage: Don Juan in Hell' Given
description: Bernard Shaw's Don Juan in Hell, being all talk, needs actors who can speak its arguments as though they.had just thought of them: with urgent curiosity and with a feeling for the weight of the English language.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: United Press International

title: Market Place
description: Adverse publicity about the plight of developing nationsparticularly those heavily dependent upon imported fuel appears to be a factor in the depressed prices of bonds of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

title: VANCE, IN JERUSALEM, SAYS U.S. IS SEEKING END TO ARAB DIVISION
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 11Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the United States would do all it could to mend the split in the Arab world and thereby improve the chances for achieving an overall ArabIsraeli peace agreement.

title: KENYA IS SAID TO ARREST FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 11 (Reuters) Riot policemen have arrested a former vice president of Kenya, Oginga Odinga, and 17 other persons at a meeting he was to have addressed, witnesses reported.

title: Unilever Tells of Tentative Accord On $73.50 Bid for National Starch
description: Unilever, the giant international food, soap and chemical company, and the National Starch and Chemical Corporation of Bridgewater, N.J., announced last night that the two companies had reached tentative agreement for Unilever to take over National for $73.50 a sharea total of $482 million in cash.

title: P.B A. /lids Reirees Refuse toArlswer Earnings Inquiries
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association has advised officers who have retired on early disability pensions not to answer a department questionnaire aimed at ascertaining whether the retirees were earning more from outside jobs than they can under city law.

title: Ethiopia Denies Its Planes Bombed Northern Somali City of Hargeisa
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 11 (AP) Ethiopia has denied Somali charges that its warplanes bombed the northern Somali city of Hargeisa, the Ethiopia radio reported today. The radio said that spokesman for Ethiopia's Ministry of Information called the bombing report fabricated lie to cover up Somalis's brazen and naked aggression against Ethiopia in the Ogaden war.

title: Budapest Dismayedby Possibility Mrs. Carter May Deliver Crown
description: VIENNA, Dec. 11  Speculation that President Carter may entrust his wife, Rosalynn, with the mission of taking the historic Crown of St. Stephen back to Hungary has caused bafflement close to displeasure in Budapest.

title: ISRAELI PATROL ATTACKED BY GUERRILLAS IN LEBANON
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 11 The quiet on the Lebanese border was broken last night when Arab guerrillas ambushed an Israeli patrol in Lebanese territory shortly before midnight and Israeli artillery responded with an intensive bombardment, according to military headquarters here.

title: Brzezinski, U.S. Diplomats Guest, Is Told White House Ignores Them
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11It was the annual Awards Presentation of the American Foreign Service Association, the club and the trade union of the country's career diplomats, and nobody expected fireworks, even though intellectual courage and creative dissent are among the criteria for which the awards are made.

title: Porter Stars as Nets Turn Back  Bullets for 2d Straight, 10695
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 11 (AP)Kevin Porter scored 30 points and had 17 assists today to paoe the New Jersey Nets to a 10695 victory over the Washington Bullets in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Mrs. King Sets Back Miss Wade
description: LONDON, Dec. 11 (AP)Billie Jean King defeated Virginia. Wade of Britain, 63, 61, today to win the Bremar Cup women's tennis tournament.

title: Ice covered everything in range of the hoses at site of fivealarm blaze at Richmond Occupational Training Center Staten Island, and a firefighter had to help one man chisel open the door to his parked car.
description: At Rockefeller Center yesterday, thousands of fingers fumbled numbly with cameras pointed at ice skaters in the rink. And elsewhere around the city, buses were arriving from farther west bearing snow on their roofs, clue of what may lie in store for New York.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Three children were killed and their parents were critically injured in fire that heavily damaged their home in a residential section of Camden, authorities said.

title: TOTAL OF ALMOST $1.7 BILLION Unusually Heavy. Volume Linked to Fears of Rate Increases Demand in Question
description: The taxexempt bond market, which has set records all through 1977 by raising well over $40 billion for states and cities, is ending the year with flourish. Almost $L7 billion of new bond issues are scheduled this week, a record for any week, let alone midDecember, when the market normally begins to shut down for the holidays.THURSDAY.

title: Commodities
description: With the announced purchase of an additional 851,600 metric tons of American corn and wheat last week, Moscow fulfilled the minimum annual requirements of the second stage of the fiveyear pact, signed with Washineton in October 1976.

title: The New York Times/Teresa Zabel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 11A tally of the human races can almost be made in Heller's Bakery in the Mount Pleasant section of this city, a city that is predominantly black, where most whites live in separate enclaves, where residential segregation is reasserting itself.

title: Anthony Romano, 78, Lawyer Served As World War II U.S. Commissioner
description: Anthony Romano, a member of the Manhattan law firm of Romano & Schenker and the acting village justice of Piermont, N.Y., died Saturday in Summit Park Hospital in Piermont, N.Y. He was 78 years old and lived in Upper Nyack N.Y.

title: 9 RENEWAL PROJECTS SLATED FOR WEST SIDE
description: Community officials on the West Side have given their final approval to a plan to develop the last nine sites in the controversial West Side urbanrenewal area.

title: Associated Press and The New York Times/Dennis Alexander C. McNally holds a bottle of Chambertin 1875 in front of powerful reflecting light to test the wine's color, and then tests its bouquet from a Baccarat glass. He judged wine superb because it had held its aroma and color,
description: HARTFORD, Dec. I2With all the hushed excitement of the opening an ancient tomb, a collection of 19thcentury French, Italian and California wines discovered inAlbany in September was opened here yesterday for the first time.

title: Indomitable Wife of a Great Man
description: Then I married and lived happily ever after. Thus Sir Winston Churchill described his life with Clementine Ogilvy Hozier. She was, in all respects, suited to the role of consort of one of the greatest and most tempestuous men of his times. If her husband.

title: U.S. Presses Trucking Concerns On Hours and Speeding Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (UPI)Federal pressure is getting trucking concerns to revise their schedules so that drivers are less likely to stay behind the wheel too long or to violate the 55mileanhour speed limit, the Transportation Department said today.

title: A Rewarding Verismo Revival
description: Has the time come to till the longneglected and largely scorned field of verismo opera, those hotblooded turnofthecentury Italian melodramas? One of New York's newest off off Lincoln Center opera organizations, appropriately called the Verismo Opera Company, apparently thinks so. Last spring the company staged its initial production, Cilea's Adriana Lecouvreur. and Sunday night in.

title: VERY REV.STANLEY RODGERS OF SAN FRANCISCO CHURCH
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 12 (AP)The Very Rev. Stanley Rodgers, Dean of Grace Cathedral, suffered a fatal heart attack yesterday shortly after delivering a sermon at the Episcopal church here. He was 49 years old.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 12The Aluminum Company of America announced a multimilliondollar addition to its can recycling facilities at its Alcoa, Tenn., plant. Although Alcoa did not mention a figure, industry sources said a plant of this type costs between $5 million and $10 million.

title: Paroling of Repatriated Prisoners Could Begin Today in San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 12 (AP)Parole hearings began today for the 138 Americans transferred from Mexican jails over the weekend under a historic prisoner exchange treaty, and as many as 44 of them could be freed beginning tomorrow morning.

title: Minorities and Women Playing Bigger Role in Unions
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 12The floor of the convention of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations is largely a sea of white male faces. Nonetheless, minorities and women are becoming an increasingly important factor in the trade union movement.

title: A Revival for Look Is Scheduled in Fall
The Case of the Peripatetic 13thCentury Mayan CalendarBook
description: The international adventure of an unwittingly illegal courier of Mayan arta mildmannered, scholarly banker and former president of the New York City. Y.M.C.A.has come to light after seyPrai years of mystery and speculation in archeological circles.

title: Bratko
description: AI BELHarryette L. Beloved wife of the late Samuel, devoted mother of Roy, Frederic and John, and devoted motherInlaw of Caryl, Susan and Janice. title: Where to Try the Son of Sam

title: Notes on People
description: Capt. Mark Phillips, husband of Princess Anne of Britain, is resigning from the army and will become a gentleman farmer, managing the Gatcombe Park estate that was a wedding gift from his motherinlaw, Queen Elizabeth II. The 29yearold officer said he would train horses for show jumping, at which he and his wife are expert. The couple have long wanted to live in the country. Really, I don't think he felt that there was much future for him in the army, said Peter Phillips, the captain's father. He said that his son was very disappointed to be leaving the service but that for fairly obvious reasons he is not able to get some of the regimental soldiering that he would have to have in order to command a regiment..

title: Pain Is Good for You
description: BERKELEY, Calif.Creativity is the key word that sums up the aims of the new psychologies so popular today. No longer the province of the artist, creativity can be expressed by Everyman as he brings to each aspect of life the intensity of the genius, the extraordinary concern with form of the most gifted craftsman. Creativity. redefines the traumatic situations of life by insisting that they are not painful but pleasurable, not destructive but constructive. Thus, we have creative birth, creative firing, creative scarcity, creative marriage and divorce and, to end it all, creative dying.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Books of The Times
description: The key words here are documentary study. Otto Erich Deutsch, the great German musicologist, started the genre some years ago, in his documentary biographies of Mozart and Schubert. In a documentary biography, only the facts are supplied. The industrious researcher gathers up the source materials, like a boll weevil going through a cotton patch. Where the material is highly abundant and there are space limitations to the book, the compiler has to make a choice, as Mr. Weaver does in this study of Verdi. Otherwise there is no interpretation, no speculation, no fancy writing. Here are the documents. Make of them what you will. But documentary biographies are not as bleak as all that. The material is assembled chronologically, and the researcher supplies a running commentarypart biography, part correction when needed of the information in the documents themselves. For human memory can be fallible, or sentiment may color a reminiscence, or the subject himself may have twisted the facts far, some reason. It is the job of the researcher, who has immersed himself in his subjects, to set the record straight.

title: The China Beyond the Wall
description: One of the maxims of Chinawatching has been that there is so much to watch but so little to see. The slogan has often been paired with the observation that two the major symbols of China remain the Great Wall and the Forbidden City. But the essential isolation of this nation of 900 million is not simply an adage; it is an important factor. fur those who seek to do business with China and bring it into the community of nations.

title: Li. Man Is Accused of Beating Jews in World War II
description: An Israeli woman testified here yesterday that a 73yearold retired carpenter from Mineola, L.I., was a former police commandant in Nazioccupied Latvia in World War II who rounded up Jewsincluding members of her familyfor execution at the Dwinsk ghetto in 1941 and 1942.

title: Goldin Proposes Using U.S. Loans For Financing Economic Projects
description: On the eve of United States Senate hearings on Federal loans to New York City, the city's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, yesterday proposed a comprehensive financing plan that would commit the city to use large portions of new loans for economic development projects.

title: Carter Is Pressing Two Election Panel Nominations Despite Republican Anger and Questions of Propriety;
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  President Carter is pressing ahead with two controversial nominations to the Federal Ekc tion Commission even though one threat ens to worsen his already strained relations with the Republican Congressiona leaderspip and the second has been chal lengedon the ground of propriety.

title: Around the Nation
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Dec. 12 (AP)TheIllinois Supreme Court ruled today that the Ford Motor Company was at fault in designing a gasoline tank that burst into flames after an automobile accident.

title: fitmorial tvrnirrs
description: MURDENForrest D., A Memorial Service will be held on Thursday December 15,1977 at 12 Noon at St. Peter's Lutheran Church City Corp Center, 54 St & Lexington Ave, NYC for Forrest D. Murden who died Div cember 4, 1977.

title: Taxes & Accounting
CHARLES E. BINGHAM
description: Charles E. Bingham, a past president of the American Exporters and Importers Association, died yesterday in Burlington County Memorial Hospital, Mount Holly, N.J. He was 86 years old and lived in Medford Leas, Medford, N.J.

title: MSGR. EDWARD J. JORDAN
description: Msgr. Edward J. Jordan, the pastor of St. Emeric's Roman Catholic Church at 740 East 13th Street from 1962 to hiv retirement in 1974, died Friday in Daytona Beach, Fla., where he was living. lie was 71 years old.

title: Literature of Dissent Rises in China
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 12 A train carrying Mao Tsetung is due to pass over the long steel Yangtze River bridge at Nanking in a few minutes. There have been rumors of an attempt against the life of the leader, and, an alert sentry on the bridge stops a young woman as she tries to cross the tracks.

title: European Jet Is Stirring U.S. Market
description: When Eastern Airline's Flight No. leaves the runway of Newark International Airport today for Orlando, Fla., it will signal the return in major way of European producers to the American market.

title: Koch to Name Henry Geldzahler As Cultural Affairs Commissioner
description: Henry Geldzahler, curator of 20thcentury arts at the Metropolitan Museum, is scheduled to be named the city's new cultural commissioner by the incoming Koch administration.

title: Tax Aid for College Parents: Action Now Appears Certain
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The HouseSenate conference committee on the Social Security bill is deadlocked, and one of the most important pieces of legislation of the year is thus stalled over the unrelated issue of whether a special tax break should be given to the narents of college students.

title: Codd, Leaving Police Post Dec. 31, May Get $46,600aYear Pension
description: New York City's Police Commissioner, Michael J. Codd, who will be leaving his $47,093ayear post on Dec. 31, could receive a gross taxfree pension of $46,600 a year if his request for a lineofduty disability pension is approved.

title: Patriots Caught in a Playoff Bind
description: The New England Patriots won, but at the same time they lost. The Baltimore Colts lost, but won. What's going on here?.

title: MAJOR SPY ACTIVITY DISCLOSED BY BONN
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 12 A major spy scandal was disclosed today as the West German Defense Ministry said in Bonn that three persons who were arrested last year on charges of having spied for East Germany had had access to more than 1,000 secret military documents, including blue??? for Atlantic Alliance defense planning.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Concerning your editorial of Dec. 1 Doing His Number:.

title: News Summary
description: Japan offered trade concessions in Washington that fell considerably hortP of those needed to prevent restrictive measures by Congress, according td Robert S. Strauss, the President's speciaI trade representative. He spoke after the first of a series of critical talks with Japan's Minister of External EConomic Affairs, Nobuhiko Ushiba. Japan proposed to cut tariffs on 300 items exported by the United States and Western Europe and to reduce nontariff barriers on various agricu!.tura'. and industrial items it imports. The United States is demanding that Japan's $8.5 billion trade surplus be cut by onethird to 40 percent within the next 12 months.. Japan's offer represented onethird of the American demands. [Page 1, Column 6.].

title: MEANY IS REELECTED AFL: C.I.O. PRESIDENT
description: Los ANGELES, Dec. 12  George Meany, 83 years old, was reelected today as expected to the presidency of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations.

title: The Now York TIrnes/Chester Higgins Jr. Rosalynn Carter visiting with residents at the Village, Nursing Home in Greenwich Village yesterday.
description: Rosalynn Carter flew to New York yesterday and had lunch with seven elderly nursing home residents, including Auntie Mame..

title: Production of Steel Declined 0.4% To 2.27 Million Tons in the Week
High Court Lets Stand Ruling Reversing Libel Award in Audubon Case
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Supreme Court declined to accept for review today a libel case growing out of a dispute over the effect of pesticides on the nation's bird population.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: SUNDAY NIGHT'S GAMES.

title: U.S. Funds Bring CrossingGuards Total to 500
description: Seventy four new schoolcrossing guards were sworn in at ceremonies at Police Headquarters in Manhattan yesterday, bringing the city's total number of guards to 500.

title: Agreement Is Reached On Olympic Broadcasts
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Dec. 12 (AP)An agreement has been reached after months of negotiations for televising the 1980,Winter Olympic Games from Lake Placid, N.Y., throughout Europe. The agreement was reached in Geneva, where the four groups met secretly this weekend and continued their talks today.

title: JAPAN'S TRADE PLAN CALLED INADEQUATE BY U.S. NEGOTIATOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12  Japan presented to American officials today its pro; posals for dealing with the severe trade imbalance between the two nations, but) the Americans promptly said that the proposals fell considerably short of what was needed.

title: Hispanic and Unequal
description: The New York City Board of Education agreed in 1974 to provide bilingual edutation for Hispanic children with Englishlanguage difficulties. This agreement, called the Aspira consent decree, resolved a Federal lawsuit that had not reached the trial phase. NoW, under pressure from the Department of Health, Education and Welfare to desegregate the city school system, the board is claiming that the bilingual program makes desegregation impossible.

title: People and Business
South's Colleges FacingPressure For Inte gration
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 11  The focus on desegregation in the South is shifting from primary and secondary schools to colleges and universities.

title: MAJOR SPY ACTIVITY DISCLOSED BY BONN
description: WEST BERLIN, Dec. 12A major spy scandal was disclosed today as the West German Defense Ministry said in Bonn that three persons who were arrested last year on charges of having spied for East Germany had had access to more than 1,000 secret military documents, including blueprints fer Atlantic Alliance defense planning.

title: Article 7 -- No Title
description: The November report followed a revised 2.7 percent rise in October, an unchanged picture in September and a 1.3 percent rise in August. Previously, the department had reported retail sales up for October only 1.8 percent.

title: LEILA ROIG, 55, A DIRECTOR FOR A MAJOR CRUISE LINE
Dow Up a Bit as Market Dawdles But National Starch Spurts 203/4
description: The stock market edged higher yesterday; led by Nat onal Starch and Chemical. which soared 20 3/4 points to 65.

title: LAETRILE STUDY DATA FACED BY CHALLENGE
description: Some of the evidence from the animal testing used in a MemorialSloan Kettering Cancer Center report on laetrile last June has been found to be erroreous, according to The Sciences, a magazine published by the New York Academy of Sciences.

title: Norwalk Agrees to Plan on Minority Police Hiring
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec, 12After six months of acrimonious racial controversy that blocked the hiring of new police officers, the city administration here has agreed to a hiring plan that gives preference to minority applicants to the force.

title: Spain Restricts Use of Energy As Part of Austerity Program
description: MADRID, Dec. 12 (Reuters)Spain Introduced new measures today to cut energy consumption as part of a general austerity program.

title: Metropolitan Celebrates Fashions Past, Present
description: Jacqueline Onassis arrived early to take her place on the receiving line and Bianca Jagger came an hour later, just as dinner was announced. Mrs. Onassis was wearing a pleated red strapless dress by Valentino and Mrs. Jagger in a gold lame designed by her escort Halston. Together they set the tone for the gathering last night at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where the clothes that people wore were, for the most part, serious, not dotty.

title: WORKERS SHUT OUT BY CURTISSWRIGHT
description: WOODRIDGE, N.J., Dec. 12Nearly 1,200 whiteand bluecollar workers were forced out of work here today when the CurtissWright Aerospace Corporation, locked its gates in a dispute with two unions over a new contract.

title: The Consensus for'78 Business: A Relatively Good Year
description: The consensus of American business forecasters is that 1978 will be a relatively good year, with real gross national producttotal output corrected for inflationrisine by 4.2 percent.

title: King Hussein, After Conferring With. Vance, Says He Feels a Little More Optimistic
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Dec. 12King Hussein,. after conferring with Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance, said today that Jordan would still not attend the preliminary peace talks that are to begin on Wednesday in Cairo, but he left open the strong possibility that Jordan would join the negotiations for an overall ArabIsraeli settlement at a later stage, possibly in Geneva..

title: A Virtual Lack of Doctors Found In Some Slum Areas of New York
description: In a city that has nearly twice as many physicians per capita as the national average, the New York City Department of Health has found a number of neighborhoods in povertystricken areas with grinding health problems that have virtually no physicians to deal with them.

title: Assets of Hashihama Are Frozen by Court
description: MATSUYAMA, Japan, Dec. 12 (Reuters) Japan's fourthbiggest business collapse since World War II occurred today when a court announced it was freezing the assets of the Hashihama shipbuilding company.

title: Market Place
description: The annuityan oldfashioned way to save for retirementis finding new expression in nocommission policies that offer, at least for the present, high returns on a taxdeferred basis.

title: Investigation of Private HomeCare Programs Urged
description: Warning that New York City might have another Medicaid scandal on its hands, New York Secretary of State Mario M. Cuomo yesterday called for state investigation of privately run home healthcare programs in the city.

title: Dollar Off in New York and Europe
COURT BACKS AIRLINE ON RETIREMENT AT 60
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Supreme Court ruled today that employers can force workers to retire at age 60, despite the Federal ban on age discrimination, if the workers were members of an age60 pension plan before the ban went into effect.

title: When the Patients Are Dying, the Nurses Also Need Help
description: You just can't deal with a cardiac arrest while you're crying, said a nurse in the Medical Intensive Care Unit, describing how it felt to work in that specialized section, where a patient's life may depend on the nurse's ability to control her emotions and be precise at all times.

title: Babble, Babble, GlubGlub
description: The following case histories are excerpted from The Annals of Babble, Montclare Shortside's monumental, immensely moving and poignant, but wise and witty study of human decay. It will soon be published by Skein & Ossa, with illustrations, at $27.50.

title: TWO MEN FOUND SLAIN IN CAR TRUNK AT AIRPORT
description: The partly frozen bodies of two men, hach bound by the hands and shot in the Ilkad, were found by the police of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey yesterday in the trunk of a car ghat had been parked in a lot at Kennedy international Airport since last Tuesday.

title: Delay Is Rumored On OPEC Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12Unsubstantiated reports circulated here today that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting, Countries may postpone its next semiannual meeting, now schduled for Dec. 20, in Caracas.

title: Velsicol and 6 Men Are Accused Analyses Allegedly Showed Possible Cancer Cause
description: The 11count felony indictments alleged: From August 1972 to July 1975 the defendants used the mails and conspired to defraud the United States and conceal material facts from the United States Environmental Protection Agency by failing to submit data which tended to show that heptachlor and chlordane induced tumors in laboratory animals and thus might pose a risk of cancer to humans..

title: DR. FREDERICK GAUDET, 75, PSYCHOLOGY PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Frederick. 1. Gaudet, professor emeritus of psychology at Stevens Institutg of Technology in Hoboken, N. J., died yesterday in his home in Yarmouth, Nova Scotia, after a long illness. He was 75 yeirs old.

title: Cowboy Jack Lopes Onto Stage
description: Robert Altman's McCabe and Mrs. Miller was a film that was deeply ingrained in the American West. One could seeand almost feel  the adventurous frontier atmosphere, the icy, mudcaked landscape, the steamy saloons and the equally steamy bordellos.

title: CurtissWright Locks Out Workers
description: The company's action, which it defined as a work stoppage, began on the midnight shift when about 50 workers were .denied entry to the huge plant. The plant :fills about 146 acres here, about onefifth ,of the total land in this bluecollar community of 8,300 residents in southern Bergen County.

title: MAKER OF PESTICIDES INDICTED ON CHARGES OF HIDING TEST DATA
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 12  The Velsicol Chemical Corporation was indicted today on charges that it conspired to suppress the results of tests that allegedly showed that two widely used pesticides produced by the company may cause cancer in humans. The Federal indictment also named six present or former company employees.

title: BRITISH, ARGENTINES HOLD FALKLAND TALKS
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Britain begins highlevel negotiations in New York tomorrow that may well lead to a change in the status of the Falkland Islands, one of the 15 remaining colonial fragments, of the British Empire.

title: Radio
Payroll Tax Up, Up, Up
description: President Carter seems eager for HouseSenate conferees to break their deadlock on the minor issue of a collegetuition tax credit so they can send him a finished Social Security bill in this calendar year. But lie American people would be better off if the deadlock lasted long enough for this massive tax bill to, be recognized for the economic disaster it is. For example:.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:.

title: Turkish Opposition Leader Says Party Gains in Local Elections
description: ANKARA, Dec. 12 (Reuters)Bulent Ecevit, leader of the opposition, claimed a major victory today after local elections throughout Turkey.

title: Laker Seeks to Start Los Angeles Flights; Low Fare Planned
description: LONDON, Dec. 12Freddie Laker, who inaugurated his Laker Airways cutrate LondonNew York Skytrain flights here in September, announced today that he had applied for permission to operate a daily alr service between Los Angeles and T nnrInn.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RHYTHM ROUNDUP Relatively Ragtime is tomorrow's opening program in a new musical series at Brooklyn College's Center for the Performing Arts Two musical units, the Flatbush Ragtime Ensemble and the Gershwin Sampler Band, will be on hand to trace the ragtime motif from John Philip Sousa to Scott Joplin. Tickets are $4.50 (reservations at 8591180) at St. Vincent's Medical Center. Dr. Wentthe center's Gershwin Theater, one block from the intersection of Flatbush and Nostrand Avenues (the last stop on the IRT No. 3 Flatbush express).

title: JOHN A. BORST
description: John A. Borst. who retired in 1969 as president of German Herold Publishing Company, publishers of the Germanlanguage newspaper StaatsZeitung and Herold, died Sunday in his home at 2482 Wilson Avenue in Bellmore, L. L He was 79 years old.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12The Supreme Court unanimously reversed today the rape conviction of an Illinois man who had been identified by the victim during a pretrial courtroom hearing at which he was not represented by counsel.

title: BUSINESS/FINANCE
The Eonomic Scene
description: Leonard Silk discusses the consensus of American business forecasters that 1978 will be a relatively good year, with real gross national product rising by 4.2 percent. Page 67.

title: Article 9 -- No Title
November Sales Increased 1.5% At Retail Stores.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)Retail stores increased sales 1.5 percent in. November, the second straight monthly gain, the Commerce Department said today.

title: JoblessBenefit Extension Pressed
description: TRENTON, Dec. 12Legislative leaders said today they were lining up votes to extend unemployment benefits to more than 400,000 workers not now covered in New Jerseysome maids, certain agricultural workers and employees of state and local governments, including school districts.

title: U.N. to Meet in May on Arms
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 12 (AP) The General Assembly decided unani, mously today to meet here next May 23 to June 28 in a special session on disarmament. Adopting resolutions recommended by its main political committee, the Assembly also asked a preparatory committee for the special session to draw up a final document. or documents for adoption..

title: Lakers Kermit Washington Fined $10,000
description: Disturbed by excessive violence in the National Basketball Association, Commissioner Larry O'Brien yesterday handed out the largest fine in sports history. He penalized Kermit Washington, a Los Angeles Lakers forward, $10,000 and suspended him for at least 60 days and possibly for the rest of the season.

title: The Baron of Bluegrass
description: On this particular day the pumps at this particular gas station in Lexington, Ky., were occupied. At one, the chairman of the department of mathematics at the University of Kentucky filed his Ford, at the other, Adolph Rupp, the university's basketball coach, filled his Cadillac.

title: Carter Nominates Five to Board Of U.S. Legal Aid Organization
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 (AP)President Carter announced his choices today for five nominations to the board of directors of the Legal Services Corporation, the nonprofit organization established by Congress two years ago to finance local groups offering legal aid to the needy.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Excerpts From an Interview With Begin on the Prospects of the Cairo Conference
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 13Following are excerpts from the transcript of Prime Minister Menahem Begin's interview with The New York Times:

title: Migrants Are Going Home to Appalachia
description: The Now York Times/David Brown

title: Reporter's Notebook: Meany, On Rostrum, Belies His Age
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 13He shuffled slowly through the hallways, bent over his cane, but when George Meany is on the rostrum before the 900 delegates at the national convention of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, he seems straighter and taller, his voice rings out unwavering and strong.

title: Jazz Group Treasures Familiarity
description: ARNIE LAWRENCE'S sevenpiece jazz group, Treasure Island, which played at the Universal Jazz Coalition's Monday night session at the Village Gate, has been together for two years and showed the results of this relatively long period of working together.

title: Jersey High Court By 5 to 2 Voids Ban On Unmarried Sex
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13The New Jersey Supreme Court overturned today an old but rarely enforced law forbidding sexual relations between a man and an unmarried woman, ruling it an unconstitutional invasion of privacy. The ruling did not apply to homosexual relations.

title: DAVID FREUDENTHAL, 82, EXBLOOMINGDALE'S AIDE
description: David M. Freudenthal, former vice president and treasurer of Blooraingdale's and deputy administrator of the Marshall Plan in Rome. died at the age of 82.

title: Best Buys: Chicken, Chops and Fish
description: IN THE LULL between Thanksgiving and Christmas, New Yorkers have gotten two consecutive weeks of holidays from rising food prices.

title: Child's World
description: VISIONS of puppies or kittens are dancing in some little heads these nights. What more lovable Christmas gift could there be for a childand for the whole familythan a warm, furry fourfooted one?

title: VANCE, IN DAMASCUS, FINDS ASSAD ADAMANT
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 13President Hafez alAssad told Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance today that Syria was deeply wounded and was not only unswerving in its opposition to the Cairo meeting but also could not see at this time how it could even attend a Geneva conference to bring about a Middle East Peace.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THE CROWDED bus, says William Cole, came to a halt outside Macy's, a quarter of a block from the designated bus stop. On the sidewalk stood a tall blind woman, tapping her cane, clearly believing she was standing at the stop. A few yards away, a sidewalk Santa noticed the woman, left his post and led her by the elbow tIV door of the bus, where the driverin the accusfgmed fashionsat immobile behind his wheel, starfrig neither right ncr left. only a small jump.

title: Careers
description: Jobs don't make headlines usually but headlines can indicate jobs.

title: Williams Stresses Need of Accounting To Reflect Inflation
description: Sounding a favorite themehow continuing inflation has distorted the economic reality of reported corporate earningsHarold M. Williams, chairman of the Securitites and Exchange Commission, yesterday called again for a form of inflation accounting.

title: Hawks Tie Islanders, 22
description: The Chicago Black Hawks tied the Islanders, 22, last night at the Nassau Coliseum on Jean Savard's goal early in the third period. Page B20.

title: Bell Appoints 10 to Replace Group That Quit Investigation of F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13  Attorney General Griffin B. Bell named 10 persons today to take over the problem of allegedly illegal breakins by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in New York. He thus replaced the group of five attorneys that quit the investigation last week after a sharp dispute with him over the proper strategy for handling the case.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: RCA Tower's Demolition Ends a Radio Era
description: ROCKY POINT, L.I., Dec. 13Like a giraffe whose knees had suddenly buckled, the 40story RCA radio antenna tower crumpled to the ground this rainy afternoon, ending an era in communications history.

title: Guardian of Art
description: Henry Geldzahler

title: Child Alive After Plane Crash
description: KERRVILLE, Tex., Dec. 13 (AP)Rescuers found a 3-year-old girl alive in the wreckage of a singleengine plane today, two days after the craft crashed in rugged hill country, killing her parents and brother, the authorities said. The survivor was identified as Shera Sneed of San Antonio. A spokesman for a local hospital said she was in stable but undetermined condition with a fractured arm and leg. Killed in the crash were Jerry Sneed, a lawyer, his wife, Suzie, and Shannon, a 6-year-old son, officials said.

title: Reds
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 13 (UPI)Pedro Borbon, the Cincinnati Reds relief pitcher; is scheduled to go on trial tomorrow on two misdemeanor assault charges. The charges stem from an Oct. 3 incident at a Cincinnati disco. Two Cincinnati men accused Borbon of attacking them.

title: Carter Authorizes $325 Million For Career Education Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)President Carter today signed a bill authorizing a new fiveyear career education program costing $325 million.

title: For New Bakeries, The Sweet Smell of Success
description: BEYOND DOUBT, the current season has to be considered prime time for the eating of cakes and cookies, pies and pastries. There could be no better time, therefore, to report on the group of  new bakeries that opened during the past year.

title: The Question Remains
description: One answer lies in complexity. Was it not expecting too much to hope that Congress could act promptly on anything so complicated as the 103page National Energy Plan, replete with a welter of taxes and an array of incentives, proposed by the Carter Administration?

title: MANISCALCO INQUIRY DROPPED IN BROOKLYN
description: An investigation into charges that John Maniscalco had often beaten his wife, Rosemarywho died last week after 12 days in a comawas dropped yesterday by District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A seclusive elderly couple and their daughter, all apparently slashed to death, were found in their flaming beds in Elizabeth, N.J., yesterday morning and their son discovered unconscious in his bedroom died later at a local hospital. The police identified the victims as Samuel Silverblatt, 78 years old, Beatrice, 71, Blanche, 46, and Harold Silverblatt, 35. The police said evidence had been found that the son had slain the others and doused them with gasoline to burn the bodies.

title: Kitchen Oldies Come Back
description: Grandmother might resent the fact that her applebutter stirrer is now a wall rack for pots and pans, or that her meat tenderizer has become an objet d'art. Yet the kitchens of yesteryear are currently being ransacked for implements which, if not put to their original use, are employed imaginatively or simply displayed to be admired for their design, quaintness, originality and nostalgic character. Supply following demand, kitchen articles are now in the marketplace, highly prized when antiques in prime condition, amusing collectibles when they lack refinement and vintage.

title: COUNCIL PASSES BILL GIVING 51 OFFICIALS AND MEMBERS RAISES
description: A controversial bill that gives substantial raises to the city's top 51 incoming elected New York City officials, including the Mayor, the Comptroller and the City Council President, was approved last night by the City Council. 33 to 7.

title: A Controversy On 3 Weapons
description: A growing controversy over three United States strategic nuclear weapons systems is expected to affect the American position in the negotiations with the Soviet Union on limiting strategic weapons.

title: Corporate Services Up in. New York Although Big Companies Have Left
description: While New York City had a net loss of 38 leading corporate headquarters from 1965 to 1975, a new study yesterday reported that businesses serving corporationsuch as banks, lawyers and accountantscontinued to expand and more than compensated for the loss.

title: BEGIN SAYS 2 SIDES WILL EXCHANGE TREATY DRAFTS IN CAIRO, DELAYING PALESTINIAN AND TERRITORY ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel will hold talks here Friday with President Carter on the efforts under way to reach a Middle East peace settlement.

title: A Squabble in Beirut Delays Vance Party
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 13 (AP)A motorcade carrying Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance was held up briefly outside Beirut's presidential palace today while Lebanese soldiers squabbled with gendarmes escorting it.

title: Merger Stocks Rise but Others Sag
description: Selected stocks in takeover situations moved ahead briskly yesterday, while the general market edged lower on light trading volume.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Personal Health
description: ABOUT 23 MILLION adult Americans have high blood pressure, a major cause of premature death and disability in this country. Most people think of high blood pressure as a disease of old age, but doctors now realize that the problem actually has its roots in childhood.

title: Dr. Alvan Barach, Breathing Expert
description: Dr. Alvan L. Barach, a pioneer in respiratory therapy and developer of the first practical oxygen tent, died yesterday at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 82 years old and lived at 72 East 91st Street.

title: That Righteous U.N. Crowd Rides Again
description: While Egyptians and Israelis sit down together to begin serious negotiation of the issues between them, half a world away at the United Nations there is antiIsraeli business as usual. Today's Installment will be a vote in the General Assembly on a resolution censuring Israeland only Israelfor its economic relations with South Africa. In the symbolic politics of the Assembly, any resolution aimed even glancingly at South Africa is assured of passage, and the Arab and Soviet bloc governments pursuing their antiIsraeli campaign will find ample support from Africa and from some other thirdworld nations.

title: Choice of Geldzahler Stirs Dispute
description: THE CHOICE BY MayorElect Edward I. Koch of Henry Geldzahler, curator of 20thcentury art at the Metropolitan Museum, as the city's new Cultural Commissioner has brought a complaint from one member of the search committee that recommended him, that Mr. Geldzahler had the lowest priority on a final list of four candidates.

title: DOLLAR IS BATTERED AS MARKETS DEDUCE U.S. WILL NOT AID IT
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Dec. 13The dollar absorbed its severest battering in months today as foreignexchange markets concluded that the Carter Administration was still opposed to taking any steps to shore up the ailing American currency.

title: 7 Are Killed in Dormitory Fire at Providence College
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Dec. 13A flash fire on the top floor of a women's dormitory at Providence College killed seven students and injured 16 others early this morning.

title: H.E.W., IN SEXBIAS MOVE, CUTS 27 SCHOOL DISTRICTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 (AP)The Department of Health, Education and Welfare told 27 more school districts today that they would be ineligible for new Federal grants because they had failed to sign pledges not to discriminate Against women.

title: ENERGY CONFEREES OFFER COMPROMISE TO BREAK DEADLOCK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13House energy conferees tried to break the natural gas deadlock today with a compromise proposal on intrastate gas sales, but the Senate side remained too deeply split over prices to respond.

title: Gregg, Facing Dismissal, Quits As Browns Coach
description: Forrest Gregg resigned yesterday as head coach of the Cleveland Browns, an unexpected act and one reflecting Gregg's discomfort with the stated pur. pose of the Cleveland owner, Art Modell, to reevaluate everything at the end or the season. The proud Gregg, who was Vince Lombardi's favorite player. among the Green Bay Packers a decade ago, preferred to step aside before being pushed aside

title: Court Investigator Appointed
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13 (UPI)Robert W. .Meserve, former president of the American Bar Association, has been appointed to investigate alleged conflicts of interest of Massachusetts Superior Cour Chief Justice Robert M. Bonin. Mr. Meserve was selected by the Supreme Court's Committee on Judicial Responsibility during a fourhour meeting last night.

title: McGuire Expected to Head Police; Wagner Jr. Likely Planning Chief
description: Robert J. McGuire

title: 6 Are Hurt in Turnpike Collision
description: Icy roads and streets caused by sleet and freezing rain resulted in scores of accidents throughout central New Jersey yesterday, including a collision on the turnpike near Woodbridge involving a school bus and a 16passenger van carrying handicapped children.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Only in America, Only in New York

title: Conference Opens Today
description: CAIRO, Dec. 13Cairo is festooned with banners, and the Egyptians are going all out to accommodate Israelis who have arrived for peace talks tomorrow.

title: Seizures of Goods Of Street Peddlers By Police Voided
description: The police practice of confiscating the merchandise of licensed peddlers who get summonses for violating vending ordinances has been ruled invalid by Justice Hilda G. Schwartz in State Supreme Court. Her action could affect the new drive by the city to reduce peddling in busy areas of Manhattan.

title: Skiing

description: ENTRIES

title: U.S. Officials Say Soviet Mounts A Major Arms Airlift to Ethiopia
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13The Soviet Union has mounted a large airlift of arms and military equipment to Ethiopia, flying over some countries without permission and filing misleading flight plans at refueling stations, State Department officials asserted today.

title: Four Children Die in Fire
description: CHESTER, Dec. 13 (UPI)Four children were killed and two persons were injured in a fire in their home last night. the police said. Officials at Crozer-Chester Medical Center indentified the victims as Carolyn Pinder. 2 years old, Ikeya Pinder, 4, Shemika Pinder, 5, and Jeana Pinder. 10.

title: A New Wrinkle for an Old Art
description: When I visited my son, a professor at Yale, and found an origami book in his living room, I thought he was cracked, the distinguishedlooking business executive was saying. But look at me now. At 66, I'm hooked.

title: Knicks Win On Basket By Shelton
description: Lonnie Shelton played the hero's role twice in the last seven seconds last night at Madison Square Garden. His second basket in that span came as the buzzer sounded and provided the Knicks with a 107106 victory over the Atlanta Hawks in a poor exhibition of National Basketball Association play.

title: VIETNAMESE INFLUX DISTURBS AUSTRALIA
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Dec. 12The arrival on Australia's northern coast of a sudden rash of fishing boats carrying Vietnamese refugees in the last few weeks has provoked unusual xenophobia in a country that, since the end of World War II, has become accustomed to receiving large numbers of non-Anglo-Saxon immigrants.

title: Gambler Agrees to Pay Fines
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 13 (UP1)United States Attorney Blair A. Griffith today accepted a commitment on behalf of Robert Iannelli, convicted head of a sports gambling business, to pay fines totaling $27,000 within six moths. The commitment removed Mr. Griffith's active opposition to Mr. Iannelli's scheduled release tomorrow from Allenwood Federal Prison Camp.

title: U.S. Reports Gains on Arms Pacts
description: GENEVA, Dec. 13Paul C. Warnke, President Carter's chief arms negotiator, said today that he was quite hopeful we can reach effective treaties with the Soviet Union on a further limitation of strategic nuclear weapons, a comprehensive ban on nuclear explosions and stabilization of military forces in the Indian Ocean.

title: Plane Taking Team To Basketball Came Crashes, Killing 30
description: EVANSVILLE, Ind., Dec. 13A chartered DC3 airplane carrying 31 persons, including the University of Evansville basketball team, crashed and burned soon after it took off in dense fog tonight. One young man survived and he was reported in critical condition.

title: Beefing Up the Vegetarian Meal
description: One problem vegetarians have is that no one ever invites them for dinner. Except, maybe, other vegetarians. Even the most adventurous of cooks, when faced with the thought of placing a vegetarian at the dinner table, blanks out when it comes to a menu.

title: Jane Austen PlayFourzd
description: LONDON, Dec. 13k previously unknown play by Jane Austen was sold today to the owner of a rural bookshop who dashed into the Sotheby Parke Bernet auction galleries Just moments before the bidding.

title: British and Freric Leaders Agree on Closer Ties
description: LONDON; Dec. 13 (UPI)Britain and France pledged closer economic cooperation today at the end of two days of talks between Prime Minister James Callaghan and President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of France.

title: Wine Talk
description: WINE LOVERS come into their own at holiday time. They have the key to the most desirable of all lastminute giftgiving routines. Anyone else may have fretted for weeks over what to give that grumpy uncle in Boston. The wine enthusiast sends him a bottle of Dom Perignon. What? He doesn't like champagne? What difference does that make? There is no finer gift. That's an end to it, grumpy uncle or not.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 13T. Edward Hollander, the State Chancellor of Higher Education, will meet tomorrow with members of the Essex County College board of trustees to discuss a study committee report that recommends .replacing the board because of the lack of confidence expressed throughout the county.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 13 (UPI)President Carter will hold a news conference at 11 A.M. Thursday, the White House announced today.

title: Bridge:
description: In general, a player who has support for his partner's overcall should show it immediately. If he introduces a new suit, he is virtually denying support for his partner. But there are some rare situations in which the exact opposite is true.

description: UNQUESTIONABLY, the traffic is bad, and it is getting worse, and often during the day now an even moderately brisk man can walk along Fifth Avenue, keeping pace with, and sometimes moving faster than, the traffic. This means it is almost Christmas.

title: Many Traffic and Pedestrian Accidents Result From Sleet and Ice
description: Sleet and ice made driving and walking hazardous in the metropolitan area yesterday and there were scores of traffic accidents. Many people were injured when they fell on icy streets.

description: John W. Hanlon, who retired in 1971 as secretary of American Brands Inc., died Monday morning in his home, 75 Borcher Avenue, Yonkers. He was 71 years old.

description: NAIROBI, Dec. 13 (Reuters)--Oginga Odinga, Kenya's former vice praident. who was detained by police in Nairobi last Saturday. was released today but under investigation for making a death threat, he told reporters.
