description: Music

title: Lisbon Forms Antiterrorist Unit
description: LISBON, Dec. 18 (Reuters)Portuga. will set up a special antiterrorist group to combat extremist operations and kidnappers, the Interior Ministry has announced. The statement said the new group would receive special training an equipment, but gave no further details.

title: Jean P. Millon, Former Official Of the Coty Corporation, at 81
description: Jean Pierre Millon, a former vice president of Coty Inc. who was long active in the city's FrenchAmerican community, died yesterday of lung cancer in his home at 1192 Park Avenue, He was 81 years old.

description: In a significant move, Governor Carey has declined flatly to endorse Comptroller Arthur Levitt for renomination but has expressed a strong preference for Lieut. Gov. Mary Anne Krupsak to be his running mate again next year.

description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

description: The continuing slide in the dollar's value against other major currencies bringing smaller earnings to shareholders of American multinational corporations and bigger headaches to executives of those companies

description: A critically wounded offduty police officer was found in the parking lot of a bar in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn yesterday morning, with bullet wounds in the chest and stomach.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The Carter Administration still hopes to win Congreessional approval of some of the proposed election law revisions that it announced with such fanfare last March, but the most ambitious and controversial Proposals appear to be dead.

title: Stage: juilliard Players Do Spring Awakening
description: To that small pantheon of great contemporary stage directors, one must add the name of Liviu Ciulei. In common with Peter Brook and Jerzy Grotowski, this Rumanian director is a true innovator in the theater, as is amply demonstrated in his brilliant production of Frank Wedekind's Spring Awakening.

title: Wenzel Takes Giant Slalom
description: LAAX, Switzerland, Dec. 18 (AP)Andreas Wenzel of Lichtenstein won the men's giant slalom European Cup event today, pushing the Olympic giant slalom champion, Heini Hemmi of Switzerland, into second place in the cup standing,

title: WheelingPittsburgh Plans to Lift Prices of Sheet Steel by 7% on Jan. 3
description: The WheelingPittsburgh Steel Corporation, the ninthlargest steelmaker in the nation, announced yesterday that it would raise its prices for basic sheet products by 7 percent on Jan. 3.

title: Polisario Guerrillas Charge French Attack in West Sahara
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 18 (AP)The Polisario guerrilla movement charged today that French warplanes attacked its forces in the Western Sahara for two days this week with phosporous bombs and napalm. causing heavy casualities.

title: Two Short Beckett Plays Are Chamber Music
description: Two brief new plays by Samuel Beckett, That Time and Footfalls, opened yesterday at the Manhattan Theater Club. They were directed by Alan Schneider, who brought Waiting for Godot to the United States two decades ago and has introduced Beckett's dramatic work here ever since.

title: Sweden Tops Nordiques In Soviet Tourney, 62
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18 (AP)Swedes scored four goals in the second period and defeated the Quebec Nordiques of the World Hockey Association, 6-2 today in the Izvestia hockey tournament.

title: Sir Ralph Cochrane, Organized Dam Buster
description: LONDON, Monday, Dec. 19 (Reuters)Sir Ralph Cochrane, who organized the dambuster raids that breached Germany's Mohne and Eider dams In 1943. died on Saturday at the age of 82. His military career began with the Royal Navy in 1912, and his last military post was Vice Chief of the Air Staff, which he held from 1950 to 1952. During World War II Sir Ralph headed the Number 5 Bomber Group, whose greatest achievement was the breaching of the two dams, widely thought to be impregnable, which provided power for German industry in the Ruhr. His specially created 617 Squadron used a revolutionary bouncing bomb that first skimmed the surface of the water behind a dam before exploding when it struck the dam's wall.

title: Credit Market Smoothly Handles Record Week of TaxFree Issues
description: The taxexempt bond market raised $1.7 billion for states and cities last week, and it accomplished that record financing feat handily, dealers were happy to report last Friday, when it was all over. interest rates had declined during the final week in November and the first week in December in anticipation of the heavy volume of bonds. There was not much more adjustment in yields list week and yet most of the bonds were sold to investors.

title: Who Will Succeed Koch in Congress? 960 Voters Hold a Key Role
description: In this season of heavy entertaining, few guests are in greater demand than a select group of 960 \lanhattanites who have suddenly found themselves flooded with invitations to cocktail parties, kaffeeklatsches, intimate athome gatherings and more formal evenings devoted to serious discussion.

title: ERITREAN INSURGENTS RUNNING MINISTATE
description: KEREN, Ethiopia, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Eritrean rebels seeking independence from Ethiopia have set up their own ministate in which they are able to provide electricity and supply water and schools, hospitals, and bus service.

title: Events Today
Giamatti, Literature Scholar, a Leading Yale Choice
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 18A. Bartlett Giamatti, a 39-year-old Renaissance literature scholar, emerged today as the leading candidate to become the 18th president of Yale University.

title: Bucs
description: Tampa Bay did it again. The Buccaneers, who won their first game last week after 26 tries in the National Football League, gave their fans a Christmas present yesterday by turning in another surprise, a 177 triumph over St. Louis in Tampa, Fla.

title: Officials Debate a Rapid Transit Proposal in Honolulu
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 18A plan to build a rapid transit corridor through the congested heart of Honolulu has picked up important support and important opposition in recent weeks.

title: Gertrude Cooper, at 88, Supervised Vanderbilt Estate in Hyde Park
description: Gertrude Sturgis Cooper, who was superintendent of the Vanderbilt estate in Hyde Park, N.Y., for the National Park Service in 1940.45 and then assistant director and director until 1948 of Greenwich House, the settlement house at 27 Barrow Street in New York, died yesterday in a convalescent hospital in Chester, Conn. She was 88 years old and lived in Killingworth. Conn.

title: Bach's Christmas Oratorio
description: Every Christmas, David Randolph becomes one of New York's most conspicuously busy musicians. This year he is engaged in a series of five Messiah performances with the Masterwork Chorus. And Saturday night at Carnegie Hall he directed another of his groups, the St. Cecilia Chorus, in Bach's Christmas Oratorio.

title: Books of The Times
description: When I started to work on this book, writes Hugh Fordin in an author's note to Getting to Know Him, an authorized biography of Oscar Hammerstein 2d, people wanted to know why I wanted to write the story of a man who didn't have a mean bone in his body, who was loved by everyone, revered by both his friends and fans.

title: FRANK W. CALLAHAN
description: Frank W. Callahan, a former president of the bond brokerage firm of Tessel, Patrick, Ostrau Inc., died Saturday at Southside Hospital in Bay Shore, L.I., after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 45 Quail Run in East Islip.

title: William Loeb and Wife Hospitalized in Crash
description: RENO, Dec. 18 (AP)William Loeb, the publisher of The Manchester Union Leader in New Hampshire. and his wife, Nackey, were seriously injured yesterday in a traffic accident south of here.

title: Zuccotti on Academy Board
description: Former First Deputy Mayor John E. Zuccotti has joined the board of directors of the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The Princeton and Yale Law School graduate served in Washington and helped to draw up Federal housing and development legislation before joining the city administration. Mr. Zuccotti's familiarity with all levels of government will be of invaluable assistance to us, said Harvey Lichtenstein, president of the academy. Mr. Zuccotti is now in private law practice.

title: SLUR TO ENVOY'S WIFE TIED TO CARTER AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18At a recent dinner party attended by the Ambassadors of both Egypt and Israel following the visit to Israel by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, Hamilton Jordan, a top White House aide, made an offensive remark, according to some guests.

title: New Corporate Bonds
For a Large Corporate Tax Cut
description: We are going to have a tax cut in 1978that is not difficult to forecast. Capital investment has fallen far short of expectations and, as a consequence, the economy and employment growth have turned sluggish.

title: A SUPERNOVA IN 1006 IS CALLED BRIGHTEST
description: From an extensive survey of Oriental, monastic and Arabic chronicles, scientists have concluded that a stellar explosion that lighted the sky day and night in 1006 A.D. was the closest and most brilliant such supernova in recorded history.

title: Banks Lose Out in Surge Of Lending by Companies
description: A fierce battle is in progress between commercial banks and industrial corporations in the hot competition to lend cash to, oddly enough, other industrial companies. Since a decade ago, when shortterm lending by one corporation to another was a mere $757 million, this business has soared to $15.5 billion, cutting out the banks along the way.

title: Man Ruled Unfit in 1975 For Murder Trial Is Held Competent After Escape
description: A 61-year-old man ruled incompetent to stand trial two years ago on two murder charges will be scheduled for trial for the murders today after a judge's decision Friday that he is competent.

title: Bronx Blaze Kills Two Children, Including Boy Firemen Delivered
description: Two children were killed and a third was critically injured yesterday in a fire that broke out in their Bronx apartment when their mother left them alone briefly to go to a store, One victim was a baby boy delivered in the apartment six months ago by three firemen who tried in vain to save him yesterday.

title: Iona (71) Keeps Rolling, But Kentucky Is Next Foe
description: Jim Valvano did not waste $300 scouting Kentucky Saturday night. The Iona coach has better ways to use the money in his meager basketball budget. Besides, he said yesterday, I can always fall back on the Italian Scouting Service, headed by the Godfather himself, Lou Carnesecca.

title: Italian Communists Demanding Greater Policy Role
description: ROME, Dec. 18The Italian Communist Party is increasing its demands for a greater voice in the decisions of the minority Government of Prime Minister Giulo Andreotti than it has had under the a legislative arrangement worked out last summer.

title: Developers Seeking to Build Secaucus Rail Depot
description: SECAUCUS, Dec. 18Hartz Mountain Industries, which is developing land here along the Hackensack River, has indicated that it would like to build a train station to simplify commuting to New York.

Dr. Stephanie Stolz WedtoDonaldBaer
description: Dr. Stephanie B. Stolz and Prof. Donald M. Baer were married yesterday in the Lawrence (Kan.) Jewish Community Center. Rabbi Michael Zedek of Kansas City performed the ceremony.

description: A new monthly food magazinea real family affair, published and edited by husband-and-wife teamsis due out in April, with financial help coming from a major publication. No, it's not Good Housekeeping or Family Circle. It's Playboy.

title: DISSIDENTS IN PRAGUE PLAN NEW STATEMENT
description: VIENNA, Dec. 18The Czechoslovak dissident group that for a year has been publicly criticizing the Communist regime in Prague is preparing a new document denouncing violations of human and civil rights, a prominent member said today.

98 Sewage Projects in State Due To Get $875 Million Federal Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18Ninetyeight sewagetreatment projects in New Jersey are scheduled for financing as a result of the belated approval by Congress of the new cleanwater bill. The biggest Federal allotment for 1978 would he $23 million for a project in Hudson County, according to the state's Department of Environmental Protection.

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 18There was no immediate official reaction to Prime Minister Begin's proposals in Arab political quarters here, but they saw no reason for optimism.

description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 18The Baltimore Colts tremendous four touchdown comeback for a victory against the New England Patriots today was blemished by one of those questionable calls by the officials that left a lot of people angry, especially the players and coaching staff of the Miami Dolphins.

description: Charging that New York City's Board of Water Supply is an expensive, inefficient anachronism, City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday called for its abolishment to save S2.6 million a year.

description: It's been a long time, nearly nine years, since Zara Nelsova played a New York recital, but this season the cellist has compensated for her absence with a pair of recitals at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. There would also have been a third if a bout of flu had not caused her to cancel the first concert in the series.

title: Large Deficit and Hard Decisions On Priorities Face Next Yale Head
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 18When the 16 members of the Yale Corporation install the next president of Yale University, they will be putting him in charge of an institution with a substantial deficit, an outmoded administrative structure, a floundering capital funds drive and a loyal but disquieted alumni.

description: David Young 3d, a Boonton, N.J., lawyer who was president of the New Jersey Senate in 1953, died Saturday in Boca Raton (Fla.) Community Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived on Southfield Road in Boonton Township, N.J.

General Harris, a native of Danville, Va., currently is chief of staff of SAC. He will replace Lieut. Gen. James Hill, who has become chief of the North American Defense Command.

Koch Urged to Speed Local Participation on Budget

title: Rose Wright, Dancer, Bride of Robert A. Anderson

description: SPOTSWOOD, Dec. 18Cecelia Ostapiej is leading a neighborhood campaign in this small, semirural community to remove a new 50foot high citizensband transmission tower in her nextdoor neighbor's backyard, which she says hradcasts vulgarities. and homosexual jokes through her television set and radios.

description: Wellheeled selfemployed persons who would like to shelter from current tax considerably more than $7,500 a year might want to get in touch with their neighborhood actuaries.

title: U.S. Tells South Africa to Accept Atomic Curbs or Face Fuel Cutoff
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 19The Carter Administration has threatened to withhold future supplies of uranium fuel from South Africa unless it agrees to stricter international controls to prevent its atomic energy program from being used to develop nuclear weapons, officials said today.

title: Taxes & Accounting Tougher Treatment for Fringe Benefits
description: The recent Supreme Court decision that cash meal allowances paid to New Jersey state troopers are includable in the troopers' gross income and thus subject to taxation probably will result in tougher tax treatment for a variety of fringe benefits, ranging from subsidized company meals to personal use of corporate jets, according to tax experts.

title: A. T .&T . Raised Net In Fourth Quarter 13% to $1.16 Billion
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, continuing as the world's largest money maker, reported yesterday a 13 percent jump in its fourth fiscal guarter earnings, to $1.16 billion. That lifted net for the full year to Nov. 30 to $4.5 billion.

title: New Coal Fields in West Lessen Effects of the Strike
description: SARPY CREEK, Mont.There are no pickets and there are no scabs, but the coal is moving.

title: Italians List the 20 BestDressed
description: ROMEAnwar Sadat didn't arrive. Neither did Jacqueline Onassis. But 13 of the 20 women and men named by the Italian Fashion Institute as the best dressed for 1977 did come to collect their prizes last night in the tapestryhung reception rooms of the Palazzo Pecci Blunt.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, the world's largest chemical producer, announced in a yearend statement yesterday that its 1977 sales and earnings were well ahead of 1976. Last year the company cleared $459 million, or $9.30 a share, on sales of $8.36 billion.

title: Meadowlands Racing
description: FIRST$5,500, cl., Inons., 3YO and up, 6f.

title: Creative Head Warns Against TV Toughs
description: Violence is beginning to creep into TV commercials now, in the view of Eugene F. Novak. president and creative director of RumrillHoyt, who doesn't cozy to the idea,

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Werblin's Leaving Stirs Concern in New Jersey
description: The suaaen departure last week of David A. (Sonny) Werblin from the Meadowlands sports complex for the presidency of Madison Square Garden Corporation has left an element of confusion west of the Hudson.

title: What Are the Visitation Rights of Grandparents in a Divorce?
description: Ever since the divorce, the Christmas presents addressed to their grandson have been returned, unopened, by their former daughterinlaw. Now, three years later, the grandfather. was talking of ending this pitiful ritual, but the grandmother would not hear of it. I am going to send a present to Billy, she told him. You know we always send a present.

title: Some Egyptian Aides Voice Disappointment at First Reports of Israeli Peace Proposals
description: CAIRO, Dec, 19Senior Egyptian officials said privately today that they were disappointed by first ireports of the peace proposal discussed by Prime Minister Menahem Begin in Washington.

title: Begin Plan Gets Unfavorable Reaction From P.L.Q. and Arab States
description: BEIRUT, Dec. 19The Palestine Liberation Organization rejected Prime Minister Menahem Begin's peace plan today and warned that as long as the Palestinians remained without a homeland there would be no peace in the Middle East.

title: People and Business
description: Paul Koltun, who is to retire at the end of the year as chairman and chief change, was appointed yesterday as chairman of the Financial Accounting executive of the American Stock ExStandards Advisory Council, a new position. The council works closely with the Financial Accounting Standards Board, chief rulemaking body in the industry.

title: Annie Hall Picked as Best of '77 By National Film Critics Society
description: The National Society of Film Critics yesterday selected Annie Hall, the comedy starring, directed and cowritten by Woody Allen, as the best film of 1977. The group, whose membership comprises 29 critics from New York and other cities, named Luis Bufiuel's That Obscure Object of Desire and Steven Spielberg's Close Encounters of the Third Kind as second and third choices.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
Bridge:
description: A group of big winners added to their collection of titles by winning the knockout team title at the New York Regional Championships at the New York Hilton Hotel Sunday.

title: TV: Holidays
description: Perhaps it is just a case of holidayseason opportunism, but television's determination to be inspirational has become distressingly sticky.

title: Kupfer Following Cauthen's Lead
description: With Steve Cauthen, the 17yearold sensation who became almost as famous a rider as Paul Revere during his oneyear stand at New York's tracks, having departed for points west, another promising rookie has come into focus at Aqueduct.

title: SCIENTISTS PRESSING ABSOLUTEZERO HUNT
description: To the uninitiated. it seems scarcely more exciting than a pool of clear water, shimmering within the transparent layers of a huge Thermos bottle.

title: Rangers Get An ExBruin, Dallas Smith
description: The New York Rangers announced yesterday that they had signed Dallas Smith, a 36yearold freeagent defenseman, for the remainder of this season. Smith was formerly with the Boston Bruins.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: New Bond Issues
description: Monday, Dec. 19, 1977

title: Cowboys and Rams Are Installed as Heavy Favorites for Playoff Games
description: The odds set yesterday for the four divisional playoff games of the National Football League reflect the view that two of the teams in the elimination series leading to the Super Bowl do not belong there, Chicago and Min??eso??a. Harran's Kace Book of Reno, Nev., established the Denver Broncos as 2point favorites over the Pittsburgh Steelers and the Oakland Raiders as 3 points better than the Baltimore Colts in the two American Conference contests coming up on Saturday.

title: Sometimes the Ratings Game Can Be a Real Drag
description: Ladies and gentlemen, we are visiting today at the North Pole where, as you know, a titanic struggle is under way to determine who will succeed Santa Claus. With me here is one of the leading contenders, Sir Walter Raleigh.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, DECEMBFR 19, 1977

title: McDonnell Wins Tanker Plane Job
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)The Pentagon announced today that theMcDonnell Douglas Corporation had been chosen over the Boeing Company as the primary contractor for the Air Force's advanced tankercargo aircraft mission.

title: HIGH COURT ASKED TO BAR SEARCHES OF NEWS OFFICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)Lawyers for nearly all American newspapers and hrcadcasters asked the Supreme Court today to rule that the police cannot obtain a warrant and make a surprise search of newspaper offices looking for evidence of a crime.

title: Bombing Wrecks Fauchon of Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 19Two bombs wrecked Fauchon, the most renowned food delicacy store in France. before dawn today.

title: TWO TIMES REPORTERS WIN PENNEYMISSOURI AWARDS
description: Winners of the 18th annual PenneyMissouri Newspaper Awards announced by the School of Journalism of the University of Missouri include two top prizes of $1,000 each to reporters of The New York Times.

title: The Standings
description: SUNDAY NIGHT'S GAMES Atlanta 134. Phoenix 120 (2 overtimes). Cleveland 101. Golden State 95. Detroit 117, New Orleans 108. Kansas City 115, Indiana 114. Los Angeles 104, Boston 97. Milwaukee 111, Buffalo 110 (overtime). Seattle Ill, Wasnington 109 (overtime).

title: 3 Satin Sisters Spin a Poetry Of Nostalgia at Stage Cabaret
description: As those who saw the original production of For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide/ When the Rainbow is Enuf will remember, Ntozake Shange is a forceful performer as well as poet and playwright. In her acting as well as in her writing, she is charged with emotion and selfawareness.

title: Ordeal by Cathode Ray Tube
description: When the National Football League closed out its season on Sunday, tears for George Allen were shed all over the networks because Washington's elderly operatives and their cuddly coach had been shut out of the playoffs for the second time in seven years. It was a tough way to go, sitting in front of a television screen and watching the Giants hold off the Chicago Bears until, with nine seconds remaining in the fifth quarter, Bob Thomas kicked the field goal that got Chicago the wildcard spot on the postseason schedule. The Redskins had done what was required of them by whipping Los Angeles on Saturday, and for 74 minutes 51 seconds of the New YorkChicago game, they stood elected to challenge Los Angeles next Monday. Still, the fact is that no team that can lose twice to the Giants belongs in the playoffs.

title: Icebreaker Leaves New Zealand
description: SEATTLE. Dec. 19 (AP)The troubleplagued icebreaker Polar Star left Wellington. New Zealand, late litst week on the final leg of her trip to the Antarctic, the Coast Guard reported today. The nation's biggest and most powerful irebreaker, commissioned in January 1975, was unable to pursue her duties until late November. An assortment of mechanical problems kept. the 399foot vessel in drydock for more than a year.

title: Economic Setup In Japan Blocks Sale of Imports
description: TOKYO, Dec. 19The Japanese customs inspector opens every crate of metal baseball bats from a foreign manufacturer. He selects one bat, saws it open and rules that the inside is not machined sufficiently. The whole shipment is rejected.

title: Thieves Get 700 Toys Donated by Brooklyn Students
description: About 700 toys, which the students at Winthrop Junior High School donated for distribution to the children's wards of Kings County Hospital, were stolen from a teacher's office in the East Flatbush school over the weekend.

title: Arguments Over Civil Liberties Delay Order on Intelligence Work
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19  President Carter's executive order on national intelligence operations, long delayed by interagency disputes over civil liberties, is not expected to be made public before the end of the year, according to interviews with Administration officials.

title: Provenzano, Top Jersey Teamster, Is Reindicted in Kickback Scheme
description: Anthony Provenzano, the leader of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters in New Jersey, was indicted in Manhattan yesterday for the third time on the same Federal charge involving an alleged conspiracy to arrange a kickback on a $2.3 million loan from union funds.

title: Nebraska Wins On a Rally, 2117, In Liberty Bowl
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 19 (AP)Randy Garcia left the bench and threw two fourthquarter touchdown passes, rallying the University of Nebraska football team to a 2117 victory over North Carolina in the Liberty Bowl tonight.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: SUNDAY NIGHT AT INGLEWOOD, CALIF. BOSTON (97)

title: Critic's Notebook: Movies Try To Get a Handle on Our Times
description: Has Richard Dreyfuss become a romantic leading man? On the evidence of The Goodbye Girl, the answer is yes indeed. But the real question, to anyone who thinks that leading men must measure up to any fixed standards of glamour, is why.

title: Federal Officials Are Criticized For Silence on Farmers' Strike
description: Leaders of the national farmers' protest accused Federal officials yesterday of ignoring their strike for higher prices, and warned that the total silence from Washington might be met by intensified picketing in the final days before the Christmas holidays, according to United Press International.

title: U.N. Envoys Pushing Work To Get Home
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., Dec. 19Today was the Day Beforemeaning the day before the General Assembly was scheduled to adjournand the habitually leisurely tempo of the United Nations accelerated markedly. Delegates railroaded one resolution after another in committees and in the Assembly so they could go home for the holidays.

title: BILL ON ALCOHOLICS IS SIGNED BY BEAME
description: New York City became the first municipality in the nation yesterday to prohibit discrimination against recovered alcoholics in such areas as employment, housing and the use of educational facilities.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positions. Letter designates OTB listing.

title: The Satisfactions of Housewifery and Motherhood In an Age of DoYourOwnThing
description: SOUTH NYACK, N. Y.My son lied about it on his college application. My husband mutters it under his breath when asked. And I had grown reluctant to mention it myself.

title: Deaths
description: ALDERMANRose Beloved wife of Israel H., devoted mother of Dr. Norman E. Alderman and Bernard H. Alderman, devoted motherinlaw of Elinor Alderman and Sonya Alderman, devoted grandmother of Mark Stephen Alderman, Joan Laurie Ambrose, Lynn Renee Alderman and Allen Alderman, great grandmother of Dawn Elaine Alderman. Funeral services will be on Tuesday, December 20 at 12PM at Shure Funeral Parlor, in New Haven, Connecticut.

title: Bell Plans to Increase Capacity Of A.T.&T.'s Domestic Satellites
description: Scientists at Bell Telephone Laboratories yesterday disclosed a plan for sharply increasing the messagecarrying capacity of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company domestic communications satellites in the 1980's, particularly for lowtraffic areas not served directly by today's communications satellites.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 19 (UPI)The Kansas City Chiefs, who had their worst season with a 212 wonlost mark, today dismissed Tom Bettis, their interim coach.

title: Sheeran Urges Restudy of System Of Mandatory Insurance on Autos
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19State Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran said today that the state should restudy the need for mandatory automobile insurance for drivers in New Jersey.

title: Bethlehem Steel to Raise Most Product Prices 5.5%
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's secondlargest steel producer, announced price increases yesterday of about 5.5 percent for most of its steel productsan advance that a spokesman for a key Government agency said was not out of line with inflation.

title: No Comment by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)The State Department had no immediate comment tonight on the Canadian action. A spokesman noted, however, that the United States, after the South African Government's crackdown on opponents of apartheid on Oct. 19, had decided to review its economic and trade ties with that country.

title: Spassky Chess Victor, First Time in Match
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 19 (Reuters)  Boris Spassky, a former world chess champion, scored his filst victory over Viktor Korchnoi today in their match to determine a challenger to the world chess champion, Anatoly Karpov. Spassky's victory came in the 11th game of the match.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
Bank Practices and Regulation Found to Vary Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 When Bert Lance's financial manipulations hit the front pages last summer, they posed unpleasant questions for the banking business.

title: Bond Market Continues Decline Into Fourth Consecutive Week
description: The bond market decline continued into its fourth consecutive week yesterday, with prices dipping moderately.

title: About New York
description: Eggbag the cat is asleep in the back of the magic shop, and Eighth Avenue looks almost greasy with the afternoon rain. There isn't much magic on the avenue and the hookers stand out under their golf umbrellas.

title: 14, Including Alleged Charter Member of Purple Gang, Charged in a Heroin Conspiracy
description: Fourteen men, one listed by the police as a charter member of the Purple Gang, were charged yesterday with involvement In a conspiracy to distribute and sell up to 200 kilograms of white heroin worth $40 million to $50 million in street sales.

title: Renewal Project Is Killed in Boston
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19Plans for redevelopment of the 10acre midtown area, the subject of seven years of debate, were canceled today when the developer abruptly withdrw from the $150 million project.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An offduty police officer found shot in the parking lot of a Brooklyn bar early Sunday was reported in critical but stable condition at Coney Island Hospital yesterday. Detectives said they had made little progress toward finding his assailant.

title: Standards Chairman Named
description: May Beanie yesterday appointed Vito J. Fossella of Staten Island as chairman of the Board of Standards and Appeals. Mr. Fossella, a 38yearold engineer who was a member of the hoard and previously served as Commissioner of Marine and Aviation, succeeds Joseph B. Klein. The salary for the post is $40,446 a year.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: COACHES' POLL

title: Point System of Reclassifying NursingHome Patients Is Under Attack
description: A 10monthold system by which New York State is trying to reclassify and transfer patients in nursing homes and healthrelated facilities to reduce Medicaid costs is being challenged by legal service groups as harsh and unreliable.

title: Carter Signs S.E.C. Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (UPI)President Carter today signed a bill authorizfor the Securities and Exchange Corning a 1978 appropriation of $63.75 million mission.

description: Transplanted New Yorkers may toil in other vineyards, but many never forget the city or such events as the annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

description: Following are the number of points allowed for some disabilities.

title: 2d Goal by McDonald Gives Leafs a 44 Tie
description: TORONTO, Dec. I9 (UPI)  Lanny McDonald knocked in a 40foot drive from lan Turnbull at 10 minutes 51 seconds of the third period tonight at Maple Leaf Gardens to lift the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 44 tie with the St. Louis Blues. The goal was McDonald's second of this National Hockey League game.

description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.Q. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19The Liberty State Park Study and Planning Commission said today that apparently there were no private funds available for development of the 800acre park, and that the $150 million program would have to be financed with Federal and state funds.

title: A Donor to the Neediest Writes: There Is Nothing I'd Rather Do
description: Residents of New Jersey have continued their strong support of the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. Among donations received yesterday was one for $25 from Sylvia H. Thomann of Cedar Grove, N.J., who said:

title: Asbestos Workers' Illness and Their SuitMay Change Health Standards
description: TYLER, Tex. Dec. 13William Morris, a 50yearold former asbestos worker, afraid that he is dying. And he is angry, because for years neither his employer nor visiting Federal health inspectors warned him that clouds of dust he was sucking into his lungs at work caused cancer.

title: Topics
description: The familiar Santas of Volunteers of America have competition this year. Members of the Hare Krishna sect, dressed as Kris Kringle. are buttonholing passersby with hard candies and a hard sell. Hare Krishna funds are used to support that group's religious pursuits. Money collected by the Volunteers pays for nondenominational Christmas distributions to New York's poor. If you want your donation to buy toys and Christmas turkeys, look for the Volunteers of America placard before you give.

title: The Health Insurance Minefield
description: The Carter Administration's apparent intention not to send national health insurance legislation to Congress in 1978 may well mean no health insurance program for years to come. More immediately, it could cost President Carter what support he has left from organized laborparticularly the United Automobile Workers.

title: Police Radio Call Cuts Short Carlyle Hotel Holdup
description: Six bewigged men wearing brown suits, neckties and false mustaches had a go at robbing the fashionable Carlyle Hotel before daybreak yesterday, but their own good forethought sacked the plan and even cost them a few of their possessions.

title: Dream Being Fulfilled By a Coast Telescope
description: MONTEREY, Calif.  We've created an adventure, said Bruce Weaver, and if adventure has to do with the untried and uncertain, then he and his small group of astronomers are indeed adventurers.
