description: Theater

title: FIRESTONE EXOFFICER FILES $11 MILLION SUIT
description: Robert Beasley, former vice chairman of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, has filed an $11 million damage suit in the Court of Common Pleas in Summit County, Akron, Ohio, naming as defendants nine Firestone officers and directors.

title: Connecticut to Sees To Try Linda Blair Prior to Extradition
description: WILTON, Conn., Dec. 21Linda Blair, the 18yearold actress who was arrested here yesterday on drug charges as she left her rented home,is scheduled to appear in court in Stamford, Conn., on Jan. 18, when lawyers for Florida and Connecticut are expected to argue about which state should proceed first with prosecution of the young actress.

title: Meadowlands
description: FIRST$6,500, CI., 3YO and up, 1m. and 70 yds.

title: U.S. Payments Gap Is Cut to $4.3 Billion For Third Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)The United States reduced its international payments deficit for the third quarter of 1977 from the second quarter's record $4.6 billion, but only to $4.3 billion, the Commerce Department said yesterday.

title: Deaths
description: AMSTERFred (Resident of Miami Beach). Beloved husband of Anne. Devoted father of Harris and Martin. Loving father in law of Ronnie and Renee. Adored grandfather of Elliot and Holly. Services Friday 12 noon, Resnick & Buchbinder Inc, at Park. side Memorial Chapel, 9860 Queens Blvd corner 66th Ave, Rego Park.

title: Sound
description: WHEN MY FATHER, as a young man, lived in Vienna during the final years of the Austrian empire, one of his great ambitions was to hear every one of Beethoven's symphoniei. He knew the Fifth, Seventh and Ninth, the Eroica and the Pastoral, for these were played often. This merely heightened his eagerness for the others and sharpened his frustration that even in a great musical center such as Vienna one couldn't hear Beethoven's entire symphonic legacy within a few years. To hear Beethoven's Second, he had to persuade his boss to give him two days off for a concert in Prague, and on another overnight journey, to Budapest, he finally caught up with the Eighth.

title: Concorde Lands, by Necessity, Where It's WantedNewark
description: NEWARK, Dec. 21This city, which sought unsuccessfully to gain landing rights to supersonic planes,.. saw its wish come partly true today: the Concorde made an unexpected landing at Newark Airport.

title: Italian Rail Workers End Strike
description: ROME, Dec. 21 (Reuters)Striking railroad workers who had threatened to cause havoc with Christmas travel returned to work today after the Government agreed to a bonus payment. The sixday strike by the 15,000 members of Italy's smallest rail union had caused major delays and cancellations in many parts of the country. The union suspended strike action last night after the Government agreed to pay about $90 in anticipation of a future bonus settlement.

title: PINOCHET HINTS AT VOTE OVER REPORT ON RIGHTS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 21 (AP)President Augusto Pinochet reacted today to a United Nations resolution last week denouncing alleged human rights violations in Chile by saying he would seek a public vote of confidence for his military Government.

title: GENERAL MILLS EARNINGS ROSE 23.7% IN QUARTER
description: General Mills Inc., a diversified company whose products range from food and restaurants to chemicals, reported yesterday profit increases of 23.7 percent for the second fiscal quarter and 22.9 percent for the six months to Nov. 27.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The American Can Company said yesterday that it was raising prices on all metal and composite containers by about 5 percent, effective Jan. 16. It attributed the increase to the impact of a labor settlement that increased crsst of living 1,,nns hPnefit costs. American Can said the increase also took into account increased utility, freight and nonmetalsupply costs.

title: U.S. Cuts Goal for Admission of Vietnamese to 7,000
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The Carter Administration has decided to seek the emergency admission of 7,000 Vietnamese refugees instead of the 10,000 originally desired by the State Department, Administration officials said today.

title: A Regent Says New York City Hires Teachers Who Are Barely Literate
description: A member of the New York State Board of Regents asserted yesterday that impoverished children in New York City's public schools who needed the best instruction were often being taught by teachers who had not mastered the basic skills of reading and writing.

title: SovietJapanese Fishing Accord
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 21 (Reuters)The Soviet Union and Japan have decided to extend for one year a temporary agreement on fishing catches in each other's 200mile coastal zones, leaving quotas unchanged from 1977, the press agency Tass said today. It added that the accord allowed Soviet ships to take 650,000 tons from Japan's zone and Japanese fishermen to catch 850.000 tons in Soviet waters. The two sides are discussing a longerterm treaty.

title: In Memoriam
description: DUHLJoseoh And Arthur with aching heart and loving memory of my sons, Benjamin Duhl

title: John Francis Xavier Fay, at 70, Writer for The Times in 1930's
description: John Francis Xavier Fay, who in the 1930's wrote industrialrelation stories for The New York Times and the old Newark (N.J.) StarEagle, died Tuesday in West Hudson Hospital, Kearny, NJ., after a six month illness, He was 70 years old and lived at 50 Hamilton Avenue, Kearny.

title: Christmas: An Atavistic Season Tugging at Us All
description: THE FIRST CHRISTMAS was the best, beyond a doubt. Since then, it's been downhill all the way for close on 2,000. years. It's natural, after all. Having something happen right. there in front of one's eyes is better than thinking about it (no matter how reverently) a long time afterwards. And although the earliest accounts are not exactly straight from the scene, they have about them a pristine clarity.

title: Personal Beauty
description: HOWTO books continue to flourishcovering every subject from how to cook for your cat to how to deliver your own baby. In the last few years, volumes on how to be prettier, slimmer or healthier have been appearing almost as frequently as cookbooks.

title: Thoughts of the Ill and Memories Of War Inspire Gifts to Neediest
description: A friend recovering from a serious illness in a hospital has prompted Ann Hartenstein of Syracuse to contribute to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: I75 Link Opens First Full Interstate Route
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Dec. 21The last section of Interstate 75 was opened to traffic near here today, making the 1,575mile superhighway the first in the system to be completed from one end of the country to the other.

title: Screeners Block Baumgarten Bid For a Criminal Court Judgeship
description: A judiciary screening committee has reversed itself and rejected a Criminal Court judgeship for Sidney Baumgarten, an aide to Mayor Hearne who heads a controversial campaign against vice in the midtown area.

title: Ashore in New York, Vietnamese Struggle
description: The sun had gone down and the sea had flattened out when Anh Hoang Dinh, his wife, and their four children, his brother, two nephews and 11 close friends crawled into a 33foot boat built for fishing, nosed the bow into the Gulf of Siam and watched the coast of Vietnam, and their lives to that time, fade beyond the stern.

title: Short Interest on Big Board Sets High of 35.3 Million Shares in Month
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest rose 1,999,183 shares in the month ended Dec. 15 to a record high of 35,321,594 shares. The interest for the yearearlier level totaled 27,510,879 shares.

title: Rock: Motors of the 60's
description: THE FACT that radio programers and record retailers settled on New Wave as a generic name for punk rock is more than a little ironic, for there is little new about it, musically speaking. Of the New Wave groups from England, where the phenomenon seems most convincing and least contrived, most seem intent on resurrecting the spirii of the early Rolling Stones or Who; with some going back to early 3960's rhythm and blues rockabilly.

description: ENTRIES

title: Fog Snarls French Highways
description: PARIS, Dec. 21 (Reuters)Thick fog caused eight deaths and 165 injuries in accidents involving hundreds of cars over the last three days, the police said today. The fog has sometimes reduced visibility to as little as three yards, they said. West of Paris at Poissy yesterday four people were killed and 40 injured in a pileup involving 150 cars.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed In order of post positions. Leber designates OTB listing.

A Purged Officer Is Fearful of Future for C.I.A. and Himself
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21Frank Dawson is looking for a job, so he wrote out a resume of his career experience. I showed it to my children over the Thanksgiving holidays, he said with a laugh. It was a revelation to all of them.

title: Blackout Hits Parts of Cleveland Looting Is Reported Some Areas
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 21 (AP)A widespread power blackout knocked out street lights and tratfic signais this evenings in downtown Cleveland and other parts of the city.

title: GUIDELINES OFFERED FOR EQUALITY IN JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission today proposed a set of guidelines for affirmative action programs in employment that would protect companies from complaints of socalled reverse discrimination made by white males.

description: After pleading in vain yesterday with the Rev. Louis R. Gigante to answer questions before a grand jury investigating the city's Department of Correction, Justice Leonard H. Sandler reluctantly held the Roman Catholic priest in contempt and sentenced him to 10 days in jail.

description: TRENTON, Dec. 21New Jersey hopes to market a new product and solve much of the state's sewagedisposal problem with the startup in February of a pilot project for composting sludge in Camden.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In retrospect, the most unusual elements of the Giants' 129 overtime loss to the Chicago Bears last Sunday were not the snow and sleet, but the significance and the tension.

Koch Will Taste Life In Jail on Christmas
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch and several of his top aides plan to spend part of Christmas day at the Rikers Island House of Detention for Men, according to the Department of Correction.

title: LEVESQUE SEES VOTE FOR SEPARATE QUEBEC
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 21Premier Ren Lvesque of Quebec predicts a narrow victory for independence when the province votes on the issue in 1979 or 1980, but if he should fail to get it, he is prepared to hold a second referendum during a new term of office.

title: A Vestige of Jewish Village Life Survives Tenuously in Rumania
description: DOROHOI, RumaniaIt was a scene of Eastern Europe 100 years agothe small group of aging Jewish men, wrapped tightly in their prayer shawls, and the graybearded chief rabbi rocking to the murmured chants.

description: An offduty police officer was shot in the back of the head and killedand another man was shot in the head and critically woundedlast night in the hallway of an apartment building at 15 St. Nicholas Avenue in Harlem, the police reported.

title: Carlucci, Ambassador to Portugal, Reported Chosen as C.I.A. Deputy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The Carter Administration plans to appoint Frank C. Carlucci, the United States Ambassador to Portugal. as Deputy Director of Central Intelligence, topranking White House and State Department officials said today.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Dec. 21The General Assembly er.ded its 32d session today after having adopted a $986 million budget for the coming two years and a record number of 256 resolutions.

title: 3 Men Allegedly in Purple Gang And Lawyer Indicted in Tax Case
description: A lawyer and three reputed members of a new organizedcrime group called the Purple Gang were indicted in Manhattan yesterday on Federal taxevasion charges involving an investment in a vendingmachine operation to sell New York State lottery tickets.

title: Inflated Mortgage Appraisals Laid To Aides of Federal Agency on L.I.
description: A Federal grand jury in Brooklyn in investigating charges that officials of the Farmers Home Administration on Long Island have deliberately overappraised property on which subsidized. Federal mortgages are written, thus allowing housing speculators to reap windfall profits.

description: Walk, Don't Run

title: Q&A
description: Q. Some time ago I had a washable wallpaper hung in my dinette and the paperhanger said it needed no lining. I find that the paper bubbles wherever I have attempted to wash off food stains. What is the cause of these bubbles and how can I remove the soil without washing?Mrs. R.P., New York City.

title: Bank Regulatory Agencies strive To Coordinate and Improve Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21In the headquarters of the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency are terminals linked to a milliondollar computer system in Floridathe National Bank Surveillance System.

50 Priests in Italy Begin a Work Slowdown
description: ROME. Dec. 21 (AP)Fifty country priests took off their vestments, put down their prayer books and began a work slowdown today, the first time the wideranging Italian strike weapon has reached into the rectories of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Fiscal Woe at Kennedy Center
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21The $78 million John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts has serious financial problems that only Congress can alleviate, according to a study by the General Accounting Office, the investigative arm of Congress. The findings were made public yesterday.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)The Air Force acknowledged today that it had grounded most of its 452 F111 and FB111 fighter bombers and bombers because an engine crack problem was bigger than was first believed.

title: News Summary
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt told reporters in Ismailia that he would not accept an Israeli military presence on the West Bank of the Jordan as part of an overall Middle East settlement. He also met twice with Israel's Defense Minister, Maj. Gen. Ezer Weizman. His public and private moves were seen in Cairo as an attempt to soften the Israeli position before his meeting in Ismailia with Prime Minister Menahem Begin on Sunday. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE HIGHEST IN 5 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21A burst of inflation in some food prices and markups for Toyota cars imported from Japan helped propel the Consumer Price Index to an increase in November of onehalf of I percent, more than in any of the preceding four months, the Government reported today.

title: Mosley's Number Comes Up
description: Glenn Mosley will be able to attend his brother John's birthday party the day before Christmas.

title: Renaissance Man at Yale
description: The painstaking and occasionally painful process of finding Yale University's 18th president has turned a public spotlight on the state of not only one leading campus but also American higher education. That the search ended with the selection of A. Bartlett Giamatti, a 39yearold Renaissance scholar who combines youth with academic accomplishment and popularity among students, should do much to allay the fears of those who see the universities abandoned to fiscal experts.

title: Fur Salon Sponsors Fashion Show for Homosexuals
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 21The Bonwit Teller fur salon in Chicago, one of the nation's largest independent furriers, sponsored what it said was the industry's first gay fashion show last night at a homosexual nightclub a few blocks north of the city's Loop.

description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz filed suit against New York City yesterday, seeking to end overcrowding and unsanitary conditions at the Rikers Island House of Detention for Men.

title: Backgammon:
description: In some backgammon positions multiple possibilities arise. When analyzing these positions, you must first formulate your best overall strategy, then determine the best tactical play accordingly.

title: Winds Blamed in 9 Coast Deaths
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 21 (AP)Winds that had brought death and destruction to California slowed to 50 miles ari hour today, and a misty rain helped fight a windwhipped fire that killed three men at an Air Force base.

title: Critics' Circle Picks Annie Hall
description: 'ANNIE HALL was chosen the best film of 1977 by the New York Film Critics Circle yesterday. The Woody Allen comedy was selected over Luis Bufluel's That Obscure Object of Desire, in second place, and Steven Spielberg's Close Encounters of the Third Kind, in third. The critics group has 26 members, 25 of whom took part in the voting.

title: And a 4Sided Triangle
description: DOWNERS GROVE, Ill.  After much debate in Washington among House and Senate conferees, Congress is putting the finishing touches on the new energy. bill. The compromise legislation will have farreaching effects on the American way of life, according to reliable Congressional sources who are visiting here during the holiday recess.

title: Better News About Dollar and Oil Helps Dow Advance 7.71 to 813.93
description: Favorable developments in two areas of chronic worrycurrency trading and oil pricingsent stock prices sharply higher yesterday in the market's first advance in five sessions. ing that has held up the. President's energy bill.

title: Panel Appointed by Port Authority To Review Procurement Policies
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, facing criticism from the New York State Comptroller's office for alleged irregularities in the letting of millions of dollars of construction and maintenance contracts for the World Trade Center, yesterday named a threemember panel to review procurement policies.

title: Concorde Lands, by Necessity, Where It's WantedNewark
description: NEWARK, Dec. 2IThis city, which sought unsuccessfully to gain landing rights to supersonic planes, saw its wish conic partly true today: the Concorde made an unexpected landing at Newark Airport.

title: OPEC SAYS OIL PRICES WILL NOT BE RAISED FOR THE TIME BEING
description: CARABALLEDA, Venezuela, Dec. 21The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, concluding a meeting here today, said that crude oil prices would not rise for the time being.

title: Port Authority Appoints Panel to Review Its Procurement Policies
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, facing criticism from the New York State Comptroller's office for alleged irregularities in the letting of millions of dollars of construction and maintenance contracts for the World Trade Center, yesterday named a threemember panel to review procurement policies.

title: Hers
description: RROSALYN S. YALOW, winner of this year's Nobel Prize in Medicine, stood up at the end of a formal banquet in Stockholm and tald her fellow Nobel laureates some truths about the status of womentruths seldom spoken by a woman of unquestionable authority before a group of male luminaries.

title: West Side Caroling Is a Howl
description: IT WAS the sort of night when people in the city are wont to stand at the window, shivering and thinking. Golly, I wouldn't send a dog out on a night like this. Nevertheless, out into the freezing rain they went, the six dogs and the 32 persons, most of them members of the Golden West Side Ecumenical Christmas Caroling and Dog Walking Society.

title: Byrne Shelves Plan For State to Rebuild Cherry Hill Track
description: TRENTON, Dec. 21At the insistence of seven New Jersey bankers and insurancecompany executives, Governor. Byrne today agreed not to push for the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority to rebuild and operate the Garden State Park race track at Cherry Hill unless a feasibility study showed this to be a wise thing to do.

title: Gunman Overpowered at Subic Bay
description: MANILA, Thursday, Dec. 22 (AP)Hostages overwhelmed a Filipino gunman today with the aid of lawenforcement personnel, ending a twoday siege at a bank on the United States Navy Base at Subic Bay.

title: HOUSE PANEL TO EXPLORE C.I.A. LINK TO NEWSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)A House intelligence subcommittee plans to begin hearings next week on the Central Intelligence Agency's involvement with the news media, the panel's chairman said today.

title: Article 11 -- No Title
HOUSING PROPOSAL ON ESTATE FOUGHT
description: A controversial plan to build 72 attached houses on the former Delafield estate in Riverdalenow the property of Columbia Universitywas sharply debated yesterday at an allday hearing of the New York City Planning Commission.

description: BASKETBALL

title: BANK SAYS IT ENDED ALLEGED VIOLATIONS
description: Officials of the State Bank of Raritan Valley in Raritan said yesterday that alleged violations of banking regulations cited in a ceaseanddesist order from Virginia Long, the New Jersey Banking Commissioner, earlier this month had been corrected.

title: Bridge:
description: Suit combinations are often equal, but some may be more equal than others, as George Orwell might have said. A declarer who sees QJx in the dummy and A10x in his hand may think this entirely equivalent to Q10x opposite AJx. And for most practical purposes it isbut he should bear in mind that his opponents do not see matters in quite the same light.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Belafonte Honored by Canada for FundRaising
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 21A love affair of more than 20 years between Canada and Harry Belfonte reached a moment of high emotion last night as Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, following a benefit concert by the singer and his company before a soldout house, appeared on stage to honor the American performer with an unusual official tribute by the Canadian Government.

title: Article 10 -- No Title
Rigging of Electric Clock Charged in Skiing Dispute
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy, Dec. 21 (UPI)The ski dispute between Austria and Italy turned ugly today when Austria said it would conduct a control or recheck of Italy's World Cup downhill victory at Val Gardena. Ugo Albl, Austrian trainer, said the recheck was necessary because of charges that the Italians had fiddled with the electronic timer during Sunday's race to give the victory to Herbert Plank.

title: The American Museum of Natural History Celebrates an Anniversary
description: A century, as reckoned by the dinosaurs and fossils at the American Museum of Natural History, is only a ticktock of time. But for the museum itself, today has significance: It is just 100 yearsand 132 million visitoradmissionssince the first building on the present site was opened by President Rutherford B. Hays. The museum's founders first organized in 1869.

title: People and Business
description: Nigel S. MacEwan, who has been executive vice president and chief operating officer of White, Weld & Company, has been named president of the international investment banking and brokerage firm, effective Jan. 1. The announcement was made yesterday by Paul Hallingby Jr., chairman and chief executive officer, who has been serving as president.

title: Something's In the Air: Perfume for The Home
Fees Charged By the Phone Company
description: For years, phone companies insisted that answering machines, Which are considered foreign attachments, be connected to the network through a protective interface device. Many who bought the machines for home use simply plugged them in without confiding in the phone company. Usually nothing happened, but there was alway the risk that the phone company would uncover the illegal connection and force disconnection or acceptance of a coupler (at $1 a month).

title: Notes on People
description: LAST year Ingmar Bergman, the celebrated Swedish film director, became so disgusted with what he considered persecution by the tax authorities in his native land that he went into voluntary exile in West Germany. Since then there have been .many attempts to persuade him to return, both officially and unofficially. Now Mr. Bergman has been given more balm for his wounded feelings, in the form of the Swedish Academy of Letters Great Gold Medal, an award that has gone to only 17 persons in this century. In presenting the medal to Mr. Bergman in ceremonies in Stockholm, KarlRagnar Gierow, a academy official, told the director that it was a sign of how highly valued you are in your home country. Present for the ceremony were King Carl XVI Gustaf and Queen Silvia.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Associated Press

title: INTERLAKE AND PHOENIX TO RAISE STEEL PRICES
description: Two more steel companies announced plans yesterday to raise prices, by 5.5 percent and 6 percent, close to the increases announced earlier this week by two major steel producers.

description: Music

title: Books: Happy, Rejuvenating Outlook for Retirees
description: PETER SCHWED, the author of this persistently upbeat book on the joys that can be extracted from old age, is at 66 chairman of the editorial board of Simon & Schuster and a demon tennis player. He is just long enough in the tooth to he: facing the possibility of his own redundancy, and, thus, to be fashioning a point of view that advocates alternatives.

title: About New York
description: In East New York, where the buildings are withering fast as a lifesick forest, some of the people sit and talk of Plato and Irving Anker and of the only honorable struggle, the one being celebrated over the daycare center.

title: Leonard Silk
description: Belief is growing in foreign exchange markets that the dollar has been oversold and will be rallying in the months ahead. That the oil ministers of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries meetine in Caracas settled for no price increase provides confirming evidence that The alarm over the dollar is Economic moderating. The caution of Scene OPEC on oil prices is, of course, also a sign of worry about glut in the world oil market and about the dangers of a slump in the world economy.

title: T. W. A. Plans Offer For Medicorp Shares
description: Trans World Airlines, in a major move to diversify away from airline operations, disclosed yesterday that it would offer to pay $120 million in cash for a 64 percent stake in American Nledicorp Inc., a leading operator of hospitals.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Charles (Chub) Feeney, president of the National League, and Johnny Johnson, baseball's administrative officer, will meet in Mexico City today with Cuban officials as part of baseball's continuing effort to send a major league allstar team to play in Cuba.

title: $150,000 in Art Objects Stolen
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 21 (AP)The authorities are investigating the theft over the weekend of $150,000 in art objects, including a painting by Thomas Hart Benton. The Benton work, titled The Water Tank, was valued at $45,000. At least 40 items were taken in all. The thieves apparently broke into the JohnsonWelsh Galleries on the Country Club Plaza Sunday, the police said.

title: Striking Farmers Block a Paper And Halt Loading of Some Grain
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 21Striking farmers, angry over an editorial criticizing what were described as the uniongoon tactics of some of them, blockaded a Texas newspaper today, delaying delivery of its morning edition for four hours. Tractordriving farmers managed to delay the delivery trucks with 80,000 copies of The Lubbock AvalancheJournal.

title: Disks: 2 Sets of Brahms
description: EUGEN JOCHUM conducts rarely in the United States, and as a result nemains a seriously underrated artist in this country. But consistently he has turned out performances and recordings that make him one of the finest of the older generatoln Of German interpreters. His readings combine the intense linearity of the modern international school with the warmth and idiomatic phrasing of German tradition in an individual and highly convincing way. Perhaps he is not a great master in the mold of a Fyrtwangler or a Klemperer, but neither is he a glorified Kppellmeister. His new Brahms set presents these works in a highly favorable light, if without the ultimate strength and authority that distinguish the finest modern integral set, that by Karl Bhm.

title: The Ills of ForeignTrained Doctors
description: Countless American parents are still inspired, or obsessed, by the dream of a medical education for their children. That was impressed upon us the last time we commented on the several thousand American students who enrolled in foreign medical schools after being rejected by schools in the United States. Many of those students want to return to this country for their final two years of studythe clinical training years that are often taught poorly abroad. We were rash enough to suggest that they should not be granted privileged access to American schools. That brought scores of angry letters from parents and students.

title: Letters
description: More on the Lights

title: Advertising
description: James T. Ong of Inglewood, Calif.; Jean Taatjis of Libby, Mont.; Irvin Miller of Omaha; Everta Gibson of Parkersburg, W.Va., and Sally Hanes of Saginaw, Mich., make their network television debuts next week. So does the RCA Music Service, a record club. They are in fact all doing it together in a 30second commercial. And of all of the involved parties, RCA has been preparing the longest.

title: And Who Is Minding the Phone?
description: SHIRLEY Camper Soman, a writer, called several weeks ago with a complaint common among New Yorkers: My answering service is driving me up the wall! she said. Can you recommend a good machine to replace it?

title: Carter Approves Overseas Routes To 11 New Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21  President Carter gave his approval today for direct air service to Europe from 11 new American cities.

title: Open Interest
description: Wednesday, Dec. 21, 1977

title: Stage: Photograph By Miss Shange
description: THE POETRY of perception is not the same as the poetry of drama. In For Colored Girls, Ntozake Shange arranged her acid and lyrical perceptions into a fine, loosejointed set of meditations and sketches.

title: Peaceful Murphy Leads Rockets Past Nets, 10393
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 21Calvin Murphy has some good news and some bad news for the National Basketball Associction. The good news is that, after the crippling blow to the head that his roomate, Rudy Tcmjanovich, took from Kermit Washington of the Los Angeles Lakers, Murphy has decided to hang up his boxing gloves. The bad news is that from now on he may come out shootingbasketballs, that is.

title: Newcombe Stirs Aussies With StraightSet Victory
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 21 (UPI)John Newcombe, stepping up his comeback pace, defeated Brian Teacher in straight sets in the first round of the $250,000 Australian open tennis championships today. The Australian is the first of the four world events making up the Grand Slam.

title: TEXAN REPORTEDLY LEADS FIELD FOR TOP PARTY JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)Deputy Agriculture Secretary John White has emerged as the leading candidate to succeed Kenneth Curtis as chairman of the Democratic National Committee, informed sources said today.

title: Benitez, Curry to Fight Again After Controversy
description: Wilfredo Benitez of Puerto Rico, recognized as the world junior welter. weight champion by the New York State Athletic Commission, has been rematched with Bruce Curry of Los Angeles. Curry floored the champion three times in their November fight. yet lost a split decision in one of the most controversial verdicts here.

title: Shadow Box Going Out With the Old Year
description: The Shadow Box, Michael Cristofer's play that won the 1977 Tony and Pulitzer Prize awards, will close after the Dec. 31 evening performance. The show, now playing at the LuntFontanne Theater, will have given 315 performances.

title: Saudi in Quest of U.S. Banks
description: Back in 1965, when he was a graduate student ,at the Harvard Business School, Ghaith R. Tharaon wrote a paper on a mythical company ne named Redec. It was to engage in the construction business in Jiddah, on the Red Sea coast of Saudi Man Arabia, and its capital, he. in the figured, would be about. $110,000 in Saudi riyals.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland. Dec. 21Prime Minister James Callaghan made A surprise fivehour trip to Ulster today and declared that the Provisional I.R.A. was on the wane. When a bomb exploded lees than a mile away, he added: The wacp can still sting.

title: Air Is Found Cleaner Though Smog Persists
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21 (AP)The nation's air is getting cleaner but smog continues to be a serious problem in some areas, the Environmental Protection Agency said today.

title: PANEL IS SET UP TO STUDY VOICE OF AMERICA WORK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21A fivemember panel has been appointed to study ways to resolve the conflict experienced by foreign correspondents of the Voice of America in their roles as journalists and government employees.

title: S. Carolina, Oklahoma Win
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., Dec. 22 (UPI)South Carolina rallied to defeat Southern California. 6558, in overtime and Oklahoma defeated Pennsylvania, 8074, tonight in the opening round of the Carolina Classic basketball tournament.

title: Japan's '78 Budget Seeks Surplus Cut
description: TOKYO. Dec. 22Spurred by the demands of its major trading partners, Japan has drafted an expansionary fiscal 1978 budget designed to increase its purchases overseas and reduce its multibillion dollar trade surplus.

title: CAIRO EXPECTS ISRAEL TO RELAX ITS STAND ON PALESTINIAN ISSUE
description: CAIRO, Dec. 22Egyptian officials said today that Cairo had received assurances that Prime Minister Menahem Begin, at his meeting with President Anwar elSadat on Sunday, would take a substantially more forthcoming position cm the crucial Palestinian issue than he did publicly during his recent trip to Washington and New York.

title: Spanish Urge Settlement
description: MADRID, Dec. 22 (Agence FrancePresse) All parties in the Spanish Parliament signed a telegram sent today to Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, asking for a just and lasting settlement in the Western Sahara.

title: ExG.I. Revisits World War II Town to Do Reprise of His 44 Role as St. Nicholas
description: ROCHESTERIt might have been just another bleak day in a wartorn town in Europe. Rut as Christmas approached in December 1944, a group of American G.I.'s scraped up some supplies and put on a party for the children of Wiltz, in Luxembourg.

title: Notes on People
description: Peter Mark Andrew Phillips, the 37dayold first grandchild of Queen Elizabeth II, was baptized by the Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday, and he cried throughout the simple 20minute ceremony. Master Peter, as he will be called, since his mother, Princess Anne, declined a title for him, was christened in the gold, white and blue Muvic Room of Buckingham Palace. A choir sang Loving Shepherd of Thy Sheep and A Babe Lies in the Cradle. Five generations of the royal family sat on one side of the font, and the Mother, father, and sister of the child's father, Capt. Mark Phillips, sat on the other. There were about 70 guests, 30 of, whom stayed for lunch after a champagne toast. Among them was Prince Charles, one of Master Peter's godparents, and Princess Alice, the Countess of Athlone, who is the only surviving grandchild of Queen Victoria. The infant and his parents will spend Christmas with other members of the royal family at Windsor Castle.

title: Providence Wins, 7270, In First Game Since Fire
description: Bruce Campbell and Dwight Williams combined for 35 points as Providence College survived a late threat and beatCalifornia State at Bakersfield, 7270, tonight for the Friars sixth victory without a defeat.

title: 5 Winners for McCarron
description: LAUREL, Md., (AP)Chris McCarron rode five winners at Laurel today, four of them for Grover Delp, the trainer. McCarron leads the meet with 79 winners end Delp the trainers with 52.

title: Meadowlands
description: aR. N. Mardin Sharon Hild entry.

title: Schoolgirl Track: New Program Is Experiencing Growing Pains
description: In January 1971. Jim Zeitler coached the first girl to participate in a boys' track meet in New York State. Now, almost seven years after Anita Scandurra's appearance, Zeitler, the boys' and girls' track coach at Harborfield in Suffolk County, is spearheading a drive to get the county's girls' indoor track program going on its own.

title: Cambodian Women Recall Nightmare of 2 Escapes
description: SONGKHLA, Thailand, Dec. 19For two women who arrived in a refugee camp here earlier this month from Vietnam, the flight by fishing boat was their second escape in little more than a year. For them, Vietnam represented a halfway house to freedom. They are Cambodian, and to them, after living for 16 months under the Cambodian Communist regime, Vietnam was a relief.

title: Salon Provides Social Sustenance for Female Writers and Artists
description: The word is instantly evocativeof a longgone tradition of letters, of the cultured and the intellectually curious gathered in the parlor to exchange philosophy and ideas, of Madame de Stael and Gertrude Stein of protg and patroness. Salon, as a literary term: It is evocative of a time gone by, not of a group of women in jeans and Indian print skirts and dangling earrings milling around a loft in the Village, reading to one another meeting and greeting those of their bent, all circa 1977.

title: Star Shows
description: Was the Star of Bethlahem that attracted the Wise Men to the birthplace of Jesus in about 5 B.C. a nova or the close passing of two planets? Or was it a miracle?

title: For Children
description: Plays

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Sinai Withdrawal Envisaged
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 22An Israeli official said today that it was quite possible for Israel eventually to agree to full withdrawal from Sinai and a restoration of Egyptian sovereignty providing that there was increased American surveillance, possibly in conjunction with the United Nations.

title: Most Egyptian Envoys to Quit Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The Egyptian Embassy ordered moat of its staff home today, hours after a building housing three Egyptian organizations was damaged by an explosion.

title: Subway Offers a Glimpse of Far Horizons
description: In Tokyo the oshiya (pusher) stuffs subway riders into the cars until the trains are efficiently full, up to 300 percent of capacity. In Hamburg, subway maps are printed on the ceilings of the cars. In Stockholm, subway stations have been designed to resemble primeval bare rock caves, complete with cave drawings.

title: TERENCE BARMAN, 71, EXDIGEST AIDE, DIES
description: Terence G. M. Harman, who retired in 1974 as senior vice president of Reader's Digest and general manager of its international operations, died of a heart attack Tuesday evening while dining with friends at the Barclay Hotel in New York City. He was 71 years old.

title: A 9YearOld Puts the Neediest Ahead of Her Christmas Shopping
description: Nineyearold Melinda Hasbrouck of Summit penned her letter to the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund on yellowtrimmed stationery that depicted a little girl watching a fluttering bufterfly.

title: JUDGE RULES HUGHES AIDE PARTICIPATED IN SWINDLE
description: SALT LAKE CITY. Dec. 22 (UPr)A Federal District Judge ruled today that John Meier, a former aide to Howard R. Hughes. had helped swindle the Hughes Tool Company out of $8.4 million on the purchase of Nevada mining claims.

title: Greenwich Election Ruled. a Tie By a Judge After Two Recounts
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 22Following two recounts, a judge today declared last month's election for First Selectman of Greenwich a tiethe first such in the stateand both candidates agreed to participate in a new election.

title: City Council Kills PayRise Bill, But Only After Warning to Koch
description: The New York City Council overrode itself yesterday and killed its controversial payrise bill, but not without letting Mayorelect Edward I. Koch  who apposed the billknow that it would not be his rubber stamp.

title: Flying Past New York City
description: President Carter gave travelers from Atlanta, Cleveland and Kansas City something to cheer about this week when he approved nonstop air service to Europe from these and eight other American cities. But his action will bring no joy to New York City, which may lose hundreds of flights a yearas well as hundreds of jobs to other airports.

title: Business Loans Up $784 Million; Money Supply Declines $1.1 Billion
description: Business loans at major New York City jbanks jumped $784 million in the week tended Wednesday, their largest increase din three and a half years, and commercial ;paper volumean alternative source of borrowed fundsclimbed nationally by more than $1 billion to a record total.

title: Toll in Iran Quake Nearing 600; Floods Hampering Rescue Work
description: ZARAND, Iran, Dec. 22 (UPI)The death toll neared 600 today from an earthquake that struck a string of villages in south central Iran, where floods isolated stricken areas and hampered rescue work.

title: Genesco Charges ExChief of Bonwit Diverted Funds
description: John Schumacher, who was dismissed in October as chairman of the Bonwit Teller retail chain, has been charged by Genesco Inc., Bonwit's parent company, with allegedly diverting funds, labor and materials from the remodeling of Bonwit's Fifth Avenue store. in 1976 and 1977 to renovating his own Park Avenue triple); apartment.

title: Notes on People
description: Peter Mark Andrew Phillips, the 37dayold first grandchild of Queen Eliz abeth II, was baptized by the Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday, and he cried throughout the simple 20-minute ceremony. Master Peter, as he will be called, since his mother, Princess Anne, declined a title for him, was christened in the gold, white and blue Music Room of Buckingham Palace. A choir sang Loving Shepherd of Thy Sheep and A Babe Lies in the Cradle. Five generations of the royal family sat on one side of the font, and the Mother, father, and sister of the child's father, Capt. Mark Phillips, sat on the other. There were about 70 guests, 30 of, whom stayed for lunch after a champagne toast. Among them was Prince Charles, one of Master Peter's godparents, and Princess Alice, the Countess of Athlone, who is the only surviving grandchild of Queen Victoria. The infant and his parents will spend Christmas with other members of the royal family at Windsor Castle.

title: United Airlines Pact Ratified
description: CHICAGO. Dec. 22 (UPI)United Airlines flight attendants have ratified a new 30month contract, a United spoesman said today. The vote of 4,937 to 914 insures no interruption of flights during the heavy holiday travel season, the United Spoesman said.

title: Topics
description: Proletarian Protest

title: A Victim of Cancer, Governor Gives Up Virgin Islands Post
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Dec. 22Governor Cyril E. King, who has an inoperable tumor of the stomach, stepped down this afternoon, turning the office temporarily over to Lieut. Gov. Juan Luis.

title: Tanner Upset in Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 22 (AP) Topseeded Vitas Gerulaitis of the United States breezed into the second round of the $250.000 Australian open tennis championships today, hut the defending champion, Roscoe Tanner, was ousted. The American southpaw fumed at suggestions that he hadn't tried to win.

title: C.F. T.C.Alleges Violations Of Futures Trading Rules By 2 Brokerage Houses
description: The Federal Commodity Futures Trading Commission cited two leading brokerage houses yesterday for allegedly violating futures trading rules.

title: BANKS LOBBY CALLED STRONGEST IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 22The nation's banks exert an influence over Congresa and the Feder, 1 Government that, in the opinion of many Senate and House members, Congressional staff members, Washington lobbyists and other officials, surpasses the power of any other regulated industry.

title: Absence of McClanahan
description: The Minnesota Vikings lost another offensive player yesterday, Brent McClanahan, which made the National Football League's upcoming fouir divisional playoff games even more of a blackwhiteandgray proposition. The gray area covers tomor About row's games, the Colts Pro against Oakland in Baltimore and Pittsburgh against Football the. Broncos in Denver, two games with no distinct favorites. But on Monday, the Rams are expected to crush the Vikings in Los Angeles and the Cowboys are favored to do the same to the Chicago Bears in Dallas.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)Fortyseven senators have asked President Fidel Catro of Cuba to release three political prisoners said to be in need of medical attention.

title: Gillian Sorensen Set For Koch U.N. Office
description: Gillian Sorensen, the wife of Theodore C. Sorensen, will head the city's United Nations office under Mayorelect Edward I. Koch, according to the Koch transition office. She would succeed Mrs. John L. Loeb, who has held the unsalaried job under Mayors Lindsay and Beame.

title: Advertising
description: What Marsteller Inc. has done for Renault U.S.A., its first automotive account, is an excellent example of how an agency's creative thinking can help a client's sales.

title: QUARTERS DEFICIT REDUCED BY GIMBEL
description: Gimbel Brothers Inc., which has made substantial progress as a result of eliminating unprofitable items, yesterday reported that its fourthquarter loss had shrunk this year and that sales exceeded $1 billion for the first time in its I35year history for the year ended Oct. 1.

title: British TV Film Accuses Company
description: LONDON, Dec. 22A television documentary with interviews alleging that Tate & Lyle, Britain's leading sugar refiner, paid almost starvation wages to its black employees in South Africa, was screened on Independent Television last night.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 23, 1977

title: A Paper Bag Package for Tully Hall
description: It might almost be a scene from some manic silent movie. A man bounces down a city street, humming a little to himself. In the distance a large, cardboard box that once housed a refrigerator looms up from the curbside. With a squawk of pleasure, he halts, oblivious to the stares of passersby. He approaches the box. He studies its seams, searching for staples. There are none. Off it goes, perched atop his head. A new piece of scenery has just been acquired for Paper Bag production. Audiences are likely to see it on stage painted into a house, or a giant horse, or even a flower. The Paper Bag Players lead a madcap life, and children are invited to join them in their latest adventure, I Won't Take Bath, at Alice Tully Hall for a week starting Monday. (Performances at 1 and 3 P.M. Monday, Wednesday and Friday: 11 A.M. and 2 P.M., Tuesday and Thursday. Tickets, $4.95. Information: EN 20431).

title: Article 1 -- No Title
E.P.A. to Propose Fundamental Changes in Treatment of Water Supply to Curb CancerCausing Chemicals
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 22The Government is moving for the first. time to impose Federal standards to protect the public from cancercausing chemicals now believed to contaminate much of the nation's drinking water supply.

title: Appearance of Conflict of Interest Leads ACTION to Cancel Contract
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 22Sam Brown, director of ACTION, the umbrella agency for Federal volunteer programs. today ordered the cancellation of a $50,740 contract because of the appearance of a conflict of interest. His agency signed the contract last Sept. 30.

title: U.S. Envoy Confers With Gromyko
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The American Ambassador, Malcolm Toon, conferred today with Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko, the official press agency Tass reported. An embassy spokesman said the meeting had lasted about 30 minutes but he refused to give any further details.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney discusses President Carter's recent pledge to the nation's top businessmen of help on one of their most nagging problemsexcessive Government regulation. Page D7.

title: Koch Has a Plan to Keep Students in Same School If Parents Decide to Move
description: The incoming Koch administration has devised a plan to allow publicschool students to remain in their home schools to avoid disrupting their studies when their families move.

title: F.D.U. 61, No. Carolina A & T 34
description: RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 22 (AP)Jay Jorgensen made six free throws in the last 1:21 of the game to help Fairleigh Dickinson University to a 6154 victory over North Carolina A. & T. tonight.

title: Schneider Pulls the Strings Together
description: The caliber of the musicians this year is so high that I certainly could have made two orchestras. They're better than ever before.

title: Duran Bout Delayed a Week
description: The fight between Roberto Duran of Panama and Esteban DeJesus of Puerto Rico for the undisputed world lightweight boxing championship will be held Jan. 21 in Las Vegas instead of a week earlier as scheduled, Don King, the promoter, said today. Duran reportedly was unable to get into condition for the original Jan. 14 date.

title: Plank of Italy Captures His 2d Downhill Race
description: CORTINA D'AMPEZZO, Italy, Dec. 22 (UPI)  Herbert Plank scored his second World Cup downhill ski victory of the season today and helped to silence the cuckooclock controversy that had soured the sporting rivalry between the Austrian and Italian teams.

title: Prospect Called MindBoggling
description: HUNTSVILLE, Ala., Dec. 22 (UPI)Ann Whitaker says that the prospect of being the first American woman in space is mindboggling but that she will temper her excitement with realism until the selection process finished.

title: Market Place LongTerm Boon to Braniff Airways
description: President Carter's choice on Wednesday of Braniff Airways to fly the new DallastoLondon route instead of Pan American is likely to have little immediate impact on the profits of either carrier.

title: 24 HOMEOWNERS SUE LILCO FOR $6 MILLION
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 22Twentyfour Long Island homeowners have sued the Long Island Lighting Company for $6 million, charging that it falsely and fraudulently misled them into converting from oil to electiric heat with promises of clean heat at virtually no extra cost.

title: Blanca Steinman, at 87, Served As Protocol Specialist at Carlyle
description: Blanca Lazo Steinman, who retired in 1970 as a protocol specialist on guests from Spain and Latin America at the Carlyle Hotel here, died Wednesday in the DeWitt Nursing Home here. She was 87 years old and had lived at the Carlyle.

title: N.C. State Women Triumph
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Dec. 22 (AP)Trudi Lacey scored 25 points to lead North Carolina State to a 9064 triumph over High Point in the championship game tonight of the Carolina Christmas Classic women's basketball tournament.

title: No Parole for Bank Robber
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (UP1)The Federal Parole Commission refused today to parole John Stanley Wojtowicz, serving a 15year sentence as the mastermind of the Brooklyn Dog Day Afternoon bank robbery. The commission delayed further parole consideration until November l9S1, but agreed to give Mr. Wojtowicz an interim hearing during November 1979, when it will have a coot plete psychological and psychiatric re. port on hand.

title: Begin Plain Gets Cabinet Backing
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 22Prime Minister Menahem Begin received a unanimous endorsement today from Israel's Cabinet on the peace plan that he will formally present to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt when the two leaders meet in Ismailia, on the west bank of the Suez Canal, on Sunday.

title: Auctions
description: BUSINESS is booming in art auctions this season, according to reports made public in New York and London this week. Although the September  throughDecember sales period represents only four months of New York's 10month season, it usually produces half the sales volume for the major auction houses. In London, however, where the season is 11 months long and usually ends with major sales in June and July, the figures issued this week represent only about onethird of the season's total.

title: Books: Printed And Bound In the U.S.
description: JOSEPH BLUMENTHAL'S book is a survey, once over lightly, of the art of the printed book in America, and everything about it is a delight. The sumptuous, though muted maroon binding, the matching fawncolored end papers, the gold lettering on the spine and the layout of the pages that makes the print accessible both to the eye and the mind, all attest to the thought and devotion that went into the work. The platessample pages from the books printed in Americacomplement the text and constitute a splendid anthology on their own. No one is a true book lover, who, contemplating these samplings, does not lust to see and handle the originals.

title: CHEN SHADMIN, 75, ROSE TO TOP CHINA LABOR POSTS
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22 (AP)Chen Shaomin, a prominent Chinese woman labor leader, died Dec. 14 in Peking, it was reported today. She was 75 years old.

title: Carter Aides to Appeal Ruling Against Nixon on Tap
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The Carter Administration has decided to appeal Federal court decision that held that former President Richard M. Nixon and two of his top aides had violated the constitutional rights of a former White House staffmember by allowing a wiretap to remain on his home telephone for 21 months, Justice Department officials said today.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
Villanova 86, Duquesne 70
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Dec. 22 (UPI) Reggie Robinson scored 16 points, including the 1,000th point of his college career, and had 14 rebounds tonight, as Villavona increased its record to 70 with an 8670 triumph over Duquesne.

title: Beame Eulogizes Civic Leader, 33, Slain Attempting to Halt Mugger
description: A 33yearold Queens civic leader, Phillip Jackson, who was to have given an award to Mayor Beame was eulogized by the Mayor instead at a civic reception last night as the police searched for youth who shot and killed Mr. Jackson Wednesday night in Brooklyn.

title: Books of The Times
description: EVERYBODY who is anybody calls him Freddie. C. S. Lewis, on the other hand, described him to Gilbert Ryle as a cross between a rodent and a firefly. Of the French existentialistswho attached a tragic significance to the fact that It was impossible to be absolutely sure of the truth of empirical statementshe once observed: It is perverse to see tragedy in what could not conceivably be otherwise. Of himself he says: If I could be thought to have played Horatio to (Bertrand) Russell's Hamlet, I should consider it glory enough.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Evansville Benefit Game Will Feature Steelers
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 22 (AP)  The Steelers announced today that they would play a benefit basketball game for the basketball program at the University of Evansville.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the obituary of Nellie Tayloe Ross, published In The Times on Wednesday, it was stated incorrectly that Jeannette Rankin was elected to Congress from Wyoming, Mrs. Ross's . home state. Miss Rankin was a Representative from Montana.

title: STEIN OUTLINES AIMS AS MANHATTAN HEAD
description: Challenging Governor Carey on the Westway, promising to summon Mayorelect Edward I. Koch's Police Commissioner to testify on Manhattan crime and pledging the same sort of public hearings that won him wide attention as an antiestablishment loner in the Assembly, Andrew J. Stein yesterday promised an activist term as Borough President.

title: Monumental Ills Plaguing LongStanding Citizens
description: Down in Greenwich Village, George Washington's jaw is crumbling.

title: CANADA TO STEP UP DEFENSE SPENDING
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 22The Canadian Government announced plans today for the first stage of a $1.5 billion ship replacement program to upgrade this country's contribution to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and strengthen the naval role in national defense.

title: LEVITT SAYS AUDITS : SAVED HALF BILLION
description: State Comptroller Arthur Levitt, reviewing the 53 audits of the Medicaid program that his department has performed since Medicaid began 11 years ago, said that the state had saved a halfbillion dollars by implementing his suegestions but had passed up another 400 million by not doing more.

title: Mexicans Living Illegally in U.S. Sneak Back Home for Holiday
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 22Thousands of illegal aliens are streaming across the Mexican border this week, south, not north. Instead of sneaking into the United States, they are sneaking out. Instead of leaving Mexico, they are going back home.

title: About Real Estate
description: HILLSBOROUGH, N. J.  The object was to banish the rowhouse look while building suburban townhouses to a density of eight units to the acre. The solution, now in construction at a place called the Meadows of Hillsborough, is unusual suburban housing  quadrangles of fourplexes facing outward around an interior court for cars and garaging. Sixteen townhouses to a court, and no one sees his neighbor.

title: No Decision in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 22 (AP)Baseball leaders from Cuba and the United States met today to discuss a CubanAmerican allstar series, but no decision was made.

title: PANEL CRITICIZES U.S ON RAPIATION HAZARD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The Federal Government has failed to protect the public against the hazards of radiation, a Senate committee said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: In the obituary of Nellie Tayloe Ross, published in The Times on Wednesday, it was stated incorrectly that Jeannette Rankin was elected to Congress from Wyoming, Mrs. Ross's home state. Miss Rankin was a Representative from Montana.

title: 2 Blacks Killed in South Africa
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Africa. Dec. 22 (AP)The police manned buses traveling to black townships tonight after four days of disturbances in which the police reported shooting two blacks to death and wounding an unknown number.

title: Monumental Ills Plaguing LongStanding Citizens
description: Down in Greenwich Village, George Washington's jaw is crumbling.

title: Dollar Rises In Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Dec. 22 (AP)The dollar rose here today to 241.275 yen, compared with 240.725 yen at the close yesterday, as conversions of yen bonds into dollars increased and the markets reacted to President Carter's statement on the dollar.

title: Roosa's Plan to Link Currencies Studied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22A suggestion by a former high Treasury official to link the dollar, the Japanese yen and the West German mark into a zone of predetermined relationships, is getting some attention in Washington in the debate over monetary management.

title: Old Music Highlights in Ancram and Ridgefield
description: The peal of medieval, Renaissance and Baroque Christmas music will ring tonight in upstate New York and Connecticut. At 8:30 P.M., the Metropolitan Brass Quartet will perform early Spanish, Italian, English, Dutch and German music at the Ancram (N.Y.) Opera House (off the Taconic Parkway). Tickets are $4.95, $5.95, $7.95 and $9.95; reservations: (518) 3291177.

title: Music: 3 Brahms Trios at Y
description: THE 92d STREET Y.M.Y.W.H.A. has its own special chambermusir organization, which is headby the violinist Jaime Laredo. Also a member of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, Mr. Laredo is trying o do in a modest way what that august group does at Alice Tully Hall. If the Y programs are fewer and less Ambitious, they at least have putstandthe taient at their disposal.

title: Rutgers 91, Manhattan 76
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 22 (AP)James Bailey scored 39 points to lead Rutgers to a 9176 victory over Manhattan tonight.

title: Cabaret: Sterling Silver
description: Fred Silver, a songwriter and vocal coach who has written special material for Carol Burnett, Kaye Ballard and Hermione Gingold, among others, has put together a group of his songs to create a small revue. Sterling Silver, with a cast of four that will be at the Ballroom through Jan. S. Mr. Silver was also musical director for Julius Monk's Revues, so it may be no coincidence that one finds one's self thinking happily of Mr. Monk's shows by watching Mr. Silver and his little troupe.

title: A LEBANESE DEMANDS PALESTINIANS LEAVE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 22A Lebanese Christian leader insisted today on the withdrawal of all Palestinians from Lebanon as a condition for national reconciliation from the deep divisions created by the civil war.

title: Two Reporters Are Subpoenaed About Leak in a Banking Case
description: TRENTON, DEC. 22 (AP)Two reporters appeared under subpoena in Federal Court here today in an inquiry to determine the anonymous source of information sent to their newspapers concerning a banking matter.

title: About Real Estate
description: HILLSBOROUGH, N. J.  The object was to banish the rowhouse look while bilding suburban townhouses to a density of eight units to the acre. The solution, now in construction at a place called the Meadows of Hillsborough, is

title: $2 Million Pledged to Smith College
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., Dec. 22 (AP)Smith College said today that an almuna had pledged $2 million to a $40 million fundraising campaign at the nation's largest women's college. The donor, who was not identified by the college. said that stocks valued at $2 million would be used to support salary increases for younger faculty members. Since starting the fundraising drive 11 months ago, Smith, which has about 2,100 students, has received $14.8 million in pledges.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For period ended Nov. 30 unless other wise indicated. (N) indicates stock Waded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange, (0) over, the counter.

title: RHODESIAN TALKS GO ON; NO PROGRESS REPORTED
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 22 (Reuters)Rhodesian settlement talks centered today on the key issue of safeguards for the white minority in a blackruled Rhodesia, and evidently little if any progress was made.

title: Financing Is Set For Rebuilding Of Commodore
description: Two financial institutions have agreed to put up $80 million of the $100 million needed to reconstruct the Commodore Hotel, and work will begin in February, Donald Trump, the developer, said yesterday.

title: DOLLAR UP SHARPLY ON CARTER'S STAND
description: PARIS, Dec. 22The battered dollar rebounded sharply on European currency markets today, following President Carter's suggestion yesterday that the United States might actively defend its value and the decision of oilexporting countries not to increase the price or oil.

title: Policeman's Strength Foils Suicide Attempt
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 22 (UPI)A policeman used his strong arms last night to save the life of a man who threatened to jump to his death from a 65foothigh television tower.

title: Top Chess Official Is Called to Belgrade In Effort to Save SpasskyKorchnoi Match
description: Max Euwe, the president of the International Chess Federation, has been summoned from the Netherlands, Yugoslavia, in a lastditch, effort to salvage the world championship challengers match between Boris Spassky and Viktor Korchnoi.

title: Large Loans to Georgia Banker Came During a Political Career
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 22R. Eugene Holley, for eight years the chairman of the Georgia Senate Banking and Finance Committee, is not as well known as a fellow financially troubled Georgia millionaire, Bert Lance, but his meteoric financial career, like Mr. Lance's, suggests that banking and politics can go hand in hand. When they do, banking regulations do not always forestall highrisk banking practices.

title: Belgrade Conference on Security Adjourns Its Sessions Till Jan. 17
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The 35state European security conference adjourned for the holidays today until Jan, 17. Diplomats predicted tough EastWest bargaining in the new year, especially on the key issue of human rights.

title: Deaths
description: ALLENMildred E. (Pat), died at her home in Zurich, Switzerland Decem ber 3, 1977. From 1954 to 1967 she was Director of the Foreign Desk of the American Cancer Society. Since then she had been Consultant to the International Union Against Cancer, Geneva. A memorial will be held Thursday, February 2nd, 1978 at 4:30 PM at the Church Center for the United Nations, 777 UN Plaza, New York. Contributions in her memory may be made to the American Cancer Society.

title: Office Shuffle at City Hall
description: The problem was: Since Mayorelect Edward I. Koch has promised that all his deputies will be equal, which deputy would get the big office next door to the Mayor's?

title: HalfFares Apply for Holiday Weekend
description: Halffares on subways, buses and commuter railroads in the metropolitan area will be in effect from 6 P.M. tomorrow to 1 A.M. next Tuesday. On the Long Island Rail Road and ConRail's Harlem, Hudson and New Haven commuter lines, the halffare program will extend to 4 A.M. on Tuesday.

title: Adelphi 73, Mansfield State 68
description: HAMILTON, N.Y., Dec. 22Gordon McCrae and Jerry Beckles led Adelphi University to a 7368 victory over Mansfield State tonight in the first round of the HamiltonUtica Christmas tournament, McCrae scored 27 points and Beckles chipped in 22 for the Panthers. who now have an 81 record. The Panthers led throughout the second half after grabbing a 3836 advantage at halftime.

title: New Face: Leslie Browne Dance, Ballerina, Dance
description: As her ballet world turns. Emilia announcing to her family that she has reached the fork in the road: A famous New York company, dancing at her hometown auditorium in Oklahoma City for two nights, has suddenly invited her to join it.

title: Kings 4, Black Hawks 0
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 22 (UPI)  Don Kozak scored two goals and Rogie Vachon recorded his third shutout of the season tonight to lead the Los Angeles Kings to a 40 victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Music: Cage and His Listeners
description: JOHN CAGE presented the first of two programs of new music at the Kitchen on Wednesday night, and one marveled again at his ability to provoke varied reactions, including genuine unease, in his audiences. During the performance of the first 16 of his 32 new Etudes Australes, which comprised the first and longest half of the program, people fidgeted, coughed and left the performance space to pace and smoke in the vestibule. Other people sat entranced, despite an overactive heating system and the frequent rumbling of trucks in the street below.

title: Crippled Ship in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 22 (Reuters)The crippled 385  foot Panamanian freighter Malaysia Permai limped into San Francisco Bay today to undergo repairs. The Permai, bound for Japan from Vancouver, British Columbia, carrying a shipment of potash, began to take on water Monday and radioed the Coast: guard for assistance. As her crew of 33 prepared to abandon ship, the the cutter, Resolute and an American merchant vessel arrived with emergency pumping equipment and stabilized her.

title: DR. FRANCIS S. JUHASZ, 52, A PROFESSOR AT COLUMBIA
description: Dr. Francis S. Juhasz, chariman of the American language program at Columbia University, died Thursday at New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 52 years old and lived in Pleasantville, N.Y.

title: Indian Dance Recital Tonight in Flushing
description: Viji Prakash of Bombay, India, who has performed Bharat Natyam, the centuriesold Indian classical dance, in Asia, Europe and this country, will give a recital tonight at the Hindu Temple Society's Cultural Center in Flushing, Queens.

title: South Carolina 65, U.S.C. 58
description: COLUMBIA, S.., Dec. 22 (AP)South Carolina scored the first 7 points in overtime tonight and defeated Southern California, 6558, in the opening game of the Carolina Classic tournament. Both teams now have 54 records.

title: ARGENTINE PRESIDENT FACING A CHALLENGE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 22 (AP)Argentina's navy chief said in a statement published yesterday that it was time for the military junta to carry out its original agreement, which would mean reducing the authority of President Jorge Videla, the army commander and a junta member.

title: 78 JERSEY ECONOMY IS SEEN AHEAD OF U.S.
description: TRENTON, Dec. 22New Jersey's economy should grow at a faster rate next year than the national average, the state's Economic Policy Council forecast today.

title: Bills Dismiss Jim Ringo As poach After 311 Year
description: Jim Ringo was dismissed yesterday as coach of the Buffalo Bills following a season in which his team lost 11 of its 14 games. That record was good for a tie for last place with the Jets in the American Conference Eastern Division, and the only teams with lesser records were Kansas City and Tampa Bay, both 212.

title: Christmas in Mill Grove, N.C.
description: COLUMBIA, N.C.  Affirmativeaction policies affect more than the life of one individual. The results of such policies can change the life and expectations of a whole people, for they change the way people view themselves and the world around them: One member of a disadvantaged minority on a Job that formerly had been forever closed to him says to many, many others similarly situated, You, too, can have a chance.

title: At the Movies
description: W HEN I get up in the morning, said the absurdly gorgeous woman, basking in the soothing quiet of her Park Avenue apartment, I don't have 45 minutes to sit before the mirror and prepare myself for the day. I have a child to tend to, and he's crying. My clothes are baggy and they don't really show my figure; I wear absolutely no makeup and my hair is quickly pinned up on top of my head. Do you realize that they cut five inches off my hair?

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Suspensions by Holtz Draw Attorney's Fire

title: HOME FOR HOLIDAYS, CARTER GOES HUNTING
description: PLAINS, Ga., Dec. 22President Carter, home for the holidays, visited with friends and relatives in this little south Georgia village today, answered a few questions from reporters, bought a hunting license and took off into the countryside to do some quail shooting.

title: E. P. A. Orders Report on Chemicals
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22Beginning longrange campaign to control dangerous toxic substances in the marketplace, the Environmental Protection Agency ordered all chemical makers today to report every product they made in 1977 to the Government by next May 1.

title: U. S. STEEL TO RAISE PRICES 5.5%, SETTING LEVEL FOR iNDUSTRY
description: The United States Steel Corporation, the nation's largest steel producer, yesterday announced price increases of 5.5 percent for most its steel products, a level in line with the advances of other major steel companies this week.

title: The Day the Waldorf Went Kosher
description: For two days and nights, Rabbi Osher Shoretz patrolled the kitchens of the WaldorfAstoria to make sure that the first ever gourmet kosher meal there really would be kosher.

title: Censure Move Raised in Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 22 (Reuters)Turkey's main opposition party took its first step in Parliament to topple the coalition Government of Prime Minister Suleyman Demirel today presenting censure motion attacking all aspects of his five-month-old administration. The motion from the Republican People's Party should lead to a vote next week.

title: Soviet Rebuffs U.S. on Shcharansky
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 22The Soviet press agency Tass today rejected American statements of concern about Anatoly Shcharansky, who is being held pending an inquiry into alleged spying for the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Opera: A New Tanhhauser at Met
description: THE STORY of the man who is seduced by the delights of the les and can be redeemed only by the love of a good woman, preferably a virgin, is told again and again in Western art. Goethe's Faust, Hogarth's Tom Rakewell and Wagner's Tannhuser all come in conflict with a society that views spiritual love as opposite sides of the coin. The Metropolitan Opera's new production of Tannhauser introduced last night, tells the ancient tale once more, and in magnificent fashion.

title: Jazz: Hot Club Revisited
description: THE QUINTET of the Hot Club of France, the group in which Django Reinhardt, the Belgian gypsy guitarist, rose to international fame in the 1930's, was never heard in live performances in the United States. Americans knew the group's music only through records. But, 40 years after the fact, the quintet's music is finally being heard here live, played by a group called Jazz a Cordes, or Jazz With Strings, that appears on Wednesday evenings at the Red Blazer Too, 88th Street at Third Avenue.

title: Carter's Pledge to Help Cut Regulatory Complexity
description: WASHINGTON  The nation's top businessmen received from President Carter an unexpected but highly welcomed expression of sympathy and pledge of help here recently for one of their most nagging problemsexcessive Government regulation. He told some 150 active and retired chief executives from business, industry, banking and finance that he shared their concern about the regulatory burden, and he invited them to write to Him or his Cabinet about their specific complaints in that area.

title: Weaker OPEC Is Worried Over Disunity
description: CARACAS, VenezueIa, Dec. 22Four years after shocking the world with sudden, fourfold increase in crude oil prices, the members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries are worried about the possibility of basic disunity developing over the price question.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Where to Be Jolly For the Season
description: As the dark envelops New York late this afternoon, the ad hoc Christmas tree that is the Empire State Building, swathed in garish green and red lights for the holiday season, towers over city that is slowing down for the Christmas weekend

title: POLICE INVESTIGATING SLAYING OF OFFICER
description: Detectives investigating the shooting death of an offduty police officer and the wounding of another man in the hallway of a Harlem tenement on Wednesday night were waiting for ballistics tests yesterday to determine if a third person had shot the two men. The officer's service revolver was not found at the scene.

title: Correction Officer at Rikers I. Charged With Accepting Bribes From Prisoners
description: A correction officer at the House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island has been charged in an indictment with accepting a $500 bribe from a prisoner to whom he allegedly delivered hacksaw blades and a knife and a $100 bribe from a prisoner to whom he allegedly promised to deliver marijuana.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT BUFFALO

title: Nation Magazine Sold to Group Led by Hamilton Fish
description: The Nation, the oldest weekly magazine in the country, was sold Yesterday to a group of investors organized by Hamilton Fish, a 26-year-old Harvard graduate who will be the magazine's new publisher.

title: Atmospheric Blasts off East Coast Puzzle Scientists and the Military
description: Three weeks of mysterious blasts along the Eastern Seaboard have led scientists to explore a number of explanations, but all they seem agreed on is that the blasts are strong and atmospheric, originating tens of miles off shore.

title: U.S., in Policy Shift, Now Willing to Sell Sudan Combat Jets
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The United States, in a move with important policy implications, informed the Sudan recently that it was now willing to sell it a squadron of 12 F5 fighter aircraft, American officials said today.

title: Enid Darlington Wed To Fred E. Brown
description: Enid Sillcox Darlington and Fred E. Brown of Harding Township, N.J., were married yesterday in St. Eustace Episcopal Church in Lake Placid, N.Y. Mr. Brown is chairman and chief executive officer of the TriContinental Corporation. The Rev. William L. Hayes performed the ceremony.

title: MANDATORY RULES URGED FOR VEHICLE INSPECTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22 (AP)States should not be given the choice on whether to comply with Federal vehicle safety inspection standards, the General Accounting Office said in a report released today.

title: Television
U.S., in Policy Shift, Now Willing to Sell Sudan Combat Jets
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The United States, in a move with important policy implications, informed the Sudan recently that it was now willing to sell it a squadron of 12 F5 fighter aircraft, American officials said today.

title: Roadrunners Switch Leagues
description: PHOENIX, Dec. 22 (AP)The Phoenix Roadrunners, who dropped out of the Central Hockey League last week in a dispute over lack of players, announced membership today in the Pacific Hockey League.

title: Market Up 7.88 in Heavy Trading; Dollar. Rise and Oil Freeze Factors
description: A recovery in the sagging dollar in foreignexchange trading fueled a sharp stock market rally in Wall Street yesterday on heavy volume.

title: BANKS LOBBY CALLED STRONCEST IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 22The nation's banks exert an influence over Congress and the Federal Government that, in the opinion of many Senate and House members, Congressional staff members, Washington lobbyists and other officials, surpasses the power of any other regulated industry.

title: MayorElect Wins Skirmish in First Brush With Labor
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch had his first confrontation with organized labor yesterday at a meeting of the Emergency Financial Control Board and while labor put up a hard, wellorchestrated fight, Mr. Koch won.

title: PhoneBet Plan At Tracks Gains
description: Proposals by the New York Racing Association to set up its own system of telephone wagering received a conditional stamp of approval yesterday from the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Marquette Drops First As Louisville Wins, 6160
description: LOUISVILLE Ky., Dec 22 (AP)Led by Darrell Griffith'sh 23 points, Louisville sent Marquette to its first defeat of the season tonight with a 6160 victory over the defending National Collegiate basketball champions.

title: Knicks Go Cold At End and Bow To Cays, 112100
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Dec. 22Spencer Haywood, restored to the Knicks starting lineup, scored 20 points and Bob McAdoo, making 13 of 25 shots, scored 35 tonight. But neither they nor the other Knicks could make a basket over the last 6 minutes 36 seconds and that paved the way for the Cleveland Cavaliers to roost a 112100 triumph.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
HOW TO AID THE FUND
