description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N. Y. 10242 or to these agencies:

title: Returning Gifts
description: TWAS THE day after Christmas and all through the house were the gifts nobody wanted. What to you do with the, gifts you can't use? Although New York City has regulations requiring stores to state their return policies clearly, there's nothing that says they have to take back the gifts you don't keep unless, of course, they're defective.

description: The appointment of G. William Miller, chairman of Textron, Inc., to replace Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board may bring a change in style in the management of the nation's monetary The policy. But, a change in Economic substance is considered unScene likely.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28A new Congressional study, apparently based on a different way of calculating the regional benefits of Federal aid, disputes the notion that taxpayers in the Northeastern states are shortchanged by the Federal Government in favor of the growing Sunbelt states in the South and West.

description: It is as though, having always been severely myopic, radio astronomers are acquiring glasses giving them 2020 vision of the heavens.

description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 28Prime Minister Menahem Begin defended his peace plan before Parliament today, insisting that Israeli forces must remain in the occupied Arab territories of the West Bank of the Jordan and the Gaza Strip and declaring that the next move in the IsraeliArab ,peace maneuvering was up to Egypt. At the start of a long debate this morning, Mr. Begin made public his plan for selfrule for the 1.1 million Arabs in

title: Study of Stamford Police Abuses erminated in 75 by State Official
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Dec. 28A 1975 state police investigation that indicated extensive corruption within the Stamford Police Department was terminated that year by State Police Commissioner Edward P. Leonard despite repeated pleas by investigators in his department for followup inquiries, it has been learned.

title: Jazz: Art Blakey and Messengers
description: ART BLAKEY, whose Jazz Messengers have maintained a consistently and distinctively thick - textured, hard - driving style for more than 20 years, is leading a sevenpiece version of the Messengers at the Village Vanguard through Sunday. It is a group that rates with such peaks in the Messengers history as the late50's quintet that included Benny Golson, Lee Morgan and Bobby Timmons, and the mid60's group with Freddie Hubbard, Curtis Fuller, Wayne Shorter and Cedar Walton.

description: Theater

title: Brandt Says Europe Should Give More Backing to Africa Guerrillas
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Willy Brandt, the former West German Chancellor, said today that Western Europe should give more than moral support to black nationalist guerrillas fighting for majority rule in southern Africa.

title: Washington &
description: WASHINGTONAt Duke University in North Carolina last October, Secretary of Commerce Juanita M. Kreps told a gathering of the nation's leading businessmen that the Department of Commerce would develop a social performance index to give them a way of appraising the social effects of their operations.

title: Road Crash Kills Player Who Missed Air Death
description: NEWTON, Ill., Dec. 28 (UPI)A freshman basketball player at the University of Evansville was killed last night with a younger brother in a cartruck collision. The victims were David Fun, 18 years old, and Byron, 16.

title: Schlesinger Hopeful on Energy Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)James R. Schlesinger, the Energy Secretary, predicted today that Congress would pass the longawaited enerty bill in early Wren. He said that the Administration was looking forward to 1978 with enthIlsiasm and an expectation of getting the legislation that the nation needs, and think we'll have a New Year's resolution regarding our energy problems.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Dec. 28 (AP)A rightist politician was shot to death on a street here during this morning's rush hour.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHEN WE LAST HEARD from Carlos Castaneda, he was jumping off the top of a Mexican mountain into the abyss, where he had been reliably informed by his sorcererguru Don Juan, he would become pure perception, bouncing back and forth like Ping Pang ball or a luminous egg between the tonal and the nagual realms of creation. He probably took his writing pad with him. He seems to have started out wanting to be Stanley in Africa and ended up as John Carter Mars.

title: In Memariam
description: FEUERSTEINEmll. Dec. 29, 1964. Dearest POOPEE. You are always In our thoughts and forever In our hearts. Cherished Husband, Be. loved Father, Adored Grandfather and Devoted Brother

title: Little Light From Con Ed
description: So now we have Consolidated Edison's final report on the July 13 blackouta fivevolume effort that follows two earlier reports and caps a fivemonth investigation. Con Ed board chairman Charles Luce calls the three reports the most comprehensive selfanalysis of a power failure ever published by a utility. That may well be truebut then what other utility has ever had such reason to explain itself? For the citizen seeking to understand what caused the blackout and what must be done to prevent another, the report is a disappointment. It throws a blanket of facts over a subject that needs an objectively analytical light.

title: Soviet Says That Moves by Sadat Have Worsened Mideast Situation
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Accusing Egypt of betraying the Palestinians, the Soviet Union said today that the Middle East situation had changed for the worse since President Anwar eI-Sadat began his dialogue with Israel.

title: Morton Has Date in Court
description: BRIGHTON, Colo., Dec. 28 (UPI)Craig Morton, who guided the Denver Broncos into the National Football League playoffs this season for the first time in the club's 18year history, has been ordered to make a court appearance next month on a disputed loan agreemen with a New York bank.

title: TV: From End To Beginning
description: Arvilla Groesbeck, a farmer, is the subject of Arvilla, a documentary concerning the status of women inrural America. It will be on Ch. 13 tonight at 9:30.

title: A Bronx Man Is Accused Of Reporting to Police Nonexistent Emergencies
description: When two Housing Department policemen responded to a report of a shooting Tuesday at 180 Brook Avenue in the Motc Haven section of the Bronx, they raced over to the building in the Mill Brook buses and found a suspect as soon asi jtey frzred the lobby. He was not holding a gun, but a scanner radio that monitors police radio transmissions.

description: Outgoing

title: POLISH LEADER AIDED BY FOREIGN CONTACTS
description: WARSAW, Dec. 28Poland's Communist Party leader, Edward Gierek, has become a widely traveled Eastern European statesman, with the apparent aim of increasing his flexibility in dealing with domestic nroblems.

title: F. D. L C. AUDITS URGED ON BANK SUPERVISORS
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 28The General Accounting Office recommended today that the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation require periodic internal audits of its own bank supervisors and require more thorough documentation when classifying problem banks.

title: Dollar Splits U.S. and Allies
description: PARIS, Dec. 28I'm afraid Carter is pulling another Vietnam on us, remarked a European banker the other day, as the dollar began its latest slide. He's trying to save the world by floodins it with dollar bills. The comparison with the Vietnam War seems harsh. But, in moneEconomic tary terms, the dollar's Analysis plight today resembles what happened during the 1960's and this is what the banker meant.

title: Secrecy Abounds in Sale of A's
description: OAKLAND, Calif.. Dec. 28Negotiations to pry Charley Finley's A's out of their Oakland lease so that they can be sold and moved to Denver will begin this week in a meeting of many interested parties at an undisclosed location (not in Oakland) and an unannounced time.

title: Channel 13 Gets 3 British Programs
description: WHAT WOULD public television be, Lawrence Grossman, president of the Public Broadcasting Service, recently quipped, if the British didn't speak English?

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  President Carter announced today he would replace Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board with G. William Miller, the chairman of Textron Inc.; a diversified manufacturing company based in Providence, R.I.

title: ALVIN ERLICII, PRESIDENT OF WARD FOODS, WAS 51
description: Alvin L. Erlich, president and chief executive of Ward Foods, died Monday while on vacation in Hawaii. He was 51 years old and lived at 11 East 86th Street.

title: Market Place
description: When insiders of a troubled corporation begin to buy shares, it may be time for outsiders to take another look at the company, according to an old Wall Street saying.

title: At Smithsonian, Decorative Art of Architect Wright
description: THERE IS no excuse not to see the exhibition that just opened at the Smithsonian's Renwick Museum in Washington, called The Decorative Designs of Frank Lloyd Wright, because it will run through next July. But if you go during the holiday season, there is the bonus of the restored salon at the top of James Renwick's great stair, a grand 19thcentury room furnished with what appears to be two of everything from the Smithsonian's collection of Victorians, now dressed up with a fine pair of trees trimmed with antique paper ornaments. The overscaled, richly polished furniture is decked with holly, and the French gilt chairs seem waiting for ball.

title: ANKARA UNIVERSITY CLOSES FOR YEAR AFTER SHOOTING
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 28 (Reuters)Authorities closed a university here for 12 months today after gunmen wounded a physics professor, apparently because of his political views.

title: Plan Calls for the Reorganization of City Bureaucracy
description: The massive New York City bureaucracy will be run a reorganized cadre of 2,000 professional managers under a plan approved yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: Marleen Kassel and Paul Kerson. Lawyer, Married
description: Marleen Ruth Kassel, a coordinator of the Japanese. program at the Riverdale Country School in the Bronx, was married yesterday to Paul E. Kerson, a partner in the law firm of Garaufis Kerson in Bayside, Queens.

title: A JobsFirst Approach
description: WASHINGTONIf nature takes its course, on Jan. 19 President Carter will propose, as part of his State of the Union Message, a tax cut of around $25 billion. Such a tax cut, he is likely to say, will undo the damage inflicted by energy and Social Security tax increases and forestall an economic slowdown.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY. DECEMBER 28. 1977

title: Around the Nation: 1977 in Pictures
description: THE PRESIDENCY: President Carter and his wife, Rosalynn, walked down Pennsyvania Avenue, heralding the return of the Democrats to the WhiteHouse. At right, in a major setback, he announces the resignation of close friend, Bert Lance, as budget director.

title: Few Wine Surprises at Le Cygne, but No One Need Co Thirsty
description: The wine list at Le Cygne is overdone. often overpriced and generally lacking in surprises and bargains. Which is to say that it resembles the wine lists at most of the city's firstline French restaurants.

title: Art: Representation Is Alive in SoHo
description: 0 NE of the many strange features of 20thcentury art has been the frequency with which representation has been pronounced dead, only to be later declared resurrectedusually in the form of a new realism. Such reports have, of course, proved to be exaggerations, delivered with an eye more to publicity than truth. Still, their very appearance has symptomized the precarious state of the mode.

title: Holiday Throngs Add More Joy To a Season That's Been Jolly
description: Wearing knit gloves and cap, a fake fur coat and slacks, 80-year-old Nettie Lang of Bellmore, L.I., stood near the angels in Rockefeller Center's Channel Garden yesterday looking at the giant Christmas tree.

title: ExEnvoy Says Risk of Exposure Negated C.I.A. Propaganda Value
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29A retired American Ambassador told a House subcommittee today that the risk of exposure and embarrassment attached to the Central Intelligence Agency's worldwide propaganda operations, combined with questions about their effectiveness, outweighed whatever political value had been derived from them over the years.

title: FreeForm Jewelry for FreeForm Fashions
description: He didn't set out to be a jewelry design. Richard Charlcs Glassen was first a model, then a talent agent. As the sales representative for a designer, he began to be interested in shape, form and fashion. About two years ago he started experimenting with decorative jewelry designs that would, he hoped, carry out the mood of today's clothes.

title: Where to Blow the Horns at Midnight
description: NEW YORK will be its customary big, blotting, singing, dancing, elbowing self on New Year's Eve, and although the cost of welcoming in 1978 is up, there seem to be enough relatively inexpensive parties, open houses and entertainments around town for even the most modest of party seekers tomorrow night.

title: George Lord Jr. Weds Providencia Morillo
description: Providencia Maria Morillo and George de Forest Lord Jr. were married in a Bahai ceremony yeaterday at the home of Prof. and Mrs. Lord, parents of the bridegroom, in East Lyme, Conn. The bride, a graphic artist, is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Peter Morillo of St. Louis.

title: Money Supply Gains
description: The nation's basic money supply rose by $1.5 billion in the week ended Dec. 28, but analysts were not surprised. Meanwhile, a broader gauge of the money supply rose by $800 million, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday. Page D2.

title: DELIVERERS
description: Deliverers of The Daily News loaded trucks and headed out to locations throughout the metropolitan area last night as union officials ordered an end to a walkout that kept most copies of the Thursday Issue off the streets and that had threatened to block the distribution of the Friday issue as well.

title: Publishing: The One Big Book Syndrome
description: T the turn of the year, many publishers and authors agree on one subject: the unfortunate trend toward the one big book. They say that concentrationeither on a handful of books or in big housesthreatens quality and variety, dominates the marketplace, and eventually curtails freedom of choice for the reader.

title: Program of Peretz At EmanuEl Y
description: Works by the Yiddish writer Y.L. Peretz, including folk tales, sketches, stories, poems, essays and speeches will he presented in English translation this weekend. Presentations are today at 11 A.M. and 2 P.M. and Sunday at 11 A.M. at the Jewish Repertory Theater of the EmanuelEl Midtown Y.M.Y.W.H.A., 344 East 14th Street (at First Avenue).

description: The marriage of Sara Ilene Tancer, who expects to graduate next May from Smith College, to Arthur Jay Gordon, a geologist for the Fugro Corporation in Long Beach, Calif., took place at the Phoenix (Ariz.) Country Day School yesterday. Rabbi Morris Kertzer performed the ceremony.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Summary

title: P.U.C . Head Rebuffs Rate Request By Bell, Stirring Aide's Criticism
description: NEWARK, Dec. 29The president of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners today rebuffed an application by the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company for a $148.8 million rate increase on the ground that the request was based on projected rather than current earnings and financial requirements.

title: FOE OF ATOMIC PLANT CALLS THE IDEA DEAD
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Dec. 29A threeyear delay in the construction and operation of the world's first floating nuclaar power plant means it will never operate off the Jersey Shore, Freeholder Daryl F. Todd of Atlantic County said today.

title: Article 7 -- No Title
description: The Nor York TIMirs/D, Gorton

title: Protestants in Israel Charge Bias
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 29Protestant churches in Israel protested today against the enactment of a law making missionaries liable to five years imprisonment if they offer material inducements to people to change their religion.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
G.M. Lifts Price of the Chevette, Its BestSelling Car, About 3%
description: DETROIT, Dec.29The Chevrolet division of the General Motors Corporaion today announced a price increase of approximately 3 percent on the division's bestselling carthe Chevrolet Chevette.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: NOT COVERED FOR FIRE PROTECTION: The farm home of Mr. and Mrs. George Raines burning to the ground Wednesday near Butler, Mo. Because the family did not

title: Uniquely Prepared as Host to West's Leaders
description: WARSAW, Dec. 29President Carter is the. third American President that Poland's Communist leader. Edward Gierek, has received in five years. Many people feel that while publicly Mr. Gierek may not relish his role, privately he enjoys these con- tacts.

title: Ellen Hallock Wed To John Goertner Jr.
description: At Calvary Episcopal Church in Summit, N.J., yesterday Ellen Davis Hallock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Charles Hallock of Summit, was married to John Melville Goertner Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Goertner of Wayne, N.J. The Rev. William Strane performed the ceremony.

title: L.I. Youth Festival Concert
description: The ninth annual holiday festival orchestra concert, featuring present and past members of the Long Island Youth Orchestra, will he given this evening at R o'clock in Bethpage High School, Stewart and Cherry Avenues in Bethpage. The program includes Mozart's . Infon a C ncertunte in E flat (K.364) and works by Copland and Berlioz. Tickets are $3.50 for adults, $1.50 for students and the elderly. Reservations: (516) 883.670(1, days: (516) 883.2242 or (516) 6767137, nights.

title: Mardersteig's Tradition Will Go On
description: Officina Bodoni, the printing house in Verona, Italy, founded by the master printer Giovanni Mardersteig, who died on Tuesday at the age of 85, will be continued by his son Martino in collaboration with the son's wife and the printer's widow, Mr. Mardersteig said yesterday.

title: SOviet Dissident Movement Is at Low Ebb
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29The small Soviet humanrights movement, which has attracted so much attention around the world though it is probably unrepresentative of any broadly held opinion, is at its lowest point in years after a campaign of arrests, threats and forced exile directed against most of its prominent leaders. Its momentum has been curbed, its political dexterity undermined and its communications network in the Soviet Union badly disrupted.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Vietnam Is Acting to Halt Escapes
description: LAEM SING, Thailand, Dec. 25  The Vietnamese Government, increasingly concerned about escape attempts, has launched an open campaign of intimida. tion, at the risk of publicizing in Vietnam the embarrassing fact that many of its citizens are prepared to risk death at sea to flee from the Communist regime.

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Nearly everyone who has looked at the nation's welfare system believes that it ought to be changed. The difficulty is that welfare reform means different things to different people.

title: The Pop Life
description: LIKE Rick Danko, who was at the Bottom Line a few days ago, Levon Helm is best known as a member of the Band. With his rocksolid drumming and his buzzing, raspy and tireless baritone, Mr. Helm did much to lend the Band its distinctively American, roots-of-rock-and-roll feeling. And since the rest of the Band was Canadian and Mr. Helm came from the depths of Arkansas, he did, in fact, bring a genuine flavor of the American South to a group of musicians who came originally to that region's music from a distance.

title: Marino Accuses Morgenthau of Being Lax on Pimps
description: State Senator Ralph J. Marino, the chairman of a New York State legislative anticrime committee, charged yesterday that the office of District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan was not tough enough on pimps.

title: Newcombe, Rosewall Ousted In Melbourne Net Tourney
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 29 (AP) Youth proved more valuable than experience today in the $200,000 Australian open tennis tournament as John Lloyd of Britain put a crimp in John Newcombe's comeback and John Alexander Australia eliminated 43-yearold Ken Rosewall.

title: Books: Feminists at Work
description: AMIXTURE of feminist anathemasindictments of what are assertedly the ruling concepts in American intellectual lifeWorking It Out strives to dedevelop a statement of current feminist thinking that is based on the authors personal battles with male chauvinism. Articulate and angry, the authors often express viewpoints in what seems like schismatic terms.

title: MRS. LORRAINE O'DONNELL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29Mrs. Lorraine O'Donnell, wife of the late Gen. Emmett O'Donnell Jr., who was commander in chief of the United States Air Force in the Pacific in the early 1960's, died yesterday after a heart attack at her home in McLean. Va. She was 67 years old.

title: FRED W. GUSHURST
description: DENVER, Dee. 29 (AP)Fred W. Gushurst, a member of the Notre Dame University football squad that made the forward pass a serious play when the sport I was relatively new, died yesterday at the age of 87. Gushurst played with Knute Rockne and Charles Dorais on the 1913 Irish team that defeated West Point, 3513, with 13 consecutive passes.

title: Soviet Dissident Movement Is at Low Ebb
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27The small Soviet humanrights movement, which has attracted so much attention around the world though it is probably unrepresentativ2 of any broadly held opinion, is at its lowest point in years after a campaign of arrests, threats and forced exile directed against most of its prominent leaders. Its momentum has been curbed, its political dexterity undermined and its communications network in the Soviet Union badly disrupted.

title: Iranians, in Reprisal for Incidents, Halt Trading With Denmark and Italy
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 29 (Reuters)Iranian companies said today that they had stopped trading with Denmark and Italy after what they said were attacks cn Iranian diplomatic missions in both countries. The semiofficial Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Mines said the companies were angered by the leniency with which the attackers were treated.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 30, 1977

title: 50 Nonstop Hours of Gertrude Stein
description: The Making of Americans is a very important thing and everybody ought to be reading at it or it.

title: Holiday Throngs Add More Joy To a Season That's been Jolly
description: Wearing knit gloves and cap, a fake fur coat and slacks, 80-year-old Nettie Lang of Bellmore, LI., stood near the angels in Rockefeller Center's Channel Garden yesterday looking at the giant Christmas tree.

title: PEACE DELAY SEEN
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29President Anwar elSadat said today that he was disappointed by President Carter's assertion yesterday that there should not be a Palestinian state and felt that the President's remark could delay a peace settlement in the Middle East.

title: Accounting Board Drafts New Code
description: he Financial Accounting Standards Board took a longoverdue first step yesterday toward reexamining the basic building blocks of accounting theory and issued recommendations on ale concepts it believes should govern financial reporting.

title: 135 SUBWAY MOTORMEN SUSPENDED IN 10 MONTHS
description: A day after a subway accident injured 30 passengers, the Transit Authority said yesterday that 135 motormen had been suspended or reprimanded for imporper performance in the first 10 months of this year.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: MANHATTAN

title: The Royal Canadians Will Be There Without Guy
description: On Saturday evening, for the 49th consecutive New Year's Eve, the old year will be sent on its way and the new year will be ushered in on a nationwide broadcast by Guy Lombardo's Royal Canadians. Since Dec. 31, 1929, when the Royal Canadians, playing in thr Grill Room of the Roosevelt Hotel, closed out the old year on the Columbia Broadcasting System and started the new year a few minutes later on the facilities of the National Broadcasting Company, the band has been heard on both sides of midnight every New Year's Eve, initially on radio and, since 1943, on television (Channel 2, starting at 11:30 P.M, from the Waldorf-Astoria).

title: Merrill Lynch to Lift Retail Rates; Discounts and Custodial Fees Set
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc., the nation's largest securities firm, will raise its commission rates to retail customers by an average of 7 percent, beginning next Friday.

title: Chinese Performing Arts At Tully Hall Tonight
description: A free program of Chinese performing arts, featuring dance, drama and opera, is scheduled for tonight at 7:30 P.M. at Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center.

title: A Concert for Ping Pong Players
description: Table tennis is a game of sounds. Between ,the fortissimo cacophony of sharp pinqs and dull pongs, there are elements, believes a composer, George Costinesco, of something grander and more euphonious. Of music.

title: Law and Terrorism
description: Kurt Groenewold is a small, cheerful, somewhat rumpled young man who does not look as if he would want to have anything to do with the terrorists who have thrown West Germany into a seizure of fear and security measures. On a recent visit to New York he insisted that he did not agree with the strategy of bombings, kidnappings and murders that the terrorists have adopted, and he said he was not entirely clear about their political rationale and ultimate goals.

title: Mideast Sides Urged to Stay OpenMinded
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29Administration officials said today that the United States had undertaken a diplorttic effort to convince Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt that, despite their sharp differences over the Palestinian issue, there exists a significant opportunity to negotiate an equitable agreement.

title: Suspended Arkansas Players Drop Suit Against Coach Holtz
description: Three suspended Arkansas football players dropped a suit in Federal District Court in Little Rock yesterday that was initiated to force Coach Lou Holtz to permit them to play in the Orange Bowl next Monday night against Oklahoma.

title: Namath's Future? A Guessing Game
description: Although he is no longer a Jet, the annual guessing game surrounding Joe Nanrath's plans to play another season apreared a bit cloudier than usual yesterday.

title: Jersey Girl, 15, Is Raped At Her Suburban Home As Her Parents Sleep
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., Dec. 29A 15yearold girl was dragged from her bedroom in Roxbury Township by an intruder early yesterday morning, raped in her backyard, and then forced back into her bedroom and raped again before the attacker fled, Morris County authorities disclosed today.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: CHAMBERS STREET runs from civic grandeur to honkytonk 4 dishevelmentor, to put it another way, from Police Headquarters at one end to bars, discount shops and lively bargain auctions at the other. The street is short  just four crosstown blocks, plus a closed-to-traffic section at the eastern endand so the range of experiences it contains feels especially compressed and heightened.

title: Concert: Tennstedt's Bruckner
description: IN A SENSE, yesterday's New York Philharmonic concert at Avery Fisher Hal marked Klaus Tennstedt's real New York debut. The German conductor had been scheduled for two weeks with the orchestra last season. He did the first brace of concerts, but they consisted of Beethoven's Violin Concerto, which is hardly a showcase for the conductor, and Prokofiev's Fifth Symphony, hardly the sort of Germanic staple In which he specializes. Then, just as he was about to take on Mahler in the second week, he was stricken with influenza and had to withdraw.

title: This Weekend's Highlights on TV
description: Friday

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Followers of the many holiday and harvest celebrations throughout the year at the Old Bethpage Village restoration on Long Island get a practical and entertaining history lesson in 19thcentury life. Today, the village's ChristmasNew Year's festivities come to an end with a Candlelight Evening. During the day, starting at 2 P.M., it will be business as usual, with a blacksmith, tailor, shoemaker and every one else hard at work. At dusk, the merrymaking will start. Lanterns will light the way to the 1857 Manetto Hill Church, where the Old Bethpage Singers will serenade by candlelight. At the 1865 Layton House, decorated in Victorian style, organ music will be played for family singalongs. And at the Village Crossroads, hot chocolate and cider will be served from kettles hanging over an open fire. Admission is $2.25 ($1.50 for children). From New York, take the Long Island Expressway to Exit 48 and follow the alerts. Information: (516)4205280.

title: Calder Results
Washington Is Reeling From Punch He Threw
description: Three weeks after he threw the punch that fractured Rudy Tomjanovich's jaw, Kermit Washington wishes he could take it hack.

title: Islanders
F.D.A. PROPOSES STANDARDS FOR CONTROL OF SUNLAMPS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration today proposed safety standards for the estimated one million sunlamps sold annually in the United States, including timers to turn them off after 10 minutes.

title: Mime: Lavinia Plonka Mugs
description: ECCENTRICITY has reached the level of a cottage industry, to judge by the number of extreme individuals encountered in the most casual stroll in Manhattan. The mime artist Lavinia Plonka has a triggerquick eye for such oddities, and brought a clutch of clever sketches to her delightfully fresh dance program Wednesday evening at Scene One. It was pure New York, with a vengeance.

title: Cash Prices
description: Thursday, Dec., 29, 1977

title: Madrid Has Heavy Snowfall
description: MADRID, Dec. 29 (AP)Five inches of snow blanketed Madrid this morning, snarling rushhour traffic and sending delighted children into streets and parks. It was the first heavy snowfall in years. Some factories in the outskirts of the city reported that 25 percent to 30 percent of their employees could not get to work.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: U.S. Studying Whether 2 Nations Acted to Keep Coffee Prices High
description: The United States.Government is investigating huge coffee purchases by agents of Brazil and El Salvador, according to wellinformed trade and regulatory sources. The inquiry, which has been under way for almost a year, is said to focus on possible coordinated attempts by the two big Latin American coffee producers to influence markets in New York.

title: Youth Who Allegedly Took a Stolen Car On a Times Sq. Ride Indicted for Murder
description: The youth who allegedly took a stolen car on a wild sidewalk ride in Times Square early this month has been indicted for murder in the death of a pedestrian, District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan announced yesterday.

title: Tony Bennett Comes East
description: The New York Times/D. Gorton

title: Female Reporter Sues Over LockerRoom Ban
description: Time Inc. and a female reporter for Sports Illustrated who was denied access to locker rooms to interview players during the World Series at Yankee Stadium brought suit yesterday against the commissioner of baseball, the president of the American League, the New York Yankees, Mayor Beame and other city officials for depriving her of the opportunity to cover baseball to the same extent as her male colleagues and competitors.

title: West Berlin Group Asserts 6,000 Are in East German Political Jails
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Dec. 29 (Reuters)The head of a West Berlin humanrights group asserted today that East Germany had about 6,000 political , prisoners.

title: New Face: Karen Lynn Gorney
description: Karen Lynn Gorney, the darkeyed disco dancer who drives John Travolta out of his mind in Saturday Night Fever, is a new face to moviegoers. But to the millions of fans out there in daytime soap opera land, she is the original Tara, the tragic victim who was torn between two men on ABC's All Nly Children.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Can Major College Playoff Help Select a Champion in Football?
description: JACKSONVILLE. Fla., Dec. 29Ma jor college football never has had a championship playoff and rarely has had a clearcut national champion. The Associated Press has conducted a writers and broadcasters poll to select a champion since 1941. The United Press International, started a coaches poll in 1950.

title: Leonard Silk
description: One of the busiest economists at the annual meetings of the Allied Social Science Association, now taking place in New York, is Kenneth E. Boulding, a 67yearold professor from the University of Colorado, whose interests range

title: W. R. KNOTT
description: W. R. Knott, who retired in 1959 as president of the Atlantis Sales Corporation, a subsidiary of the R. T. French Company of Rochester, the foodproducts concern, died Monday at his home in Crofton, Md. He was 83 years old.

title: Broadway
description: IT is true that a producer does things other than just raise money, although certainly a producer does nothing more onerous than that. In the late 1930's, 40's and 50's, there were great Broadway angels, who would back shows so they could have Cole Porter, say, to dinner, or else pursue artistic visions of their own. Now produc- ers raise money any way tney can. Increasingly, they are tapping theater owners, who will go in as coproducers; increasingly, we may now expect movie and record companies to start putting up money, too. Stuart Ostrow thinks there is another way. He has advertised for money. He would like it from you and you and you.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Dance: Chamber Group Program
description: THE CHAMBER Dance Group was formed by Nanette Bearden and William Scott two years ago as an outlet for the talents of black dancers and choreographers. Several of the interracial company's 14 members have performed with the Dance Theater of Harlem and George Faison's Universal Dance Experience. The rest are part of that floating body of gypsies whom dancegoers see only sporadically but, when they do view the trottoe, are sometimes touched.

title: Stage:
description: IN A Fine Summer Night, a new play written and directed by Michael Shurtleff at the Corner Loft Theater, two oddly matched couples sit around a summerhouse and define one another's characters, while ostensibly competing for power.

title: Hundreds of Thousands Are Down With Flu in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29From the Kremlin to kindergartens, hundreds of thousands have been laid low in the Soviet Unien by an epidemic of influenza.

title: New Tales for Children's Theater
description: Their voices become low, then hushed, as the house lights dim; their expectations soar as they wait to be carried away for an hour or so of makebelieve. For children, theater offers a special kind of enchantment, and this weekend's offerings, carefully chosen. will not disappoint.

title: U.S. and Seoul Are Close to Accord on Tongsun Park
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29The United States and South Korea are close to an agreement that could pave t he way for Tongsun Park to testify about efforts to influence members of Congress, senior Government officials said today.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and sent to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249 or to these agencies:

title: Letters
description: Debate on W.P.A. Art

title: Stan Getz and His Electric Echo
description: Reports that Stan Getz has gone electric have been greatly exaggerated. The seasoned tenor saxophonist, who has been swinging lightly and melodiously for more than 30 years now, is using an echo device called a digital delay, during his engagement at Hopper's, which runs through next weekend. His new band does include a com- plement of synthesizers and a bassist who uses a wahwah pedal. But except for an occasional foray in the general direction of rock, usually confined to one tune a set, one hardly notices the electronics, they are used so sparingly. What one does notice is the urgency of Mr. Getz's sound; it has grown up.

title: Blumenthal Victor in Miller Choice
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  President Carter made his decision four weeks ago not to reappoint Arthur F. Burns as chairman of the. Federal Reserve Board, thereby touching off a scramble among key advisers and Congressional powers to influence the succession.

title: PEACE DELAY SEEN
description: CAIRO, Dec. 29President Anwar elSadat said today that he was disappointed by President Carter's assertion yesterday that there should not be a Palestinian state and felt that the President's remark could delay a peace settlement in the Middle East.

title: Dow Up by 0.69
description: Stock prices posted modest gains yesterday as the equity market got its first chance to react to the selection of G. William Miller, chairman and chief executive officer of Textron, to be the new chairman of the Federal Reserve Board.

title: KOCH ASSAILS BEAME OVER APPOINTMENTS OF 13 NEW JUDGES
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch yesterday aysailed Mayor Beame's final judicial appointments as an abomination and pledged to follow the City Bar Association's recommendations in naming his own judges.

title: Soares, Trying to Form New Lisbon Government, Meets Other Party Chiefs
description: LISBON, Dec. 29 (Reuters)The Socialist leader, Mario Soares, whose minority Government was forced out of office when it lost a vote of confidence three weeks ago, reopened talks today with opposition parties on ending Portugal's political stalemate.

title: About Real Estate
description: The savings banks Mortgage Review Fund was a long time getting into business. It was in 1975 that the banks announced plans for such a fund, to make loans, or help to place loans, for residential properties that qualified for savings bank investment but for one reason or another had been turned down by individual banks. It is a backup mortgage pool that provides a fresh evaluation of residential mortgage applications.

title: The Pressures of Liberalism And Terrorism in West Germany
description: Peace has its own perils, and In our time, as before, peace breeds boredom, boredom violence. Nietzsche's warning that under peaceful conditions a warlike man sets upon himself may apply to societies as well. Terrorism is a particularly vicious, immoral equivalent of war; its potential for social and psychological disruption is immense.

title: BEGIN LAUDS STAND
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 29Prime Minister Menahem Begin today welcomed President Carter's stand in opposition to a separate Palestinian state and said that Mr. Carter's remarks, in an interview broadcast last night, would be helpful in the negotiations between Israel and Egypt toward Middle East peace.

title: 2 LARGE CONCERNS ADMIT TO QUESTIONABLE BILLINGS
description: WASIEINGTON, Dec. 29White Consididated Industries Inc. and Massey Feruscn Limit d leave disclosed that they have engagc,l in millions of dollars Worth of nye:-Olin-1gs, underhillings and other forms of questionable practices in their foreign sales activities over the last five years.

title: How It Was to Kiss Jack Dempsey
description: Teddy Hayes was Jack Dempsey's trainer in the 1920's when Jack was heavyweight champion of the world. Teddy was 7 years older than the champion, plenty young enough to enjoy the fun between fights, and in those days the fights were few and the fun long. In 1922, for example, there were no fights at all, just laughs. A crowd of them went whooping through Europe  Dempsey, Jack Kearns, Teddy Hayes, Joe Benjamin, the lightweight fighter, and a few others. It couldn't happen nowadays, Dempsey

title: Letter: On Medicaid Abortions
description: To the Editor:

title: 20 Books in 5 Categories Nominated by Critics Circle
description: The National Book Critics Circle, made up of more than 200 professional book critics and bookreview editors across the country, has nominated 20 books published in 1977, for the third annual National Book Critics Circle award. Five nominations were made in four categories: fiction, poetry, general nonfiction and criticism. Only books published by American authors in the United States were eligible. The awardwinning title in each category will be chosen Jan. 11. An award presentation will he held Jan. 19 in the TimeLife auditorium. Rockefeller Center,

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Polish Leader Hopes Carter Visit Will Aid Detente
description: WARSAW, Dec. 29 (AP)Edward Gierek, Poland's Communist leader, who views himself as a bridge builder in international relations, said today that he hoped his talks with President Carter would further understanding between Washington and Moscow.

title: Carter's Two for the Money
description: In a week, President Carter has selected two of the top people on his economic policy team. They will replace two of the :host colorful personalities on the Washington scene. Arthur Burns, 73, will step aside as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board for G. William Miller, a 52-year-old b'usiness executive. And the post of Director of the Office of Management and Budget, which Bert Lance left in September, will be filled by 37-year-old James McIntyre, a relatively unknown Georgia lawyer who came to Washington to be Mr. Lance's deputy.

title: Stage:
description: IN Cold Storage the stage once again becomes a hospital corner where the dying use the special authority, the metaphysical intensity of their condition, to try to decipher the. much hazier process of living.

title: In Memoriam
description: ANNONFlorence (PeMalan) In cherished memory of my beloved sister who entered eternal rest December 30, 1956.

title: Reactions Vary For Economists On Fed Change
description: The New York Times

title: Restaurants
description: WE can think of no more festive or felicitous windup to 1977 than to be able to report on a sensationally good restaurant. Le Cygne, on 54th Street between Madison and Park Avenues, fills that bill exactly. Its kitchen may not be the most ambitiously elaborate, nor its decor the most spacious and elegant in town, but the food turned out at Le Cygne by the chef, Alain Sailhac, is currently the best haute cuisine French fare in the city. We have been casing tile place on and off since June and find that th.? cooking is consistently, solidly delicious with absolutely no-fool-the-eye chichi.

title: Gov. Grasso, in Change, Now Asks Building Connecticut's Part of I84
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., Dec. 29Gov. Ella T. Grasso said today that she favored construction of the Connecticut section, between Hartford and Providence, R.I.. of an Interstate System highway, and that the state would seek the Federal funds needed to design the highway section.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Guard Questioned in Stranglings; Police Say He Knew Two Victims
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 29 (AP)The police said today that they were questioning a 55-year-old Hollywood security guard who had given refuge to several of the hillside strangler's 11 victims.

title: U.S. Is Urging Egypt and Israel To Press Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29Administration officials said today that the United States had undertaken a diplomatic effort to convince Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel and President Anwar elSadat of Egypt that, despite their sharp differences over the Palestinian issue, there exists a significant opportunity to negotiate an equitable agreement.

title: Basic Money Supply Rose By $1.5 Billion for Week; Fed Funds Rate 6.65%
description: The nation's basic money supply rose by $1.5 billion in the banking week ended Dec. 23, but moneymarket analysts were not surprised. Meanwhile, a broader gauge of the money supply rose by $800 million, the Federal Reserve reported.yesterdaV.

title: Cowboys
description: DALLAS, Dec. 29Tom Rafferty was angry. He prowled through his McDonald's lunch bag but could not find the apple pie.

title: Another Plan Is Offered to Revitalize Times Square
description: After years of crackdowns, sweeps, raids, redevelopment studies and promses of action by politicians, the City Planning Commission yesterday came up with another plan to revitalize the tawdry Times Square area.

title: South Africa and the Bomb
description: Three months ago the United States representative at the United Nations, Andrew Young. opposed banning nuclear energy exports to South Africa as part of the worldwide campaign to force that Government to end its oppressive racial policies. If America terminated assistance, he reasoned, the South Africans might be encouraged to develop their own nuclear capacity, free of America's restraining influence. We applauded Mr. Young's stand on the ground that our nuclear export policy should be shaped to achieve a safer nuclear environment, unencumbered by additional political objectives.

title: The New York Times
description: THE WAY IT USED TO BE: Children being read to in the Junior Museum of the Newark Museum as part of a Winter Festival program called A Victorian Holiday. The purpose was to acquaint the children with Victorian customs.

title: The Emotionally Painful Sometimes LifelongSearch for Perfect Mother Love
description: When Nancy Friday was in Chicago recently, she met a distraught. 25-yearold woman who said she was considering calling off her engagement because her mother didn't like the young man she deeply loved and planned to marry.

title: At the Movies
description: I'VE vE GOT to figure out how to be Wallace Beery, brooded Ryan O'Neal, an actor whose Olympian muscles, golden curls and mischevious blue eyes have been marketable movie commoditties ever since Love Story. If he seems unnuiy nauntea mom?? by a ueeibellied, bulbnosed, gravelvoiced spirit from Hollywood's past, it is simply because he will soon be slipping into one of Wallace Beery's most memorable roles, that of the boozing, hasbeen boxer in Franco Zeffirelli's remake of The Champ.

title: I. B. M. Computer Analyst Slain
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 29A 49-yearold computer analyst was murdered here last night, and his wife was charged today with stabbing him to death with a kitchen knife while their twin children were asleep upstairs.

title: BEGIN LAUDS STAND
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 29 Prime Minister Menahem Begin today welcomed President Carter's stand in opposition to a separate Palestinian state and said that Mr. Carter's remarks, in an interview broadcast last night, would be helpful in the negotiations between Israel and Egypt toward Middle East peace.

title: President of Israel To Step Down in May
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 29 (AP)President Ephraim. Katzir of Israel said today he would leave the largely ceremonial post next May, when his fiveyear term expires. The 61-year-old Mr. Katzir, an eminent scientist, is expected to resume his chemistry research.

title: DemolitionIndustry Investigation Finds Corruption
description: The New York City Investigation Department, which set up its own demolition company to look into the industry, reported yesterday that corruption was organized and widespread but that it could not seek criminal prosecutions because its key witness had died.

title: New Nassau Police Head
description: The appointment of Sammuel J. Rozzi as Nassau County's Police Commissioner was announced by County executiveelect Francis T. Purcell. Mr. Rozzi, 52 years old and deputy chief inspector at present, s a 29year veteran of the county force and will replace Commissioner Daniel P. Guido, who was appointed in March 1976 and who is retiring.

title: $9.5 Million for Filming Annie
description: One of the charms of Annie, the smashhit musical at the Alvin Theater, is the song its performers sing, Easy Street. The play's producers and others involved in bringing it to Broadway now may also carol that tune as they contemplate additional profits from deal just consummated with Columbia Pictures.

title: Little Change Expected at Textron After Miller Leaves
description: When G. William Miller steps down as chairman and chief executive officer of Textron Inc., he will be leaving a giant corporation that has apparently had its fill of acquiring new companies. Its top management is now concentrating on the maximization of the growth and sales of five major product groups.

title: 9 BERME NOMINEES REJECTED BY COUNCIL
description: Fractious in the closing days of their terms, members of a City Council committee threw out nine nominations by Mayor Beame yesterdayincluding that of Anthony Scotto, leader of the longshore union in Brooklynand quarreled when a black nominee was asked by a Council member if he had ever been arrested.

title: Gifts to Neediest Pass $700,000
description: The 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund passed the $700,000 mark yesterday with the receipt of $16,512.50 from 250 donors. The overall figure for the campaign. which is in its fourth week and will con tinue through February, now stands at 8700.044.96. from 4,638 contributors.

title: Notes on People
description: Gerald R. Ford said yesterday that he likes being an exPresident, likes the traveling, the speechmaking and tha writing, but he suggested that he would like the activity even more if he were President again. In a television interview, he was asked if he would like his old job back and he said, There's no question I would enjoy it. The 67-year-old former President then left himself a raft of options. I'm not going to make any committment either to become a candidate or not become a candidate until some time in 1979, after the 1978 Congressional-gubernatorial elections, he said from his winter honie in Vail, Colo.

title: Ballet:
description: VISIONS of sugarplums continued to dance in 2,800 heads at every soldout performance of The Nutcracker at the New York State Theater, and the latest Sugar Plum Fairy presented by the New York City Ballet comes direct from Paris. She is Ghislaine Thesmar, who made her debut in the role on Wednesday in the first of two performances that day of George Balanchine's version of the Tchaikovsky ballet classic. A Pekingborn French ballerina who has etoile, or star, ranking at the Paris Opera Ballet, Miss Thesmar has been seen periodically with the City Ballet in the last two years. In this instance, she, as in the past, is said to be part of an exchange of dancers with the Paris Opera Ballet. And it is a fact that Helgi Tomasson, one of the City Ballet's principals, has just danced Giselle in Paris.

title: U.S. Bars Mexican .Gas at Prices Above Canadians

description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 29A 15-year-o girl was dragged from her bedroom Roxbury Township by an intruder eat. yesterday morning, raped in her bad. yard, and then forced back into her be room and raped again before the attack fled, Morris County authorities disclose today.

title: Carter's New Year Torch
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29At the turn of the year, President Carter will be making two major speeches overseas, one in India and the other in France. Both, according to the White House, will touch on the critical political question of our timewhat is the relevance of the democratic oraer to changing conditions in the developed and developing world? The same question could obviously be asked about Communism and Socialism and very other ism. New years nave a way or raising such troubling questions, and the chairman of the National Security Council, Zbigniew Brzezinski, defined the theme of Mr. Carter's tour with even more challenging questions: Does democracy have a future, he asked, does have a relevance; what should be its role .?

A playwright, poet andthrough his teaching of creative writing to children and the elderlya cause of poetry in cthers, he has Kochsed a number of busy artists, including Red Grooms, Roy Lichtenstein, Jane Freilicher and Alex Katz, to contribute their talents as set designers for his new adventure drama, The Red Robins.

title: Greenwich Elects First Woman To Its Top Executive Position
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 29After nearly eight weeks of recounts, legal arguments and court hearings, Ruth L. Sims was overwhelmingly chosen First Selectman here tonight in a special election. She is the first woman elected the town's chief executive and the first Democrat in 73 years.

The project has the dual goal of providing a year of steady work for jobless artists and enriching the cultural resources available at the community level.

description: DENVER, Dec. 29When the newest member of the Federal judiciary was unanimously confirmed by the Senate on Dec. 14. there were some things about him that the senators probably did not know. Not every Federal judge has had a convicted murderer living with him.

title: U.S. Studying Whether 2 Nations Acted to Keep Coffee Prices High

description: In its closing days, the United Nations General Assembly directed Secretary General Kurt Waldheim to make the most important appointment of his careerthat of a Director General, second only to himself, to oversee all the organization's economic and social operations. At stake is the way some $2.5 billion in annual development funding is allocated and spent.

title: Buster Williams, a Bassist, With Mary Lou Williams
description: For years, Mary Lou Williams has been complaining about the difficulty of finding good bassists to accompany her pilnoplaying. At Blue Hawaii, Third Avenue at 15 Street. where she is ending a run tonight, she has finally come up with a bassist who is not simply good. He is superb.

title: Portuguese Pilots End Strike
description: LISBON, Dec. 30 (UPI)  Pilots of Portugal's airline, TAP, returned to work today, ending a strike that had snarled air traffic for eight days. The pilots reached an agreement for a pay raise with the governmentowned company.

title: Roger D. Hamby Marries Elizabeth Thompson
description: Elizabeth Hunter Thompson, daughter of Mrs. David C. Thompson of Essex Fells, N.J., and the late Mr. Thompson, was married yesterday in the First Presbyterian Church of Caldwell, N. J., to Roger Dale Hamby, son of Mrs. James Hamby of Nashville. The Rev. Dr. Andrew McElwee performed the ceremony.

title: Notes on People
description: Alexander Schreiner ended a 53year career as organist of the Mormon Tabernacle in Salt Lake City with a public recital there yesterday. Through his daily recitals at the tabernacle as well as the weekly broadcasts of the Tabernacle Choir, for which he was accompanist, Dr. Schreiner achieved an international reputation. The program, which began in 1929, is one of the oldest continuous broadcasts on American radio. The 76-year-old Dr. Schreiner was born in Nurenberg, Germany, and began playing the organ in the Mormon church there when he was 8 years old. He emigrated to Utah with his family when he wars 11.

title: Events Today
Ward of Jets Resigns As General Manager
description: Al Ward, the easygoing Texan who had been general manager of the New York Jets for three .seasons, resigned yesterday. He said his authority had been eroded by the hiring last summer of Jim Kensil as president.

title: Jeanne H. Gregory Wed to R.B.Ferrell
description: In the United Methodist Church in Haddonfield, N. J., yesterday, Jeanne Hampton Gregory, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Milton Gregory of Holmdel, N. J.. became the bride of Richard Bradley Ferrell, son of Col. Robert M. Ferrell, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Ferrell of Cherry Hill, N. J.

title: Woman, Reportedly 118, Is Dead; Was Born Into Slavery in Alabama
description: ALIQUIPPA, Pa., Dec, 30 (UPI)Nora Lee, la former slave who was reportedly 118 years old, died Monday in a nursing home.

title: Riding the Westway Roller Coaster
description: Westway is having so many ups and downs that it is beginning to look more like a roller coaster than a spectacular replacement for the crumbiing West Side Highway. Six weeks ago, we assessed the costs of Westway as compared with Federal funds that could otherwise be used for mass transit. Westway seemed to us clearly preferable. But since then, there have been four consequential developments. Two essential permits have been held up. A committee studying the relative economic impact of Westway and mass transit has completed its report. And Federal legislation has been proposed to fund highways and mass transit more equally. If you are still riding with us, this is two swings down, one up and one mysterious ride through the Federal tunnel of finance. After it all, the case for Westway remains compelling.

title: Mary G. Lohnes Is Wed To William L. Braman
description: Mary Grace Lohnes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Luhncs of Darien. Conun., was married there yesterday to William Lawrence Braman. son of Mr. and Mrs. Chester A. Braman Jr., of West Norwalk, Ccnn. The ceremony was performed in St. Luke's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Frederick Bender.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DON'T MISS_ _ Nataurally there is a great deal of purposeful coming and going through the main levels of the North Tower, One World Trade Center. And tonight in particular the pace may even be feverish, with commuters anxious to get home and other pedestrians trying to reach midtown for the midnight celebration. A few minutes look at an offcenter art display, tucked away on the mezzanine of the North Tower, should brighten anyone's outlook. The display of 49 Aubusson tapestries by 41 noted artists has been drawing enthusiastic crowds; it closes next Friday, Jan. 6.

Democrat of Atlantic City, warned today that the casinoinspired economic recovery of the city would not be achieved for five to eight years, but he defended the strictness of Casino Control Commission regulations as a guarantee that we can stay in business against competition from other states for at least 25 years.

description: DALLAS, Dec. 30Coach Bud Grant needled the National Football League tonight for forcing the Minnesota Vikings to arrive 48 hours before Sunday's National .Football Conference championship game against the Dallas Cowboys.

title: EGYPT SAYS CARTER FAILS TO UNDERSTAND ITS PALESTINE STAND
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30Egypt is eager to tell the United States that President Carter and his aides have failed to grasp just how fundamentally unacceptable is the plan of Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel for limited selfrule in the Israelioccupied territories of the West Bank of the Jordan and the Gaza Strip.

title: Party. No, thanks. I prefer to be alone tonight.
description: LOS ANGELESI tried to spend New Year's Eve alone last year and I spent the bulk of this year trying to live it down.

title: Mercedes Lopez Is Wed To Anthony Ian Morgan
description: Mercedes Loreto Lopez, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfonso Lopez of Elizabeth, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to Anthony Ian Morgan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Morgan of New York.

title: EGYPT SAYS CARTER FAILS TO UNDERSTAND ITS PALESTINE STAND
description: CAIRO, Dec. 30Egypt is eager to tell the United States that President Carter and his aides have failed to grasp just how fundamentally unacceptable is the plan of Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel for limited selfrule in the Israelioccupied territories of the West Bank of the Jordan and the Gaza Strip.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference With U.S. and Polish Journalists
description: WARSAW. Dec. 30 (Reuters)Following is the White House transcript of President Carter's news conference with American and Polish journalists here today:

title: Hollywood Film Directors Approve Contract
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 30A threatened strike of motion picture and television directors was averted last night when Hollywood members of the Directors Guild of America approved a fouryear contract loaded with new creative rights, raises, and heavy increases in residuals. Ratification by New York members of the guild on Wednesday is expected to be a formality.

title: Carter Is Expected to Discuss Shah's Energy Plan
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 30The Shah of Iran expects to discuss with President Carter an idea for investing vast sums from oilproducing countries in development of alternative energy sources, a senior diplomatic source said today.

title: Tough Critic of Welfare System
description: If Blanche Bernstein had been more talented as a child violinist, she might have fulfilled her ambition to become a I"female Jaccha Heifetz. If she had nbt stumbled over organic chemistry at Hunter College in the early 1930's, she would have become a doctor.

title: Cholera Kills 100 in Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Dcc, 30 (Agence FrancePressoMore than 100 people have died and 1.448 cases. of cholera have been recorded since the disease broke out in Tanzania early last indlith, an official of the Tanzanian Ministry said here today.

title: Cornell Six Triumphs. 53
description: ITHACA, N,Y., Dec, 30 (AP)Cornell won its invitational hockey tournament tonight by defeating Bowling Green, 33. In the consolation game, Dartmouth, getting two goals from Rick Ilam, defeated Toronto, 73. Mark a sophomore wing, scored two goals for Cornell,

title: S.E.C. SUSPENDS TRADING IN STOCK OF 4 CONCERNS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30The Securities and Exchange Commission has suspended exchange and over-the-counter trading in the stock of four corporations.

title: Brzezinski and Mrs. Carter Hold Discussion With Polish Cardinal
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30Rosalynn Carter and Zbigniew Brzezinski; the President's national security adviser, met today with Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the primate of Poland's Roman. Catholic Church. in an encounter designed, the President said later, to express odr appreciation for the degree of freedom of worship in the country.

title: United Press International
description: A FATHER AGAIN: Muhammad Ali cuddling his daughter Laiya after the heavyweight champion's wife, Veronica, gave birth to the 7-pound-10-ounce baby in Miami Beach yesterday. All has four other daughters and a son.

title: EWING IS APPOINTED TO ANTITRUST DIVISION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Ky P. Ewing Jr., a Washington lawyer from Texas, will join the Department of Justice on Tuesday as a Deputy Assistant Attorney General in the antitrust division, it was announced today.

title: Judge Allows the Use of Laetrile For Cancer Patient Who Wants It
description: HACKENSACK, Dec. 30A 78-year-old woman who is dying of cancer won the right in State Superior Court today to have the controversial drug laetrile administered to her.

title: PENNSYLVANIA PLANS CUT IN AIR POLLUTION
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 30Gordon M. Rapier, director of the Air and Hazardous. Materials Division of the regional office here of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, said today that Pennsylvania had submitted a plan for reducing air pollution in the Philadelphia metropolitan region.

title: Morgenthau, Answering Criticism, Cites Curbs on Prosecuting Pimps
description: District Attorney Robert M. Morgenthau of Manhattan yesterday termed incredible the criticism of his office by State Senator Ralph J. Marino, who accused him of laxity in the prosecution of pimps. Mr. Morgenthau said a bill that would facilitate the prosecutions had been lying dormant in a Senate committee on which the Senator served.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Off in 3 and 9 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both 91day and 180day maturities.

title: H.U.D. Rushing Study to Revive an Ohio Steel Works
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30A crash study that may lead to the reopening of a major Ohio steel plant under community and worker ownership was ordered today by the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

title: Meyers, Bucks
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 30 (AP)A Milwaukee Bucks forward, Dave Meyers, today appealed the onegame suspension without pay that was imposed on him for bumping with a National Basketball Association official in a game last Friday night.

title: Words And Music
description: It's that time. The party's in full swing. New Year's Eve again. And here.1 am. at the piano. As usual. Playing and thinking. Icy cold in Central Park: Parties up and down Fifth Avenue. And Central Park West. And this

title: Sanitation Record Set
description: A record was set last month, the New York City Sanitation Department said yesterday, when sanitationmen hauled away an average 11.2 tons of trash per truck in an eighthour shift.

title: About Newyork
description: There is an air of an ending and of a beginning, entirely approprtate to the season, within skoaling distance of the linuoi store at the corner of Third Avctrnt e and 10th Street. There is the seedi- ness of the Bowery, the homeyness of the ethnic Lower East Side, the artiness of the East Village and, increasingly, the sterile but expensive charm a the Upper East Side type of highrise that is moving into the neighborhood.

title: Dance: Robert Weiss the Cavalier in Nutcracker
description: The cavalier in The Nutcracker. like so many of his noble brethren in the Tchaikovsky classics, spends much of his time offstage, waiting to be summoned on for one climactic appearance. In The Nutcracker, this appearance is even briefer than in other bal- lets, but Robert Weiss made it memorable for his bravura style Thursday at the New York State Theater.

title: Sex Pistols Are Given Visas To Enter U.S. for Concerts
description: The Immigration Service in Washington yeste.rday granted entry visas to the Sex Pistols, Britain's controversial punkrock band. The action came only a day after the United States Embassy in London had declared the band members ineligible for visas because of their criminal records in England. A spokesman for Warner Brothers Records in New York announced yesterday that the band's first American tour, which had been scheduled to begin last night in Pittsburgh, would now get under way next Thursday in Atlanta.

title: The Year in New York: A Pictorial Review
description: In 1977, it happened again as the city suffered a second major blackout; the best team money could buy won the World Series; the suspected .44. caliber killer was captured; the Concorde was finally able to land; the city elected a new Mayor; Broadway's box offices came alive, and a human fly thrilled New Yorkers by ascending the World Trade Center.

title: Capitals Tie Rangers, 33
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 30--A wild shooting match in the final five minutes of a game between the New York Rangers and the Washington Capitals failed to produce a goal tonight a the teams settled for a 33 tie.

title: Gerulaitis, Lloyd Gain Tennis Final
description: MELBOURNE. Australia, Dec. 30 (LTDVitas Gerulaitis and John Lloyd. both victors in the semifinals today. will share breakfast tomorrow, practice together for 30 minutes and then compete for the S28,000 first prize in the final of the Australian open tennis tournament.

title: Emir of Kuwait, Sheik Sabah, Dies; Crown Prince Assumes His Post
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Saturday. Dec. 31The Emir of Kuwait, Sheik Sabah alSalem alSabah, died this morning of a heart attack. it was officially announced in Kuwait.

title: Haggerty Named Referee
description: DALLAS, Dec. 30 (AP)Pat Haggerty was named referee for the N:F.C. championship game between Minnesota and Dallas.

title: HUMANA MAKES OFFER FOR AMERICAN MEDICORP
description: Continued From Page 23

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
Geils Gives Rock Concert at Palladium
description: The imitation of black mannerisms by white rock performers has long been one of rock's most unappealing stylistic options. It is an option that has been exercised much less frequently in the 1970's, but it has not entirely disappeared. Geils, formerly the .J. Geils Band, was a prime offender 10 years ago, when it was getting started, and it still is. The principal culprit is Peter Wolf, the lead singer, whose stage patter and inflections are obviously not his own. Mr. Wolf is from Boston, but he would like one to believe that he just stepped off the streets of Southside Chicago.

title: GIANT OIL SLICK IS HITTING BEACHES OF SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 30 (Reuters)A giant oil slick from the collision of two supertankers two weeks ago washed ashore on popular South African beaches today in the midst of the holiday season.

title: FORD G. OWENS
description: VAN WERT, Ohio, Dec. 30 (AP)Ford G. Owens, publisher of The Van Wert TimesBulletin, died today. He was 85 years old.

title: Interpreter's Gaffes Embarrass State Department
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 30Not in many years has the State Department. been more embarrassed or subjected to more ridicule than it was today by the flood of press reports from Warsaw about the misfortune of Steven Seymour, the interpreter who did a faulty job for President Carter yesterday.
