description: Beaths

title: Defeat of Begin. Plan Is Predicted
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 30 (Reuters) The Mayor of Nablus, Bassam alShakaa, said in an interview here today that the Palestinians would defeat the proposal by Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel to give a measure of autonomy to the West Bank of the Jordan while maintaining Israeli military control, Mr. Shakaa arrived here last night to seek financial aid for Nablus, the largest town on the West Bank.

title: DelBello Starts His 2d Term Under Cloud of Inquiry
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 30Alfred B DelBello was sworn in today for a seennd term as Westchester County Executive as witnesses began appearing before Federal grand jury in Manhattan investigating his first campaign for the post.

title: Cast N.Y. Savings Names President
description: The election of Paul Brady Murray as president of the East New York Savings Bank was announced yegterday by Robert G. Brandely, chairman and chief executive officer of the bank. Mr. Murray formerly was executive vice president.

title: Report Charges U.S.  Underestimates Cost Of Federal Pensions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)The Federal Government has been underestimating by several billion dollars a year the projected longrange cost of Civil Service pensions, according to an unpublished Government report.

title: MEXICANS CONCERNED THAT RELIANCE ON OIL MAY AGGRAVATE ILLS
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 30Euphoria over Mexico's recent oil discoveries is beginning to give way to uneasy recognition that the new wealth will not solveand may even aggravatemany of the country's deep social problems.

title: 3 HELD FOR TERRORIZING IRT RIDERS WITH CLEAVERS
description: Two teenaged boys and a girl were seized yesterday after terrorizing elderly New York subway passengers with meat cleavers and robbing them.

title: Pacific 75, Columbia 58
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Dec. 30 (AP)Pacific exploded after a slow start for 17 straight points near the end of the first half and went on to trounce Columbia. 7558, last night.

title: George A. Mitchell Is Dead at 77 Former Nabisco Vice President
description: George A. Mitchell, executive vice president of the National Biscuit Company from 1962 until his retirement in 1965. died Wednesday at his home in Killingworth, Conn., after a long illness. He was 77 years old.

title: They Raid the Men's Clothes Racks
description: Ingeborg Day was more than a little surprised when the stout middleaged man, who stood in the center of the large department store dressing room wearing only his underwear and socks with a suit jacket, paid her no notice. But perhaps he had seen It before: A woman like Ingeborg Day, a writer who buys some of her clothes in men's departments, trying on sweaters and trousers and shirts and jackets in the dressing rooms.

title: U. S. Player Is Deported
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Dec. 30 (UPI)Larry Whinseton, a 21-year-old winter league baseball player, was sentenced in court today to he deported hack to the United States after having pleaded guilty two days ago to a charge of possession of marijuana. The court also fined Whinseton $1,000.

title: Castle Is Secure But Weathermen Are Still Moving
description: Barbed wire and steelbarred windows and doors arc ether security measures have been installed by the New York City's Parks Departmeut the National Weather Service at the nelvedere Castle station in Comm F'irk in another effort to foil vandals.

title: Stravinsky Night Set at Tully Hall
description: The Performers' Committee for TwentiethCentury Music, which has been giving retrospective programs of modern music for the last 11 seasons. will begin a new series with a look at the works of Igor Stravinsky pest Saturday.

title: Knicks Win Small After Leading Big
description: In the Knicks dressing room last night the players used words like scary and made statements such as :we quit fastbreaking and we were too cautious and I hate when we 2et bie leads.

title: Around the Nation
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 30 (AP)Widespread outbreaks of influenzalike illnesses have been reported in four states, the first such reports in the United States this winter, the National Center for Disease Control said today.

title: Deborah Adams Becomes Bride In Connecticut
description: Daborah Elizabeth Adams, an artist, and Gerald Felix Warburg 2d, legislaive assistant to Representative Jonathan B. Bingham. Democrat of New Yeirk, were married yesterday in the First Congregational Church in Fairfield, Conn. The Rev. John Thornton, godfather of the bridegroom, of St. Stephens Episcopal Church in Belvedere, Calif.. performed the ceremony.

title: Saudis Said to Fear Deal by Sadat
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia. Dec. 30Despite differences between Israel and Egypt over the Palestinian issue, concern persists in the Saudi leadership that. Cairo and Jerusalem might yet conclude a separate peace, according to sources close to the rulers.

title: Braths
description: BACHBella, beloved wife of the late Jacob, devoted mother of Rita Strauss, loving mother-in-law of the late Joseph Strauss. Services at BoulevardPark West, 190 Flatbush Ave (at Ave L), Brooklyn, Sunday, Jan. 1, at 10:15 AM.

title: Associated Press
description: GIRL SURVIVES TWODAY ORDEAL: Michelle Robson, 10 years old, (inset) was rescued Thursday from wreckage of a plane in which her grandparents were killed on a mountaintop near San Diego, Calif. Michelle spent two days with a broken jaw in cold, rainy weather before she was found. They had been flying to Mexico for vacation.

title: Interpreter's Gaffes Embarrass State Department
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 30Not in many years has the State Department been more embarrassed or subjected to more ridicule than it was today by the flood of press reports from Warsaw about the misfortune of Steven Seymour, the interpreter who did a faulty job for President Carter yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: Americans and Poles have the same hopes for human rights, President Carter ap.id at a news conference in Warsaw but conceded that both nations and toe Soviet Union are occasionally made uncomfortable by public discussions of their failure to guarantee them. I don't think there is any doubt that the will of the Polish people for complete preservation and enhancement of human rights is the same as our own, he said. There were hints from White House sources that Mr. Carter was considering a meeting in Egypt with president Anwar elSadat, probably on Wednesday. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30A woman Inventor has won acclaim for her seat for skiers, and hopes to get it into mass production when the snow is heavy enough. Louise G. Cadwalader of Homewood, Calif., was granted a patent this week for what she has trademarked Sit N Ski.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the most unusual endings in the game occurs when a player plays a losing card to squeeze an opponent. An elegant example of this occurred on the diagramed deal, played recently in New Zealand, the country that has the highest percentage of bridge players in relation to nonulation. The hero was the great playerwriter Bruce

title: Volcker Links Irrational Cycle To Dollar's Fall
description: Continued From Page 23

title: Volcker Links Irrational Cycle To Dollar's Fall
description: Paul A. Volcker, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. said yesterday that an irrational cycle was at work in foreignexchange markets, causing the United States dollar to keep dropping excessively against such currencies as West German mark and the Swiss franc.

title: Congressional GoodWill Trips to Korea Linked to Seoul's Covert Efforts to Influence U.S. Foreign Policy
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 30When the House of Representatives began a parliamentary exchange with the South Korean National Assembly in 1969, the plan had all the marks of similar goodwill exchanges with other nations.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
Rhodesian Company Bombed
description: BULAWAYO, Rhodesia, Dec. 30 (UPI) Explosives believed to have been planted by black insurgents last night blew a hole in the roof of a building housing a computer company and slightly injured two men, the police said today.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Dec. 30If Representative Andrew Maguire of New Jersey's Seventh Congressional District goes ahead with his plan to run for the United States Senate, the president of the State Senate, Matthew Feldman of Teaneck, will run to succeed him.

title: 3 KILLED, HURT IN NEWARK AS FIRE DESTROYS A HOTEL
description: Three persons died in a suspicious fire that destroyed a 75-year-old residential hotel in a deteriorating section of downtown Newark last night.

title: Kuhn Reacts to Suit Of Female Writer
description: Commissioner of Baseball Bowie Kuhn said yesterday in a statement released in New York that he would allow female sportswriters into baseball locker rooms for postgame interviews if they could satisfy us that we have violated any law with the present policy that denies women writers access to clubhouses.

title: New Chief in Greenwich Sets Her Priorities
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Dec. 30 Ruth L. Sims. who won a stunning Democratic victory yesterday as this town's chief executive. said today that a major priority of her term as First Selectman would be to alleviate traffic congestion.

title: QUEEN AGREES TO REDUCE FORMAL ROLE IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 30In a step further reducing the active role of the British monarchy. in Canada, Queen Elizabeth has agreed to relinquish all formal functions in the Government to the Canadian Governor General, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's office announced today.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
Cooke Donates $200 to Neediest
description: A personal contribution for $200 has lcen received from Terence Cardinal Cockr for the 66th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: World News Briefs
description: CASTEAU, Belgium, Dec. 30 (Reuters)NATO announced a change in its command today that will put Turkish generals at the head of major formations in the alliance for the first time.

title: Seoul to Let Tongsun Park Testify Under Oath on Influence Peddling
description: WASRINGTON, Dec. 30The South Korean Government has agreed to permit Tongsun Park to return to the United States to testify at bribery and conspiracy trials resulting from the investigation of alleged influence peddling in Congress, .the Departinent of Justice announced today.

title: Let a Hundred Airlines Fly
description: The White House hailed it. as an important step toward effective international airline competition. Pan American World Airways board chairman had a somewhat different view, calling it political manipulation. At issue was President Carter's decision to overrule the Civil Aeronautics Board and award DallasLondon service to Braniff Airways rather than Pan Am.

title: San Francisco Conquers Arizona St. in Final, 10290
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Dec. 30 (UPI)Winfrod Boyne; scored 40 points to lead the University of San Francisco to a 10290 triumph over Arizona State tonight in the final of the AllCollege basketball tournament.

title: Annin, Top U.S. Flagmaker, Found Bicentennial Sweet
description: VERONA, N.J.In the outer reaches of the room, a twinklyeyea woman was bent over a design she was handpainting for a 6-by-10-foot Florida flag. My, they like their flags big in Florida, she said to herself. Nearby, a slightly stooped woman snipped away a pattern for an International Agricultural Exchange Association flag. she shifted her weight from foot to foot, muttering, Another day, another flag.

title: OPERATORS WALK OUT OF COAL NEGOTIATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30Negotiators for the coal industry today broke off bargaining with the. Unted Mine Workers on a new contract that could end the 25day strike of 160.000 miners.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
20 JUDGES APPOINTED IN ACTION BY CAREY
description: Governor Carey yesterday appointed 17 judges to the Appellate Division of State. Supreme Court, nominated two judges to the Court of Claims, and designated a judge to hear cases stemming.from the office of the special state prosecutor for corruption in the criminaljustice system.

title: PRESIDENT EQUATES. HUMANRIGHTS GOALS OF POLAND AND U.S.
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30President Carter today equated American and Polish aspirations on human rights but conceded that both nations and the Soviet Union were occasionally made uncomfortable by public discussions of their failure to guarantee them.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company announced yesterday that it had filed requests with the Federal Communication Commission for a variety of higher rates on Mailgram service within the 48 contiguous states. If approved, the rate increases would become effective April 1. They are expected to produce $1.7 million of additional revenues in 1978.

title: For Blacks, Milwaukee Proves a Hard Place to Find a Job
description: MILWAUKEE, Dec. 29Each workday morning, armed with determination and his high school transcript, Edwin Anderson says goodbye to his two children and his rundown north side neighborhood. and sets out for eight hours of tough worktrying to find a job.

title: Kodak to Lift Prices Of Film, Equipment
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 30 (AP)The nation's largest supplier of film to the amateur photography market, the Eastman Kodak Company, today announced price increases for film and equipment.

title: Mrs. Carter and Brzezinski Hold Discussion With Polish Cardinal
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30Rosalynn Carter and Zbigniew Brzezinski, the President's national security adviser, met today with Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the primate of Poland's Roman Catholic Church. in an encounter designed, the President said later, to express our appreciation for the degree of freedom of worship in the country.

title: Ethiopians Arrest 40 People
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 30 (Agence FrancePresse)Forty members of the clandestine Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Party, the exiled Ethiopian Democratic. Union and the secessionist Eritrean Liberation Front were arrested here today. Official reports said they had pistols, hashish and political leaflets.

title: Jazz: Teruo Nakamura's Sextet
description: Teruo Nakamura calls himself a druppectout artist. His entire familyparents, brothers and sisters  are artists, and so was he until he was 15 years old. Since then, he has been musician, playing bass, and he now heads a sextet called the Rising Sun that reflects the family heritage in art.

title: President Arranges For Visit by Gierek
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30 (Reuters)The Polish Communist Party leader, Ed.ward Gierek, accepted an invitation today from President Carter to visit the United States at a date to be specified later.

title: The New York Times/Marilynn K. Yee
description: COLLISION ON COURT: Ray Williams of the Knicks, right, and Leonard Robinson of the Jazz running into each other as they chased ball in the first half of game at the Garden last night. Knicks won, 118116. Page 14.

title: U.S. Seeks to Counter Soviet Neutron Bomb Criticism
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30In an effort to counter rising Soviet criticism of the American program to develop the neutron bomb, the Carter Administration has begun to attack publicly Moscow's recent deployment of a new, nucleararmed missile aimed at Western Europe.

title: Police in Stamford Still Under Inquiry; Corruption Alleged
description: STAMFORD, Conn.. Dec. 30A state police investigation of alleged corruption in the local Police Department that was started more than two years ago is still active, State Police Commissioner Edward P. Leonard said today.

title: 2 Adult Communities in Monroe Are Blending In
description: MONROEWhen Ross Cortese, a California developer, proposed in 1964 to erect an enclosed, adultsonly community of 43,000 people on 2,600 acres of farmland here, many local residents were worried.

title: Plan to Reorganize Police Operations In Bronx Is Halted
description: The New York City Police Department yesterday ordered the suspension of a rorganization plan for its operations in the Bronx, including the revision of all precinct boundaries.

title: Cambodia Cuts Ties With Vietnam
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Saturday. Dec. 31 Cambodia broke diplomatic relations with Vietnam today, accusing its fellow Communist country of ferocious and barbarous aggression.

title: NET SAVINGS INFLOWS OFF AT S.&L.'s LAST MONTH
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board said yesterday that net savings inflows of savings and loan association fell in November to the lowest level in nearly a year and a half.

title: EMERY IMRE GONOOR
description: Emery Imre Goncior, a child psychorogist and a former assistant professor pf psychiatry at New York Medical College. died Monday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was SI years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Earl and the Campbell Twins
description: DALLASThe big money is only a few months away now for Earl Campbell, the Texas running back who won the Heisman Trophy this year. The big money will appear in May after he is chosen early in the National Football League draft. But he's not spending money that he doesn't have yet.

title: The Spreading Decline
description: Notes on political parties:

title: Personal Investing
description: With short interest on the New York Stock Exchange hovering at an alltime high, investment advisers such as Yale Hirsch are beginning to talk of the slaughtered six and rightly so.

title: United Press International
description: FRIENDLY GETTOGETHER: Charles 0. Finley, left, owner of the Oakland A's, and Bowie Kuhn, baseball commissioner, at meeting in Palm Springs, Calif., yesterday. They met with representatives of the Oakland Coliseum Finley's plans to sell the team to Marvin Davis, who wants to move it Denver. Finley's lease on the Coliseum still has 10 years to run.

title: The New York Times/Marilynn K. Yee
description: SAYING GOODBYE: Accompanied by his grandson, Richard, 8, Mayor Beame paused on steps of City Hall as he left for the last time as Mayor. Page 22.

title: Japan's Latest Farm Shortage: Wives
description: OTOECHO, Japan"Wanted: 8,000 brides for 8,000 grooms. Young women must be willing work hard in house and fields. Daily cooking. Also husband's bath preparation. Desire for many children imperative. Must be re- spectful of and obedient to inlaws. Taste for long winters away from town preferable. Oneway airfare provided. Fluent Japanese required. Apply Hokkaido Farmland Bride Liaison Bureau.

title: Humana Increases Offer for Merlicorp
description: A multimillion-dollar battle for control of a leading hospital company appeared to he developing late yesterday.

title: Player's Death Investigated
description: IRVINGTON, N.J., Dec. 30When Jerome Vorhies opened his mail one day this week, he found a transcript for his son Bob's first college semester. At the bottom was this notation:

title: A New Start for Paul
description: When the clock strikes midnight tonight. Gabe PUul will be unemployed for the first time since he took his first job as a newspaper delivery boy in Rochester, N.Y., at the age of 10, Paul, however, won't have to collect unemployment money.

title: New Rules Permit Interest Rate Rise For Credit Unions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)Credit unions around the country will have the opportunity to pay higher interest rates on deposits next year under new rules taking effect today.

title: Stein and Wagner Bury Hatchet, This Time Not in Each Other
description: Just a few weeks ago, Andrew J. Stein and Robort F. Wagner Jr. exchanged brickbats in their bitter contest. for Manhattan Borough President. Yesterday, they exchanged compliments over a reconciliation lunch.

title: Goldin Accuses Taxi Commission Of Laxity Ovre Safety Regulations
description: New York City's Taxi and Limousine Commission does not inspect taxicabs adequately, is too lenient in penalizing violators and, in general, fails to enforce safety measures adequately, the city's Comptroller chargea yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Board of Public Utilities is sending letters to all 208 bus companies in New Jersey, ordering them to provide discount services for grade school and high school students by Feb. 1, 1978.

title: Holtz Is Fearful of Dispute's Effect on Team
description: MIAMI, Dec. 30"This is the most difficult time I've ever had as a coach evaluating a squad, Lou Holtz said here today, acknowledging he could not be certain his Arkansas players all believed they could win Monday night's Orange Bowl football game against Oklahoma.

title: A Washington Hostess Who Is Resisting the New Casualness
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30A couple of years ago, people were speculating that Allison LaLand just might be the capital's next Perle Mesta. After all, during the Nixon Administration she had hooked a couple of Cabinet officials for her parties. There was the big one, with its cast of hundreds, for former Attorney General and Mrs. William B. Saxbe that had White House people and 10 ambassadors rubbing shoulders and dancing into the night.

title: Memories: IX Clouds Ahead
description: PARISFew governments in today's complex world even pretend to honor Jefferson's principles: 'The care of human life and happiness, and not their destruction, is the first and only legitimate object of good government and that government is best which governs least.

title: Letter: On New York City Finances
description: To the Editor:

title: Buse, Weber Top Ski Jumpers
description: OBERSTDORF, West Germany, Dec. 30 (AP)Mathias Buse and Martin Weber of East Germany finished one, two today in the annual FourHill ski jumping tournament, cut from two jumps to one jump because of strong winds and heavy snow. Buse took first place with a I03meter jump and 118.2 points, and Weber was second with a jump of 101 meters and 109.3 points. The only American in the top 20 was .Tim Denney of Duluth, Minn., who finished 13th.

title: PRESIDENT EQUATES HUMANRIGHTS GOALS OF POLAND AND U.S.
description: WARSAW, Dec. 30President Carter today equated American and Polish aspirations on human rights but conceded that both nations and the Soviet Union were occasionally made uncomfortable by public discussions of their failure to guarantee them.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., Dec. 30 (AP) Thomas N. Bonner, president of Union College, today denounced the school's former hockey coach, Ned Harkness, for his unconscionable act of quitting in midseason.

title: Videotapes Add Dimension to Psychiatric Training at Medical Centers
description: On the television screen, the middleaged woman squirms in her chair. For a moment, as she explains to the camera why she thinks people don't like her (it's because she smells bad, she says), she sounds rational. Then she grimaces and the words trail off into incoherence. The obviously disconnected phrases and jumbled, childish ideas that accompany her gestures are the symptoms of a disturbed personality.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: 1. The two men pictured above were appointed to important Fecieral jobs by President Carter. Who are they, what are the jobs and whom will they replace?

title: 5 in West Side Social Club Injured As Man Throws Incendiary Device
description: Five persons sultered burns. most of them described as not serious, when a man threw an incendiary device into a West Side social club where he had argued with several patrons an hour earlier last night, the police reported.

title: U.N. Pact to Stabilize Sugar Price In Force Provisionally Tomorrow
description: UNITED NATIONS. Dec. 30A new fireyear International Sugar Agreement Was assured today of the necessary goyernment support to bring it into force Provisionally on Sunday.

title: the New York Times/Marilynn K. Yee
description: Former Mayor John V. Lindsay paid a farewell visit on soon-to-be former Mayor Abraham D. Beanie during an open house at City Hall yesterday that was highlighted by good wishes, goodbyes and a good bit of sentiment.

title: Cambodia Cuts Ties With Vietnam
description: DANGKOK, Thailand, Saturday, 13cc. 31 Cambodia broke diplomatic relations with Vietnam today, accusing its fellow Communist country of 'ferocious and barbarous aggression.

title: Club Champion's Widow
description: John Braden, who played Uncle Sid in the Circle in the Square Theater's revival of Ali, Wilderness!", has joined Maureen Stapleton in John Ford Noonan's new comedy, The Club Champion's Widow. The drama is the first production of the Robert Lewis Acting Company. Lisa Sloane and Barry Jenner complete the cast, which is now rehearsing for an opening Jan. 23 at the company's 175seat arena theater in New Rochelle, N.Y. It will be performed through March 5.

title: Booms Along Shore Are Guns This Time
description: OCEANPORT, Dec. 30 (AP)  A new round of explosions shook the sky along the New Jersey shore today, but Army personnel at Fort Monmouth said a ceremonial cannon firing had been responsible for the blasts.

title: City Is Taking Over Prosecutions of Teacher Assaults
description: Responsibility for the Family Court proiccution of minor.; sccused of assaulting teachers in New York City's Public school, has been shifted from the Board of Education to the city's Law Department. the City Corporation Counsel, W. Bernard Richland. said yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: Americans and Poles have the same hopes for human rights, President Carter said at a news conference in Warsaw, but conceded that both nations and the Soviet Union are occasionally made uncomfortable by public discussions of their failure to guarantee them. I don't think there is any doubt that the will of the Polish people for complete preservation and enhancement of human rights is the same as our own, he said. There were hints from White House sources that Mr. Carter was considering a meeting .Egypt with President Anwar elSadat, probably on Wednesday. [Page 1 Column 6.]

title: 86 American Prisoners Returned From Mexico Still in U.S. Facility
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 30 (UPI)Of the 233 Americans who were returned to the United States from Mexican prisons earlier this month, 86 remain in the Metropolitan Correctional Center here, associate warden Lowell Kincaid said today.

title: Goldin Accuses Taxi Commission Of Laxity Over Safety Regulations
description: New City's Taxi and Limousine Commission (loos not inspect taxicabs adequately, is too lenient in penalizing violator; and in general, falls to enforce safety mast.rcs adeatriely, the city's Compir ller charged yesterday.

title: First Practice for Morton
description: DENVER, Dec. 30 (AP)Craig Morton, the Denver Broncos quarterback hip, has been bothered by a sore left hip, participated in practice today for the first time this week, Coach Red Miller said.

title: CHARLES J.UMBERGER A TOXICOLOGIST, 70
description: Dr. Charles J. Umberger, who retired in 1972 as director of the toxicological laboratories in the office of New York City's Chief Medical Examiner, died Wednesday in Kingston (N.Y.) General Hospital after a short illness. He was 70 years old and lived on Old Fort Road in Wallkill, N.Y.

title: Key Index Off in November But Decline Is Discounted
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 30(AP)Ecanomis indicators released by the Government today gave out weak signals for the start of the new year, declining for the first time in five months.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Pentagon Delays Halt In Broadcasts to Ships
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 (AP)The Defense Department has agreed to postpone for 90 days plans to end broadcasts of news to United States ships at sea, Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island who is chairman of the House Merchant Marine Committee, said today.

title: HAROLD DAVIS A PIONEER IN DEVELOPING DERRICKS
description: Harold W. Davis, a pioneer in the development of derricks, cranes and other heavy construction equipment, died of cancer Tuesday at North Beach Medical Center in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 91 years old and resided in Fort Lauderdale.

title: 24 Killed as Plane Crashes in Ecuador
description: GUAYAQUIL, Ecuador, Dec, 30 (Reuters)All 24 people aboard an Ecuadorean airliner were killed yesterday when it crashed into the side of a mountain in southern Ecuador, aviation officials said today.
